review:
Tudo e mais um pouquinho sobre: Blade Symphony - "Uma Aventura de espadas." (Valxb21) recomendo. 

1. **Hist√≥ria:**
   - Infelizmente, Blade Symphony n√£o se destaca por sua narrativa √©pica. A trama √© como tentar entender a trama de um filme experimental enquanto est√° de olhos vendados. Pouca coes√£o, muita confus√£o.

2. **Modo Multijogador:**
   - Ah, o modo multijogador! Aqui √© onde Blade Symphony brilha como uma estrela cintilante. A competi√ß√£o √© feroz, e a emo√ß√£o de derrotar advers√°rios em duelos √© viciante.

3. **Jogabilidade:**
   - A jogabilidade √© a dan√ßa mortal entre espadas, e √© incr√≠vel! Os movimentos s√£o fluidos como a √°gua, e os combos s√£o t√£o satisfat√≥rios que at√© um samurai iria aplaudir. Prepare-se para praticar, porque a curva de aprendizado √© uma montanha russa.

4. **Conquistas:**
   - As conquistas s√£o como trof√©us de papel mach√™. Algumas s√£o interessantes, mas outras s√£o t√£o irrelevantes que voc√™ se pergunta por que se deu ao trabalho.

5. **Bugs:**
   - Blade Symphony tem mais bugs do que uma floresta tropical, e alguns s√£o t√£o estranhos que voc√™ pode confundi-los com recursos secretos. A equipe de desenvolvimento provavelmente tem um zool√≥gico virtual escondido.

6. **Parte Gr√°fica:**
   - Gr√°ficos? Poderiam ser melhores. Parece que os artistas estavam usando uma tela de pintura enquanto usavam √≥culos de sol escuros. Mas hey, ao menos a est√©tica √© √∫nica.

7. **Trilha Sonora:**
   - A trilha sonora merece um grande "arigatou gozaimasu"! Ela mergulha voc√™ no clima de batalha, fazendo voc√™ se sentir como um verdadeiro samurai em uma jornada √©pica.

8. **Tutorial:**
   - O tutorial √© mais escasso do que cabelo em uma bola de bilhar. Prepare-se para descobrir as nuances do jogo sozinho, ou contar com a bondade dos veteranos.

9. **Legendas em Portugu√™s:**
   - Infelizmente, para os brasileiros, as legendas em portugu√™s s√£o t√£o raras quanto um drag√£o no jogo. Prepare-se para polir seu ingl√™s ou jogar no modo "compreens√£o contextual".

10. **Nota de 0 a 10:**
    - Daria um s√≥lido 7.5. O modo multijogador √© onde ele brilha, mas alguns bugs e a falta de uma narrativa envolvente impedem que seja um 10.

11. **Cr√≠tica:**
    - Como um guerreiro samurai, Blade Symphony √© uma jornada emocionante, mas a falta de uma hist√≥ria coesa e alguns bugs irritantes impedem que alcance o status de lenda dos jogos. Um polimento na hist√≥ria e corre√ß√£o de bugs poderiam elevar este jogo a patamares ainda mais altos.

author: {'steamid': '76561198324353587', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 27, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1695280699}
review:
I like this game and I recommend it, I played the training chapters, the trainer chapters are pretty cool because you fight an AI bot for training purposes. I enjoyed the sword play against the AI bot and I had access to the server too  and the server at the time I logged in which was early morning were working but there were no players on the server. 

I think Blade Symphony is undeniably an exhilarating swordplay game, I could  see from the training chapter sessions offering detailed combat mechanics and diverse character styles that make every battle a thrilling challenge. However, as I explored the game, it became evident that it lacks a dedicated solo mode or AI opponents.I think that game would benefit from a solo mode even if the ingame battle is against AI bots. 

Nevertheless, I can't help but think that Blade Symphony would greatly benefit from incorporating AI bots for solo play. This addition would not only enhance the single-player experience, allowing players to practice and refine their skills at their own pace, but it could also benefit the multiplayer aspect. AI bots could fill in when human opponents are scarce, ensuring that the game remains accessible and enjoyable for all types of players.

Incorporating AI bots would undoubtedly be a valuable addition to an already impressive game, making Blade Symphony an even more versatile and appealing choice for sword-fighting enthusiasts.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072310730', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 138, 'playtime_forever': 479, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 203, 'last_played': 1694616702}
review:
Blade Symphony

Online Sword Dueling

https://youtu.be/58esajg85KY

In a world where blades met in a deadly trance,
A tale unfolds of a princess, in a fight for chance.
The best sword fighter, with skills untold,
A Jedi-like dance, her destiny foretold.
With blades as her companions, a symphony of steel,
She moved like a phantom, an otherworldly zeal.
Every foe she faced, in the dance of death,
A robotic grace, acrobatic breath.
A princess of grace, a warrior profound,
The last of her race, destiny's resound.
To save her world, a quest she embraced,
Never to lose, in the sword's cold embrace.
Through realms she traversed, in shadows and light,
Fighting every enemy, a relentless fight.
The world depended on her, a fate entwined,
In the sword-fighter's world, destiny defined.
A nemesis awaited, in shadows unseen,
A dance with death, where the air grew keen.
Blades clashed, a thunderous sound,
Princess and nemesis, fate's battleground.
Robotically she moved, with precision so clear,
Acrobatically she spun, a dance without fear.
The last of her race, the weight on her shoulders,
In the sword's ballet, where destiny smolders.
A sword fight to the death, in the moonlit night,
Princess against nemesis, in the final fight.
Fate hung in the balance, on blades so keen,
A world to be saved, a princess unseen.
With every clash, the world held its breath,
In the dance of death, a dance with death.
Princess prevailed, destiny fulfilled,
Her people saved, in the silence stilled.
The best sword fighter, a Jedi-like sprite,
Faced every enemy, in the dance of the night.
A princess victorious, her world now at rest,
In the blade's embrace, fate's final test.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075588533', 'num_games_owned': 1821, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 147, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 147, 'last_played': 1515854762}
review:
Blade Symphony is an action fighting game developed by Puny Human.

Graphics: Blade Symphony features detailed character designs and detailed environments, with fluid animations and effects. The game's graphics are not the most cutting-edge, but they serve the game well and provide a pleasant visual experience.

Sound: The sound design in Blade Symphony is good, with appropriate sound effects for combat and a fitting musical score. The game's audio helps to create a believable world and adds to the overall immersion.

Story: Blade Symphony does not have a traditional narrative-driven story, but instead focuses on the gameplay. Players take on the role of a swordsman in a world filled with other skilled warriors, and the game's story is told through the player's interactions with other characters and the world.

Gameplay: The gameplay in Blade Symphony is fast-paced and intense, with a focus on one-on-one duels. The game features a variety of weapons, each with their own unique abilities, and players must master their chosen weapon in order to excel in combat. The game also features multiplayer modes, allowing players to compete against each other online.

Good Points: Blade Symphony is a fun and intense action fighting game, with a strong emphasis on skill-based combat. The game's multiplayer modes offer a lot of replayability, and the game's community is active and supportive.

Bad Points: Some players may find the game's lack of a traditional story to be a drawback, and the game's single-player modes can become repetitive after a while. Additionally, the game's limited character customization options may not be to everyone's taste.

Overall, Blade Symphony is a solid action fighting game with a focus on skill-based combat. Fans of the genre will enjoy it.

Score: 7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198075672651', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 241, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 241, 'last_played': 1441550158}
review:
I am reviewing every game in my library and this is the 30th. I got this game when it was released or around that time, it cost something I do not recall what and it was cool when I played it. That was 2014-2015.

Looking back at this game now, it is simply a fast paced PvP game with parkour elements to it. mimicing some swordfighting styles and you can do some neat combos. All in all a cool idea, but if you play something like this, just hop over to Warframe, it is simply this concept but better and more well done. 

Besides that I mean, the game might as well not exist. About 3 players play it, it might literally be 3 friends who just play this game. Last I recall this is a multiplayer only pvp game, so no players = no game. 

What do I say, it's dead and I cannot recommend this.

review: The game's fighting mechanics are somewhat decent, but the game itself is dead, sadly. Not only this, but i hate how this game mixes together futuristic, urbanistic and medieval designs. This looks cursed and its not a rare occurence at all. There is judgement the knight, whose face is a bit scary in a bad way, but overall it's a knight, a tough guy with medieval armor and brutal voice. But past that, what do we have? A Beer-saurus in a checkered shirt(or at best just a Yakuza knockoff character)? Two battle women with dyed hair and scifi bodysuit, that look like they will start yelling feminist or any other kind of SJW bullcrap losungs? A mongolian? I have no freaking money to buy chivalry medieval warfare or anything like that, but come on... I just want to swing my sword to berserk music, why did it have to come to this? At least it feels good to kill those freaks

review:
It used to be fun back in the day, it had some ongoing issues that haven't been addressed for a while and playerbase slowly declined as a result. Also, few years ago the Steam Workshop was removed from the game in order to make space for paid skins. That's never a good thing.

The game is now free to play but the multiplayer is dead with less than 10 people online during peak hours.

review: When i used to play this game my laptop ran so hot i had to rotate cold wet towels to hold on the bottom of it so it didn't burn my legs. I can remember running around a mall and duelling my friends being fun but i don't know that anyone still even plays this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071494612', 'num_games_owned': 536, 'num_reviews': 120, 'playtime_forever': 2335, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2335, 'last_played': 1482546552}
review:
It's really weird when I saw this suddenly plop up in my store page as recently updated.
I was almost tempted but I literally remembered everything wrong with it.
Blade Symphony AT THE TIME was a very interesting concept, but it's usefulness has already been surpassed, it's art style is very interesting, had a actually pretty solid soundtrack, and a workshop that lets you put whatever on aswell.
HOWEVER, it's now facing the problem of "we have better games now for this exact concept".
The only people who play Blade Symphony are basically the type of people you'd expect who play dead sword/fighting games, you'll get destroyed or just not have a good time, and remember, this is a [b] SOURCE SWORDFIGHTER, [/b] it's about as janky as you'd expect.
If you really want to play a game like this I unironically would recommend For Honor, I don't even like For Honor that much but the concept of "sword fighting" is much better done in that game, Chivalry 2 is also a good option.

author: {'steamid': '76561198427365449', 'num_games_owned': 641, 'num_reviews': 285, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1661401425}
review:
Another underrated game with dead online.

There are two free heavily modified games on Source engine that you can't recognize anything familiar from typical Source games (Half-life/Portal): it's Apex Legends and this "Blade Symphony" (which is also the only fighting game on "Source" engine).

But unlike "Apex Legends", this game is completely dead in online. Yes, we can play with bots, but they are... not finished. You can easily kill them by pressing w+left click, because even though they get damage they won't stop jumping and let us easily kill them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033499439', 'num_games_owned': 156, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 627, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 627, 'last_played': 1639049452}
review:
they TOOK away my DRIP

on a less serious note
- Dead servers, wouldn't bother installing unless you feel comfortable finding people to play with on discord or you have friends that are interested.
- Performance issues. Note that I do NOT have a high end gaming PC by any means, but it's decent. Does a good enough job. The game ran beautifully first time I started it up again, even decent on the highest settings. Then it suddenly started lagging randomly and freezing on loading screens. It seemed like it was getting worse each time I restarted it. Considering some of the other issues reviewers have had with this, maybe play at your own risk
- The mechanics are fun enough, but they feel a little clunky. I don't know if I just like them less than I did when I initially played however, or if they actually changed something. If you changed something, please put it back
- Customization is in a sad state. I cannot stress enough that they took away my drip. All of my cosmetics? Gone. My Carefully Cultivated Looks tm? Gone. How am I supposed to play dress up like this? Apparently you can get more cosmetics as you level up, but that's difficult with dead servers. I'm devastated. Beating my friends up in this game was good nice etc etc w/e But looking cute while I did it? That was absolutely priceless. I loved that. It's been taken from me. Also I don't think removing the masks was a good idea.

All in all, can't recommend this game in the current state its in. Normally I'd say since it's free to play (now..) it's worth trying with a friend, but with the performance issues I'd be cautious. It's sad because I had fun with it when I initially played and I think it has a lot of potential. I'd love to see it, or a sequel, get the love it deserves.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042573235', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1639022651}
review:
I won't waste your time complaining about a small player base because, honestly... I never even got that far; I played the tutorial, and that's all I needed to play to see what I needed to see. I'd say this game, along with a handful of others, kinda serves more as a proof of concept for like, say, a (at the time of this review non-existent) Soulcalibur MMO (which, in my opinion, is a REALLY cool concept); the core concept's great, but this's where I get into the reason I can't in good conscience recommend this game; the core concept's poor execution.
I'd read in other reviews that the game's controller support was crap, so I went the keyboard & mouse route instead; but even THAT was extremely clunky. When I was just holding a direction key down to move normally for instance, it somehow still registered a double-tap, and my tutorial character did a quickstep instead, sometimes a few times in a row; and don't even get me started on the roll button, why game developers continue to make the hard to press while using the movement buttons left control key the default for crouching, sliding and rolling remains a mystery to me; as is why important items and moves are still by default mapped to the hard to press while using the movement keys number keys. In my experience, doing that deprives the player of the ability to even MOVE at least half the time; but that's exactly what they did with the stances. A much BETTER move would've been to map all the stances to the mousewheel, to allow the player to cycle through the stances in the middle of combat while moving your character around the ring, and reduce the cycling's sensitivity some to avoid the problem where the player could accidentally cycle past the stance they wanted; if you used THREE fingers on your mouse instead of two, this'd even allow players to switch stances without the temporary surrender of their attacking ability.
The parrying mechanic, while a pretty much essential mechanic for any swordfighting game, doesn't work half the time as far as I can tell, with your opponent's attack hitting you even if you time your counterswing correctly. There's also only one recognized jump attack as far as I can tell (I've tried doing others), and the wall running's not especially useful in this type of game; you have to be facing the wall to be able to use it, but that entails turning your back to your opponent, which if they have half a functioning brain they'll exploit to get a free hit on you, which can really change the duel's tide with how few hits swordfighters can take in this game, even with armor on (the old bullshitty "armor is useless" trope in action); the tutorial says it's to afford players backed into a corner, literally, a means of escape, but like I said, your character has to be FACING the wall to use it, so again, you're opening yourself up to a back attack. But why would you get backed into that corner to begin with? Because the concept of keeping your footing doesn't really exist in Blade Symphony; attacks can REALLY push you around the ring, even, or rather especially, if you guard. Speaking of guarding, I get it not being a perfect defense against the charged attacks, you have to have some reward for taking the risk of using an attack with such a long wind-up, during which you're at your most vulnerable; but guarding's not even a perfect defense against NORMAL attacks, with chip damage, heavy chip damage, being very much a thing with them, which renders guarding pretty much POINTLESS. I swear if it weren't for the safety measure of the tutorial AI opponent being designed to not knock that last hit point off, I, through a combination of the clunky controls and the chip damage normal attacks can do through guarding, I would've lost the final tutorial matches both times I fought them. Going back to the wall running thing for a minute, according to the tutorial, pressing the spacebar, the default jump button, CANCELS the wall run; while I didn't try it myself, I suspect this means it just causes them to drop. What'd be COOL is if it instead made you spring off the wall to give any jump attacks you might do some forward movement, because the normal jump attack barely moves forward at all.
Lastly, swordfighters, as well as having a lackluster grabbing ability, have throwing weapons they can use, which, like the rest of the game, is a cool but poorly executed concept; there's no option to just quickly tap the throwing weapon key, E by default, to do a much weaker but quicker throw, you HAVE to hold the button down to the end to have your character throw the weapon at all, the loading tips literally say so themselves.

To sum it all up, Blade symphony's a cool but poorly executed concept, and I think its greatest contribution to the video game medium is to pave the way for other games, like a hypothetical Soulcalibur MMO, to present players with what it does but BETTER; I'll look at it with appreciation for that, but I can't in good conscience recommend anyone play it.

This game has by far the worst controller support I've seen in my entire life (for a game that openly says it supports it, This is one of the worst games I have ever played I am very disappointed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064593529', 'num_games_owned': 1355, 'num_reviews': 120, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1631979892}
review:
This is one of the worst games I've ever played. I read an article that ranked this as one of the 12 best games for combat ever, and I am extremely disappointed.

Firstly, all the game is, is combat. There's no story, no single player, nothing. It's just playing matches.
Secondly, it doesn't seem like there's any ranking system, or rewards of any kind (at least from what I could see).
Thirdly, many achievements are broken (I won a match, no achievement. I killed someone with a grab, no achievement. Etc.)
Fourthly, the actual combat is very clunky. Rolls and shuffles are slow, and don't move you much, and don't have any invulnerability frames, so really, dodging just leaves you wide open for attack.
Fifthly, the general feel of the combat is just clicking a lot. It doesn't feel strategic, or enjoyable. Even blocking doesn't even seem to work (you do it in the tutorial, but in a real match, right clicking seems to do nothing... broken?)
Sixth, the sounds and animations are not satisfying, and feel really, really old, and badly done.
Seventh, there's no controller support for this game, so if you want to play with a controller, don't even try. They literally haven't even mapped the jump button to the controller.
Eighth, if you try to customize yourself in-between rounds, too bad, it will start the match in a matter of seconds, regardless of what you're doing.
Ninth, no one actually plays the game. You can see in the forums that people complain there's no one online. If you want to play, you're probably going to have to join an empty server, and just sit there waiting forever for someone to join. I have currently been waiting for about a half an hour with zero people joining (it's a Sunday night, which I would think would be the peak time, still, no one).
Tenth, the music is trash. I'm currently hosting a room waiting for someone to join to fight me, and the music is absolutely torturously bad.

This game is an absolute joke. Avoid it at all costs. It "could" be an easy 100% completion, which is why I even bothered to continue, but now I regret ever opening the program, because many achievements are broken.

author: {'steamid': '76561198103868558', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 590, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 569, 'last_played': 1619789703}
review:
I come on and off on this game to time time, last I have-- at least had a lot of fun playing this game with my friends. Sometimes I just look at this game and rarely launch it. This is a really fun 3D sword fighting game. It has something from Tekken which I enjoy a lot which is the "easy to learn but hard to master" deal. I've defeated people better than me and done dumb stuff at times too. Though this game is worth it, free or not in my overall opinion. The soundtrack itself is really good and it really gives semi-freedom on customization. What I mean by that is you have to unlock or buy stuff to further your customization. For a free game I don't mind this at all- at least paying part as this game really gives me a lot of joy. If you ever have time check this game out as I am reviewing this game it is free. Back then I had a very potato computer and had really good connection. With the modern days with everyone getting better PCs, I recommend you giving it a honest try and just lower the quality as low you can if needed.

7/10 Great Game

Sin embargo el juego es una joyita del combate, es fluido y reaccionario. author: {'steamid': '76561198012363945', 'num_games_owned': 2117, 'num_reviews': 404, 'playtime_forever': 1012, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1012, 'last_played': 1606682273}
review:
Been playing this on-off for years. The game mechanics intrigue me endlessly. Rare are the games where you study tutorials and swords and their proper use. 

Now back to the review: A new major patch made re-install. But the sorry state is still there. 

- No players on servers. 0-2 is the amount i have seen in the weeks of last patch release and 0 is the most common number. Also no EU servers so ping is 150+ all the time for US servers. 
- You only get XP in online so i play that one US server that has duel and usually that one arena that has a bot available. I absolutely hate the queue system that makes you wait for bots to finish their fights in other arenas. Even worse when all bots pile up in one arena. 
- In this state the sword Katana -> What's the point against bots. Who am i feinting against? Bots don't go far in this game. 

So all in all it was again a interesting sword fighting lesson and i enjoyed it but this content is again exhausted so quickly. Go ahead and try the game it's free now. It is ok even against bots if you have never tried games like this but don't bother spending too much time with this anymore. The true salt of the game is long gone and can only be read from reviews from players who have a lot of hours on this.  

Too little too late it seems.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001568088', 'num_games_owned': 630, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 3967, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3939, 'last_played': 1673062580}
review:
Hello, I came back to piss on this game's corpse a few more times before afk'ing in a 24/7 fashion contest and farming simulator. 

When I left this game a couple years back it was in a fully playable state with defined concepts such as: masked fighters that don't need a face, lots of workshop items for player customization, and even working settings (wow, what a concept, revolutionary even). Now, every fighter shows their ugly ass mug with a voice for the world to not care about, a megafuckton of workshop items that are no longer compatible because you morons spent so much time rendering faces that not many back then cared too much about, and for fuck sake the audio options don't even save anymore so I can hear the music in full ear piercing quality. A shame really because the soundtrack for this game was amazing.

This game had so much potential back then due to how unique it was in its genre as well as an interesting variety of sword types to play around with. If there's an older player reading this I'm sure you still get PTSD from a Washing Machine Katana Riposting Phalanx or a Jumping But It's Only Heavy Side Knight. And it's a shame that people won't experience much of that because of the near dead playercount. "Oh we're a tightly knit-community, we'll still survive!" Fuck off, you had your chance years back and then blew it when you did nothing with the momentum of new players coming in during seasonal sales when this game had a buy-in.







Also your item servers don't work or you just removed almost every cosmetic for the characters. Either way, fantastic job that only a mother would give a sympathetic half-grin to before pulling out the belt.














I just really have to know, why did you spend resources on the faces or voices anyway? They are just so jarring and out of place.

Grug want cling-clang and swish-swoosh, not "ah-uh".

author: {'steamid': '76561197994595024', 'num_games_owned': 338, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1415, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1383, 'last_played': 1605390175}
review:
I mean, in terms of content it's about the same as most fighting games, but the whole 3-dimensional aspect of the fighting with a bunch of different fuck-off swords is what really draws you in. Combine that with mods to put on your favourite cosplay and weapons from any series and film you want, and you can have a mega blast if you get a good group of friends going.
Despite it being a new take on fighting that isn't Mordhau or Chivalry however, it suffers from the main weaknesses as most fighting games. After however long, only the hardcore fighters are still playing, which scares off new players. Combine that with a smaller dev team that only have so much to give and a content drought, it's no wonder the game's suffering. Big AAA devs have a hard time keeping their fighting communities alive, so you can barely imagine the struggle with these guys.

That said I do want to see this game do better, and it's definitely worth trying, especially with your friends. I played it for the first time way back years ago, and there was a magic to it that I couldn't help but enjoy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198112810429', 'num_games_owned': 2591, 'num_reviews': 578, 'playtime_forever': 470, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 470, 'last_played': 1592505760}
review:
In its current state, Blade Symphony is the bad egg. I can't recommend it to anybody. First and the main reason - it's a multiplayer-only game with empty servers. The second reason - this game had my PC in total BSoD recently, three times in a row. Maybe the second thing is my issue only, maybe it is the problem of x64 version only, and you'll be fine with x32. But what do you plan to do on the empty server? Sure, you can run some tutorial, and get some bots to fight against you. But it would be a bore after only a little while.

It wasn't always like that. About 5-6 years back when Blade Symphony was still in the development, it was promising. Even Very Promising, for some of us, who are really enjoy complicated fencing gameplay mechanics. Some people even called Blade Symphony "Bushido Blade for multiplayer". Well, it ain't really close to Bushido Blade, but yeah, the game had some attractiveness back in the days. However, it turned out that there are not so many people actually want to buy a PvP-only battle arena where you really need to learn many moves, timings and all that. The servers were almost empty even 3-4 years ago. Then Blade Symphony turned into the free-to-play, in hope to attract at least some new players, to live up those servers. Didn't worked well. Many people who invested their time and money in the game when it was Early Access, felt ripped off at that point. And there were never enough of the new players.

What else can I say, except the game's dead? Well, it wasn't the most accurate fencing simulator. Complicated - sure. With various stances, movesets for every blade available, some fencer classes with different strong and weak points - the game was really sophisticated. But not fancy. For most of the players, there was never that touch of success when your honed skill worth anything. Sure, Blade Symphony was a skill-oriented game, not just an arcade as Soul Calibur or something like that. But. Then again. All that complexity worth nothing when you don't have the uses for it. Empty servers, remember? It's like learning some Cantonese by the books while living somewhere in the hills of Nebraska and not moving anywhere from your home. What chances there are that you will meet Cantonese-speakers? And that those people will understand you even if that meeting occur?

I'm a sword practitioner myself in real life. I enjoy every solid fencing game. I am always over-ecstatic when I remember playing Bushido Blade, for example. But, the case of Blade Symphony... It's a very sophisticated, but not realistic mish-mash. Sure, you can't use one or two buttons only to cut through the opponents. But... it is still a mish-mash. Even with all those movesets and timings included.

So I don‚Äôt grieve much by hammering the coffin lid of this game. It gave me some hope for a good time and a few hours of gameplay ... but that's all. Another little engine that couldn‚Äôt. Mark 4.5/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093753025', 'num_games_owned': 249, 'num_reviews': 117, 'playtime_forever': 269, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 269, 'last_played': 1548013961}
review: This is some unique fighting game. There a lot of mechanics and ways a battle can unfold. There are no items that could grand advantages or any pay to win mechanics. The battles depend on pure skill. It is refreshing to see a fighting game in which you can't just win by spamming a certain hit. The game is highly recommended to try, but please remember the game has a small player base, therefore it will be much more fun if you play the game together with a friend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024292248', 'num_games_owned': 746, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 800, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 800, 'last_played': 1525794703}
review:
Was just talking shit with a friend of mine about how games like For Honor, Chivalry, Mordhau, really any games that include indepth weapon clashing and dueling mechanics, all feel by the wayside in comparison to Blade Symphony for me. Even though I never got that amazing at it, I felt at home with the style that I used and practiced with, and it stands like a titan in my mind in comparison to games like Dark Souls when it comes to the depth of involvement the PvP felt like.

I remember people even saying back when Absolver hit the stores, got popular, and fell out hard due to shallow / preferable combo sets within the PvP, many would bring up examples of games that were balanced while having a wide range of quality / choices. Blade Symphony was the dream, and it pains me that such a beautiful game had such struggle with player base and follow through. I don't know how the Devs went financially with the sales being continuous over the years, but lacking in constant player base, but I hope they got the financial support they needed to continue following their passions. This is a one of a kind game that'll always have a place in my heart.

10/10, love you Blade Symphony

author: {'steamid': '76561198057534239', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 516, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 516, 'last_played': 1586574979}
review:
Bought this game ages ago back when it was around 15 dollars, combat was fun, albeit a little clunky. Made a return after years, and come to find half of the roster's moves are stripped so combos are completely wiped, my character is completely naked now and doesn't even have a base model with a mask or anything anymore, and all the workshop swords are gone. Not only that, but the game acted like I never played it when I very clearly had many hours in this.

I'm not one to typically write reviews, but the changes in this game are so awful that it astonished me that I didn't find out about this sooner, and it's really no wonder nobody plays this steaming pile anymore. Thanks for wasting my $15 years ago, I appreciate it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032682990', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 766, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 766, 'last_played': 1381085318}
review: As someone that played this in 2013, the saddest thing I've ever seen in gaming history is seeing what happened to this game and the dissolve of the community, I really miss this game and what it offered with the community, I remember all the learning I did and the fun I had, and all the community support back then. author: {'steamid': '76561198054693436', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 4750, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4531, 'last_played': 1585059609}
review: This game is honestly so much fun. I purchased the game when it first came out and there were only 3 characters. I super loved it. Now logging back in years later, the servers are sadly dead. I miss being able to log into a FFA server and just hang out with people, parkour, and when I'm feeling it duel. that was sick. Now you almost can't play the game unless you have a friend queue up a match with you. Solid game, just wish there was more of a community. Also, all the anime swords I downloaded from the Steam Workshop years ago are gone. Idk if that was a licensing issue or what happened. Now all the downloadable weapons seem to be made by a single creator.

review:
This game looks great, plays great, and has amazing potential.  The problem is there is hardly any players online for a online game and once more I got kicked from a game not knowing what was going on and having been unable to say one word.
I can not logically fathom a idea as to why someone would feel so inclined to have someone banned with virtually no interaction.
This just goes to show there are plenty of weak minded cucked out soy boy punks with glass chins that still have authoritarian disorders even in very small sub sections of gaming such as this.   I sure hope the creators get this game and community straightened out. before this flounders.

author: {'steamid': '76561198277235026', 'num_games_owned': 85, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 36, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1579392967}
review:
Blade symphony is a interesting dueling game with different swords, and differents charecters.
each charecter has some kind of bonus towards a ceretain sword, such as fast hitting rapiers, punishing katanas, or well balanced long swords.
I could honestly imagine people building up their own preffered playstyle, a unique style, but the player base is lacking, the game struggles to hit a total amount of 20 players.

the mechanics and gameplay are nice I guess, wall running, countering, punishing, parying, the game has a lot to offer, but feels overwhelming.

overal, I think the game is alright, but given the current amount of players of the game, I would not reccomend getting into the game and spending time on it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002508822', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 39047, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39034, 'last_played': 1581647420}
review:
[h1]WARNING! THIS PUBLISHER HAVE BETRAYED ITS PLAYERBASE![/h1]
[h1]WARNING! THIS GAME HAS "GONE WHALING"![/h1]

This developer have decided that taking an existing game that customers have already payed for and re-making it into a free-to-play model while erazing the progress of the old players and not leaving them a functional Legacy Version is morally OK.

The only material progression of the older version of this game was the inventory. Players were engaging with the game to unlock more cosmetic options. Some of those options were avaliable to all players from the start. Those were a part of original visual design for the characters and fitted them like a glove.

When game have changed the model aside from "Going Whaling" opening doors to more players in hopes to catch someone with a big wallet and a compulsive disorder. It also removed all of the unlocked cosmetic options that old players had already unlocked and placed those as items behind a forced level progression system. Including even those items that were a part of character's original design and were avaliable to everyone from the very start.

More over when "whaling" method had failed the publisher have decided to take the support of this game hostage and to [u][url=https://punyhuman.com/crowdfund/blade-symphony/]set up a fundraising goal of $14,200[/url][/u]. Demanding money for further support of the project.

[b]Be warned! All of the actions of this developer/publisher have shown that they have little to no capacity for moral principles or respect for the playerbase.[/b]

To not fall for tricks of this publisher follow through to [u][url=https://store.steampowered.com/developer/punyhuman]this page[/url][/u]. Click a gear icon and choose "Ignore This Publisher" option.

Here are some games that you might enjoy if you looked up the Blade Symphony:

https://store.steampowered.com/app/6020/STAR_WARS_Jedi_Knight__Jedi_Academy/

https://store.steampowered.com/app/1000360/Hellish_Quart/

.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048243063', 'num_games_owned': 485, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 376, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 376, 'last_played': 1567906254}
review:
Played this back in early access, it was actually unreal.

I've always been a fan of soul caliber and this added a new level to that style of game, it was fluid, it was full, it was community mod friendly.

came back recently, this game is a pile of wank. I downloaded numerous sword cosmetics to play with, I could play this game half cut, lose and still enjoy it.

There is no one to play with now, the devs killed this game, paid cosmetics? no thank you, not after people did it for fun.
Unfortunately I can't recommend this game anymore. Save your money guys....it's dead as a door knob.

author: {'steamid': '76561198163701585', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 1319, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1319, 'last_played': 1489610452}
review: This game is a true gem! Here you can experience swordfighting on a very high tactical level, unmatched by other games which are not even free (!) to play. The combination of different classes and sword types results in unique combat styles, which gives room for a lot of freedom and creativity. Also thanks to the workshop support you have almost unlimited possibilities to customize your character. Duelling with friends is even more fun!

author: {'steamid': '76561198039312374', 'num_games_owned': 826, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 17374, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9603, 'last_played': 1675175599}
review:
[h1]It's starting to feel like its old self again.[/h1]

Although workshop support and ranks have returned, there's no denying you should've been there in its prime. The experience of logging into servers on community maps full of fresh faces and grizzled veterans, gathering around an ongoing duel and challenging the winner, practising against people on your level and adding them to your friends list later on, or getting folded by a Master rank while they offer you tips and strategies to help beat them has created a vibe I haven't been able to experience again.

The gameplay feels unique. Even if you're getting curb stomped, you can feel yourself improving. You'll see their health bar dwindle lower and lower as you proceed match after match until finally... you take a single round off them, and the endorphin release distracts you and undoes all your hard work in the final round. Yet, you go right back into the next game knowing you can do it again and finish the job.

Please play this game. New faces are joining every day, and I want to see the servers revived with you being there for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032546576', 'num_games_owned': 630, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 29781, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29739, 'last_played': 1581641442}
review:
The two best things about the game are its mechanics and music. If you can get a friend to play with you, then you'll have a good time. If you manage to stumble upon a random player, chances are it will be a veteran, who will either wipe the floor with you, try to teach you or present you with an adequate challenge. The latter is only possible if you're also a veteran, so you might even recognise each other. In any case, make sure you play in "classic" mode since "arcade" mode simply limits your options and I fail to see why would you want to play like that in the first place - you can always spam that one attack or combo you consider imbalanced in "classic" mode until your opponent learns to counter it, forcing you to adapt.
The problems include some pretty long loading times, but that's about it for the technical side.
As for the aesthetics... The "Harmonious prelude" update made the game free to play, but severely limited customization. Before the update you could subscribe to a ton of items from the workshop and pick any colour you want for your character. Now you have to farm levels to get random drops of items and colours. In addition to that all characters start unmasked, which is useful if you want to weaken your opponent by invoking hysterical laughter or paralyzing fear that will inevitably occur once you take a look at those faces. But if you can endure and get a character to level 3 (or 4) you'll get the default mask, allowing you to remove the effect that a bald man with glass eyes has on your game. The image can still haunt your dreams, though. Alternatively, you can try going back to the "unharmonious" (yes, it's "inharmonious" spelled wrong) version by following this guide: https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1780050320
To sum up, the game is mostly dead, but still has some die-hard fans, who occasionally play it - there are many such games out there. If you're into fighting games, give it a try, especially if you have a friend - it's free now.

review:
Much more better than many other AAA games of the same genres.
Lack of automatization and stats bullsh*t focusing on actual control and timing player skill, pityful the lack on the aesthetic make it played less than it really deserve, making the game low "populance" his actual and only flaw.

Definetively to play if you look more for balance and skill than fancy graphic.

author: {'steamid': '76561198387197406', 'num_games_owned': 80, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1579295700}
review:
This is honestly a great game, was looking forward to play it, saw a couple of reviews saying that it was dead didn't want to believe it so I gave it a go, went through the tutorial went as far as finishing it.

Finally I felt like I was ready for a duel, I spawned into a map and chose any on game mode and map as I was really eager to play, found myself roaming around a map, it's a nice feature that you could sit down and just chill, so I sat around just mediating on my thoughts(in-game of course), was actually hoping someone would pop up, anyway it's totally dead but I won't uninstall it just yet, I mean who knows I might find someone else who hasn't given up, if anyone reading this has played it and has found nobody and still wants to give the game a shot just let me know. I want to duel someone, but that's pretty much it.(And yes I recommend, but it's dead)

author: {'steamid': '76561198134624774', 'num_games_owned': 375, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 49, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1558460596}
review: me jode tener que hablar mal de un juego asi. me gusta la idea, sus mecanicas bien, etc, lo tenia todo para gustarme. me he encontrado con un juego al que tienes que ense√±arle a programar y a poner controles decentes. los de teclado no estan mal del todo pero echo en falta un modo fijar por c√≥mo son los controles. pense que al cambiar a mando seria mejor, me parece un juego para jugar con mando; pues no, todavia peor. si el problema con teclado es que se hace muy pesado y complicado de manejar (no porque te exija masterizar algo, sino porque se hace horriblemente tedioso y poco practico) cuando cambias a mando desaparecen cosas como el ataque lateral y el ataque cargado, el salto, etc, y algunas cosas las puedes cambiar pero es un juego que te esta dando la opcion de poner mando y no trae nada configurado?!?!!? y tampoco puedes colocar el comando del ataque lateral... me da mucha pena que por 3 detalles se haga tan dificil apreciar lo que es el juego en si, pero ni siquiera parecen dignarse a cambiarlo. si aguantas los controles de teclado y raton recomiendo probarlo, porque seguramente este bien, pero cuando me pusieron la opcion de combo en el tutorial dejo de funcionar el ataque cargado. ojala entiendan y arreglen estos problemas porque son sencillisimos de arreglar, yo mismo estaba a punto de crear unos decentes porque tenia ganas de probarlo bien, pero sigo sin poder usar el atque lateral o el cargado... en fin, suerte.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079931738', 'num_games_owned': 109, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 2135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1335, 'last_played': 1688905677}
review:
I love this game. not because of the game though....
 If you are trying to get into this game, keep an open mind, have patience, and remember, just because someone says its broken doesn't mean it really is... (more likely they just don't know how to deal with it.)

I am a swordsman in irl, and this game makes me drool, cry, and cringe, simultaneously!
I drool, due to my deep desire for a game like this to work!
I cry due to the lack of players.
I cringe, due to how incomplete the mechanics are.

The dev team has a lot of work to do!
 The good news, they have a masterpiece in the making.

author: {'steamid': '76561198100599212', 'num_games_owned': 181, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 73, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1555770059}
review:
You can try it, but I tell you what's up.
The graphics are nice, mechanics aren't that bad.
But first online match...well, good luck matching up against a good player at first try. I got a lv24 knight, so obviously I had no chance. The only way I beat him was when he told me to kill him to level up faster...≈±
FIX THE SHTTY MATCHMAKING!!! Make a level-based, rank-based, whatever-based matchmaking, but don't ruin new players' experience....
If they could fix this one problem, I would not bother with bugs and stuff like that...those can be fixed on the go, but the MM system needs to be fixed (or even created) ASAP!!!

Otherwise, this is fun for a fighting game, try it, seriously!

author: {'steamid': '76561198062018987', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 761, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 738, 'last_played': 1557282682}
review:
I really loved this game, the combat is unique, complex and interesting, the mods were great and limitless and while the population was small, they were mostly all non-toxic.
Since the new update, mods are almost all gone and replaced by paid cosmetics that looks 10 times worse than the previous free mods, the hitbox became worse than before and the community.... What is left of it, has become more and more toxic. I would only recommend it if they would reverse the changes or if a private server of the old version is made. As of now, this game is a shell of its former self.

author: {'steamid': '76561198154098965', 'num_games_owned': 322, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 564, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 564, 'last_played': 1554010140}
review: a nice actually skill-based swordfighting game, I loved just going into fights over and over and against numerous different opponents and slowly understanding the game's mechanics. The best part of it is freely exploring the huge moveset (as there are different characters, as well as different swords), randomly figuring out something you think would work well, and trying to use it and perfect it against an actual opponent. Alternatively, you can learn from something you fight, and try to replicate what they did against someone else. When you get the handle on a move or hit a combo right, it feels so soo good. The game's multiple settings to fight in and soundtrack also make you constantly feel badass

author: {'steamid': '76561197978608209', 'num_games_owned': 887, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 150, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 150, 'last_played': 1553831014}
review:
Well, thought it would be nice using a blade instead of the constant shooting gamery. It looked nice, and I really tried it for a few hours, but lost most time on the settings.

The display is always not completely visible. Tried every setting, but even when in a small window, while practicing the text is falling off the screen on the right side (and the translation to dutch is terrible, but cant even change it to english). Half of the time I didnt understand what to do, so if I got past to something it was more luck then skill I guess.

The mechanics are very clunky. Tried it with keyboard but it didnt response correctly, like the shuffle (shift something) didnt work and because of the many different buttons I turned to a gamepad, however getting that properly working was even worse.

Mind you I tried two gamepads, an xbox type and the steam version. The latter one seemed a bit better working, but the standard setting is so off (like weird), so tried other settings, even made my own. But I could not get the throwing into the settings. Its just not even available as an option. So i still would have to use the keyboard (and still would have to use the mouse in the menu settings - even there the keyboard was not working)

Then the character is terrible in turning, so I constantly get hit from behind or get stuck in a corner.
Like I said getting something done was more luck than skill, and without skill you dont get far, thats for sure.

So I was more and more getting irritated, and thats not the right way, so I just deleted it, guess its not for me.

BTW Also my antivirus kept kicking in and out, never had that before with a game

author: {'steamid': '76561198107886424', 'num_games_owned': 112, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 83, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1578370185}
review:
oh boy, where do I start?

alright, graphics are alright, there isnt really a problem with that, but there character animations? what is this 2003? theres not many moves to do, theres no point in throwing a projectile the other person can always block AND it takes 3 seconds to throw. the power move make no sense because you dont have time to execute one, and when you hit someone once, you hit them anywhere between 3 and 8 times? come on, even in 2014 this was bad. 

I will say tho, the music is alright, dont like how when you customize your character it still puts you in a match, then you die because you think think your just spectating another match. the weapons are ok at best. just, dont waste your hard drive on this. theres little to nothing this game offers even for free

author: {'steamid': '76561198052012509', 'num_games_owned': 992, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 403, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 403, 'last_played': 1552737305}
review:
Yeah nah. I have way too many games in my library so I recently decided to install and play all of them to decide if they should be kept or thrown it the bin. Blade Symphony went in the bin. (Support > Games Software etc. > I want to permanently remove this game from my account)

I bought Blade Symphony long before it went free to play. I tried it for a bit but the controls felt clunky and unintuitive so I ended up putting in on the backburner. I totally forgot all about it until they went free to play and I thought I should check it out again, The controls are just as iffy now as they were back then. 

I'd suggest checking out a game called 'Strength of the Sword ULTIMATE' instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018450069', 'num_games_owned': 811, 'num_reviews': 587, 'playtime_forever': 223, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 223, 'last_played': 1553450632}
review:
Blade Symphony is one of those interesting concepts, that we see very few identical games these days. 
But unfortunately, although it is so unique, it has not survived over the years.

Taking in consideration that the game is a 2014 game, it is a very nice game, graphically speaking. The game was certainly an excellent experience, back in the days, and this is visible for the positive reviews at the time and many of them of players with hundreds of hours of game.

But my main concern now, in 2019, is the fact of the servers are almost empty, even after the game move to a F2P. 

I do not say you should not try it, since it is now free, but from my game experience I cannot recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198139810472', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 36, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1562632316}
review:
I really, really LOVE this game. 
In an area where almost every game is dominated about guns and shooting, it's REALLY nice to get a 
DEEP Swordplay alternative.

I haven't tried the PvP yet because my connection is crap right now, I still have a lot of fun even against bots.

In summary, if you  were YEARNING a great swordplay we haven't seen before, check out this game. 
But if you're are all about PVP, I'm REALLY, REALLY SORRY I can't help you there yet, 

(But don't forget this game is just out of the oven and probably will get better with time)
Also, I'm sure all other reviews will give you a good idea.


Anyway, since it's free, you can give a try and make your own decision.

Have a great day!!

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198001911739', 'num_games_owned': 954, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1421, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1376, 'last_played': 1540261045}
review:
I have found this game quite fun as long as you make sure you are in classic mode. Your other option is arcade mode which is a shitty simplified mode where you have way less attacks and options. This mode is terrible and honestly seems to have confused those who say the game has been simplified. I can only assume they were just spamming click when they entered a server and accidentally selected arcade mode. 

Otherwise though the combat in the game is quite deep as you play mindgames with your opponent. Nothing feels quite as good as parrying a light blow with a heavy one and chunking someones health bar.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083083263', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 928, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 927, 'last_played': 1581974341}
review:
Fighter games are a niche genre, and most of them are pay 2 play. This is one of the most complex, innovative and satisfying games of its genre, which makes it even more niche. 

And it also costs 0$. 

If you ever wondered if you like such niche games, wonder no further and try this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041790019', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 640, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 620, 'last_played': 1621512919}
review:
From the few hours I've experienced, I've tried out all characters and weapon styles.
I've come to three conclusions.

1.) The game used to have a load of other weapons that were purely visual, the base is still sword, rapier, longsword, katana and scimitar. It seems that they either haven't transferred over all of it OR they plan to sell them. 

2.) The original playerbase is mostly positive and very willing to tutor, new players often ignore the general behavior in FFA (Free For All) mode from advanced peers and just outright fight everyone, interrupting conversations, bothering people who just want to enjoy the scenery, so on so forth. This is not the best, seeing as you get no rewards for literally just trying to kill people outside of duels or active games like CTF.

3.) Most new players don't try to learn anything, they expect to be professionals capable of going toe to toe with the best, then complain and leave negative reviews, blaming the game for their own inability to explore and learn. Most don't even know that there's MORE beyond Arcade Mode, they don't even read the tutorial prompts.

So I've come to the following conclusion:
- If you want to enjoy a fast paced, violent and complex timing and motion based game, come play this, enjoy the community of mostly friendly players, its very rare to find a toxic one as most of the toxic ones are new.
- If you personally complained about, lack of complexity... perhaps take some introspection classes. To anyone who involves themselves with the game they play, will quickly see how incredibly superficial you must be to not notice what lies beneath the hood.

author: {'steamid': '76561198295832153', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 127, 'last_played': 1552635418}
review:
A fairly simple fighting game with a lot of potential that falls short. The game revolves around a couple of weapons (scimitar, rapier, etc) and there fighting styles and a handful of characters who alter these styles into unique attacking motions. Combined with four different fighting stances (Light, Balanced, Heavy, and air attacks) you'd think there would be a variety of attacks to do, especially for a fighting game like this. However, it just consists of repeatedly clicking the left mouse button (which can really hurt your finger after awhile if you are interested in the more aggressive fighting styles) and either moving your character left or right or not at all. The movement is mediocre and the attacks feel stiff and unnatural. It becomes fairly apparent early on in any pvp matches that some characters simply have better movesets, allowing them to easily overcome opponents with repeated combos or attacks, and considering some of these attacks (not a combo, but an attack or two) can take away nearly half of an opponents life, this shows itself to be a serious flaw.  
 The player base isn't toxic, but instead mostly silent and consisting of what appears to be almost entirely of new players with an occasional semi-veteran player (someone who has played more than a week at least). While having new players to your game is nice, what isn't is not having them come back or play enough to advance in the ranks. The combat is also quite buggy and many times you can win by just button mashing, spamming a combo, and occasionally changing stances. 
  There are a couple of game modes; FFA, 1v1 dual, 1v2, 2v2 and some variations on the rules of these.  While having these other modes is nice (and honestly would be fun to play, I mean doing a bunch of random samurai battle in ffa would be great, or working with a partner in 2v2 would be fun) none are played except 1v1 matches. After playing quite a few of 1v1 matches I felt that playing some of the other modes would be fun, but after waiting almost 20 minutes in a room trying to get a 2v2 going I was a little dissapointed as only 2 people joined and left shortly afterwards. FFA is pretty much a joke - you can go around randomly fighting others in large arenas (I played in a mall and monestary) which would be fun if they hadn't decided to add the ability to private dual others, which is highly endorsed by many and they consistently go around only private dualing others, essentially making it impossible for people to actually do any free for all fighting because the player count is so low (the highest it was while I was in it was 5 people, and it was the only populated ffa server). 
  

  Overall, I thought the game had a lot of potential to be fun, but the poor controls, lack of players, inexperienced playerbase, and only one game mode actually played by players make it a lackluster, boring experience. I recommend if you have some friends you want to dual with or mess around with, but otherwise you are fairly likely to find it boring if you can't get around these flaws.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094523839', 'num_games_owned': 420, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1552549801}
review:
also ehrlich gesagt habe ich schon das spiel deinstalliert noch bevor ich das tutorial abgeschlossen habe aber das hat auch einen grund die videos auf steam sahen vielversprechend aus das war auch der grund warum ich mir das spiel erst runtergeladen habe gut ich starte das spiel was mir direkt auff√§llt ist das wenn die musik im spiel l√§uft das sie ein knistern verursacht hatte ich bei noch keinem spiel ok dachte mir halb so schlimm machste musik einfach aus gesagt getan fragt mich das spiel ob ich das tutorial starten m√∂chte habe ich gemacht und da war ich das erste mal ingame und da viel mir es wie schuppen von den augen die animationen sind nicht wirklich fl√ºssig liegt nicht an mir hatte 120 fps man kann horizontal und vertikal angreifen das kann man mit w.a.s.d steuern also w√§hrend man in eine richtung l√§uft und die maustaste dr√ºckt greift man an dann gibt es noch verschiedene kampf haltungen schnell,defensiv und schwer ok genug grund mechanik des spieles erkl√§rt die charaktere f√ºhlen sich an wie wenn sie tonnen schwer w√§ren ein "ausweichschritt" geht grade mal so 40 cm d.h ausweichen kann man das nicht nennen die "ausweichrolle" ist genau so also einem angriff ausweichen ist nicht wirklich m√∂glich ganz ehrlich nette idee aber nicht gut umgesetzt.

Fazit: Schaut es euch an aber ich pers√∂nlich w√ºrde eher etwas geld ausgeben um dann ein besseres kampfspiel zu kaufen wie z.b die Tekken reihe oder For honor oder street fighter oder WWE aber WWE ist nicht wirklich ein vergleich aber trotz dem lieber etwas in den geldbeutel greifen und sich was gescheites kaufen als sich auf ein spiel zu verlassen was einst geld kostete und jetzt free to play ist auch eine masche der entwickler spiel hat nicht wie erwartet genug geld eingebracht also transaktionen einbauen und free to play machen immer hin sind sie so gescheit den leuten die sich mal das spiel gekauft hatten 10 "exklusive" items zu geben wie "exklusiv" sie wirklich sind kann ich nicht sagen aber ich schweife ab also ich sage probiert es aus oder lasst es sein und ich meine 3,4 GB glaube ich waren es gehen ja noch zum runterladen ansonsten greift lieber in den geldbeutel und kauft euch bessere spiele. 

danke f√ºrs lesen hoffe diese review hat euch bei eurer entscheidung geholfen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198195303607', 'num_games_owned': 598, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 362, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 362, 'last_played': 1552928428}
review: I've given this game a shot and I honestly don't see why people hate it. While it is a little hard to read animations and it is a little janky It's not bad by any means and the fact that it's free to play means that for a free to play game this game is really solid especially when it tries to mimic the Movie Battles mod for Jedi Academy and does a really good job at trying while also doing it's own thing. Some people are comparing this to For Honor but honestly I think it's really unfair considering a game that was made by a small team of developers to a game made by Ubisoft. If you haven't given this a shot then I recommend you do before you let the review bombing change your mind. I expected far worse and I was very surprised. I'm glad I didn't let dumb Steam reviews decide for me.

review:
Blade Symphony is an amazing fighting game. 5 different weapons and classes, with many combinations to mix and match for your own preferred playstyle. Well made and great fun with randoms and/or friends, I really don't understand the negative reviews. Would definitely recommend this game, no doubt.




(ALSO, I paid for this game as well. I did not start playing after the F2P update, first played it in a free weekend a while ago and bought the game soonish after.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198052516598', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 274, 'last_played': 1554003247}
review:
Just picked the game up, it's harder than it looks and very fun. 

There's a lot of bugs, especially in the tutorial as of writing this. If you decide to try this game though, make sure you get through the whole tutorial, then fight against a bot or two. Then, join a server and try to figure out how the servers work. Choose 'Arcade' mode to make the fight simpler and easier to learn at first. 

You're not gonna do very well at first but that's ok, the game's still fun even when losing. It definitely requires a bit of learning to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996224120', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 31814, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30927, 'last_played': 1693009083}
review:
Normally I'd not post a review unless I really wanted to, but seeing all the negativity towards the game is seriously annoying.

People with 3 hours tops, most of which I'm betting was from a combination of loading the gaming, doing the tutorial, and sitting on their as. These same people are talking badly about the game for the combat, which is earnestly phenomenal and probably the only legs that this game has to stand on. 

Playing this for a few minutes and saying it's bad is like walking into a buffet, having a piece of bread, and going "Wow there's nothing on offer here".

This game is, at heart, a fighting game but in 3D space. It's a deep, intense, and honestly well designed core (read: core) system that is highly competitive. When you're new, you're going to get dumpstered by better players, 100% guaranteed, because there's next to no dice rolling as far as winning in this game is concerned. The better player wins, the guy who doesn't choke wins, etc.

So, as someone who loves this game and with good reason, let me lay it out for you.

This game is good, but hard. It's fun, but competitive. It's janky, but the core game is very well designed. It's that simple. Play the game, give it a go, it's free and the download is tiny. If you like even the concept of it, then with enough time spent, you'll love the game itself. It's that simple.

Ignore all the people with a handful of minutes who don't understand anything *about* the game who're downcrying it.

Now, there *are* issues with the game, of course. It's janky, the F2P random swords stacking is annoying as hell, and some aspects are painfully badly through out. There's plenty of things in this game *not* to like.

But the reason you'd play it, the combat itself, is deep, meaningful, complex, enjoyable, and competitive. So if you are ok with enjoying a game for the *game* aspects of it, then you should have no issue here.

It's that simple.

author: {'steamid': '76561198131490741', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 150, 'last_played': 1564531613}
review:
It's not as bad as the reviews make it out to be. There aren't many bugs, and the online gameplay is fun. The only micro-transactions are a few cosmetics. The tutorial isn't the greatest, but online is fun. 
A bit of advice, change the settings early on. It defaults to double-clicking as a requirement for attacks, which is annoying to me. Grabbing is also set to both 'q' and attack+block. Both are easily changed it settings and having them off improves the game (at least in my eyes). 
It isn't the best game ever, but it's fun and free so you might as well give it a chance.

author: {'steamid': '76561198127122233', 'num_games_owned': 75, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1552358008}
review:
This is really a great idea. But...
COMBAT MECHANICS: The thing that would save this game if it was good. But it is not. Tutorial looks awesome, and you might think that there will be fighting that actually includes more than sensless button bashing. It really looks and feels good. Then you enter online match and see nothing is important. Just mash it. If you want a sword fight PLEASE include mechanics that FORCE player to obey the rules and be punished for mashing and not thinking with death in the game.
Character movement: You can't just make all kind of movement in a video game to have same speed. How am I to catch a fleeing enemy if there is NOTHING to hinder him running around, and map design helps me not?
Beyond the pretty artwork, there are serious problems with this game.
User interface in the match: Horrible typeface under players legs to identify them. Badly done friend-or-foe identification (people keep attacking teammates). No identification on what team am I at all.
Netcode: Does game have to stutter and lag and almost die every time someone new joins the match?
Completely insane mistake: Rounds seem to hurry to end and start new one and then suddenly you have a tiny text saying server is changing map. 
Maybe if they get serious, and spend 2 years fixing this - it may look like something.
P. S. Anyone talking about "free games" go look at Path of Exile. Like it or not, it's proof that work can be done right.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062300801', 'num_games_owned': 403, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 24, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1552354446}
review: Aw man this game is so disappointing!  I went in with high hopes. This game has really awesome enviornments, sound + music and equiptment design but its like they couldn't find someone to get the control movements programed right. I knew it was bad when I struggled in the tutorial. For one thing a big part of the movement problems would be helped if they just made the jumping higher than a bunny hop. The hitting movements dont transition into the next hit so there is always a pause before the next attack even starts. This means you cant smoothly or quickly attack. Just think about any soul calibur type games and think about how quickly you can jump and attack and how every attack goes seemlessly into the next attack. This game cant do that so it ends up being super cluncky, stilty, and limiting. Dont be fooled by the videos, just because a single attack looks fast doesnt mean you are fast. The solution to their problem is so simple. It would truely be a cool game if they just emulated the animations of games like Soul Calibur. If it ain't broke, don't fix it and if it sucks ass please for the love of gaming and your livelyhood, fix it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048577615', 'num_games_owned': 1293, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1552351233}

author: {'steamid': '76561198136427816', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1552323904}
review:
I have been curious about this game for a while, and after seeing it go free to play I decided to give it a look.
But even playing the tutorial proved way too much for me, lemme explain:

The game is overally slow, with animations way too clunky to withstand and most mechanics seems placed a bit at random;
You can direct your attacks in multiple directions (with the movements keys...), yet the block is universal and will block any non-charged attack.
The parry mechanic is the most stupid in my opinion, since it's almost a pure rock-paper-scissor based on which stance you and your opponent are using, so if you simply don't know each single attack animation for every stance you have roughly 1/3 of chance of parrying by simply spamming attacks.

I'm not gonna talk about graphic, models, visual and audio effects, since if a fighting game of this kind has such messed up core mechanics.... welp, I guess I'll stay away from it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074007259', 'num_games_owned': 79, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2306, 'last_played': 1506847619}
review:
Bueno, yo lo tengo desde hace tiempo porque lo compre, la verdad me he divertido bastante con este juego, sin embargo es verdad que cuando lo jugaba habia muy poca gente de Argentina jugando, al menos habia, en el a√±o pasado cuando lo re instale no habia nadie casi ni en los servidores rusos que antes se llenaba jaja, es un juego que no se puede jugar con mucho ping ya que requiere coordinacion y reflejos rapidos, eso es lo que mas me gusto del juego, creo que el punto debil es que necesita mas gente jugandolo, no me quejo de que lo hayan puesto gratis, me parece buena forma de hacer vivir el juego, otra forma es agregar contenido y progreso personal, tambien estetica mas atractiva para la mayoria de gente, y otra negativa que le veo es que algunos movimientos no se ven tan naturales, pero el juego es bastante divertido.

PD: las rese√±as negativas con gente excesivamente molesta con la jugabilidad me da la sensacion que son personas que les fue bastante mal en el juego porque no llegaron a comprenderlo bien, les rompian la cara en todos los partidos que jugaban y por eso terminaron asi enojados con el juego, realmente es algo complejo y eso para mi es lo que tiene de divertido.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064495745', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 242, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 242, 'last_played': 1429389192}
review:
Bought this game back in 2014, didn't pay much attention to it at the time but just wanted to say that it does not deserve any hate that is getting spread around by manchildren that feel ripped off. And about the player base: This game is 5 years old, it is past its prime and people don't play it much, thats why it went F2P, to attract more players, playing a free-to-play but laggy game that is going to get its issues sorted out is better then to play a game for 30$ without other players.

Try the game out, bring a buddy while you are at it.
DON'T complain that a 5 year old game wen't free to play, especially considering that most of those reviews by the people who did not even care about the game in the first place.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037680270', 'num_games_owned': 841, 'num_reviews': 110, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1509546881}

author: {'steamid': '76561198891001635', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 185, 'last_played': 1584269198}
review:
ok ok ok this game is super fun to play i have cons and pros and i will be discussing why it is bad for me

PRO
1. The combat is satisfying 
2. It has a Great combat system
3. The Weapons and Cosmetics looks Great
4. The community is ok they always say gg and nice if i beat them 
5. Graphics is top notch for a game that runs on source 
6. Its Gamer friendly it isn't mandatory to buy the weapons and cosmetics and the weapons are still the same like on CS:GO
7. It has a Big Skill gap but its easy to learn (if you played the tutorial or not)

CONS
1. It doesn't have a lot of content but there is a workshop for it
2. The game crashes (but i got it 1 time and its summer for me so my computer heats up
3. If you play offline the game runs so smoothly but on online it doesn't (but it also depends on your computer power and your wifi i have a good computer but i am not near to my router so maybe that"s the reason)
4. THE GAME IS DEAD
5. The game is not satisfying if you don"t see your combat like if you play on online you don't regularly see your attacks so oof
6. Doesn't have a lot of people in the servers
7. it gets boring for a while
8. Lacks on single player mode (i know there's a mod that increases the difficulty of the bots)

Conclusion
The games is still fun but its not great anymore it is super frustrating and i am sad that a game that has so much potential like 100% potential waste it there is still hope if the devs change the game and made it better there's so much things that the game can improve on i will give the game like a year or so if they change

review: It is a very niche game, but is worth some of your time to see if it's for you. Now that it's free to play, It'll be full of new people so head on in and try it out.
