author: {'steamid': '76561198016997891', 'num_games_owned': 514, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 3362, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3362, 'last_played': 1552273419}
review:
This is a niche game thats not for everyone. Its clunky, its a bit obtuse, and your going to get your ass kicked.

But if you like becoming better and dueling other folks, and can look past some of its flaws, you'll find a great little (now free to play) gem.

Again, its free to play. You'll know in a hour whether you'll like it or not.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994428793', 'num_games_owned': 353, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 412, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 359, 'last_played': 1602971768}
review:
Blade Symphony is a fencing/dueling sword-play based game that has classic and arcade game modes.  It has very few avatars to choose from, but they can be customized with items that are earned randomly as you level up.  You can also purchase items off of the Steam Market or select items on the store page of the game.  This game apparently went free to play recently, which I feel was a good move for it.

The game also boosts an awesome soundtrack, which is also purchasable in the Steam store.

https://store.steampowered.com/app/301600/Blade_Symphony_Original_Soundtrack/

review:
Puta basura, ni 10 min he durado, el juego es super tedioso, la postura "rapida" ya de por si es lenta de cojones, incluso el mu√±eco de pruebas del tutorial no te deja respirar y te spamea el mismo ataque una y otra vez con un arma mucho mas rapido que la tuya. author: {'steamid': '76561198077083121', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 180, 'playtime_forever': 27, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1552174378}
review: I can't believe people paid money for this crap. It was a waste of time to download.
developer_response:
Hey BACON WARRIOR,
I'm sorry that you feel like our game is crap. We're only a team of 3 people working on this game, and work tirelessly to get things right. With a 14 year old engine, and such a small team, it can be hard to get things right. 

However, that being said, we're still working hard to get this right. If you have more feedback on your negative experience, I would be interested to hear it. What made your experience crappy?

We've recently added 8 new items that are exclusive to those that have owned the game. We'll be adding another 8 items in the next two weeks. These are highly polished items, that cannot be unlocked by anyone else. We hope to continue adding more items.

If you feel like these 16 high quality items are still unsatisfactory, then please let me know, and I will be happy to send you a refund of my own money.

All the best,
Mike

author: {'steamid': '76561197967460895', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 88, 'last_played': 1559680566}
review:
Like Smash Bros.? Like M.O.B.A.s? This game is for you.

Blade Symphony is free to try. Worst case scenario you waste a couple of hours.

The genre of game I'd compare this to is the mid-1990s wave of "fighting games" (a.k.a. "button-mashers" or "combo breaker games"). At the higher level of competition, games like Street Fighter II were actually fairly strategic, with players caring about how fast a given attack would be and learning other characters' moves so they could know how to respond. That is Blade Symphony's whole approach. If learning a meta and thinking on your feet appeals to you this is a game you'll like. Also, if you don't usually like those games you may still be interested. Read on.

I play strategy games and story-based games. I don't usually like "button-masher" games. Years ago I played some story-heavy shooter games from a Star Wars series called Jedi Knight. They were noteworthy because they had detailed controls for lightsaber duels, so you weren't just clicking "try to kill that guy" all the time. When I heard about Blade Symphony I was kind of excited because this game gets compared to Jedi Knight, which I actually remembered pretty fondly. When I tried Blade Symphony I was struck by the attempt at strategic depth. I found myself interested in a sort of game I don't usually like, an action button-masher with no story. Why? Because there's a lot of really accessible strategy. I felt like I was learning a new M.O.B.A., not a button-masher. This is a thinking player's game. Don't be discouraged by what you think you'll find.

Note: When I started reading the other reviews I noticed a lot of Blade Symphony's past players are angry about the game's pricing. Originally you paid a flat price up front and everything was immediately unlocked. I didn't play back then, but I get why those players are upset at seeing a massive change in how you paying for the game. If you're a newcomer you may want to be cautious of how much the past players feel betrayed by the game's publisher.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066416796', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 770, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 770, 'last_played': 1552277820}

author: {'steamid': '76561198215802927', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 150, 'playtime_forever': 105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1552080374}
review:
ansich n nettes nahkampf/schwert kampfspiel. gibt viele tricks und combos die auch nicht allzu schwer zu beherrschen sind. wo das spiel ansich total versagt ist die beute/belohnung bei lvl ups und nach manchen duellen. irgendwie hab ich 10 mal das selbe schwert und in der info wird mir jedesmal die selbe info/stats gezeigt... stellt sich die frage, sind die 10 schwerter wirklich alle gleich oder √ºberseh ich was? es ist n√§mlich sehr l√§stig wenn man durch die schwert auswahl klickt und dabei erstamal 10 mal das selbe schwert anschauen darf bevor man zum nem anderen schwert kommt. das selbe hab ich zb mit masken. ich hab nach kurzer spielzeit 3x die selbe maske gedropt. die ist nicht mal farblich variierend oder anderes. h√§tte auch gereicht die maske zu stapeln, wenn man damit etwas anderes anfangen k√∂nnte wie zb verkaufen oder tauschen.
noch dazu ist mir das spiel am selben tag mehr als 6 mal gecrasht. 1 mal sogar nach beendigung des tutorials als es zur√ºck ins menu gehen wollte... durfte hier den letzten tutorial schritt noch mal durch gehen, weil sonst das spiel jedesmal anmerkt "sie haben das tutorial nicht komplett beendet. m√∂chten sie forsetzten ja/nein?". hier zu sei angemerkt ich in den letzten 10 jahren sehr selten spielabst√ºrze hatte. sie k√∂nnen schon mal vorkommen, ist ja auch nicht schlimm, aber nicht so oft an einem einzigen tag wo man erstmal ins spiel kommen m√∂chte. f√ºr ein spiel das angeblich schon lange auf dem markt ist, ist dies ein armutszeugnis

h√§tte das spiel ne gescheite server √ºbersicht wo man sich aussuchen kann wo man beitritt anstatt nur "zuf√§llig" verbunden zu werden um dann rauszufinden das es nur 1 server gibt der grad gehostet wird.auch wenn dieser gut besucht ist, l√§sst einen das denken das das spiel eine seeeehr kleine comunity hat wenn √ºberhaupt

trotz der abst√ºrze und der schlechten server auswahlgeschichte sowie der schlechten loot organisation bringt das spiel fun in duellen. f√ºr ein mittlerweile f2p spiel gut genug. ka was das spiel vorher gekostet hat, aber es war den preis sicher nicht wert. aber jetzt kann man ja nix falsch machen damit ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198013583343', 'num_games_owned': 355, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1418786720}
review:
4/10, kind of boring, and mechanics weren't all that interesting back when I bought it.

It's free now apparently, so the $20 I wasted is even more of a waste now.
developer_response:
Hey Azerik,
I'm sorry that you feel like something was taken away from you. The intention for this game going free-to-play was to open it up to a broader audience, so that we could swell our player numbers. It's obvious that there is still more work to do, and we are working hard.

We've recently added 8 new items that are exclusive to those that have owned the game. We'll be adding another 8 items in the next two weeks. These are highly polished items, that cannot be unlocked by anyone else. We hope to continue adding more items.

If you feel like these 16 high quality items are still unsatisfactory, then please let me know, and I will be happy to send you a refund of my own money.

All the best,
Mike

author: {'steamid': '76561198145114325', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 30362, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25976, 'last_played': 1668357728}
review:
Okay folks, so as someone who has actually played this game for a "couple of hours" I should just throw my opinion of it out there. I've bought the Game some years ago, played it a bit. Then just let it collect some dust in my library for bout a year, then played it again. And Oh boy, I played the living hell out of it. I enjoyed it, because of the small playerbase which knew each other (Greetings if anyone of my pals read this). I really liked the mechanics, which purely depended on Skill, because there is no levels, or better swords, or whatever. I wasn't that good, not horrible, but not that good (even after 400 hours, gosh some people still destroyed me). Though I really enjoyed those close fights, going head to head, even if I lost, because, shit, it was a good fight. And then, the Update came. I was not prepared for it. It changed some things, some for the better, but mostly, it ruined my Game. They modified the ranges, which totally threw my feeling for it, which I aquired over all those game hours, off. Couldn't hit anything anymore. Now, okay, I thought "Well just try to get the feeling back" but welp. 50 hours later, and still no change. I kinda gave up. And now, seeing that this games Free to Play aint even that well received... I guess I will say goodbye. It has been a great Time, a Fun time, a frustrating time, there were times where I gave up, times i pulled through, times I learned new moves and mostly just wonderful times. Its been a fun ride, Blade Symphony, but i guess, this is the End. See ya. 


But hold on there buckaroo. Thats not a review, you say? Well, technically yes. 
So here is some reviewish (?) Advice: "Just try that shit for some hours, its fun." It also really helps your Gaming Esteem when you wipe the ground with some guy that normally is way better than you. 
Have fun folks.

Btw: This Review is like real bad.


UPDATE: Whoa, this Game is loaded with Players since the Free to play Update. Oh my gosh, never seen that many in Blade Symphony. I played it shortly after writing this review, just to say goodbye to it, some last duels. But it seems like I just can't leave. Way too many memories, too much time spent, and so many good fights. I can't let go, so I will continue playing it, from time to time, whenever I feel like it. I wont be on as much as before, but still sometimes. 

That being said, if anyone ever needs some advice, someone to play with or anything else, feel free to write me. 
Enjoy the Game.

Over and out.
developer_response:
Thanks for this wonderful review. We're all super happy that you've enjoyed the game for so many hours. We can use all the happy vibes we'll take right now, so thank you for this.

That being said, we still have our work cut out for us. Performance still needs work, there are still crashes out there, and plenty of bugs to go through. Thanks for the patience.

review: I paid money for this, and now its free.
developer_response:
Hey Luka,
I'm sorry that you feel like something was taken away from you. The intention for this game going free-to-play was to open it up to a broader audience, so that we could swell our player numbers. It's obvious that there is still more work to do, and we are working hard.

We've recently added 8 new items that are exclusive to those that have owned the game. We'll be adding another 8 items in the next two weeks. These are highly polished items, that cannot be unlocked by anyone else. We hope to continue adding more items.

If you feel like these 16 high quality items are still unsatisfactory, then please let me know, and I will be happy to send you a refund of my own money.

All the best,
Mike

author: {'steamid': '76561197986948005', 'num_games_owned': 273, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 76, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1552050209}
review:
Figured i'd give it a try despite the overwhelming amount of recent negative reviews.

Honestly the game has potential to be good, but right now its really, REALLY bad.
The gameplay is clunky as all hell and you can't tell if an attack was supposed to hit you or not, since most of the time an attack will hit you a split second or even a second before it makes contact. Some classes are far superior to others, sometimes an attack that should've hit or a parry that you scored don't count and you promptly get your arse handed to you.

now im not exactly "blade of symphony master 420 blaze it my fellow gamer dudes" but i can see major flaws where they're present, in a fighting game a single frame can be the difference between winning and losing a match, so its kind of a problem when the hit boxes are all over the place and attacks hit you way before they make contact. 
Another flaw i mentioned was classes being weaker or stronger than one another, not sure if this applies to weapon types as well since i didn't exactly bother playing with anything other than the longsword. 

Basically i played as the knight for about an hour or so, every fight i'd try to keep my distance and set up strikes since my attacks were all either wide and slow or narrow and somewhat fast (fast if i was using the fast stance, that is.) the fully charged guard breaking strikes would be horrendously slow and although wide they were inaccurate as all hell and had little to no range. So i switch to the vanguard and lo and behold, i no longer have to keep my distance as my attacks, even in heavy stance are extremely fast AND powerful with spinny strikes although these spin4win strikes had slightly less range than the knight's broad swings had (debatable since range is a mystery in this game where a sword will not touch you and you'll still die) they were extremely fast, hit in complete 360 arcs meaning that you couldn't dodge to the side and counter them and were just as if not more powerful than the knight's, PLUS the once slow easily counterable charged attacks now executed extremely fast and this was all done in HEAVY STANCE.

another problem is actions not registering. On multiple occasions i would land a parry (blocking at the last second) which opens the opponent up for a counter attack, yet my opponent would just keep swinging as if i never landed the parry despite the animation taking me out of my blocking stance, on other occasions my attack would clearly strike my opponent and simply go through them doing absolutely nothing.

Another problem with the game is the lack of punishment, in most games if you get caught with your hand in the cookie jar you're in for a spankin', in blade symphony? a light slap to the face at worst and a light breeze at best. 

You missed a charge attack and you weren't the knight? take a step back to avoid any consequences for your failure so long as your opponent didn't position themselves perfectly and react the second your attack frames went away (debatable since some classes have insane recovery from what i've seen, the knight is not one of them though) 

You just got parried? your opponent either accidentally grabbed the air because going from blocking to attacking can't be easily executed because FOR SOME REASON grabbing is bound to both Q and attack+defend or they didn't react in a split second to your clunky "i got parried" animation so just take a step back or slap them back.

you got knocked down by an opponent's charged attack/grab and they're trying to follow up? good, you can just use a wake up attack that executes in less than a split second to instantly take 30% of their HP away so long as you know how to aim.

There's a lot wrong with this game right now and i can't recommend that anyone waste their time on it.
One good thing i can say about the game is that it doesn't look all that bad, but sprinkles ontop of a pile of shit doesn't really make it any better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016380105', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 78, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1552041407}
review:
It's been a while since I really wanted to write a review for a game. Probably since I haven't had such negative experience lately.
This game has different weapon "types". But don't lie to yourself.
1) Style is defined by character you've chosen. You pick knight you fight like a knight whatever sword you've taken. you pick bald guy - rapire style, black dude - spins with sword like monkey whole time, etc, etc. [looks stupid and retarded, especially if you know at least 5 katana stances used by samurai and see how it looks in game]
2) Weapons: just swords - lame and boring.
3) Played it around an hour I guess....got 4 steampunk cloaks, 4 foxy blahblah katanas, 4 times same color in each group, 4 armor sprays from 1st group in misc that don't even have a texture. And you can't even throw them away.

Game came out in 2014....and 5 years later it's still trash.

author: {'steamid': '76561198152846420', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1552032770}
review:
I only played 20 minutes of the tutorial and I am giving my review. The fighting mechanics are unique and well thought out, the game runs well, there's customisation and cool stuff like that.

Unfortunately for me, what I got really hung up on were the animations. They're not horrible... but they need work. This game was made in Unreal Engine 4, and it's clear that a lot of what's in the game came from stock or free resources. That's not necessarily a bad thing either. What turned me off was that I was expecting this flashy, ninja-like fighting experience, which I hoped would have wow'd me like the first time I played Warframe. I was not wow'd.

It is evident that this was made by a small team, and I don't want to knock their efforts, but this game is going to need at least some procedural animation before it's worth playing in my opinion. Or perhaps some more polish. Perhaps take a note from the game LET IT DIE. Their animations weren't top-of-the-line, but they were convincing and quite fluid.
developer_response:
Hey there Tanktop, thanks for the review!

I'm sorry you had a negative experience with Blade Symphony. We put a lot of work into the last two years of transitioning the game to Free-To-Play. You're right, we're a small team, only two people worked on this game part time for a majority of those two years to make this game a F2P title.

However, I did want to clear some things up. This is not an Unreal Engine 4 title. It predates UE4, and is on the Source Engine. We're aware the animations are pretty dated. The animations were made either by a first-time animator, or a junior animator, between 2007 and 2013. So yes, they're quite dated.

However, given our current team size for the last few years, we've been unable to replace them.

Again, I apologize that you've had a negative experience with Blade Symphony. If there's anything you feel we can do to improve experiences, let us know. However, we do intend to add some polish, as long as this game continues to have players.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001988432', 'num_games_owned': 413, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1552008527}
review:
This game is broken and bad beyond belief. When i looked at the trailers i knew why this fail on a basic level, the combat seemed very clunky and action pretty stiff and unnatural. Going into the game and playing the tutorial is goddamm horrible, broken as hell and the game didnt make any progress in smoothing the previous mentioned problems. Also the "partial controller support" is a straight out lie, you dont even have all the shit binded for combat on the first place, what is worse is that you can do it yourself yet the base game doesnt have it..

Clearly this is a case of devs getting more that they could possibly fathom to chew and the results are obvious at bare sight even on trailers. 5 Years past its "initial release" they didnt improve anything clearly and worse, they focused on content instead of making what was avaiable actually work. Just stay away from this

author: {'steamid': '76561198231129468', 'num_games_owned': 79, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 676, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 553, 'last_played': 1575158077}
review:
This is a great game. The mechanics are not simple and it requires skill to play. I highly recommend it.
Advice for new players: Play the tutorial and pay close attention to what it says. Then practice with bots until you feel comfortable enough to play online. You don't have to become a pro, but understand the basics at least.

author: {'steamid': '76561198149833165', 'num_games_owned': 270, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 1085, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 998, 'last_played': 1604790933}
review:
When I got this game from one of my friend and we tried it out, it was love at the first sight for me, and its still not expired. Even when it was on discount I bought it to one my other friend to play together and try it out. It absulotely worth it price, I say its have to be more expensive, but sadly the game will be free to play in 10 days from now. (Old price was 0,79‚Ç¨, what is way too cheap for a good game like this) I became an absolute fan, played a lot everyday, started to love one of the heroes Pure. But even is how mixed this game my favourite things, is that mixed the good and bad things too.

[h1]Positivities:[/h1] -This game have a perfectly designed complicated, difficult hard to learn fighting combo system. For my oponion its works better than For Honor fighting system. Not that realistic, but more close to me. All about combo the 3 stance and moving directions. The way how to move and how to attack your opponent is rich as hell, and can you play with a whole unique playstyle. Even pretty smooth, you dont feel your character move slow or something. You have to get used to it of course. The pose are almost perfect pretty close how in real life you should use these type of swords and blades in that style of fight. Its similar to ArcheBlade combo system for me, but with even more combos and blades instead of bear hand combat.
-There are 5 different character with each of them own style and moves. Like for example Pure (my favourite one) use a Wushu Sword Style with use mostly better of katana and chinese long sword. Or there are Judgement who use the typical slow but pointly knight moves mostly with long swords or Ryoku who use a ninja style of attack with pretty good mobility and cool looking body tricks. Of course you can use them in your own style what is a pretty good thing, other swords etc, just this is the required ones.
-The blades. So lets talk about the sword collection of course because its name blade symphony there are must be a hell a lot of them to choose. There are long sword, katana, curved swords, scimilars, etc.. A lot of them, but maybe not enought.
-The community. In every multiplayer game the community is the most important pillar of the game. A game can be good, but if the community is bad, this dont mean anything. In Blade Symphony even the community is good too. There are not a lot of player, but at least who there they are all kind, funny and helpful really much. Its like a close but still wide cricle who plays it, they all act like some kind of family. And even this game is mostly a duel game, so who isnt plays honorable, that player will not get notice anymore. They are teaching the newbies and learning together, share things between each other and other things. And even there are FREE in game emotes, what is makes the role playeing or just the conversation way more better and funnier. And even these emotes are hella creative.
-The game graphics. The game graphics are for this price just simply amezes me. Sometimes the loading screen arts not perfect but the in game graphics, is totaly uptodate. Temple is the most beautiful all of them, but all of the maps, even the training room looks pretty damn beautiful. And even not requries a expensive PC, so you can calmly do anything until you play, like hearing musics, what kinda nice, give it a lot to the chill feeling.
-The musics are just awesome. Totaly fit to the situation.
-Pure is love, I can just love her so much to play with, but needs more content. 
-The game have a pretty smart way to trap players in, what good for you and them too. You will play many, but you will enjoy it. Basically every ittem in this game is unlockable with leveling your hero. Advisable to leveling one character mainly and learn it, how to play with it better. You get basic things until lvl 7, then you can go I think maybe the max is lvl 98, and almost every level you get something new, to show how experienced you with your character with. You can get chat color, sword effect, attack color, hero color, hero attachments, new design swords and others totaly free, with only leveling up. You can get experience from fighting against bot, but its not adviseable cause its infinitesimal after a time, like after lvl 20 you have to do houndreds of battles to level up with bots. And you can go of course against players, what I advice cause you learn better to play against them, and you can get significantly more experience from that real life opponents. Win of course gives better than lose, but you can level up pretty fast, if you play much, and duel a lot. I think this is a pretty clever way, to shown from a player how experienced is he in the game, and how much he played. I love it so so much. 
-And for final of course the tutorial quality. Its medium. Pretty hard to understand, but even the game is pretty hard. At least it teach almost everything you need to know, and I liked that they give an achivement for those who do the tutorials, because I'm an old player and still think, they are important in a game, speeding up the learning progress and give more better experiences even who plays over the tutorial and his first online duel partner. And this game have no massive single player(only training), just multiplayer so its even more important to be ready what you will get.

[h1]Negativities:[/h1]-So negativities I start with the most common problem, is Puny Human made almost a perfect job, but the saddest thing in this game, they looks like not interested to update and develop it anymore. There are a lot of things they can do, and there are a lot of buggs wait to be fixed, but they are dont really do much, or at least dont really see anything new happens. The FREE TO PLAY launch is one of this move I fear about, I hope they dont let this game hand totaly after this, because I and a lot of player love this game so much and want to see its alive and new things. This is the main problem of all negativities. There are some old buggs like the honorable achivement dont count well, the game can easily crash out after 3 alt+tab, what happens pretty much if you change music, phalanx cancer, etc.. I hope this negativity will become one day a positivity and they again get back to track, like old days they did.
-There are needs to come back the workshop and how the video says again a whole "independent game", cause a lot of fan made pretty good things in workshop what I really want to try. Or do it like VALVE do, make every month a vote, and the most voted 10 things will be in the game if it deserves it.
-There are needs more content, like more swords, more skins or anything like that. Maybe microtransactions, to buy them cause I'm 100% sure a lot of fan wanna do it, just like I do, but there are absulotely no way to support the content with money. There are only 5 ugly ittems what you can buy, and if you done that you are done. 
-Phalanx are cancer.. He needs a balance update really much.
-And this one for last one, is my own oponion, but I need more fanarts and quality drawed loading screens, from the five heroes, cause it can make it so much better feel to play. And I know you can do it, cause this game is hella beautiful, so please do this and do more content, cause the only things is needs are microtransactions to get money to develop and most importantly conteeent a lot of lot of content, cause players who love the game and a character so much as I do, if you do not much, just a bit content everytime, you got their hearth easily, just need some Labor of Love.

[h1][b][u]Overall:[/u][/b][/h1] This game is absulotely worth it price, sadly it will become free to play, hope the good community will get no worse. The game is almost perfect, beautiful, well made, good running and creative, fun to play with, the only one problem with this game is easly can be solved, the developers have to wake up and make more contents more arts, more bugg fixes, and maybe some microtransactions or something like that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013990072', 'num_games_owned': 1507, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 1262, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1183, 'last_played': 1569842891}
review:
Used to play it a bit and have fun with it, but it was difficult to get into without enough dedication, plus the game was very dead already.

Now the game is much worse in many aspects: simplified, less options, clunky controls. How did this game lose features over time I'll never know, but I don't have fun with it anymore.
developer_response:
Thanks for the feedback, it means a lot to us!

If you wouldn't mind taking a moment to help us understand exactly what you disliked so we can tweak a few things in the future, can you elaborate on what you meant by simplified, less options and clunky controls?

review:
Geli≈ütirilmesi lazƒ±m , oyunda kabaca oynayabileceƒüiniz 75 farklƒ± stil var ve benzer mekanikte ki oyunlardan √ßok daha iyi. Oynayabileceƒüiniz en iyi kƒ±lƒ±√ß temelli d√∂v√º≈ü oyunu. Zaten √ßok ucuz kesinlikle alƒ±p denenmeli. Training'i bitirdikten sonra online modunda 20 dakika ge√ßirin , kesin seveceksiniz. 

+ Her 5 karakter i√ßin yapabileceƒüiniz en az 27 farklƒ± kombo
+ Ger√ßekliƒüe en yakƒ±n ve en serbest kƒ±lƒ±√ß d√∂v√º≈ü√º deneyimi
+ √áok ucuz olmasƒ±
+ Stil √ße≈üitliliƒüi
+ Kolay √∂ƒürenilebilirlik (Ama ustala≈ümak zor)
+ Block ve attack mekaniƒüinden fazlasƒ±
+ Arkada≈ülarla oynamak i√ßin √ßok uygun
+ 10 dakikadan kƒ±sa s√ºrede de oynanƒ±labilirlik

Eksileri
- Hala √ßok geli≈ümesi gereken bir oyun olmasƒ± 
- Silah √ße≈üitliliƒüinin 5 ile sƒ±nƒ±rlƒ± kalmasƒ±
- Karakter yaratmanƒ±n olmamasƒ± ve oyunun size sunduƒüu karakter ve o karakterlerin saldƒ±rƒ± bi√ßimleriyle sƒ±nƒ±rlƒ± olmanƒ±z
- √áok az oyuncu sayƒ±sƒ± (Genelde 1 ya da 2 serverda toplam 8-9 tane oyuncu oluyor)
- D√º≈ü√ºk grafikler (Ger√ßi + olarak sistem dostu da diyebiliriz √ß√ºnk√º grafikler √ßok fazla g√∂z√ºn√ºze batmƒ±yor)
- Oyunun training modunun yetersiz olmasƒ±
- Harita modlarƒ±nƒ±n az olmasƒ±

Temel olarak b√ºt√ºn eksileri geli≈ümesi ile bitecek diye umuyorum , ≈üimdi almazsanƒ±z bile 6 ay sonra kesinlikle d√∂n√ºp tekrar bakmanƒ±z gereken bir oyun yinede bu ucuz fiyatƒ±ndan dolayƒ± alƒ±p denemenizi ≈üiddetle tavsiye ederim. Sadece 2 saat oynamam oyunu vazge√ßilmez kƒ±lmaya yetti √ß√ºnk√º kƒ±lƒ±√ß d√∂v√º≈ü√º tarzƒ±nda en b√ºy√ºk serbestliƒüi tanƒ±yan oyun. 

Blade Symphony almaya karar verenler i√ßin √∂neriler:
Online moda girdiƒüinizde Tab tu≈üuna basƒ±n ve sol altta arcade mode √ºst√ºnde de classic mode yazƒ±sƒ± olacak. Mutlaka classic mod se√ßeneƒüine tƒ±klayƒ±n √ß√ºnk√º oyun arcade moddayken size sadece tek bir √ße≈üit saldƒ±rƒ± ≈üekli sunuyor oysa classic modda onlarca farklƒ± saldƒ±rƒ± ve kombo ≈üekli oluyor. (Arcade modu neden koyduklarƒ±nƒ± anlamadƒ±m bile bu oyunu g√ºzel kƒ±lan √ße≈üitli saldƒ±rƒ± bi√ßimi ve kombolarƒ± oysa)
B√ºt√ºn karakterleri deneyip silahlarƒ±n √∂zelliklerine bakƒ±p oynamak istediƒüiniz tarzda karakteri olu≈üturmanƒ±zƒ± √∂neririm.

Oyunu merak edenler i√ßin:
Oyunu anlatmak gerekirse
5 karakter var ve her karakterin farklƒ± saldƒ±rƒ± hareketleri ve her karakterin Fast - Balanced - Heavy modu ve bu moda g√∂re farklƒ± saldƒ±rƒ± √ße≈üidi  ve arka arkaya yaptƒ±ƒüƒ± her saldƒ±rƒ± i√ßinde yine farklƒ± bir saldƒ±rƒ± hareketi var.
√ñrneƒüin Pure karakteriyle kombo yapacaƒüƒ±z. Fast modunda 4 saldƒ±rƒ±lƒ± kombosu balanced modunda 3 heavy modunda 2 saldƒ±rƒ±lƒ± kombosu var. √ñnce heavy modunda ilk saldƒ±rƒ±mƒ±zƒ± yapƒ±p ardƒ±ndan balanced modunda 2. ve 3. saldƒ±rƒ±yƒ± yapƒ±p fast modunda da 4. saldƒ±rƒ±yƒ± yapƒ±yoruz. (Her modun 1. - 2. - 3. -4. ... kombo sƒ±ralarƒ±nda ki saldƒ±rƒ± hareketi farklƒ±dƒ±r) Kƒ±saca ufak bir kombinasyonla (3+1(havadan saldƒ±rƒ±))4*3*2*1=24 farklƒ± kombo yapabiliriz ve bu sadece Pure karakteri i√ßin ge√ßerli. Oyunu Classic modda 5 dakika oynayƒ±nca demek istediƒüim her ≈üeyi anlayacaksƒ±nƒ±z.

Kƒ±saca alƒ±n bi oynayƒ±n 20 dakika ≈üu oyunu pi≈üman olmazsƒ±nƒ±z. 2,10tl !






Edit: Yazƒ±nƒ±n ba≈üƒ±nda "En az 27 farklƒ± kombo derken demek istediƒüim kƒ±lƒ±√ß √ße≈üitleriyle beraberdi.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996964816', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 129, 'playtime_forever': 118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1549062023}
review:
Gonna have to give it a negative. 
Its quite clunky, its really very dead (While Im typing this review there was literally nobody online playing for quite a while.) the AI is pretty poor, and the tutorials do a pretty bad job of getting across what its like to battle and exactly how. 

That said, it is a bit of a shame, because when I did manage to catch an hour or so of play (and despite getting soundly beaten in almost every single battle.) it was pretty addictive. It never felt particularly fantastic to play even when I was winning, but there was enough progress in what I was pulling off that it kind of keeps you hooked in, keeps you wanting to have one more bout to see if you can come up with a winning strategy. (and you can definitely see the influence of Jedi Knight here, which is similarly quite clunky yet strangely enjoyable.)

So the game went from my finding it to be thoroughly awful, to me being far more forgiving, and perhaps if there were more people around more often I would have grown to like it even more. 

So a thumbs down, but if you can get some friends together to play it, or have more luck with finding people around when you are playing then I reckon itd be well worth the low cost of entry.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113212404', 'num_games_owned': 176, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 588, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 573, 'last_played': 1553365851}
review:
when i bought this game i though ill refund it within 30min.
So i did the tutorial and went on the server browser.
And there was only one server with 4 people on it, in my head i was like ;welp this is a waste of time.;
but i still went on it. the people were very kind on it and offered tips and stuff.
mostly the game is just spam your weapon and win and the game is dead.
but i still had lots of fun during the 2h of game time i had at the time.
i recomend this game even if it is dead, because when people come online and play its lots of fun.
i really wish more people would play this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991694157', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 290, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1662631743}
review:
From the makers of a olden and outstanding work of their game called Dystopia, with qualificaiton that brings you this precise indepth fighting game.

Challenge your self to a spectacle way of swordplay fighting. Strafe the way into attacks and move freely of a dodge to even a sidestep for another chance in turn.

Pros - Indepth mechanics that has it shine in a old fashion way.

Con - A bit of a learning curve to understand. 

Overall a solid game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062813911', 'num_games_owned': 1952, 'num_reviews': 2041, 'playtime_forever': 184, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 184, 'last_played': 1541661981}
review:
[h1] DISCLAIMER: This is a first impressions review, and NOT a full review [/h1]

[quote] PLEASE NOTE: I recommended this game with some exceptions, overall if the game did not live up to just a tiny expectation, I would not have recommended it at all, so please read the review carefully if you are thinking of buying/playing this game [/quote]

Blade Symphony is a game developed and published by Puny Human

The game offers some pleasant graphics and really vibrant colours, although some ugly glitches here and there, it is pleasant all the same

The game does suffer with some repetitiveness at certain areas of the game but a fun game nontheless especially with friends which sadly I don't have. However, how the developers had the audacity to include microtransactions years and even months later after the game came out I have no idea...

Blade Symphony overall, however, is a fun game to play in short bursts, just good luck trying to find players!

[h1] RECOMMENDED :) [/h1]

[b] REVIEW SOURCES: [/b]
[list]

author: {'steamid': '76561198152760885', 'num_games_owned': 17433, 'num_reviews': 481, 'playtime_forever': 239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 135, 'last_played': 1539072685}
review:
[h1]Introduction[/h1]
If you agree that wit should be sharper than a blade, I shall now write about a game which features both and puts that adage to good use. I had my initial reservations in Blade Symphony‚Äôs case. Deliberately delayed my review for it, all in the hopes that I may found a worthy (and very human) swordsman to pit my skills against. This is a multiplayer-centric title, be fully aware of that, while you‚Äôll be most likely dueling bots and an AI which is quite predictable. As the de facto Steam debut of Puny Human (their first project was a Half-Life 2 mod from 2009), Blade Symphony has been on the platform around four years already. It had time to grow and plenty more to gain enough traction and a community. I refuse to believe that melee fighting is a gaming niche, but reality shall contradict me regardless of my intentions. ‚ÄúOnce more unto the breach, dear friends‚Ä¶‚Äù
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1534485173
[h1]Story[/h1]
A huge factor in Blade Symphony‚Äôs diminishing popularity, can obviously be attributed to its utter disregard for proper singleplayer modes, other than some dreary AI fights in which you stand to win almost certainly. I had fun in it, though. It offers complexity to the simulated sword play found in video games. You no longer mindlessly bash a couple of buttons until your opposition succumbs. Against a human player, depending on his or her skill, you stand to lose if you don‚Äôt employ tactics which transcend mere blocks and evasive maneuvers. Forget the melee fighting from countless RPGs you may have played over the years, since the‚Äôll only hinder you now. Perhaps Kingdom Come: Deliverance‚Äôs portrayal of sword fights come a bit closer to the experience in Blade Syphony. As in, rushing and underestimating your opponent will only result in defeat. The stamina bar is only half the obstacle, since parrying and anticipating your foe‚Äôs next move will matter far more.

You still want a story, do you? I can deliver only partially on this front. Simply by judging the visual assets in this title, I presume that we‚Äôre dealing with a ‚Äúcyberpunk-meets-traditionalism‚Äù kind of environment. Some of the bots sported a very futuristic design for their armor, while others preferred the classic half-plate of medieval knights. Don‚Äôt even get me started on the ‚Äúskater kid‚Äù look exhibited by several characters. They can all be dueled in a wide variety of arenas around docks with warehouses, abandoned (yet still neon-lit) city streets, dojos near snowy peaks and gothic cathedrals. No hint towards a timeline or actual locations, so it‚Äôs still up for debate. It somehow seems even more bare bones than your run-of-the-mill MP game in regards to offering any context or explanation. The tutorial doesn‚Äôt alleviate this, it merely thrusts you into an arena where it instructs the many gameplay mechanics which help Blade Symphony stand out. That, it does and I shall go more in-depth below.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1534485580
[h1]Graphics[/h1]
For a 2014 release, the game stood well against the cruel test of time. No surprise, given that Source Engine beats efficiently as the heart of Blade Symphony. Source has almost as much growth potential as Unity and it all depends on skill and dedicated time in the pursuit of pushing towards new limits. Game ran well, looked even better and didn‚Äôt offer me any chance of spotting bugs. True, the maps don‚Äôt allow any sort of exploration, but they‚Äôre clearly well structured beyond the arenas which remain the focal point. I had no problem maxing this game out at 4K@60fps on a GTX 1070. 

[h1]Audio[/h1]
Complaints shall arise from the lack of diversity in the audio department. The sound effects became repetitive much faster than I expected, while the in-game music wasn‚Äôt convincing either. Ended up listening to my own tracks and the problem was solved eventually. I can‚Äôt recommend a certain music genre to you, since sword fighting represents different strokes for different blokes. Pun intended. Just listen to whatever floats your proverbial boat while playing Blade Symphony.

 [h1]Gameplay[/h1]
When I praised this game for getting melee fights right, it wasn‚Äôt a light compliment. You may get overwhelmed by the sheer complexity of the control scheme. I bet you didn‚Äôt expect a fighting game to feature controls reminiscent of strategy titles. Blade Symphony never felt too hard, but combining directional attacks in effective chains while avoiding two or even three bots at the same time, might just be a bit too much for a novice player. Take it nice and slowly with classic one-on-one matches until you get the hang of the peculiarities of different blades. Armor may not be customizable, but the weapons take center stage in this game. Similar to quite a few multiplayer games on Steam, Blade Symphony features occasional item drops to your Inventory. These swords of different shapes and sizes are both tradable and marketable on Steam. Player customization through color schemes and various predefined skins is possible through natural level progression, but in practice and given the current status of the MP modes, I‚Äôd say that‚Äôs an uphill battle.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1534485653
A literal grindfest awaits you, if battling bots shall be used as the only means of gaining experience points. Each win offers a laughably tiny amount of XP, while I guess that even defeats yield a portion of that as well. At least they strived for ‚Äúrealism‚Äù there. Each loss can be a gain, if a lesson has been learned and mistakes shall not be repeated. The dev team realized that most players will feel confused by the complexity of juggling between stances, chain attacks and overly aggressive AI, so they divided the fights in two approaches which shall dictate the final difficulty of the match: Arcade and Classic. Get well acquainted with the former before progressing to the latter. Skipping the tutorial or feeling overconfident, won‚Äôt get you far in Blade Symphony. Ignore what Skyrim taught you about melee combat. Whacking a metal rod at something until it drops dead, won‚Äôt help unless you show restraint and determination in ample supplies.

 [h1]Verdict[/h1]
I was almost ready to turn this into a negative review, for a game which is lacking in singleplayer and featuring a nearly abandoned multiplayer module. But I kept playing, even against the bots and understood that Blade Symphony isn‚Äôt a title that‚Äôs deserving of a score below 60 and despite its current price tag, it is as far from the dollar bin as it is from countless games which implement sword fighting while simplifying it drastically at the same time. Not all game mechanics should be risk-free and straightforward. Same principle which governs most titles looking to stand out, applies here: originality can arise from complexity, if it‚Äôs rarely exhibited in a project‚Äôs competitors. Blade Symphony has no equal in what it does, but sadly that didn‚Äôt save it from relative obscurity... 

[h1]Strong Points[/h1]
+ Beautiful graphics.
+ Comprehensive gameplay mechanics.
+ Steam Achievements & Trading Cards.
+ More than decently priced for what it offers.

[h1]Weak Points[/h1]
- Matchmaking & multiplayer are ghost towns.
- Limited and repetitive sounds.
- No story/campaign.

[b]Rating 60/100[/b]

[quote]This review was submitted for [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/32199709-Fun-Fab-Game-Reviews/]Fun Fab Game Reviews[/url] through the Steam Curator Connect program.[/quote]

author: {'steamid': '76561198033290913', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 96, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1540793222}
review:
Owned this game ever since it released on Steam way back in the past. It was a cool concept that definitely caught my eye, but the combat just never seemed to be there and the multiplayer was either nonexistent or filled with one of the ten people who actively played this game. Gotta say, this was like playing Warband again given how small the community was then. 

Came back because I saw the news of this MASSIVE update. Turns out by "massive",  the devs meant microtransactions made up of items that were previously free from the workshop. On top of that, there is still no community. If you attempt to criticize this, the devs and the five people playing the game will go off on a tangent about how "this generation of gamers gives up too easily" or how you should just use Discord to find someone to play with (out of the pool of the three people still playing Blade Symphony). 

The game is still the same game it was four years ago, the community is basically the same size it was, and now you can pay for Steam workshop skins. All in all, this is probably one of the biggest disappointments on Steam right now, but hey 99c is 99c so don't feel like you're wasting too much money if you do decide to try it out.
developer_response:
Hi Suave,
I'm sorry that you've had a bad experience with the recent Harmonious Prelude update. That really sucks, we worked hard on it and want everyone to enjoy it. Seems like there's still some work for us to do, so I'd love to hear from you if you have some time.

I would argue that the "massive" part of the Harmonious Prelude update was that it contained a new complex multi-matching system, a new style of play, bots to fight against, a level and XP progression system, and Mac and Linux ports.

However, I can certainly see your point regarding micro-transactions for items that were previously free. I've gone into quite some detail about [url=https://steamcommunity.com/games/bladesymphony/announcements/detail/1690432065523584769]what we're doing to mitigate that here.[/url]
One of the four items that we sell has already had been replaced with a new item that is being sold for $0.99 USD. The originally free item has been returned to the game as an unlockable item, free for anyone. [url=https://media.discordapp.net/attachments/474634912561889281/507112681090711552/unknown.png?width=1440&height=538]We're continuing that trend next with a new texture for the Flame Song sword.[/url]

As far as not having a community, I'm sorry that you see it that way. We do rely heavily on our Discord to find people to play with, but it's our only option. Do you have a better way we can attract players? I'd love to hear it.

I will NEVER take criticism defensively, and openly welcome it. It sounds like the statement of "[this generation of gamers..]" is from one of our community members, that does not represent the thoughts and opinions of the rest of the development team or Puny Human as a whole.

There are currently no workshop skins for sale, I recommend you browse the workshop and see the items that have been implemented into the game (as free unlocks.) The items that we are selling on the item store, are meant to supply enough revenue to continue working on Blade Symphony (which grosses about $1,000 a month,) so that we can turn it into a free to play title.

Please feel free to message me directly on Steam, e-mail me at uc (at) punyhuman.com or find me on Discord if you have more concerns. I'm always all ears.

author: {'steamid': '76561198138326576', 'num_games_owned': 247, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 598, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 357, 'last_played': 1436569998}
review:
I used to be a really big fan of this series. In fact i got pretty high up there and alot of the weapons i had were super cool.

Unfortunately this pandered to a very small niche of players. So its playerbase was unsustainable. the game looked absolutely amazing however and was super fun...

however... i have to echo the problems mentioned by alot of other negative reviews. Greedy practices, bad overall direction, and just completely misguided staff have not only fucked this community over royally but driven it so far into the ground it hit the molten core of the earth and burst into flames.

What you're looking at now is the ashes of a once great game. Do not buy it. Not even for 99 cents. Not even for free. Dont even look at it. Ignore this game and leave this page forever. The people who run this do not deserve anything. Let it die in the back channels of steam.
developer_response:
Hi TheAngelOfRoses,
This is some pretty strong language, which tells me you're pretty upset about the recent large update to Blade Symphony. I'm sorry that it's caused you to feel this way, we never want anyone to have such a bad experience with Blade Symphony.

If you have the time to offer some feedback or suggestions, I'd love to hear them. I'm curious what you mean with regards to pandering to a small niche of players. This game is certainly a niche title in that the gameplay and mechanics are unique, even to similar titles. However, I want to know how we can mitigate any pandering or favoritism to a small group of players.

As far as greedy practices, can you expand on this? We're trying to make this game into a Free-To-Play title, which unfortunately is not a "one button click" from a strategy perspective. If the game were to be free overnight, there wouldn't be any money to continue to support the game, fix bugs, create new features, encourage community events, or expand into new languages. As a result, we've lowered the price of the game from $4.99 to $0.99 USD. There are four items for sale in our itemstore, but there are not currently any preivously free workshop items for sale. Does this appear greedy? If you feel so, definitely reach out, so that we can adjust our perception to our prospective fans.

Bad overall direction seems to be a fairly subjective way of saying "I don't like the way the game's design is going." Blade Symphony is pretty complex, there's a lot of moving pieces. However, I always want to know what parts someone doesn't enjoy or think are worth their time. We've introduced a new style in order to cater to newer, less-hardcore players. The multi-match system solved the problem of players continuously sitting in spectate, waiting for a duel. Level and XP progression was an answer to an aging micro-currency system that was routinely broken, and not very expandable. If you can be specific as to your dislikes, I'd love to have us make adjustments where possible.

If you feel like we still do not deserve anything for our 5 years of post-release support, and 11 years of development on this title, please let me know and I would be happy to Venmo, Paypal, Cashapp or even send you a check for the amount you paid for Blade Symphony. You can contact me through Steam, my e-mail, uc (at) punyhuman (dot) com, or on Discord.

Thanks for your feedback, and looking forward to hearing from you.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987787865', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 45, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1540461370}
review:
While I cant say I liked the game in the past or after trying it again at it's $0.99 price point.  The combat feels like something considered acceptable 10 years ago(actual release 4 years ago).  While I really like the enviroments its still not enough to convence me to play this over games like  For Honor, Absolver, or any traditional 2d/3d fighting game.

You could argue their different price points, budgets, dev team sizes, but that wont give it an edge on the competition if it still has a subpar combat system when it goes free to play.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198036020557', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 157, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 154, 'last_played': 1540894696}
review:
Died when they introduced the character Vanguard back in 2014, as the character is over-powered and has a low "skill ceiling". Nothing has changed and the forward-step+attack that is her entire move-set still trumps any move any other character has.  Now they further defecate on the old fans by removing the fan-made free workshop items and replacing them with paid items. 

It's going f2p "soon" (Source "1" is the dev saying it's gonna go f2p at the start of 2018, lol.) and it's not a bad price at that point, but even now it's asking a bit much considering the wound is still raw. Also it was "on special" for $1 after the "FREE WEEKEND MASSIVE UPDATE!", was increased back to $10 for about 8 days and now it's $1 again. I believe that this was the last actual attempt at getting money out of people and now it'll fade back into obscurity.

1-https://steamcommunity.com/games/bladesymphony/announcements/detail/1471973407582394082?l=ukrainian
2-https://steamcharts.com/app/225600

Also the masks look fine but all the characters start without masks (Because f2p now) and look like they have hydrocephalus. Please change this Puny Human, and I'll remove this paragraph from my review.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069827833', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 219, 'last_played': 1455863400}
review: The hard thing is that I want to recommend this game. It has a great combat system and is pretty fun and relaxed for a fighter game. Even the open areas for free for alls were pretty fun even to just chat with people. Because why not dice up people you might become friends with. The best thing too was the workshop support so im here bashing peoples heads in looking ridiculous. But they have gotten rid of that. They did offer a content update and even after all this time try to revitalize the game. It is fun to play with but having no community or population makes this a negative review.  The update was a valiant effort but the lack of workshop and addition of microtransactions really were a kick in the balls for players that had this game for a long time. Hopefully the redo the game from the ground up keep the combat and flow as well as the chill, semi competitive vibe of it and release something better later on. Gotta really rate the game a C-. Pricing is very favorable but you'd have to get friends in on it. The removal of the workshop and addition of the microtransactions hurt and take away from the exciting surprise of the content update and attempted revival of the game. On the surface and to a new  player just looks like a game someone made for a  small grab. But it really is fun to try in small doses.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970977142', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1538341221}
review:
Coming from someone who loves sword fighting games like Kengo (Sword of the Samurai),

I had this game in my wishlist for 6 months and now I finally decided to get it for 1 Euro.
This game is not worth 5 Euros.
The animations are bad. The tutorial is completely confusing.
At no point in time had I had the feeling that I'm in control of my sword at all.
In the tutorial the AI is just spamming forward attacks and you can't really get away no matter what you do.
Yea, I know some of you may say, I'm a noob and git gud. The game doesn't even make me want to get good.
It plain and simple sucks. That's probably the reason why there are only like 5 servers which are mostly EMPTY.
I remember the duels in Jedi Knight games, where you could control your saber with mouse movements instead of complicated button combinations. Maybe the devs should take a look at that and learn something from it?

review:
I've owned this game for a while. It doesn't seem to have imrpoved much over the years.
The animations and models look pretty nice but online combat is very choppy and there are barely any players online (~6 online right now as I write this).
I don't feel like I win/lose based on my ability to play the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970882950', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 180, 'playtime_forever': 67, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1538290478}
review:
Steep learning curve for this fighting game, but I like it after playing its free weekend. I wished it had offline single player even with AI bots. The game ran well on my ancient, updated 64-bit W7 HPE SP1 PC with 6 GB of RAM, ATI Radeon 4870 video card (512 MB of VRAM), 2 SATA HDDs, etc. Also, its berimbau.exe game process gets stuck after quitting the game. I have to kill it to make it go away. :(

I also like how this game has Linux and Mac OS ports too. Nice!

author: {'steamid': '76561198090757837', 'num_games_owned': 1400, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 597, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1629764267}
review:
First of all, these videos you see here are lies. It's "play for free" today and tomorrow and after spending 30+ minutes fiddling with settings trying to enable the controller (it changes to disabled as soon as you leave the menu) I gave up and went through the tutorial with mouse and keyboard... Only to find the controls clunky as f*ck. The camera is all over the place but somehow feels unresponsive. There's a [b]huge input lag[/b] because the game waits to see if you'll keep a button pressed for a charged attack or release it right away, it often doesn't register left+attack or right+attack and instead just shoots you forward with a regular slash making you loose a duel, every now and then if you move in one direction then stop for a second and then move in that direction again your avatar dashes even though you didn't double tap. Stance changing with 123 is the craziest of all. You need to lift at least one finger from your WSAD home position sacrificing one movement direction in order to switch the stance and you [b]have to do that mid-combo after each attack[/b] (to avoid getting insta-parried and countered) - feels unnatural and badly designed. It's 1$ now but seriously, save yourself the trouble and just ignore it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11095, 'playtime_forever': 510, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 510, 'last_played': 1534687572}
review:
This is a PvP arena third person sword fighting/brawler game.   A lot of effort seems to have gone into putting the combat mechanics together, but apparently it never caught on.   There were absolutely zero players when I went to look for a game.

Because there's no single player game, and multiplayer is completely dead, I can't recommend this.   Should a developer read this review, it's a good time to make the reminder that while PvP games can be wildly successful, PvP is not content.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079514954', 'num_games_owned': 396, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1553397110}
review:
DISCLAIMER: I bought this game via Chrono.gg's coin system for daily logins. So it can be seen sorta as a free copy. But i still bought it technically

That being said of what i played so far. This game is pretty fun and kinda makes me wish For Honor played this smooth. While the game feels like it has some jank to it, it is very enjoyable and fun. Every attack feels very satisfying and the way moves and stances flow are really unique. Every attack flows to the next as you can see in the bottom left. So you could do 1 heavy into 1 balanced into 2 lights if your stances support it.

Lastly and this is the biggest downside... this game has little to no population so i have to kick into a bring your own friends kinda game or look for a community discord to set up matches. I did catch a few randoms on today but i didnt have the nicest ping for those games. At $5 you can 100% get what its worth and is pretty cheap for a fighting game. But note there is talks of a f2p patch or something so you can wait until then either.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009474997', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1072, 'playtime_forever': 31673, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1105, 'last_played': 1575262746}
review:
a Fun game but its pretty much dead, if you buy this game expect to play against AI bots unless you and a few mates buy it together...

The gameplay itself isnt bad , the character movement was done smoothly flowing nicely with the game itself, the same for the physics behind the game , it comes together very nicely.

 The game optimization is also very decent, i played this game on a low end laptop and it still ran pretty decent for me.
The combat is very nice and quite enjoyable, its nice and fluid, the entire game is good, the only actual issue is that the servers are pretty much dead, if it wasnt for that this game would be great.

review:
Can't get a server going to play with friends. Co√†ntroles are stiff; nothing is flewend, everything feels stiff. You have no idea where you are aiming your sword at. You can throw knifes, but why is a mystery. They take for every to throw. instead of like 3 knifes per life fast throwing or charging up you can only charge. Dodge rolles are very short and wallrunning is poor.

There is a swordfighting/gunslinger wall runing shooter out there. GunZ 2: The Second Duel. Way more flewent then this. They could take a look at it and learn a lot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038146007', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 234, 'playtime_forever': 21, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1525410989}
review:
DON'T BUY THIS GAME.

I'm giving it a thumbs up because it is really fun, but literally NOBODY plays it. It's 100% dead. All you can do is play against some generic AI bots. It was fun for 20min, but that's all the fun I got out of it.

If this game actually had people playing it, it'd be well worth the pickup, but since that is NOT the case, DO NOT BUY THIS. You will NOT get your moneys worth. 

I recommend the game itself, because it's not fair to downvote the game as a whole because nobody plays it. That wouldn't be fair, but it's only worth it to play with others. Since there is nobody playing, I can't recommend it. 

Sorry guys :(

author: {'steamid': '76561198042509103', 'num_games_owned': 444, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 995, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 957, 'last_played': 1673132135}
review:
Great game, pretty underrated, and totally worth its price :D (got it for 1 buck on sale) It's a sword-fighting online arena with a lot of depth. You can play 5 classes with 5 different swords, each of these having their very own strengths and weaknesses. Sadly, the playerbase is pretty small.. Also, there's a weekly meeting every friday (which I can't attend unfortunately). Be careful though, some players there are pretty strong ~

Totally recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067359292', 'num_games_owned': 475, 'num_reviews': 306, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1546361218}
review:
Seems like a fun sword duel game, the mechanics seem to focus on timing and counters, even the tutorial gives you a good grasp on the depth of the game ( not that you couldnt just try to smash buttons to win too :P )

It seems fun and the all but there is no one playing at the moment, its a shame because it looks like a nice polished game, there really ought to be some even to make the playerbase increase.

Its too bad I seem to be late to the party. However I read that soon enought (April 12th) the game is going to be re-released in free-to-play mod, which should be enought to revive the game for a bit longer and maybe find someone to play with, so I will be back to recheck it on a few days.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996356906', 'num_games_owned': 733, 'num_reviews': 215, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1536414593}
review:
Another absurdly hard game with a worse than useless tutorial. Most of the time I thought I was doing what it asked, only to get no credit for it, and then suddenly I'd get a couple of progress markers with no idea why. Frankly it would be better to just give you a relatively dumb AI to fight and a reference sheet with the various moves. I skipped most of it because I honestly could not figure out how to progress. At least this game lets you do that, unlike Furi.

The AI bot will slice you up and you won't even know what happened most of the time. And that's all the offline play you get. And the servers are a ghost town.

The Dev's need to think about how they might encourage new players. Definitely an easier AI to practice against and Possibly even a slowed down mode (At least down to half speed).

It's one thing to make what looks like a beautiful and challenging game, but this game seems to go out of it's way to sabotage new players and keep people away.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976367281', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 3843, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3441, 'last_played': 1555834382}
review: A truly amazing game that I haven't played for almost 4 years. I got into this game before travelling to China, and was inspired to model some content or it, but never got around to doing it. I remember the community being really funny and awesome. I forget the name of the character I played as, but he was the breakdancing ninja guy. I miss faint dodging people and saying "Too slow" on the mic" 5/7 perfect game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979918194', 'num_games_owned': 1188, 'num_reviews': 206, 'playtime_forever': 93, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 93, 'last_played': 1517372692}
review:
One of the most bizarre fighting games I've ever played.

Now that may not be a bad thing; as there's not many other games out there with you can be pyramid head using a traffic cone and his authentic sword ripped from the original game.

But the controls in this game are awful, the fighting is-  weird, buggy, and clearly there is skill required for it gained via practice but even then I'm not sure how much you can master the weird sparratic combat in this game.
Aiming your sword swings seems to be completely useless for the most part;  mostly just existing for the sake of adding a sense of style to the combat or when you really want to parry the enemy-  but even then I think your sowrds probably collide either way.

The game itself is pretty cheap so perhaps it's kinda worth it at the price, but you're honestly not likely to enjoy it much;  there is no single-player in it outside of just 1v1, 1v2, 2v1, and 2v2 bots. 

I've tried so many times to get into the game but get just completely done with it within 20 or so minutes of messing around in it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027447537', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1516723384}
review: A rather neat diversion from the average source game, requiring constant attention and quick thinking to take your enemy down. While not many people are playing at the moment, the AI bots you can fight against are perfectly competent to practice against until a human opponent arrives. Since it's so cheap, one can buy the two pack for less than $10 and bring a friend along for the ride with the soundtrack to boot! Pretty fun game, and a nice alternative to the AAA titles that try out a similar format.

review:

-Matchmaking but not fully, it would be nice to join community servers
-Lobby creating just so its easier to join a match with your friends
-Better ping on official servers, i am playing on the au servers and i always have at least 200 ping n the official servers which makes it difficult to earn notes
-an easier way to get notes, this is basically because theres not much official servers and you dont earn much notes from winning battles

author: {'steamid': '76561198206881763', 'num_games_owned': 912, 'num_reviews': 412, 'playtime_forever': 433, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 168, 'last_played': 1515968445}
review:
Ok, I recommend this game , especially for the price you can get it at on sale. But, with some serious reservations, see my pros and cons.

Pros:

Level design is exceptional
Manages to be original with gameplay despite an increasingly crowded genre
Graphics/sound/all other bells and whistles are very nice

Cons:

Level of difficulty is in the "so hard it's no longer fun" realm (except at the very beginning)
-- My biggest problem with this is the way the creators accomplished this. They either add environmental elements that are entirely random (i.e., eliminates the actual challenge of a platformer which is muscle memory and makes it largely about chance), or by making your character almost impossible to control. The ladder is kind of fun IF YOU LIKE THAT KIND OF THING, the former almost made me not recommend the game.

This is only a platformer by a VERY loose definition, all the later levels involve significant modifications to control and environment that mean most of the time you are not jumping from platform to platform.

review:
The game is not bad its actually quite good, but it has multiple flaws that made the game a bit harder to play
the combat feels very unique and gives the player the full control of the character
and yes, you are gonna get you balls beaten out of you until you get a hang of the game

the a.i s don't really give much space to defend yourself neither give you any to land a hit really annoying for a new player
the u.i. keeps freezing whenever i try to do something even if i lower the settings its really frustrating

i really like the game it just needs a bit more improvements

review: Extremely hostile to new players. It's one of those games with a community that expects to get trounced until you learn to "git gud".  Inadequate tutorials. Just not a good idea to buy this unless you have a dedicated sparring partner or the personality type to get your head cracked open until you learn the ropes. Frankly it didn't make a good enough initial impresssion on me for either of those choices to sound appealing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198147160282', 'num_games_owned': 99, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 26275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19190, 'last_played': 1674402570}
review:
I've played this game for a while first played in 2014 started playing pretty often in 2016 then took a long break and came back in winter 2017

My toughts: - I personally do not have alot of fun whit this game anymore the fighting system gets preatty repetitive after a while its basically ROCK PAPPER SCISSORif you opponent doesnt use katana , katana can feint its atacks soo it will counter yours

                    - this game is Whiff punishing simulator focusing on footsie but ofcs the best tactic is holding S and waiting for your enemy to make mistakes

Why I don't recommend this game: - pretty repetitive
                      
                                                          - dead I fought the same persons more than 1000 times all I see are new players who say "this game is awesome !1!!11!1" then quitting in 1 weak                     
                                    
                                                          - I no longer have fun whit this game and I think its to much effort to put time in this game and get good tournaments are preatty rare and if youre new you prob have no chance beating the ppl from 2014 or veterans        
                                                          
Why I like this game (dont worry it wont be long) - This game made me meet some some really nice people and some good friends you can just chill in FFA if you want and discuss  Stuff

Overall -Dead game
   
            - Borring after a while
   
            - takes like 300 hours to understand how the game works and after that its just practicing to get good
   
            - buy it but I don't recommend playing for a long time

PS : If you're a masochist this is the perfect game for you
        Devs are cool best devs GlamazonianRage and Joshua Ashton

author: {'steamid': '76561198073865843', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 557, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 250, 'last_played': 1531102917}
review:
This is a shame. This game is everything you want in a 1v1 dueling game, but its not active. 

fighting seems jenky and restrictive at first, but when you start to get used to it, you see the depth and possibilities it has. the combat is fair, i have yet to notice any "op" tactics or playstyles, and its not button-mashy at all, yet its easy to pick up.

dont buy this game for the online, buy it with some friends, or wait for it to go f2p.

A Fantastic addition to this would be a more fleshed out PvE/ bot fights. right now there is only one dificulty setting.

review:
Wow. I REALLY regret installing this, even having bought it for $1. One of the games that look so different on paper than reality, it hurts.

Gameplay seems nice, but it actually is a clunky unresponsive mess. Take into account my rig is really good, and had no issues, but game seems like it registers slow AF. Been playing games that require timing all my life, this has got to be the saddest excuse

Gamepad support is nice, but the actual controls are so bad I can't even begin to explain, even the layout is so dumb, I don't see anyone using the default one

The combat mechanics require tight timing, yet said timing is more off on the software side than it ever could be on the player. Honestly, Chivalry is way tighter and plays better than this. 

I will play more to see if in fact their tutorial was absolute crap, and the game is to be played differently, which would also be offensive, but at least I would be playing it. 

If you get it on sale, don't expect anything better than a $1 game. For Honor is better than this, and I hated For Honor when it showed it's true face, I can only imagine this ones cause I won't invest any more time for a game that has no base, and the developing is worse than an Alpha

author: {'steamid': '76561198032141646', 'num_games_owned': 525, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 573, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 553, 'last_played': 1530403603}
review:
I begin glowing as I charge up a heavy blow. He lunges towards me. Suddenly, I release my attack just as he lashes out with a quick stab. Sparks fly as our steel clangs‚Äîhe recoils, but my attack follows through, emptying his health bar. As his body floats in the waterfall's pool, he types ‚Äúgood fight‚Äù into chat. I bow, and return the sentiment after my hands stop shaking.

That sense of respect is prevalent in Blade Symphony's community. Civility among anonymous online players is itself an anomaly, but to have a sense of honor be the norm is unheard of. There's a deep intimacy in the duels that's rarely found in other games.

ou can change your tactics depending on their character and sword of choice, but the most defining factor is always the player. Though understanding how the matchups work is undeniably important, figuring out how to exploit the gaps in their expertise is infinitely more useful. ‚ÄúHow will they react if I do this? Do they know how to counter that? Can I get away with this?‚Äù It's science with swords at a breakneck pace: form your hypothesis in the passing moments between clashes of steel, then put your theory to the test.

Those brief pauses are what defines the game's depth and intimacy. Most fighting games reward constant action, but the moments in Blade Symphony when both players step back and observe are some of the most tense in fighting games.

The music completes the atmosphere and sense of tension. Traditional Japanese strings, piano, and throat singing capture the desperate drama of Blade Symphony's swordfights, while ambient bells and chimes give match spectating a meditative tranquility. It's absolutely worth a separate purchase for any soundtrack enthusiast.

Even with all of these crowdsourced improvements, there still isn't much to do when tired of duelling. The other game modes are largely underdeveloped and rarely played. However, the saving grace of Blade Symphony is that its duels are thoroughly, distinctively, and consistently exhilarating.

Blade Symphony's duels are electrifying and intimate, more than making up for a lack of content.

overall the game its nice im loving playing...there are some  - aspects and + aspects of course like in all games...but that its what does the game ...if you never play this game...give it a try , the game have Steam Workshop here you can do your blades and costumes and that makes  a litle more fun to play... i recomend this game to my friends yes

author: {'steamid': '76561198061751694', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 746, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 743, 'last_played': 1571865724}
review:
All these negative reviews are negative only because there aren't any players, but these negative reviews aren't going to help new players find their way here when it goes F2P.

This game has very fun and fast paced melee combat, a handful of characters to pick from, and also free customization of the characters via the workshop. 

I highly recommend it, if you want challenging, very competetive, melee PVP combat.
