author: {'steamid': '76561198072293563', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 590, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 493, 'last_played': 1647003197}
review:
PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE MAKE OCEANIC SERVERS.


I know my playtime isnt very MAJOR but i highly enjoy this game. I like the combat and art styles. However, the servers with the high ping make it really difficult to play against other people. I've been told by one of the players in the game that the servers are russian. I also am confident to say you guys are planning to make this game F2P and i think that is a great idea. The only issue is that once it goes free, thousands of people will download the game and face the high ping. So please, add in different servers for people who live in different countries, I live in Australia, so the ping takes the win everytime. 

Sincerely, 
 A fellow fan and supporter of BS

author: {'steamid': '76561198100929156', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 803, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 688, 'last_played': 1525690110}
review:
I played this when it came out and the community was so cool. Just join a server with a pretty big map then travel around the map and duel random people or multiple people at a time. Those were the days BUT there is nothing at all left of that. There is never anyone to play this game with because its always dead. Game-wise it's phenominal with a great soundtrack and altogether a well done game that just died well before it should have.

However I recommend you buy this game. If you have a large group of friends to play with then you can probably recreate that experience. There still people online but it is so minor that it makes me cry because the game is so fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044354030', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 280, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 280, 'last_played': 1434583081}
review:
Fucking amazing sword fighter that I was super hyped to play when it was released.
Wasn't able to pick this up until sale but by god. 

The sword  play is kind of like from what I've seen in for honor. Use your mouse to guide your fighters sword and such and  pull off different moves, there a few characters with some cool customization if you get points to  unlock things.

Also every character class has a different fighting style like heavi, lightweight, etc. 
SPRAYS ARE ALSO COOL

If you're gonna pick up this game, expect to find nothing but dead servers usually there's about 1-3 of them that are mildly full. These people you will end up playing with are either expereinced players who are willing to help you learn and have fun with you or elitists who will make fun of you for being ignorant to the games mechanics and such.

The learning curve isn't too big. If you practice for about 30 minutes then you really start to get the basics down.

Overrall it's a great game and I wish it wasn't so dead.

Cheers to everyone online who DOES play it still.

author: {'steamid': '76561198189984828', 'num_games_owned': 407, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 1770, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1315, 'last_played': 1677374700}

author: {'steamid': '76561197964180061', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 112, 'last_played': 1400171176}
review:
Hab das Spiel gekauft weil mir die Lichtschwertduelle von Jediknight im Multiplayer so gut gefallen haben.
Ich habe schon sehr viele Beat Em Ups gespielt und ich finde Balancing ist immer wichtig und schwer umuzusetzen.
Sowohl bei Beat em ups als auch bei Jediknight gab es immer schon "lamer" die gewisse Mechaniken ausgenutzt haben, sie bewusst mit Serverlaggs kombiniert haben oder Spielmechaniken exploiten um sich unfaire Vorteile zu schaffen.

Leider ist die Community von Blade Symphony auch so. Das Spiel bietet zu viele M√∂glichkeiten des "herumlamens" und hat kein konsistentes Gameplay, was diesem auch nur im Ansatz gerecht entgegen wirkt. 
Selbstverst√§ndlich, kann/muss man sich diese fiesen tricks selbst auch aneignen um auch h√§ufig zu gewinnen.
Kann man machen, ist aber behindert. Deswegen verpufft der Spielspa√ü hier innerhalb k√ºrzester Zeit.

Dazu kommen die vollkommen "wirren" Animationen der jeweiligen Schwertkampfstile. Bei allen Beat em Ups versucht man erkennbar zu machen, wer oder was einem gegen√ºber steht. Klar, ist ein riesiger Koloss langsamer und haut mehr rein. Klar hat eine Lanze mehr Reichweite als n Dolch. Es ist alles irgendwie sofort nachvollziehbar. Ganz egal, ob einem einzelne Characktere etwas unfair und lame erscheinen. So wird man doch dennoch nicht g√§nzlich getr√ºbt in seiner Wahrnehmung. 
Bei Blade Symphony ist das einfach √ºberhaupt nicht der Fall. Sei es nun, dass man ein riesen Schwert hat, aber die ganze Zeit nur Kungfu m√§√üig rumtritt und damit das Schwert v√∂llig √ºberfl√ºssig wirkt oder ein Typ in R√ºstung einen dreifachen Salto macht und mit Flickflacks durch die gegend springt. Ist ja vlt Geschmackssache, aber ich finds einfach richtig dumm.
Das ist wie son nerviges Xbox Game f√ºr kleine 12 j√§hrigen Kiddys...

Es wird hier n geiles Duell Spiel suggeriert, aber man bekommt n nerviges Free for all , v√∂llig chaotisches, √ºberhaupt nicht episches, melee rumgelame game. Da verliert auch jede noch so tolle Animation ihren Glanz. Generell, sind die Animationen teilweise durchaus ansehnlich. Der √úbergang von einer Animation in die andere ist auch technisch durchaus gut umgesetzt. Aber die Geschwindigkeit wie manche Angriffe ausgef√ºhrt werden und die Reichweite die manche Attacken haben, oder die Bewegung wie sie ausgef√ºhrt werden, sind teilweise richtig behindert. Als ob die Waffen keinerlei Gewicht h√§tten, Tr√§gheit und Physik war den Entwicklern wohl ein Fremdwort, oder einfach schei√ü egal.
Selbst die Lichtschwerter bei Jedi knight hatten mehr tr√§gheit und gewichtung. 
Da wusste ich okay, 
leichter Schwertkampfstil = schwert sehr eng am eigenen K√∂rper schwingen um die Tr√§gheit gering zu halten -> weniger Reichweite und geringerer Schaden
mittlerer Schwertkampfstil = durchschnittliche Bewegungsgeschwindigkeit, mittlerer Schaden , mittlere Reichweite. Vorteile, etwas mehr variation in den Angriffen was Schlagrichtung betrifft. 
schwerer Kampfstil = enorm langsame angriffsgeschwindigkeit, aber weil der Charackter die Arme sehr weit ausstreckt, das Lichtschwert so schwingt, dass er sehr weit ausholt und dann gro√üe B√∂gen schwingt und die tr√§gheit seiner Angriffe vermeiden, dass man zickzack rumwedeln kann, wirken die angriffe etwas, als w√ºrde man mit seinem Schwert langsam "r√ºhren"
Das war unspektakul√§rer, aber einfach besser. Vom Gameplay, einfach besser. 
Blade Symphony hat einfach n schlechtes Gameplay. Das kriegen die mit Grafik und Design und Animationen und wer wei√ü was einfach nicht wett. Die ganzen positiven Eigenschaften, die bringen einfach nix.

review: "Son c√ºmleyi de oku" Ben hayatƒ±mda b√∂yle bir oyun g√∂remedim YARABBƒ∞M dedim, bu nasƒ±l bir oyundur acaba bunu insanlar mƒ± yaptƒ± yoksa source kodlarƒ± melekler tarafƒ±ndan yer y√ºz√ºne mi indirildi oyuna bir girdim zevkten g√∂z bebeklerim b√ºy√ºd√º ben b√∂yle bir ses b√∂yle bir ambiyans ne g√∂rd√ºm ne duydum bir an k√∂r ve saƒüƒ±r olduƒüumu beynimin bana bir oyun oynadƒ±ƒüƒ±nƒ± d√º≈ü√ºnd√ºm ama hayƒ±r BU m√ºkemmel oyunun bir cazibesiydi, g√ºzel g√ºzel kƒ±lƒ±√ßlar ≈üekil ≈üekil katanalar, swordlar, long swordlar boy boy dizilmi≈ü saƒü tarafa karakterleri koymu≈ülar beyaz temanƒ±n √úST√úNE oyuna giriyorSUN training ƒ± farklƒ± bir listede g√∂r√ºyorsun hadi diyorsun girsem mi girmesem mi. author: {'steamid': '76561198042460330', 'num_games_owned': 2705, 'num_reviews': 122, 'playtime_forever': 839, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 837, 'last_played': 1512529621}
review:
Blade Symphony is actually really cool. 

The mechanics are smooth, the graphics are lovely, the game runs well, and you have lots of character options. That being said - I've barely gotten to play because no one is ever online, and there's no bots. The maximum number of people I've seen on this game at one time is.... 4, including me. That makes me incredibly sad, since I'd really like to sink some hours into Blade Symphony. 

If they somehow bring life back into the multiplayer, I'll change my recommendation. For now - until they fix their population problems, steer clear. Without MP this game is next to worthless.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095531721', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 6139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5247, 'last_played': 1673054186}
review:
Okay, so this is the first review I am ever writing and it is pretty much the only one I ever plan to write, but I am doing it because this game deserves it. 

For starters, I think if you look at my hours played you already know how I feel about this game, but I will tell you why it is great. For one you will never play a fighting game that has a better combat system. Not only does it reward fast reactions and switching up your combinations, but it also rewards players who study their opponent and learn how they fight. Second is the art. Now the only thing that the artists need to work on is the character's faces, but otherwise the environment and character bodies are very well made. Most importantly there is one thing this game has that no other competitive game I have seen has: A great community. The people in this game respect players who are worse than them and actually help you get better, maybe it's just me but after a long day I dont want to lose a game and have people throw it in my face.

There is really only 1 reason not to buy this game and that is the lack of players. Ill be honest, even I have slowed down in playing this game because there are usually not enough people on the US servers to play with. There is one simple solution and that is for more people to buy it. I purchased the game at 20$ when it first came out, but now it is at 5$ and with the sales looming there is a chance you can get it for even less. There may not be a ton of players, but if people are willing to pay just a little money it will eventually grow. Even if it doesn't I think that this game is worth it just for the experiance of playing it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067605081', 'num_games_owned': 105, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1495147229}
review:
Perhaps (most likely) I am being hugely incompetent. But I cannot even defeat the bot during the tutorial. Whilst I have to say, gameplay is smooth (even on my potato laptop), and the graphics are quite pleasant (even in the grayscale room). However, the actual mechanics, while I would have thought would be a nice mix of simple but complex enough to be difficult to become able at, meant I was not able to even complete the tutorial as I could not defeat the bot.
Again, I'm probably being hugely incompetent but when a game is set up so that defeating a tutorial bot becomes (for idiots like me at least) near-on impossible, I can't recommend the game.
Also, I can't seem to disconnect or end the game session without the aid of Task Manager, as "disconnecting" the game session lead to a frozen game screen, despite the rest of my PC being completely functional.
I would also like to add that I bought this game for just over ¬£1 on Humble Bundle in their spring sale, and I am still disappointed with the outcome of the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068648180', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 128, 'playtime_forever': 736, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 694, 'last_played': 1486501818}
review:
[h1]Blade Symphony Review[/h1]

[b]Short Version:[/b]
Not enough players nowaday so I can't recommend it if you do not have several friends to play it with.

[b]Long Version:[/b]
I wanted to love this game, and got it quite early after I first saw about it. The unique Fightingsystem in combination with the strong artstyle and the solid music performance entertained me for some hours but I never managed to master the combat.
The Fights can depending on the players be a slow and thoughtfull dance or more of a furryfilled rampage, and both ways can be quite funn.
There are several fightmodes, like 1vs1 2vs2 1vs2 and even capture the point like teamgames.
Camera and controlls work fine, despite being a little bit clunky sometimes.
There are many things to unlock but all are purley cosmetic. So it allways is a skill question who winns, and not simply the equipment that winns a fight.
Loading Screens took way too long for me though and the game crashed from time to time when I wanted to switch server.
The Interfaces look nice but could be a lot more clear than they are now.
So in summary it is a great experience with some weakpoints that can be annoing but do not kill the whole game.
But there is one more thing that changes nearly everything:
The game has AI controlled opponents, but they can't (as far as I figured it out) fill in in real player matches. They are restricted to the practice mode. This means that without Friends to play wou might not find a single server to play on with players on it. And if you find one they often are way above your experience level and can stump you into the ground without much effort... Or you find friends playing that do not always want to play with random strangers. It seems there is still a bunch of active players, and with some efford you can surley organize a full server on a sunnday evening or so.
But if you just wanna start the game and play, it will feel like a ghosttown.

[b]Final Words:[/b]
Would love to recommend it but I just can't do that in this state, with the exeption for someone who has some frineds to play this with. Not a perfect game by far (For honor could be a good alternative nowadays) but it is certainly not a teriible game aswell. If yo uare still interested just grab it at a sale and give it a try.

Thanks for reading.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020507456', 'num_games_owned': 383, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 694, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 510, 'last_played': 1602435588}
review:
Adoro questo gioco probabilmente perche fanatico delle armi bianche ma non sono qui a scrivere per me stesso perci√≤ vediamo come si presenta questo titolo...
Appena aperto ci si trova davanti un menu semplice ma efficace dove si pu√≤ scegliere fra: le classice opzioni, giocare online, e allenarsi offline o customizzare i personaggi.
iniziato l'allenamento si viene a conoscenza di questa differenziazione fra tipo di spada e stile di combattimento ci√≤ permette di creare il proprio stile (cosa che personalmente ho trovato MOOLTO bella). Nello stesso allenamento si puo entrare in contatto per la prima volta con la meccanica del combattimento, essa √® sulla carta una cosa complicata in quanto la nostra spada si muovera in base a : direzione del colpo data dai tasti direzionali di movimento (WASD), posa adottata (velocita, bilanciato, pesante : tasti numerici 1 2 3) e i tasti sinistro e destro del mouse in base a quale spada stiamo utilizzando... Ripeto sulla carta sembra impossibile ma dopo una 20ina di minuti sarete pronti per duellare online.
La customizzazione di per se non √® molto varia ma il workshop in questo caso la fa da padrone in esso potrete trovare OGNI tipo di arma bianca (anche ripresi da altri titoli fra cui StarWars, KigdomHearts, FinalFantasy, MgSRising ecc),skin e attachment per i vostri duellanti.
L'Online √® l'unica pecca negativa di questo gioco ma non a causa del gioco stesso ma dalla totale assenza di giocatori e ci√≤ mi ha lasciato molto triste visto il potenziale che ha questo titolo perci√≤ spero che le mie parole vi persuadano a comprarlo visto che nonostante la sua semplicita puo donare grandi soddisfazioni... 11/10 IGN

author: {'steamid': '76561198046825967', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 669, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 570, 'last_played': 1569516677}
review:
i mean

alright, so, it's a pretty fun game if you're playing with friends. the problem is, if you're not playing with friends, you're playing with no one. average players the past day was a good 2, not even joking

the people who do play the game are reaaallllyy toxic elitists, which is probably one of the main reasons why user retention is -1/10. it's funny because half of the elitist people spam heavy judgement attacks for quick kills, or fast attacks with the fencing guy and wushu girl to look cool without any effort. it's pretty lame ngl

my recommendation is no, because you won't have fun playing alone. even if it's like 2 dollars on the summer sale, don't get it. buy skittles instead. they're funner.

if you're reading this, though, and you have friends that want to play, go ahead and give it a shot with them if it's cheap. you'll have some fun figuring it out with friends.

review:
Alright. I played for 3 days and I must say that this game isnt for people who dont care or are too lazy to learn how to get better. Many complain about fighting master teir fighters which is bull crap. Yeah there's a few but even so, half of them (If you pay attention) can be beaten because they use the same thing. They have the same mentality as those who just start. (Oh maybe if i use this one combo, nobody can beat me!) haha get rekt by someone who just started playing.

Basically, just practice. Try NEW things and watch closely if someone keeps beating you. The good thing about this game is there's a way around ANYTHING. You just have to catch on before it's too late!

author: {'steamid': '76561198213145548', 'num_games_owned': 208, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 3441, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1265, 'last_played': 1682730459}
review:
Note: This game is not yet dead but it's close. That hasn't hurt me in having fun as people here are very nice to each other and since there are so few everyone knows everyone. 

This game is awesome. The combat feels so right and the developers really have done great things with the game. Very addicting and even though I get slaughtered most of the time by veterans it is still fun. Also you can have a wide array of custom weapons. 

graphics: 7/10 
Nothing fancy but it is pleasing to me. The graphic also doesn't distract from the gameplay and the custom weapons really make it cool

gameplay: 9/10
There are a few mistakes with the game but the core gameplay is amazing. So addicting to fight. The game also features very cool stuff like wallrunning (you can wallrun >> jump >> wallrun indefinitely), sitting together with other people, spraying the walls (also custom sprays for tug life) and you can bow, taunt and blow a heart or draw a heart.

music: 9/10
Very soothing and good for spending time in the arena with other people.

community: 10/10
The 30 people who still play are all very nice except for the player sarcasm who will backstab you. Everyone ganks him so that is still fun. He is more of a fun troll than an annoying one.

Another note: There is only one server where people can brawl together and fight duels. While in roaming mode you can attack and be attacked by everyone. When duelling you can only fight with your opponent. Other people will watch you fight and gf (good fight) will be said multiple times. D

P.S Don't forget to bow before you fight.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004231682', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 333, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 333, 'last_played': 1487374588}
review:
Interesting game but pretty over-rated. Hit detection leaves a lot to be desired, combat is repetitive and all the populated servers are based in Europe, resulting in a pretty much constant 200 ping for a NA player.

Learning curve is extremely difficult and made moreso by the fact that the game has no new population coming into it. Be prepared to face nothing but master ranked players with thousands of hours of gameplay. Furthermore, I think the TOTAL playerbase for the game was about 10-15 people during the time I played, worldwide.

This in itself would be okay if the players were friendly and willing to help teach someone new some tricks. (When first getting into M&B Warband I actually had some helpful players tutor me in how to play.) However everyone I met in the several hours I played seemed fairly elitist and would only speak to insult me for losing. Bowing before a fight? Enjoy a throwing knife to the face. Had a close match? Prepare to be teabagged. (Or teabagged in general, I usually was)

I think with the right community and some populated NA servers this game could be decent, certainly worth the five dollars, but as it stands, I wouldn't recommend this. There are better games with better melee mechanics, and much more friendly and populated servers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035112614', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1067, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1067, 'last_played': 1434284901}
review:
TL;DR

+ Aesthetic
+ Performance
+ Lightning-fast gameplay that'll leave you feeling like a badass
+ Realistic sword fighting with cool fantasy elements
+ Beautiful OST

----- No player base, but play it anyway because that's the only way to fix that (also it's very fun)


REVIEW (Early Access, 17.8 hours on record as of writing):


This game is amazing. Everything from the aesthetic, the performance, the lightning-fast action, the music, the variety of sword and combat styles on display, the different moves blending both realistic sword combat and techniques with some fantasy elements (such as running on walls and aerial attacks), it's all great.

However, there is one major problem with this game that hurts it very much - there are almost no players. Only very few people still play this on a regular basis, jammed into the same server, practicing every day/week and not getting any worse for it. The result is, any new players get stomped and beat into submission. The tutorial does nothing (it can't, really) to prepare you for the level of ass-kick you're going to get before you start to learn the tricks and subtleties that make the difference between winning or getting your ass handed to you by yet another longsword-wielding Phalanx. The learning curve is a serious brick wall because of this, and the player base isn't large enough to split people up into multiple tiers based on games played, win ratio and whatnot.

This is the only fault I've really come across (other than Early Access Limbo) and there isn't much to be done about it, other than this - which is to say, recommend it. Anyone who reads this: give it a shot and with a bit of luck you'll like it as much as I do.

review:
This game is one of the rare masterpieces on Steam that I really enjoy. Altough I haven't played that much I can say that this is an amazing experience. Altough the game is quite difficult to undestand and fully master I have enjoyed it very much, and every time I come back to it I am greeted by one of the greatest communities in gaming.

However the game doesn't really have a big community and that is the greatest problem this game has. I'd hate to see another gem get buried under big titles, such as Minimum did. But the developers haven't given up hope on this one so I'm really optimistic about this game's future.

author: {'steamid': '76561198108071064', 'num_games_owned': 509, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 741, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 737, 'last_played': 1515693986}
review:
First of all.Multiplayer is dead.So dont buy it for multiplayer.

Pros:
-Decent graphics
-Pretty simple mechanics for newer player to be able to play
-Great optimization

Cons:
-Well obviously the DEAD playerbase 
-Level design that doesn't affect the gameplay 
-Lack of a single player option, besides vs AI and Tutorials, there's nothing more
-Sometimes it feels like a Hack n Slash game

Overall, i'd say that the game is certainly worth its Sale price because i can't think of anything better to spent $1 on that isn't ramen noodles, but i will say this, its better than Chivalry, its more satisfying to hit an enemy with your Longsword or Cardboard tube (yes that's an actual weapon), but again, keep in mind that this game is dead, don't expect Multiplayer experiences, unless you have a friend with you who wants to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013716991', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 27, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1483285762}
review:
Gameplay √† la fois excellent et un peu rouill√©?
Avant toute chose, j'√©cris cette review apr√®s moins d'une heure de jeu. Ce sont mes premi√®res impressions. Si j'y rejoue, je mettrai cette critique √† jour (probable).

D√©j√†, les jeux FPS ou TPS √† int√©grer des phases de combat int√©ressantes sont rares. Ici, le jeu EST un ensemble de combats √† l'√©p√©e. Des roulades, des dashs et surtout des combos customisables faits par des personnages customisables avec une arme customisable. √ßa fait r√™ver. On peut presque parler de plusieurs gameplays car les styles sont tr√®s vari√©s.
Malheureusement, on sent quand m√™me que les m√©caniques sont un peu rouill√©es. C'est le genre d'argument qu'on a du mal √† avancer parce que c'est une s√©rie de touts petits trucs qui d√©rangent un peu, comme la longueur des sauts, les petits bugs √† la r√©ception des wallruns.

Vu que je suis un joueur super chiant qui d√©teste la contrainte, j'ai h√©sit√© √† faire un remboursement. Puis je me suis rappel√© que le jeu ne co√ªte presque rien, qu'il est fun et qu'on sent que le travail d'id√©ation des d√©veloppeurs (notamment sur le syst√®me de combos), la variation des styles etc. sent le travail acharn√© mais le manque de moyen. Pour vous encourager, je garde le jeu et j'y rejouerai (car il est bien hein :p), j'esp√®re qu'un jour on aura une mise √† jour pour rendre les m√©caniques de jeu plus fluides.

R√©sum√©:
6/10. Un peu rouill√© mais tr√®s original et amusant tout de m√™me.
Je recommande plut√¥t. (surtout avec un prix si honn√™te)

author: {'steamid': '76561198139824148', 'num_games_owned': 62, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 53, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1494733008}
review:
A fast-paced swordfighting game with many different styles, moves, and most importantly, weapons to choose from. 
I think the game would be better if the weapons were more realistic (i.e. every weapon appears to be two handed, and some don't even exist) and the characters weren't so anime/futuristic/weird looking. Basically I'd prefer this game be a more traditional swordfighting game. It's an okay game, but even the swordfighting in Sid Meier's Pirates is more satisfying...
I'd say, get it for 99 cents while it lasts, otherwise pass and buy (or play!) some Chivalry.

author: {'steamid': '76561198161516400', 'num_games_owned': 543, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1483169051}
review:
So here's the first thing you need to know if you're going to buy the game, Don't buy it for the Multiplayer (Because its dead), now that we got that out of the way, let's move on

Pros:
-Decent graphics
-Pretty simple mechanics for newer player to be able to play
-But also complex enough for older players to master, 
-Great optimization (this runs on my GT620M laptop at 60Fps High settings FFS)
-Cheap, bought it for under $1 , even when its not on sale its only $4.99 

Cons:
-Well obviously the DEAD playerbase 
-Level design that doesn't affect the gameplay 
-Lack of a single player option, besides vs AI and Tutorials, there's nothing more
-Combat can feel a little clunky at times, to the point that it feels like a Hack n Slash game

Overall, i'd say that the game is certainly worth its Sale price because i can't think of anything better to spent $1 on that isn't ramen noodles, but i will say this, its better than Chivalry, its more satisfying to hit an enemy with your Longsword or Cardboard tube (yes that's an actual weapon), but again, keep in mind that this game is dead, don't expect Multiplayer experiences, unless you have a friend with you who wants to play, or for some reason the playerbase of this game came back to life, 

oh, and if there's actually people playing on the server, don't jump in there unless you already understand the mechanics because you'll get your ass kicked,

author: {'steamid': '76561198308754135', 'num_games_owned': 164, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 12535, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 225, 'last_played': 1702126594}
review:
Mucha gente se est√° quejando de que si la gente Spamea mucho, que si el juego tiene muchos bugs, lo de lo bugs os lo confirmo, a√∫n le faltan parches hasta que arreglen esos problemas, lo de los spammers en el juego, es como si os met√©is en el Tekken y os toca un Eddy que se tira al suelo y te da patadas sin parar desde abajo, es como si os vais al Naruto y solo veis Deidaras, es como si os vais al Mortal Kombat y veis a cualquier personaje sin parar de hacer el mismo ataque de mierda imposible de esquivar. Le dais rese√±as negativas por chorradas aunque quitando lo de los bugs que yo que llevo jugando a est√° mierda durante tres a√±os le duele, porque son cosas que no deber√≠an pasar pero pasan por el cambio del engine al motor que usa el CS:GO.
Voy a decir las cosas claras del juego y por dios, espero que la gente lo lea y comprenda de una vez de que trata el juego.
No se trata de pulsar el click derecho y ala, que sea lo que dios quiera, hay que saber posicionarse, tanto en el lol como en el dota como en el cs, las posiciones cuentan, no se trata de lanzar el dash o rodar o atacar as√≠ por que si, puede ser que a uno o dos les funcione, pero si se observa bien los movimientos, al final el spammer no llega a nada y te acabas sacando unos combos espectaculares.
El juego no es fac√≠l, hay que aprenderse los movimientos del personaje, ver sus limitaciones y sus ventajas, cada uno tiene lo suyo, excepto Vanguard, Vanguard va a dar sida hoy y siempre, el caso es que cuando te conoces uno o dos combos con los personajes, y te sacas jugadas de la manga, las partidas se hacen muy pero que MUY entretenidas.
Llevo jugando al menos tres a√±os a esto, me considero bueno con el caballero, me conozco bastantes cosas del juego y estar√≠a mas que encantado de ese√±ar a la gente todo lo que se, me encantar√≠a crear un grupo para estas cosas, agregadme y si quere√≠s jugar ni lo dude√≠s, ahora que el juego es free to play no hay escusa, no estoy al nivel de los m√°s pros del juego pero soy capaz de defenderme. 
No haga√≠s caso de los analisis negativos por que son gente frustrada y que no conocen el juego a fondo, si esta√≠s dispuestos, estoy aqu√≠ para ayudar en todo lo posible.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116100475', 'num_games_owned': 4712, 'num_reviews': 596, 'playtime_forever': 5131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5622, 'last_played': 1430603284}
review:
[h1] Let's make this short [/h1]

Pros:
-excellent tactical combat system
-great graphics
-reasonable price point
-courteous fanbase (so far)
-skill-based rather than money-based success

Cons:
-Occasional lag leads to strange teleport-grabs or instant deaths
-level design is a little frustrating, often spawning you FAR from the action in a game where the action is everything.

Additional Note: I was one of the top #10 Player in Game. That means i'm not a noob. That's why i have so many hours of playtime.

author: {'steamid': '76561198114903321', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1096, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 493, 'last_played': 1637456776}
review: If you want a break from shooting games then you should try Blade Symphony, a fighting game. It has a lot swords and a lot of designs for your own character.  I like to play this sword fighting game because it has a lot of swords and i can chop up everyone and go wild and run on the walls too. You can play at home or at your friends home and you can fight strangers in their homes using the multiplayer - that can let you into 32 strangers homes if they join you. I fight alone because that means more chopping up for me, but i can also fight on a team of 2 against another team of two. There can be an audience too watching you in a pit-fight.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086872983', 'num_games_owned': 92, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 42852, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1, 'playtime_at_review': 27025, 'last_played': 1710376084}
review:
I have 400 hours aprx. I've been with this game for 2 years through thick or thin. This is part review, part history.

tl:dr   This isn't what it used to be. The playerpase is small, but its very tight knit. It's the kind of community where everyone know's everyone by name. The gameplay itself is wonky but often fun when you get it right. The learning curve is a brick wall. You're going to lose a lot when you start. Don't be afraid to ask for help. Almost everyone in master rank would be more than pleased to take you udner their wing, all you have to do is ask.

Don't expect this to be a hardcore fighter with lots of fierce competition. Thats what Blade Symphony used to be. Today theres an average of 10 different people who log on per day. I can say for sure that I'm one of those 10. This game is what most would be concidered dead. To the newcomer this game will seem like theres nothing here for you. I'm here to tell you you're wrong. You're simply unable to see it for what it is.

Where this game excells is in the high level community. The issue is the skill gap between those dubbed "newgen" and those from the old gen and alpha gen. The majority of regular players have played for years. I have played for 2 years, and over a year of that was solely training the class I use. Many people who have played less have attained my skill level and beyond, but it still takes a conciderable amount of time. On top of that this game is impossible to play without a lot of resiliance. Put short, you will lose. You will lose often if not constantly. However thats how you learn. If you can take a loss without suffering the weight of defeat then you'll make it far in this game. The people who sit atop the skill ladder are there not because they have inate tallent, but because they simply kept trying. And you too can join them, all you have to do is not quit. Keep at it. Learn from your mistakes. Reach out to masters for help. Reach out to me for help. I'll tech you how to play if you really want to become better (disclaimer: I'm a bad teacher). 

My final reason Blade is good is the community. Some parts of it are toxic, some are sweet. Overall it's tight knit and diverse. If you play more than a week you'll recognise everyody. 3 weeks and you'll know everybody. In no other game have I seen this many freindships form and hold over time. I have my mixed feeling with the people I play this game with but the one thing I can say about the people of Blade Symphony is that thay're the only people here I really trust. We're not here to beat you back to cs:go. We're here to be your freind and have some fun. Thats what this game is about. Its about having a good duel and not climbing the ladder. 

If you're hesitant about this game pm me, and I can talk to you about it and why you should play.

Okay, this game is garbage. I dont care that it is 5 dollars now. Do not buy it. No one literally no one plays it anymore and when you do find a match you are greeted with a combat system that is higly unbalanced. For instance, Judges strongest attack does about the same amount as pures, however the pures strongest is literally 2 times faster. I seriously have never wanted a refund so bad....

Final thought: I wouldnt play this game for money. Thats saying a lot, ID DO ANYTHING FOR A QUICK BUCK

author: {'steamid': '76561198071978837', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 831, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 687, 'last_played': 1542385336}
review:
READ UNTIL END IF YOU WANT TO BUY!

Holy fuck this game, I did NOT expect to get such amazingness for free off freebie websites! That's probably the only reason I am writing this essay/review.

Blade Symphony is a sword-fighting simulator where players fight 1v1 or more with balanced controls on a handful of maps.

Now for it's Pros:

1) It runs really good for such great cinematic graphics.

2) Great arsenal of different swords to try.

3) EVERYONE, and I mean EVERYONE can have their unique sword style thanks to the excessive ways to attack your enemy.

4) Semi-skillbased. (I'll get to this in one moment in Cons).

5) Despite being semi-complex, tutorial clears all hardships in knowing the game.

6) Has AI offline training.

7) Your sword fighter can be customized real good with colors and plenty of armors. (Thanks to Workshop).


Now for the cons:

1) Swords aren't completely balanced, thus there is a slight meta. (That can still be overpowered by skill).

2) By the time I was playing this, servers were completely empty so I didn't have some online fun.

3) Camera problems, wish if devs would add FP mode.


TL;DR If you like competitive sword simulative fights then get this game, although for fair warning you'll be upset by no online mode and meta of several weapons over each other.

author: {'steamid': '76561198110558168', 'num_games_owned': 261, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2778, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1904, 'last_played': 1589520535}
review: Rest in peace, Blade symphony. You were one of my favorite games for a pretty long time. I would play for probably 3 to 4 hours a day on average. Sadly, after awhile I got burnt out and figured I would wait for some more characters, and for better usage of masks and capes. I just came back to it, and all I saw was empty servers. No new characters besides the single new one that was present at my time of leaving. I will continue to play this game with friends, and whenever I find others on the game, but it seems this beautiful beast of a game has grown tired. It's life force nearly drained, with a max of 10 players online at any given point. I will hope this game regains its community. I hope this game becomes as famous with age as Super smash bros.Melee did.  But on that note, if its fanbase does come back, the creators of this beautiful beast need to care for the players more, with more playable characters, and more sword types.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066288971', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 220, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 208, 'last_played': 1514728913}
review:
The game itself I feel is completely fine. I have always been intrigued by sword fighting and the such, so seeing this game, I was naturally very excited for it. It plays out well, the mechanics are solid. The only problem is...

It's completely and utterly dead.

This game thrives on the online community, which is entirely non-existant, except for maybe 5 or 6 people in a single server, and even that many is a miracle in itself. You more than likely won't find any more players than that, and there really is nothing else to do in the game. Honestly, if this game had a thriving community, I would recommend this to everyone, but it's dead and most likely won't come back. 

I do not suggest buying this, since you'd just be getting an over glorifed tutorial for a game you'll never be able to play to its maximum potential. A true shame, it really could have been something.

Gameplay wise? 8/10

The game as whole? 2/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198119527384', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 156, 'last_played': 1473067944}
review:
[b] Blade Symphony [/b] review

[b] Overview [/b]
Blade Symphony is a sword based group fighting game. Customize your whole loadout with a ton of sword types, characters and skins. The maps are decently sized for this type of game, they're a bit boring though, just very basic. During combat, you can do arial attacks and change from fast to balanced to heavy to even powered attacks, oh, and blocking attacks. I imagine the game would be fun if people actually played it, so I wouldn't need to play with bots to experience the game. Because the game is dead, half of it is locked behind a wall of "here's some content you need to buy with credits to get, but play against real people to get the credits", which is beyond frustrating. So here you are, stuck with the starter swords and  a free little cardboard tube, I suppose it's not much to do with actual gameplay, though, and more to do with customization... However when you finish playing with bots there's really not much to do other than wait for friends to buy the game. So, from what I have gathered about the game: different sword genres (such as rapier and katana), many different maps, tons of potential content. 

[b] Gameplay [/b]
I'd say it's rather easy and very simple to understand. Just go with fast swings so you can hit the enemy before they can even charge an attack and you will win much more times than not. A match consists of either 2 or 3 rounds depending if one side wins the first and second one or not. These mechanics are nothing innovative, maybe just because it's past paced, but otherwise it's pretty similar to what many other games of this genre are like.

[b] Pros and Cons [/b]

Pros:
Multiplayer support (no guarantee for a match, though)
Great customization
A few maps

Cons:
Very little players
Rare updates

[b] Finale [/b]
Maybe. It has turned F2P. Try it out. 

*review cut down to size for cohesion on 2020-07-25 (yyyy-mm-dd).

author: {'steamid': '76561198165760088', 'num_games_owned': 2527, 'num_reviews': 117, 'playtime_forever': 697, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 539, 'last_played': 1552686025}

author: {'steamid': '76561198070616266', 'num_games_owned': 134, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1979, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1948, 'last_played': 1554667739}
review:
When I first got this game, there were more players than there originally were. Nowadays, there are only 5 or less people on a single server, and it would sometimes be rare to find a server with more than that amount. 

But sometimes, I wonder, what went wrong with this game?

The game has an amazing concept, that's for sure. The idea of dueling using a variety of combo's is certaintly intresting, with the community having to study each move a character makes carefully, to figure out what is the best one. It also looks a bit nice, as you watch your fighter gracefully execute their moves in a strong fashion. 

But what I think went wrong with this game is that it simply unfinished.

Right now, there are only 5 characters to choose from, each with their own style with a variety of weapons to pick. But the issue here is, there isn't really much to do other than duel other people. Sure fighting other people is fun, but what else is there? Yeah there are other modes, but what else? The main thing here is [b] what else? [/b] There are only about 3 modes to choose from, while the developers rarely provide updates for the game. This is more of a game to play once in a while, maybe with your friends or with other people, and that's that.

However,

I do think this is an alright game, despite its flaws. But I simply cannot reccommend this game, with its community abandoning the game, the lack of modes, and the dev's not really supporting this game at a fast rate.

Unless you've got some friends to play with, I suggest to buy this game when it's heavily discounted.

[b] Edit, Nov 23 2016: [/b] I've checked out the store page of this game to see if anything has changed and to my surprise, this game is now around $5 CAN when it was originally around $15 CAN at the time of this review. Although I still stand by my criticism, I can suggest that due to its price, you wouldn't have to wait for a giant discount on this game. 

But, like I've said previously, only a few people play this game nowadays; it's best to pick it up when you have a bunch of friends joining the fun along side you.

[b] Edit, October 5 2018: [/b] Man, do times cause massive changes. What just happened to this game? Being excited to play this game after the "major" update, I eagerly got on my computer and booted up this game after a few years or so. Now, every single one of my workshop skins are gone, every single one of my characters are lacking in customization (unless I grind for hours to be able to actually put things on my character) and almost every single server is dead, with a few holding around 0-10 people. Looking back to the store page of this game, the price magically is now $1.19 CAN, quite literally over 14 times the price I paid to play in the first place. And did I get any compensation for this? Nope. Not a single thing. However, from recent discussions on the forums, they are planning to. But how long do I have to wait for that. We've waited months, even years for this update to happen, and yet it essentially made the game worse.

I've honestly lost my patience.

Grab it for a quick buck if you like, but be wary that this game undoubtedly and undeniably suffers from its lack of players and developer support.

inb4: at least we got capes in nov 5!!1!

author: {'steamid': '76561198132780522', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 741, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 477, 'last_played': 1518616385}
review:
Blade Symphony is a visually pleasing, adrenaline filled sword fighting game. With a healthy number of characters, stages and weapons in good variety, players are the only thing that‚Äôs sorely lacking in the game.

The controls are intuitive and easy to grasp, but the combat has a lot of depth. Learning when to block is just as important as learning how to attack, as well as making use of the environment to maneuver around your enemy like an acrobat on steroids.

The inclusion of bots is a good thing since it provides opportunities for practices, but the game would have been a lot better if there were additional challenge modes on wall riding or style mixing.

It is a shame that the game held so much potential but never fully realised because of the non-existent community. While I am aware that dozens of veterans still play this on a regular basis, but they tend to scare away new players more than anything, mostly due to the huge gap in experiences.

While it is possible to git gud over time, I fail to see how it could be fun if I get trashed by the same 5-6 people over and over for months. Now if the developer can adjust the asking price to a dollar USD and put this frequently on sale, the community might just thrive again. Sadly, I don‚Äôt see this happening any time soon. With all that I‚Äôve seen from the game and all things considered, I will give this a marginal recommendation and hope it will help in drawing in new blood.

author: {'steamid': '76561198136977600', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 56249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52572, 'last_played': 1599848372}
review:
Blade Symphony is a very well made sword fighting game. After 900 hours I can tell you, first starting I could not stop playing this game. The learning curve is really small. I got to say, after learning some of the basics of Blade Symphony you start getting a fair understanding of each character. Anyone can become the best at this game if they tried really hard. The game has a vast amount of swords to choose from and anyone can look unique. But throughout my journey playing Blade Symphony, like any game can become very dull. After mastering this game it feels like you are doing the same thing over and over again. And just hoping for a different outcome. The ranking system in this game is very flawed and the same person has been rank 1 for over a year now. Did I say that the person who is rank 1 on the ranking system is also rank 2? The ranking system does not have any decay and if you're rank 10 and lose to a rank 30 or 40, you'll drop down to like rank 60. After gaining some hours on Blade Symphony the game starts the frusturate you as you play against the same 10 people who you can't beat because simply they either play too passive or are using a broken sword or class. The community in this game is absolute garbage. And this is the main reason why I highly don't recommend Blade Symphony. The community is so trash and aren't very welcome to newer players and argue about the same things over and over again on each server. The forums can also get out of hand too. Although the community can sometimes shine and have sunny days, they have more rainy days than sunny. Once you actually start beating people you start to either get known for cheese or meta ryoku 1234. The community will simply complain about everything. And the developers barely update the game as the community keeps flaming about everything that exists in the game. Now lets get onto the swords. Almost all the swords in my opinion are balanced. One thing I personally think the developers should change is the Scimitar and Jian. Those two swords just seem too chunky and a little bit broken. All and all...

Should you play Blade Symphony?
The answer is no. The community seems too dead and stale to actually have a fun time on the game. The game itself feels like it's still in beta and Blade Symphony just needs a lot of work. In later stages of learning the game it just feels like you're doing the same thing over and over again and it's just not enjoyable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046186268', 'num_games_owned': 417, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 58069, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54399, 'last_played': 1598751837}
review:
Surprisingly Blade Symphony is actually very similar to fishing. They both heavily involve patience, both communities are made up of experienced veterans, both take time and experience to master, etc.

well I know some of you want to know the shortened version of my review so heres a positive and negative thing
+Great Music
+Great Community
+Many different ways to play
-Giant learning curve 
-Community is getting smaller
-Possibly unbalanced

I should probably explain the game better but I don't know how to without just talking about the community.
Blade Symphony is a fighting game with a tiny but incredible community, but this tiny community is what keeps the game great. the community is constantly trying to find ways to rebalance this game and make it better than it is (to the point where it starts to get annoying, hearing the bickering of whats balanced and whats not.) I should also point out that this community is primarily made up of veteran players, so if you do buy this game, remember that these other people probly have more than 100 hours on this game.

if you have questions about the game, leave a comment and I can probably answer them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021006583', 'num_games_owned': 400, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 1445, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 791, 'last_played': 1538284820}
review: Great fighting game. It gets super complex, and every duel is a satisfying one. Each character has its own moveset, and each sword type has certain characteristics that set it apart from the others. All of them are balanced (well, except for Vanguard, but that's just my opinion) and it's fairly easy to pick up. Only complaints are that the server populations are pretty low, but from time to time a few friends and I hop on a server and other randoms pile in with us.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053866606', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 731, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 731, 'last_played': 1448446286}
review:
If you have friends that are interested in game focused on sword duels and the occasional, sneaky shuriken...

Then this is the game for you.

If you don't have friends that are interested in this genre, or even have friends, then you may want to look elsewhere.


In my (short) experience with Blade Symphony, I was quite fond of this type of game (being one that grew up with games such as Super Smash Bros). But as the community in Blade Symphony is very small, and those who actually do play are extremely better at the game, than most beginners like myself. Don't get me wrong, the controls, the gameplay, and the added Workshop support make this game quite fun, if you don't have friends to play this with, eventually you'll just get bored of getting ass-blasted by those who have much more hours than you do.

8/10 - I liked the gameplay Blade Symphony has to offer, along with Workshop support which just makes serious fights comical with stop signs for swords.

author: {'steamid': '76561198265026140', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 483, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 483, 'last_played': 1475293408}
review: This game is awesome! Great gameplay, and excellent game mechanics. I only have two complaints: I wish it had a singleplayer campaign. I feel like that would be amazing. Also, it needs to be bigger. The game is great, but it's so small! I get on, and it's rare that there are more than five people online. All this game needs is a singleplayer campaign and some good marketing.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967132117', 'num_games_owned': 4623, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 970, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 970, 'last_played': 1671968857}
review:
it LOOKS cools and nice ... but the game flaws...

to start of let's take a look at the tutorial; which is really needed for this game...  
since this type of game is without doubt best played with a controller it's quite obvious that controller support could not miss, so far so good, but the tutorial lacks secondary support for the controller... for those who don't get what i mean... each and every action is specified with; Press X to ... now sadly X is only an example; because in reality it's; Press Shift + E, press E, Press Space, press A + W (aah, got you there), and each and every time you just got do find out yourself what the corresponding button on the controller is.. most of the time you'll find it... but when they say "press the grab button to continue'; press E to grab and you cannot find that button on your controller because it's a combination of pulling both triggers at the same time; then things become tricky.

so in my eyes they flawed already for this alone; bad support for the most common type of control for this type of game ... it's like creating an RTS game, putting in controls for mouse and keyboard as one does expect, and then only showing the controls for an xbox controller as if the keyboard controls don't exist ; exept for that vague options screen. 

Then the game itself ... OH MY GOD; how awful do these 'samurai' control; for real ... i've played  multiple swords fighting games in history but this one really takes the crown among the pile of poop.  It's sad though because it really could've been a great game if they just kept it real..

what is so wrong with this game?
- Tutorial as described
- really bad controls
- NPC Enemies are hard as hell; they are controlled fluid and they release combos on pity you; which is impossible as a normal player because of the fantastic control scheme..
- the game looks good, but you cannot enjoy it because you get frustrated all the time

i would surely not buy this game for it's 9.99 pricetag in it's current state ...i'm glad it came along with a bundle i bought; it looked good though and i had high hopes for it; but i got more and more disappointed the longer i was playing it... i managed to get the only achievement in the game though; so the game is 100% completed as far as my mind goes, because i just cannot enjoy it anymore.

I really hope this bad experience changes down the road, i don't wish my fellow players to have to experience this too...

Dont let yourself get influenced by the negative reviews. This game is great, it has a deep learning curve and its really fun to play. Everyone says that this game is dead, but its not really. There are always people online to play (at least for me there are) and they are friendly, too. 

Should you buy it? >Yes. Maybe wait until its in sale, so a few of your friends can get it, so they can play it with you IF there are (most unlikely) no people online.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056876945', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 2811, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2397, 'last_played': 1652052251}
review:
Don't buy this game, it's dead. The only community left seem to be have been playing forever, and even those are few and far between, like 3-8 people on 1 server, for a few hours of the day.

Shame, used to be a great game, one of my favorites.

Apparently devs have been upsetting the community, so that may have something to do with it being dead, but I know nothing of that, I was just a casual player.

Let us all bow our heads for a moment of silence, and remember what was once a brilliant and amazing game, whose life was taken too soon and without warning.

...

Lower the casket, que the bagpipes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198140981875', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 548, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 548, 'last_played': 1427347334}
review:
Blade Symphony was promising. I bought a copy for myself, and a copy for my friend, and for a while, we had a good time. However, I cannot say I recommend the game in it's state at the moment. 
The combat itself isn't bad. However, the hackers and cheaters on the servers are really annoying. They can modify game files so that they attack faster, and basically destroy you no matter what. If you're good at the game, you might not get trashed on as much, but I would still recommend watching out. 
The customization--eh. Let's just say that Lego the Hobbit had better customization options than Blade Symphony does. And Lego the Hobbit had rather limited customization. 
Ultimately, the game is just past it's peak. The devs take a while to respond to any problems raised by the players (as I'm sure many other reviews have already stated. Nevertheless, I shall give my two cents), and there's not much that is more frustrating to a gamer than unresponsive devs. 
It's a good concept, and I liked how it was in Early Access, but the game is kinda dying now. No one's really on, the devs are unresponsive, and it just isn't fun anymore :( 
2/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198028376147', 'num_games_owned': 393, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 572, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 572, 'last_played': 1465147052}
review:
This game WAS GOOD. Me being the fool I was played it a little then left it for other games. I have just come back to it to find it almost dead. There is only a few souls still left on the servers.

This is incredibly horrid to see as the few hours that I played the game while it was at its prime, was absolutely brilliant. The art design, graphics, sounds, combat and community were all nicely working together. Unfortunately the community obviously was not kept alive by the devs.

So don't buy this game. As much as it was great when people were on the servers and there was atleast a good few hundred people spread out between the servers. They have now all but gone away.

I will be trying to find a game to replace this but I am probably going to find it hard to find a game to try and give a similar expeirence.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009654132', 'num_games_owned': 2910, 'num_reviews': 148, 'playtime_forever': 403, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 403, 'last_played': 1464009988}
review:
[b] Blade Symphony is a multiplayer arena close-combat/swordfight game which looks promising and neatly designed at parts but falls too short. [/b]

[h1] Pros: [/h1]
+ Gfx and textures are worked on, look nice enough (nothing superb)

[h1] Cons: [/h1]
- Multiplayer is deserted (game itself is multiplayer only)
- Controls are awkward at times and not fluid
- Too much cheaters on servers (if you find a player to match, you'll get owned very quick due to exploits)
- Even in a balanced play, combat gets repetitive and boring very quick.
- No fun at all.

Game itself can be considered "dead" already. Pure shovelware to collect cards and uninstall.
[h1] 0/10 [/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561197994459543', 'num_games_owned': 480, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 690, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 626, 'last_played': 1462992890}
review:
Apparently, you can only move your legs *or* your sword at any given time.  What?

I don't know what to say... very stiff controls.  Very awkward to play.  I want to like this for being a new attempt at making an interesting swordfighting game, but I just can't find it enjoyable.  Even in the fast stance, my character freezes up completely during swings.

I would recommend that anyone who's interested in this, pick up a copy of Unreal Tournament 2004, install the ChaosUT2 mod for free, and try out the melee dueling.  This game seems like a remake of those mechanics as a standalone game, down to the 3 stances, the controls for sweep attacks, etc.  Problem is, the Chaos mod's version is just more *fun*.  You can move fluidly while attacking and it just feels more like a good action game.  The one thing I liked gameplay-wise in Blade Symphony is the way heavier attacks can break through a parry.  In the Chaos mod, it's a little silly when daggers parry a hammer blow.

Good effort, but I hope the developers give this "your legs freeze during any attack" mechanic a hard look.  Just changing it to a speed penalty could go a long way towards making this game playable.  I do miss the melee duels of ChaosUT2 and will be open to a good challenger.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081779114', 'num_games_owned': 289, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 663, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 663, 'last_played': 1462395512}
review:
I'd love to recommend this game.
The game looks great and the sword fighting can be a lot of fun.
With 5 characters who all play differently and 5 swords to pair them with the game offers quite a lot of variety.
The rock-paper-scissors style "stances" make the game a lot more interesting aswell.

The problem though is that this game is multiplayer only... and there is absolutely nobody playing... 
And even if you find someone to play against they are veterans with 200 hours under their belt(who completely destroy you). Sooo if you are a solo player looking for some fun online, dont buy this game.

If you are looking for a great swordfighting game to play with a friend who also has/wants the game? go ahead and buy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085367707', 'num_games_owned': 778, 'num_reviews': 368, 'playtime_forever': 81, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1592722140}
review:
Blade Symphony √© um jogo pautado em duelos de armas brancas. Foi totalmente desenvolvido para se jogar online, e n√£o possui hist√≥ria alguma e nem mesmo campanha para um jogador. 

H√° dois tipos de servidores, sendo que no primeiro tipo, somos inseridos em um amplo espa√ßo p√∫blico, onde podemos encontrar outros jogadores e desafia-los para um duelo. Caso queira, voc√™ pode simplesmente entrar e assistir os outros duelarem, ou ficar perambulando pelo local. J√° o outro tipo √© basicamente uma esp√©cie de arena em que o jogador vitorioso pode continuar jogando, e o perdedor cede seu lugar para outro desafiante.

O jogador pode escolher um entre os quatro tipos de personagens dispon√≠veis, cada um com um diferente estilo de combate, sendo Phalanx, o esgrimista; Judgement, o samurai; Ryoko, o ninja; e finalmente, Pure, a √°gil espadachim.

Al√©m das particularidades do estilo de cada personagem, h√° tamb√©m a varia√ß√£o de posicionamento, dos personagens, que poder√° ser balanceado, r√°pido ou pesado, a depender do estilo de luta do oponente e condi√ß√µes em que voc√™ est√° lutando. Tais posi√ß√µes podem ser rapidamente alteradas, mesmo durante a luta, para atender as necessidades do jogador.

O combate tem regras simples que podem ser facilmente absorvidas durante o pequeno tutorial, o qual ap√≥s ser completado, lhe render√° a √∫nica conquista do jogo (Edit.: Posteriormente, foram adicionadas novas conquistas).

No entanto, ao entrar em alguma luta, voc√™ perceber√° que n√£o est√° t√£o preparado quanto pensou que estivesse, sendo a pr√°tica crucial para um combate efetivo.

Algo interessante √© a possibilidade de customiza√ß√£o dos personagens, em que podemos alterar desde fatores est√©ticos como cores das armaduras e acess√≥rios, at√© a possibilidade de equipar o personagem com diversas armas dispon√≠veis, alterando seu desempenho em combate.

Por√©m, apesar de todas as suas virtudes, os servidores est√£o quase sempre vazios, sendo que em poucas salas ainda se v√™ algum movimento, caracter√≠stica extremamente negativa em se tratando de um jogo exclusivamente online.

No geral, Blade Symphony √© um jogo bem divertido e de proposta diferenciadas da maioria dos jogos de luta do mercado. O problema √© que a falta de jogadores coloca em cheque sua viabilidade. RAZO√ÅVEL (6/10).

author: {'steamid': '76561198031958659', 'num_games_owned': 1083, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 89, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1469705704}
review:
Great swordfighting game, easy to play but hard to master the mechanics. Smooth gameplays and nice sounds.
Only problem is the small player base, since it is multiplayer only.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064261637', 'num_games_owned': 522, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 981, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 913, 'last_played': 1475255492}
review:
The whole game is just damn fun. I just wish there were a bit more people on then Usual numbers.
- The music is beautiful as is the environments and blades.
- Game play is simple but hard to master depending on your character that you choose.
- Workshop has some cool things for you like Maps and different blade sets for you to have fun with.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011595325', 'num_games_owned': 2468, 'num_reviews': 928, 'playtime_forever': 656, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 428, 'last_played': 1462271778}
review:
Pelo tutorial Blade Symphony parece ser um jogo divertido de combate samurai/ninja, mas infelizmente n√£o pude experimentar propriamente porque a comunidade est√° morta, os serves est√£o sempre vazios, deixei aberto principalmente pelas cards, n√£o vale a pena comprar um jogo assim, j√° que n√£o tem campanha single player.
--------------------------------------
Through the tutorial Blade Symphony seems to be a fun game about samurai/ninja fights, but unfortunately I could not try properly because the community is dead, the serves are always empty, left it open on my pc especially for the cards, not worth buying a game like that, since It has no single player campaign.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056407099', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 616, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 616, 'last_played': 1460217964}

author: {'steamid': '76561198090115850', 'num_games_owned': 342, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 611, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 557, 'last_played': 1482358272}
review:
Not what i expected. In a bad way.

The amount of content is very bare. Because it's all about 1v1 pvp duels. WHICH I DONT LIKE BECAUSE ITS ¬£7!! I just feel like there should be more. 
I think the animations are a bit off at times which is weird since its a combat oriented game, it should spend more resources on animation.
Has good music (i think).
It's not realistic incase anyone thought of that. Just typical holywood fencing theme.

The community is pretty much dead and in a pvp-only game (unless if you count training bots) that sux.

I got bored and quit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089489845', 'num_games_owned': 823, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 89, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1419663517}
review: A very fun, fast, and satisfying 3-d fighting game with the most elaborate swordplay I've ever seen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021372856', 'num_games_owned': 126, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 367, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 367, 'last_played': 1461081137}

author: {'steamid': '76561198045986966', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 36, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1460175943}
review:
It looks like it could have been a beautiful, engrossing fighting game. There aren't any players on, however. The learning curve on the game is very steep, and the people left online have clearly been playing the living daylights out of the game. Most matches I was lucky to get a single hit in. I want to like it so much, so perhaps I'll spend a little more time with it to see if I discover some other facet of it, but I can't picture the game having any real staying power.

Edit: I tried spending some time fighting bots to get a better handle on the game. They are more difficult than the only three other players that were online. In three matches I was able to hit the AI once.

review:

Good: Flashy sword animations with an extensive combo system that varies between swords make for a unique fighting game that is unlike most others.

Bad: Small community, rarely play against someone who is also on the same skill level as you.

Comment below for any questions regarding this game!
Video Card: Nvidia GTX 760 OC
CPU: i5 4670k
RAM: 8GB

author: {'steamid': '76561198025546193', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 5389, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4546, 'last_played': 1707789183}
review: They say it requires too much skill to play this game... I can only tell you that those people are call of duty hipsters that rely on pulling a single button and killing their foe. This game is like a trophy, perfectly polished and made just right. but sadly it has been washed away, broken, rusted. It is like and isolated town that should be full of people, Its like going to disney world and seeing knowone there. There are the few people that still play this game and i am one of them. Though running about the only two or three servers whith players on them. I feel like this game does not have much hope in becoming popular these days, but I still love this game with all of my heart.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977505651', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 17, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1459301599}

author: {'steamid': '76561198053528114', 'num_games_owned': 417, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 689, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 689, 'last_played': 1453097633}
review:

4/10 kinda weird controls and mechanics but if you get them then, go ahead, probably better if you practice. Seemed a bit boring to me

author: {'steamid': '76561198010341700', 'num_games_owned': 1022, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 158, 'last_played': 1459099592}
review:
A good concept that's died off.

Before you start on me, yes I know people still play.
People who've been playing for a long time.

It's important to know that if you're a potential buyer on the fence about this game, the community now is comprised of the odd newbie checking out the game, or veterens. You'll either have other noobs to practice with, or vets destroying you.
The latter will be moreso.

review:
I do recommend this on sale, but the review kind of implies that I am observing it under normal circumstances.
It's an okay game. Fun for 1v1 with a friend.

Long loading times, no US populated servers. That's unfortunate and is a deal breaker for many. Indie games that are online only without official servers and a simple "play" auto-search function don't do well for a reason.

review: Wenn man in das spiel rein kommt stellt man als erstes fest, dass die einzige spielweise, die hier m√∂glich ist, online spielen behinhaltet. Die KI von gegner im Tutorial ist abartig hochgestellt und nicht einstellbar. Des weiteren muss man sich im online modus mit denen herum schlagen, die das spiel schon sehr viel l√§nger spielen als man selbst. Kurz um: Absolut anf√§nger unfreundlich und nicht was man mal eben spielen kann ohne gleich sein zimmer zu zerlegen. Lediglich die grafik und die gestallungsm√∂glichkeit der zur verf√ºgung stehenden Charakter ist in ordnung.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081914634', 'num_games_owned': 79, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 12580, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3925, 'last_played': 1673029329}
review:
Great game about swords,cool techniques,moves.Let's see the pros and cons:
Pros:
+It's fucking hard to play good
+Not pay-to-win type of game,only pure skill and tactics
+Not left-click-to-win type of game either,think about what are your doing
+Great community,no toxicity,every oak or iron rank(lowest ranks) player can easily talk to master(highest rank)
+Pretty nice graphics,but requirements for your pc is not high
+Wide character costumisation,you can change almost anything on almost,well,anything
+Low price
Cons:
-Almost entirely dead playerbase

author: {'steamid': '76561198067660959', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 117, 'last_played': 1400115629}
review: This is one of the worst games I've ever played. When I bought it the game was a "Blind Swordsman game". Sounded interesting. I thought it would be a sound based game or whatever. Instead it turns out to be a buggy, hack and slash game, where the main character is indeed blind, but you, who are controlling said "blind" swordsman, can see everything, and the term is thrown around willy-nilly. There is no real skill to the game, and no real reason to it either. Very unfortunate, this game had potential to be something new.

Oh, and the workshop has just about every sword from anything ever. Go slashing at people with your Master swords.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075741100', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 852, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 567, 'last_played': 1458920934}
review:
Why so much hate for this game?
Yes it does have issues. There aren't a lot of players out there, and some days I genuinely won't play it because there isn't enough players. However, there always at least 5.
Some say the movement system is clunky, and i thought that at first. However, I quickly realised that if movement was too fast, the game would simply be running. In my opinion, it is great, and allows evasion of attacks without gifting excessive movement to new players. It also encourages parrying as a way to defend, essential to the game's mechanics.
There aren't a lot of variations either- 5 swords and 5 characters allows for 20 different combinations, and not all of them are used. There are enough though, and each person's play style is different enough to create a different experience for every person you fight.
The combat system is delightful, and creates many different ways of manipulating spacing, positioning and damage output.
I am only 10 hours in to this game and loving it already. I find the player base agreeable and helpful, and love the combat system.
TL;DR -- A great game with a tough learning curve, but has no limit to the skill that can be amassed. Slight content issues and a small player base doesn't stop this game from being great.
Pros-
Great combat system
Helpful player base
Cons-
Lack of content
Small player base

author: {'steamid': '76561198083815221', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 98, 'playtime_forever': 385, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 342, 'last_played': 1499366704}
review:
Okay, I love sword fighting. That's pretty much the only reason I bought this game. This review isn't all positive. I wish I had nothing bad to say about this game... sadly that's not true. If there was a button between Recommended and Not Recommended, that's where this review would be.

Blade Symphony is a sword fighting game combining parkour elements with various sword fighting techniques. Unfortunately, the wall running doesn't work 100% of the time. Granted, it does work the majority of the time, but sometimes when you attempt it, you'll just roll at the wall and get stabbed in the back.

The combat mechanisms are all right, nothing really that great. The combo system does add a bit of repetetiveness to the combat, because you're doing the same couple moves EVERY time, some of which don't help your situation at all. It would be a lot better if they gave you more freedom over your moves.

The combat itself is a bit buggy at times. Sometimes your stabs don't register on the enemy, your sword sometimes will just slide off the person you're fighting like they aren't even there. Also, the throwing stars you get can be a bit annoying, seeing as they're nearly impossible to actually dodge, you have to block them with your sword. sometimes the enemy will have their sword behind them as they charge you, throw a star at them and their sword instantly snaps up to block it. It's not very fair, making attacking from a distance if you have low hp difficult and just annoying.

The art style and the animations though? They're pretty awesome. If the devs would actually update the game now and again, it would be pretty fantastic.

That's all I can really say for now. Don't get me wrong, I don't hate this game, however the bugs make it a little hard to enjoy.

7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197965579841', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 255, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 255, 'last_played': 1454906541}
review:
A fun game, but implementation is weak, animations are funky as hell and its translated by someone who doesn't speak English. Very rock/paper/scissors ingame, it manages to be amusing if you are playing vs friends but quickly pales against randoms when you can just take the same character and do the same moveset to beat every oponent out there. Untill they pick her too, then you beat them anyway because, lets be honest, this is a game of masterful backpeddling and thats about it.

I cannot recomend this game at full retail price. It just isn't worth it. Get it on steam sale for $2 and you are gonna have a few laughs.
