author: {'steamid': '76561198055325188', 'num_games_owned': 487, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1430, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1082, 'last_played': 1486402425}
review:
I don't write reviews much, but man is this game awesome. Best fighting game I've played. Not that I've played many or even am any good at them generally. I played a little soul calibur casually on the gc with some friends and I've been pretty good at Smash 4 at local tournaments, but I don't tend to care enough to memorize combos and stuff. One thing I like is how complex the combat is with a lot less memorizing things than classic fighting games.

Other reviews have complained about the lack of community, but I haven't had problems finding a game so far, and I'm hoping most of these who have got it on the sale this week will stick around. Have yet to meet any noobs who lose one game and then rant about how unbalanced the game is, an experience I had several times when I played Toribash.

Final thoughts: The combat really reminds me of the combat in the Sword Art Online books/anime and I love it. Definitely come join this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997165938', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1569, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1051, 'last_played': 1485653082}
review: Love the concept of this game, just wish there were more players online. If you're looking for a fighting game where precise movement extends beyond two dimensions, then pick this up. The fighting system is essentially a glorified version of rock paper scissors, but it's easy to forget that in the midst of an intense fight. A lot of gripe towards the game comes from how clunky the movement feels, but from experience there are plenty of attack move sets for each character that make up for this. Having high ping is also a killer, but this is mainly because servers are few and far between (where's the love for the west coast?!?). At the end of the day, a lot of issues with the game pertain to the lack of players and therefore demand for better servers, but hey! The game is on sale right now, why not pick up a copy and give it a try? I'd recommend it :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198054351721', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1803, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1679, 'last_played': 1442960950}
review:
A brilliant game, perhaps the best game I have played that simply did not get the recognition it truely deserves. 
It is by far the best fighter game i have played on PC, that said there are currently and probably will remain many flaws.

Should you buy it? Probably not mostly b/c the community is dead and you wont really have anyone to play with, but I do give it a thumbs up for what 'could' have been one of the greatest games on pc... In that sesne to be honest as a computer programmer I almost wish the devs would pass the game on to developers that dont want to make money and instead simply want to revive an otherwise great game. 

What the game needs in order of importance that it currently doesnt have:

1) An active community and development team.
2) A easy to use multiplayer experience that matches players of equal skill levels and makes matches more meaningful. 
3) Slightly more polish. (It has great scenery, music, and fighting is pretty smooth, but it never hurts to improve and in many ways it fails to fully take advantage of the good things it does have).

review:
Character custimization is WAY too limiting so characters look like similar variations of one another. The gameplay is too difficult to master for the casual player and is MUCH too complicated. 

Some may like all of the complicated figthing aspects but for me it was just frustrating and boring. Nothing to do but PvP guys who spent lots of time mastering it so you lose all the time which is lame.

1.5 stars.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004538847', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 647, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 647, 'last_played': 1452993248}
review:
Great amazing Sword Fighting game 
Get this game IF 
1. you have a buddy that shares the same interest and you want to duel eachother 
2. you have multiple "Friends" to play with
3. Love using mods, this game has so many weapons to download, it will overload your brain. 

Do NOT get this game IF
1. You cant stand losing in a fighting game
2. have no friends to play with
3. have 10$ to spend

This game isnt worth 10$ any longer if you can get it for 80%-90% off then go for it and enjoy the game with your friends. 
Just dont punish yourself to play online with the dead community of trolls

author: {'steamid': '76561198034013775', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 85, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1589666655}
review:
Don't buy this game!
It's a dead game. Only few players and a hand full of servers. When you finally find a server with players on it the game is mostly unplayable: Most of the time you have a too high ping and your enemy can grab you at 10m distance, you can't parry any attack or you die while hitting the enemy.
Save your money and don't buy this piece of crap.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019447074', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 178, 'last_played': 1481915483}
review:
I just got this game on humblebundle for 0.94‚Ç¨/0.99$, and. I must say, that this is one of the best games you can get on Steam for that price.

I have played 1 hour so far, so my opinion might be not so good, but I feel like I should recommend this game while the offer lasts. For 9.99‚Ç¨ I would not recommend this game since it will not have new content anymore.

PROS
+ Beautiful Graphics
+Beautiful Soundtrack
+Combat Mechanics are hard, one bad move and you are almost dead (this might be annoying for some players, this game might be really frustrating, I have won 1 of my 23 matches so far.) But I like them.

CONS
- Small playerbase (I have seen 20 players online), although that is enough for get to experience the online mode, so it is not so bad after all.
- Game is no more under development, thus not getting any new content.
-Not many online game modes
- No single player content at all besides fighting AI or doing the tutorial

But yey again, for 0,99 cents? This is the best game you can get!

author: {'steamid': '76561198046667799', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 5036, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4435, 'last_played': 1673374534}
review:
De lo mejorcito que hay, perderas de paliza hasta que aprendas que es un juego de tactica y espadas, y cuando allas aprendido olvidalo todo y aprende de los que tengan rango maestros, reyes del salto spam y ataques a mid-air, que acaban siendo aun mas rastreros jajajaja.
Pulsa B antes de cada combate es la manera de ser deportivo en este juego, 
tu experiencia dependera de tu actitud, no te enojes por perder y aprende que hiciste mal.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042757315', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 154, 'playtime_forever': 462, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1561040360}
review:
Here's my experience with Blade Symphony

1- Booted the game
2- Started the tutorial
3- Witnessed very clunky and ugly combat animations
4- Was very confused by a few mechanics (esp. the parry), and the combat stance switching
5- Ears started bleeding from the bad tutorial music
6- Started the final tutorial battle
7- Got beat by the AI
8- Got beat by the AI
9- Got beat by the AI
10- Started the tutorial over
11- Got to the real fight again
12- Got beat by the AI
13- Got beat by the AI
14- Friend came over asking what's up
15- Friend asks if he can play against me
16- No local play. Friend leaves.
17- Got beat by the AI
18- Got beat by the AI
19- Got beat by the AI (still the tutorial fight mind you)
20- Closed the tutorial
21- Tried an online battle (after a long wait)
22- Got owned without a clue what happened, with severe lagging
23- Closed the game
24- Uninstalled the game
25- Regretted my purchase

Do not recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072976290', 'num_games_owned': 912, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 602, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 578, 'last_played': 1609324188}
review:
Mirad, os voy a contar HECHOS, pues son ciertos, e innegables.
Comunidad fantasma en un juego multijugador? Despilfarro de dinero.
Sab√©is que Steam inplement√≥ hace poco eso de que puedes devolver juegos si cumples que A: sea en menos de 15 d√≠as (creo recordar) desde la compra, y B: que tengas menos de 2 h jugadas a ese t√≠tulo? Pues HAY UN C: si has conseguido UN SOLO LOGRO, no puedes devolverlo. Y los desarrolladores de este t√≠tulo, sab√©is qu√© hicieron? El mism√≠simo d√≠a metieron UN √öNICO LOGRO que te salta al acabar el TUTORIAL. 
No puedo recomendar menos esto, y solo por estas razones, el juego en si es bastante bueno, mec√°nicas interesantes, distintos accesorios y customizaciones, para cara y arma... Pero no creo que sea buena idea gastar tu dinero en algo que no vas a poder jugar y que despu√©s ni vas a poder devolver...

author: {'steamid': '76561198011101707', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 5499, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5299, 'last_played': 1457060682}
review:
If you like swordfighting and competitive games as much as i do, then you'll love this one.

pros:
- high skill cap. Learning the game makes a noticeable difference.
- one of the best fantasy sword fighting simulators i've seen out there (it's like a fast paced rock, paper, scissors.). Rewards both prediction and reaction.

cons:
- lack of playerbase.
- pretty much an abandoned game.
- high learning curve, unless you can find a teacher.

If you are not willing to practice and think twice about what button you are going to press, you'll quickly get frustrated from constantly losing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032632811', 'num_games_owned': 888, 'num_reviews': 749, 'playtime_forever': 895, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1483832434}
review:
A game that is way too complex who expects you to know everything in the first 5 minutes and as probably the hard tutorial I've ever played. CPUs have the extraordinarily ability to read everything you throw out so after learning what each button does your expected to know way to much of the meta.

It may look pretty good but there is now decent way to practice and there seems to be no way to actually get into the game. Thought it would be a neat game to get into for relatively cheap. Rip.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043661900', 'num_games_owned': 465, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1452, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1434, 'last_played': 1454482168}
review:
This game deserves a buy solely because it boasts the best sword fighting in any game I have ever played! (Yes even better tahn Jedi Academy) The community is generally welcoming and willing to teach you and the playerbase is large enough so that you will face other people with the same skill levels. There is also huge modding support so you can create your own sword to fight with, or you could choose from the plethora of anime and movie inspired swords others have already created. 

  The only flaw I've found is the limited amount of game types in the game. There are 4 game types (Duel,CTF,Control Point, and FFA) and Control Point and CTF have no population on any of the servers supporting the game types. FFA isn't a unique game mode because its basically a chatroom that you can choose to fight other people. Duel is the only consistently populated mode which can limit the game for people who don't like it. I however am satisfied with Duel as it is fully fleshed out and I feel as if the game was made for this mode.

The game has 1 superb game mode that pits you in a 1 v 1 duel with another player, and you use the best sword fighting mechanics I have ever seen. Buy the game just to try out the combat and If you don't like it then get a refund!

author: {'steamid': '76561198041122041', 'num_games_owned': 319, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 402, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 286, 'last_played': 1473393229}
review:
This game NEEDS just a hint of marketing!!! 
-the player base is small enough to where its a bit of a problem.
-Solid, straightforward yet difficult to master mechanics, Character customization is more expansive than Mortal Kombat but of course less than Soul Calibur, and its visually beautiful without being heavily dependent on good hardware. 
-I want to see this game get bigger! Devs, If you each spent an hour blasting youtube, forums, and your gamer friends with a well made cinematic trailer (I KNOW you can do it the existing videos have good production quality, and hard to beat a bangin soundtrack such as this) we could very well see the player base double in a matter of weeks. do it while you're on sale and call it triple! you know its not the "game's" fault when every commentator's post is about the player base and nothing to do with performance issues.

author: {'steamid': '76561198127168329', 'num_games_owned': 625, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 80, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1450888436}
review:
You want to play rock-paper-scissors? This time with swords!!! And three hands!! 

You cannot say you are good or bad at this game, 
I play seriously and hardly win. 
I spam attack moves and the results are still the same.... 

Pros: 
+ unique gameplay 
+ complex combination of moves and stances
+ great graphics and effects 

Cons: 
- No free training (each character got the different attack pattern) 
- Playing with AI means spamming moves 
- No variance in AI difficulty 
- The combo is overpowered 
- No indicator of enemies stance or moves (need to be real pro to understand each stance of each character)
- controls are weird.

this game major disapointment is the AI not helping player to be better at all..
or maybe i am just super noob...

author: {'steamid': '76561198073602244', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 589, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 540, 'last_played': 1479634626}
review:
TL;DR - If you want multiplayer, don't bother. If you don't mind sparring with an AI over and over again, get it.

Let me start by saying that this game is absolutely amazing, the footwork, the timing, the swordplay is all fantastically executed, probably better than in any other game I've ever seen and it pains me to see that thumbs down...

That being said, the problem with this game is the players, or... lack thereof, and the league of those who are still around.

I am an Australian, and the playerbase is probably 0.1% Australian, perhaps the Aus vs. US tournament that has begun is changing that but as it stands no such luck, there are very few servers and the ones that are there lag like nothing else, and in this game, lag is a big deal.

Lag the difference of whether or not you can snipe that quick hit, or make that jumping lunge, or make the decision to dodge or block your opponents att- Oh wait he already jumped back and you couldn't tell, oh wait she already hit you before you could even consider making a decision, The lag makes this unplayable.

On top of this, the players who are left are all of the elite, beaten countless opponents and have their swordplay honed to a razors edge, and they will beat you down time after time without fail, because they know all the ins and outs, all the skills and tactics and how to counter them all.

And I end by saying this, if you enjoy skill based games, believe you can bear the lag and believe you can weather through a thousand soul crushing defeats for a single victory, I say without question to get it.

If however you cannot, then find something else I'm afraid.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050596069', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1309, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1227, 'last_played': 1552012504}
review:
This game is very fun. Not a huge variety of characters... BUT, it still really delivers because of the unique fighting style with each character. And finding what sword is best for you on said charactter. Learning techniques and combos unique to that specific character I always find very satisfying. Carefully planning your next attack or countermeasure for their attack, switching between the different fighting stances depending on the situation or to sync a combo, and finding that character that fits a fighting style you are very comfortable with. The one thing I really need to put on the table though is that the servers aren't very full. Yes, you'll find a server or two with a decent amount of people on it. But not enough to where playing without friends can keep you entertained for 1+ hours. Point being, buy the game with friends. Or be a Generous Gonzalez and get a two pack for you and your bud. And even if the servers were very alive, I would still highly suggest to get this game with friends. It's always fun to learn the game together and see who is able to slice their way to being the best in the friend group!

Score: 7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198004282144', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 1300, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 921, 'last_played': 1449385346}
review:
Blade Symphony is honestly a great game. I have always wanted to love fighting games, but I could never get around the ridiculous learning curve required to memorize and input the button strings required to pull off special moves. I love games that are easy to pick up, but hard to master, and this game is one of them. The developers attempted to recreate the kind of fighting atmosphere that was in Jedi Knight 2: Outcast, and I feel like they suceeded. 

Basically, there are five playable characters, and each character has their own move sets, as you would expect from any fighting game. However, that is not the most important element of the game. Just like Jedi Outcast, there are light, medium, and heavy stances. These stances are like a rock-paper-scissors kind of deal, and each one cancels out the other. What makes this important is that if you hit a character using medium stance with a heavy attack it does extra damage. Really, this makes the combat extremely simple: figure out which stance your opponent is using, switch to its counter stance, attack. I was able to win a duel in my first play session using this strategy. This doesn't mean you can win by button mashing/spamming, because the more you play, the more you memorize the moves of the five characters, and can easily dodge their counter stances and move in to use your own. This is just a basic summary, because you can also charge attacks for each stance, and there are also five different weapon types to choose from, which mix up the formula quite a bit!

There is one major drawback: low player base. Unfortunately, it is rare to see more than 10 people playing this game at one time within a reasonable ping. Once you go over 100 ping the game is really unplayable (which is not any different from any other game), but that is often the only way to get on a server with any players!

I definitely recommend that you get it, especially if it's on sale, so you can be part of the solution and increase the player count! you won't regret it!

author: {'steamid': '76561197983172447', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 178, 'last_played': 1448585234}
review:
Unfortunately, this is a dead title.

One server with <16 people playing? Yeah, sad but true.

It has all the makings of a fun combat and duel sim, but the major failing point is the HORRENDOUS issue of lag, and the constants swing of balance. There's a distinct lack of direction for what becomes good or bad over time, and more often then not you're going to be up against some nerd mashing buttons with 400 ping, or some 3gud5u die hard no-lifer who has played this game every waking moment of every day since its release.

Sucks that this promising title fell off within a year.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058202680', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1428, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1428, 'last_played': 1417923125}
review:
This will be one of the best fighting games you will ever have the pleasure of playing. It's really unfortunate that a large part of the dev team doesn't care anymore.

There aren't enough official servers and many of the external functions (read: out of game/menuing) is barely functional at times. If you stick around for the very small community, then you'll be meeting some of the most enthusiatic and fun people in the world. If Blade Symphony became more popular and gained some more meaningful official content, this game would be, without hyperbole, the best fighting game in the world.

If you have the ability to try and gather players for a local connection tournament, definitely try. The lag compensation above 50 ping is pretty hit or miss and the more players introduced to this game, the better it will be.

author: {'steamid': '76561198251214526', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 603, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 546, 'last_played': 1489033579}
review: 8/10 A great change of pace. Its complex, quick, and creative with lots of mobility and some actual sword fighting strategies built in (this is coming from a novice fencer, take that however you wish). The animations aren't consistent however, as some look ridicoulously cool and others look stiff and slightly half-assed, although these bad animations aren't very common. You pick your sword and your character, each has their own abilities and allows you to make different combinations and different builds. It is slightly frustrating in the first 3 hours or so because of all the ass beatings the community will gladly hand you, but relatively quickly you will be slicing and dicing with the rest of them. Its not hard to get started, but very hard to master, you can get a hell of a lot of hours out of this game. The community is more than willing to help you learn, however there is the occasional asshole, as with every game. $10 bucks is definitely an appropriate price for this game, as you can tell its budget was small but what results is some extremely satisfying combat once you learn how to play. When you put everything together- running up walls, backflipping, dashing, parrying, and jumping and slashing and spinning- it all comes together elegantly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085054889', 'num_games_owned': 146, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 538, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 538, 'last_played': 1440880956}
review:
Un juego de pelea r√°pido, sencillo de aprender pero con la suficiente profundidad como para poder dedicarle horas y horas hasta conseguir el dominio perfecto.

Blade Symphony es todo jugabilidad, no hay muchos mapas, hay solo un pu√±ado de personajes y unos cuantos tipos de arma. Los gr√°ficos son correctos y la m√∫sica no distrae. No hace falta mas.

Mis aplausos a Puny Human por la formula. Probablemente ten√≠a potencial para ser m√°s de lo que llego a ser, pero igualmente es un juego recomendable para cualquier amante de los juegos de lucha online que no quiera dejarse los dedos con extensos y retorcidos combos.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068229405', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2089, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2053, 'last_played': 1483586940}
review:
A third-person fighting game that handles like a hack and slash game. Blade Symphony plays as if it were a more fleshed out version of Jedi Academy multiplayer or the bastard child of Anarchy Reigns and Dynasty warriors. 

Its main features are its excellent gameplay, somewhat questionable netcode and balance, and an unfortunately dwindling playerbase.

if you had pleasant memories of Gunz gladiator mode, S4 League, or any sort of hack and slash you'd enjoy this, but you'll be looking at maybe one or two barely populated servers at most during peak hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070157456', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 315, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 315, 'last_played': 1445687446}
review:
Best being alone simulator 2015, will probably get my vote again 2016.

Logged in today to find a total of 12 people on the servers minus me and my friend, marvellous.

Between the clunky controls, the spamming of left click and the "free running" that is essentially just zero-g sliding up a wall what's not to love?

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198043993377', 'num_games_owned': 192, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 300, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 233, 'last_played': 1466827258}
review:
My god I love this game. I love this game half to death. If I had anyone I knew would play it I would play the hell out of it with them. It's a very, VERY solid fighting game that works just fine on the keyboard, with diverse strategy and fast paced combat. The only problem, as every other review had said, it lacks PLAYERS. I've yet to see more than 100 people playing this game at one time. And yet, boot it up, the soundtrack and the gameplay get you hooked. Get this game, then get this game for your friend, and then get this game for your other friends, and play the HELL out of it.

Need anything else? Steam workshop items are visable on every multiplayer server. Have fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031840984', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 5827, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5826, 'last_played': 1455210779}
review: This game is purely amazing, it's one of the best fighting games out there! Part take in epic duels with an amazing range of swords, techniques and characters to choose from. The game is pretty complex and will make up for a great challenge, you have 4 stances, Air, Fast, Medium and Heavy between which you alternate to create your own moves directly in combat! Plus, each attack can be changed by your movement, attacking while strafing to the right won't do the same as if you were strafing to the left. This game is just amazing, what are you waiting for? Just pick up your sword and come!

author: {'steamid': '76561198047952501', 'num_games_owned': 204, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1094, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 499, 'last_played': 1451898584}
review:
Combat is fun and has enough depth to take a long time to master. Having the ability to roam is a nice touch and the challenging system works well. It feels like you're part of a community . . . Provided you log in when people are online.

I speak for the Australian region when I say that unless you log in at a specific time of day, you're never going to have anyone to play with. Even then,. you probably only get a window of one or two hours. The gameplay is great fun, but the lack of players makes it really hard to get into, especially when most of the playerbase are veterans.
I want to love this game but it makes it difficult for me to do so, especially with there being no Australian ranked servers, so unless I play on >300ms, I can't unlock any new weapons.

I'm going to recommend this game because it needs recommendations. The game is great. The community is friendly. But the sheer limited playerbase is what kills it, and a negative review won't help this game be what it should at all.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085077988', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 35, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1443433060}
review:
Wow, I have no idea what to say. I attempted the tutorial and it was initially easy, then it started making me Fail/Draw parrys. As in, "DO BAD INSTEAD OF GOOD TO PROGRESS". And further into the tutorial, it introduced the rapier, citing that attacks are turned when you parry, except it immediately proceeded to go "Oops, bots won't actually turn away, you get the idea".

No. No I don't. I couldn't tell if it was actually working. For a tutorial, that was absolutely shoddy. Never has a tutorial actually put me so far off from a game that I immediately stopped wanting to play it. I saw the previews and thought, "Hm, this looks good." No, no it wasn't. It looks pretty darn good, I'll give it that. I've rarely had games so bad I legitimately feel like calling it garbage unironically. This is of course one of them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031760474', 'num_games_owned': 753, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 27976, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 577, 'last_played': 1500114166}
review: This is one game that has lots of potential but the devs has abandoned it unfortunately. There isn't a lot of people playing this game anymore and the servers are kinda empty almost all the time but yes there are still [i]some[/i] people playing this game on a regular basis. Personally it's really fun, the combos and what not in this game isn't that hard to execute but you've just gotta watch out on whether your opponent's moves are gonna counter yours. The steam workshop also offers some nice add ons like masks, swords and some armor mods. The customizability kinda ends there but it still good enough for most. Overall I'd give it a 8/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972390763', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 166, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1443311612}
review:
I bought the 2-pack hoping to play with a friend but had no end of problems getting multiplayer working.

The steam invites do nothing. If your friends host public servers you won't be able to find them in the server browser since servers are (apparently) LAN-only by default. After searching the forums I discovered that there is a workaround by running a bunch of commands from the game's developer console, but it really seems like more effort than it's worth.

I requested a refund but unfortunately I waited more than two weeks before installing it and Steam rejected the refund request.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040622496', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1285, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1230, 'last_played': 1468657143}
review:
2.5 stars out of 5, a great idea lacking in funding and dev. time, characters and weaponry do wildly varying amounts of damage despite the amount of "charge" put into the attack (which i might add seems to slow your character model in the moment of your attack to "show off" the attack so to speak) also the game as a whole feels like a modded version of a ijji game i used to play called GUNZ, which had the same graphics and artistic feel of this game, back in 2008.
 some of these ideas seem more fitted for games like dynasty warriors  where your oppenents are slow moving crappy AI's that dont care you are about to mash them in the face at 1/4x normal speed, but when the game you are trying to devolope is about reaction time and timing and combo'ing the fact that the move you had to spend time charging up is also  the slowest character animation in the game makes the charge up completely useless on the grounds that there are no slow moving crappy AI's in the game at all, even the training AI is overly aggressive to the point where you have to spam the fastest attacks to hit them and then they just run into them, but if you take the time to use a slower attack then the AI spams the fast attacks not allowing you to. but once you spam the fast attacks, they dont do enough damage to beat the other person and then your combo resets allowing them to evade and counter with another character and same weapon dealing more damage than you

TLDR: if you are going to make a game solely based on pvp online reaction time, do not waste your funding and time making the game "flashy" by slowing down your own mechanics to the point of uselessness, because then that waste appears through out every other aspect of the game. hence the lack of damage balancing and outdated ps2 graphics

author: {'steamid': '76561198103431330', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 831, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 591, 'last_played': 1450229231}

author: {'steamid': '76561198013202359', 'num_games_owned': 325, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 2758, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1413, 'last_played': 1507805461}
review:
This is the best fighting game I've ever played, even though I don't really like fighting games, nya. There are so many ways to fight, since you can choose between 3 stances and a couple of different swords that all work differently. There are also ranged and jump attacks, nya. The fights can get so intense, you don't even have to be a part of the fight to enjoy it. Sometimes I've just walked around for hours, watching other people's fights, listening to the epic sountrack. After a while, I noticed you can get a cape if you're good enough to win a tournament, nya. 
... YOU CAN GET A CAPE!

Ehem, the only bad thing about this game is that it has very few players, and therefore only a few servers to play on, nya. I really want this game to get more players, it really deserves it. 

Oh, and it's best to play this with friends, because who doesn't love to outplay your friends in a fighting game?

But then again, this is just my experience and what I think, nya

In order to master a single character you need like 60 hours of play. I personly love the art style it's just amazing.(although they have a glare effect on the water that makes me want to gouge my eyes out) Plus this game needs more players. Honestly I want to see this game soar, but it can't without more players. I promise you will not regret scraping ten dollars out of you pocket for this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068375400', 'num_games_owned': 153, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 639, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 523, 'last_played': 1556494475}

author: {'steamid': '76561197966534829', 'num_games_owned': 726, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 98, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 93, 'last_played': 1441681003}
review:
This is a fun and enjoyable game. Has some game balance issues that could stand to be resolved. However I find that the term "game balance' as it stands to dueling is laughable at best anyways. Some styles are better than others. 

If you like sword dueling - fast pace, and very quick matches, this is the game for you. If you are looking for anything more than that - look elsewhere.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066878377', 'num_games_owned': 56, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 266, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 257, 'last_played': 1474979447}
review:
This game has a skyrocketing potential.. But that potential is wasted.

I find this game's Fighting Mechanics the most unique!
Theres just one problem...There's hardly anyone to play with and theres only a few servers available
and since im in Asia. ALL THE SERVERS ARE US.. I ALWAYS LAG AND CANT EVEN FIGHT.
So i think buying it now isn't the right choice Maybe wait atleast a couple of months or a year for them to create Asia Servers.

To be Honest this game is suppose to be a thumbs up for me but theres not that much Servers.. so for now ill give it a Thumbs down

author: {'steamid': '76561198007817556', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 316, 'playtime_forever': 36, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1648812624}
review:
A deep game with a hollow community. There's little to nobody to play with. It's a real shame since this is one of the most unique blade-fighting game mechanics I've seen in a long while.

Perhaps all the effort on the game mechanics and engine can still be salvaged by giving it to a well-known franchise that focuses on sword-play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046880960', 'num_games_owned': 483, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 8868, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8027, 'last_played': 1538264589}
review:
Blade Symphony is a game that, when played by anyone, is played differently. Everyone has their own style, and not only favorite character and weapon type, but stances, combos, and movement flow together to create almost infinite possibilities in how you can deal with situations and adapt to defeat your enemies.

Pros:
+Great combat system
+Large number of different attacks, all of which can be chained together
+A large Workshop following that will surprise you with just how many weapons you can have

Cons:
-Combat can feel quite sluggish with some of the characters, or jagged.
-Nobody plays it.
-High level of difficulty when it comes to "aiming" some attacks by moving the mouse to hit a poke lower, etc.
-Nobody plays it.
-Online is ill-suited to this game, and lag spikes during clashes and attacks can ruin the experience. Lan is amazing for this game.
-Nobody plays it.
-Some characters seem unfair, and easier or harder to play. Lots of balancing is needed still.
-Nobody plays it.


Overall, this game is GREAT. I recommend it only to people who you can play against and you will not lag against them, or to people who live in dorms and can have big lan-parties. Other than that, especially if you lag in other games, this game is NOT a good single-player experience, with only very shoddy AI to fight against if you can't with friends.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072010737', 'num_games_owned': 1215, 'num_reviews': 115, 'playtime_forever': 1555, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1184, 'last_played': 1553437934}
review:
The game is a very solid thirdperson fighting game. It has many classes and many swords to chose from. It may look hard to learn but its actualy fairly simple. Let me get on with my review:

Pros:
-Nice community (except if you are on a tournament, be ready for the insults.)
-Constant tournaments
-Well explaining tutorials
-Solid sword fight
-Gameplay variety
-Easy to learn, hard to master
-Great, atmospheric music
-Overall fun game

Cons:
-Some controll issues
-Gets a bit repeatitive
-Bearable but overall bad graphics and animation quality
-Arguably bad balance between classes.

73/100 - Fun time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050457104', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 941, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 151, 'last_played': 1457584292}

author: {'steamid': '76561198114248276', 'num_games_owned': 197, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 808, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 741, 'last_played': 1538243373}
review:
This game. This game is really something.
Having played it as a trial back on its free weekend, I really enjoyed it, but never found the money to purchase it. Now, after finally putting it at the top of my list, I find that it's just as wonderful to play as it was that weekend. The controls are fantastic, the game is the opposite of a stress. There's no grind, no desperate time pounded into the game. If you play the game, you're playing because you want to play, there's no progression, no storyline, and only a skeleton of a ranking system. The only reason anybody plays is to hone their skills. And I think that's beautiful.
How often do you find a game so raw? A game with so little to do, and yet so much to experience. This game is gorgeous, with graphics that bring back memories from my childhood, and a simple but fantastic soundtrack, I honestly can say that I've enjoyed the entirety of my time playing.
The only real issue with this game, is the very, very small community of players. They're mostly good people, but with so few of them it means there is only a couple of servers to be played on at any one time. I'd really like to think this game could get recognized as the gem that I personally feel it is, but until then I'll be training with the few dozen players that frequent the servers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010003156', 'num_games_owned': 545, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 370, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 128, 'last_played': 1485617456}
review: I quite like the game its really funny and has a really good sword mechanism. Even if its running under source mod it works really well. But you need some other friends to practice with them or play against eachother. There are few classes or charachters (Which you prefer) and has five different swords which is very good and a massive load of sword skins some of them are saying "IM A FUCKING BADASS!" and the classes has some skins to but those are not that much even with the workshop which has hundreds of good sword skins but less good class skins which is sad. The gameplay is very good and funny and the adrenaline when flows through you when you has a bit of health left and your opponent has more health then you is just kicks in more. And as i mentioned there are swords skins and class skins which needs points what you cannot buy (If im right) you need to defeat more and more opponents to get more points so its not Pay2Win this is a Play2Win so you really does damm skillz. Whoever buys this game going to have somuch fun. Only last thing i want to say is have fun playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038787571', 'num_games_owned': 215, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 46500, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44790, 'last_played': 1605336291}
review:
The truth hurts.  

This game peaked sometime in the 2016-2017 era, around December.  The era before Vanguard.  It was beautiful, well done, felt good, populated servers.  

It makes me so sad to play the game where it is now.  I know the devs care about this game to some extent, but it's a shadow of its former self.  The gameplay feels choppy, it didn't used to feel so choppy.  Feints are pathetic and encourage some really stupid tactics like balance 1 spam on judge.  Vanguard is a disgrace, her moves are just not well designed compared to the other characters.  

I loved this game.  I poured so much of myself into playing it.  A huge part of my teenage gaming years.  But at this point... honestly... I'll hold the memory dear and let this game pass.

2023 update: 
I graduated college, am continuing my adult life, still fucking miss this game man.  God DAMN do I miss this game :(

author: {'steamid': '76561197999424584', 'num_games_owned': 1231, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1211, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 871, 'last_played': 1576451854}
review:
Thsi game can be fun when you play against the right people. Unfortunately, the game is now littered with people who use macros and abuse the ability to charge their weapon, jump forward, and attack, closing huge amounts of distance while attacking faster than any attack can parry without losing.

Devs need to work on some serious balance issues, so I can't recommend this game for now. If you're looking for good sword combat, go play Movie Battles for Star Wars Jedi Knight Jedi Academy.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963259080', 'num_games_owned': 2238, 'num_reviews': 104, 'playtime_forever': 1795, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1795, 'last_played': 1445920878}
review:
[url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/27632048/]ARCANE RAISE - CURATOR PAGE[/url]

Pros (+4):
+ Truly amazing Soundtrack, the music is really great. Theme song is the best.
+ Hardcore old-school gameplay style, Jedi Knight fans would love this.
+ Visuals are beautiful and astonishing. Source engine isn't very demanding.
+ Great character and fighting style diversity.

Cons (-4):
- Gets old very fast without much content to offer.
- Extremely difficult to learn for beginners.
- Repetitive gameplay and game modes.
- Small playerbase, servers are empty most of the time.

[b]VERDICT[/b]:

I would recommend picking it up during a sale along with the soundtrack, but it's well worth the 10$ price-tag. If you're an old-school Star Wars Jedi Knight fan, you must play this. Otherwise, it's your call. Since there's no neutral vote on Steam, I'll just give it a thumbs up!

review:
The game itself is truly amazing, it's fun to play and learn as well as the community making lots of swords for you to try, and experiment with. With amazing graphics, music and maps, you feel truly immersed into a proper sword fighting game that involves skill and wit to win, you get your mouth breathers on the mic and offensive players spouting their profanity but you get that everywhere and it is somewhat a rairty in this game (this being said from my past experiences). The servers either full or barren but either way i think it is worth while even to check this game out, like i said the swords are many and there are multiple sword types and characters for you to have your own unique appearance, i rate this game

7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198006913154', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 117, 'playtime_forever': 93, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 93, 'last_played': 1436463301}
review:
It's not worth your time and money. 

It looks good on the surface but the animations are pretty poor, so much so that you can't see what you're meant to react to (its sword play, I figure reacting should be key) and fights ultimately look really sloppy, like everyone's just button mashing. Sure the characters look cool and you can do a sick wall jump but if thats what you want: this game is no better than Warframe (which is free!).
I think to really get good you'd have to learn like every weapons attack time, theres like three types of attack per weapon all with different combos and then I dunno if the character you play would also affect it. To me thats just not worth the time at all.

There is a good small community so no marks lost for that but theres not much choice in game modes or servers for that matter.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044784523', 'num_games_owned': 808, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 136, 'last_played': 1435541837}
review:
Blade Symphony feels to me like someone played a lot of Dark Souls PvP, and thought, "Wouldn't it be awesome to have a fighting game like this?"

As it turns out, it IS awesome, and Blade Symphony will feel like a natural callback to any fans of the Souls series. Each fighter has a specialization in some area of combat (speed, damage, etc) and each sword provides their own movesets and styles. Some blades are meant for parrying, some for guard breaking, some for pokes, etc. 

The really mindblowing part of the game comes from the combat mechanics themselves. Various stances outplay others, in a rock-paper-scissors manner, so maintaining a balance in a fight becomes essential. The arenas are very open, similar to Soul Calibur, but with free movement, going back again to Dark Souls. Character customization is extremely in depth, with a ridiculous number of workshop skins that look fantastic. Servers are active (currently 7/14/2015) and able to accomodate as many as 32 players in a single lobby (although combat is still 1v1).  

If the game has any flaws, it would be balance issues. While I imagine it's bloody difficult balancing each and every sword when they can be wielded by each and every character, I sometimes feel like I've had as much luck button-mashing as I have playing a certain style.

Should you get it? I don't know. If you like Dark Souls PvP, I'd say absolutely, although the price is a bit much for what feels like not enough of a game. If you like fighting games, take a careful look before buying, because this is not your average fighting game. If you like swords and fighting games based very much on strategy during your fight, this game is for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049558222', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 69, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1502068572}
review:
I know I haven't spent much time on this game, I'm fully aware of that, but heed my review.

First Impressions always matter, and I wasn't too impressed. I didn't see much I enjoyed about the game, from both a customization standpoint and gameplay, among other things.

This game isn't for everyone, and I see tons of people love it, and good on them! Play the game you love, but it is not for me.

I'm finding it difficult to list many, if at all any pros about this game. Not everything is bad, but a Pro to me is something that jumps out to you as awesome.

[b]Cons:[/b]
Clunky combat and movement
Restrictive movement
Animation is always choppy
Animation is either unmanagably short or boringly long.
Very few customization options. 

When you can blaze through customizing the 5 characters this game offers you (Yes, only 5) then there is a big problem. I see more masks and such in pictures, but the problem is that this game does NOT show these to you, they are completely hidden and leaves you with minimal options, most of which you wont or cant use. 
You are able to use "Skins" which are full body costumes excluding the head, but the different heads/masks that match those skins are locked. Whats the problem here? Well the skins aren't locked, and nothing else even comes close to matching the skins except the one mask made for them, and that IS locked. See the problem?

With the first 4 cons, it breaks the game for me. It ruins the deal and now I've put in an order for a refund.
With movement being so restrictive, unfluid and slow, it makes it difficult to call this game anything that it proposes it to be. Combat is restrictive aswell, being very boring to play with and almost always glitchy, especially with the animations.
Animations can be so unbelievably slow for one swing that you don't anticipate the attack but instead you end up just waiting for it to finish. Either that, or attack animations are so fast that you can miss them within a blink of an eye, making them nearly impossible to block or dodge.
Ontop of movement being restrictive and animations being slow, pressing shift makes you jitter to whichever direction you were moving when pressing it. Pressing ctrl makes you Roll in your direction of movement, only the problem is that the roll is so short in distance, slow and clunky that it turns out pointless and in all honesty; annoying to use.

I would definitely not reccommend Blade Symphony. A Symphony is beautiful, fluid and gradual. This game is not. It's jittery, clunky and restrictive in basically everything it proposes with it's very little amount of content. If the game goes on sale then give it a try, or if it knocks down to $5 then go ahead, but $9.99 is not worth it for this game. If you enjoy it then like I said, more power to you, however...

[h1]It is not for everyone, in any regards.[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198101974532', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1244, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1158, 'last_played': 1468786500}
review:
A well thought out duelling game with the majority of players developing a sense of good will and sportsmanship sparsely seen in many video games today. 

Fights generally take place in these 1v1 arenas where players use strings of light, medium and heavy attacks to defeat the opponent. Players can make use of evasive moves and the environment to reposition themselves favourably in combat. Sword strikes themselves are influnced by the direction you're moving in, so clashes occur naturally where swords meet. 

The best part of this game is definately the decorum and sportsmanship demonstrated by the community as a whole. You may on occasion be greeted by the one annoying hater, but generally speaking games begin with a bow, and end with "GG" and showers of praise.

There are only a handful of characters at this point, but lots of customisation and personalisation options, compounded with steam workshop to expand the horizons even further. Right now, I play as Judgement with a TV for a Head and use a stick with a love heart on the end of it.

Last I checked the community was waning and I had difficulty finding players at my skill level to play with, but we shall see following my new PC upgrade!

author: {'steamid': '76561198076403193', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 42800, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35107, 'last_played': 1704070255}
review:
Welcome to Dance Simulator 201x

This is by far the best dancing simulator i've stumbled upon since when I was a child.
The dancers have swords tho, i dont know why , I guess they represent the personal space of each dancer, so you shouldnt get to close or you'll get hurt.

Let's get on with the review, here's pros and cons:

 PRO
. the music is cool
. there is a sword that is actually a dildo (isnt that cool!!)
. you can't pay-to-win (2 big thumbs-up...thumb-ups...whatever)
. 4
. workshop content for everyone to customize, yayy
. the npcs are well-done and really feel like they're people
. you can measure your e-peen with the useful ranking system

 CONS
. feel like they put more effort in the musics that in the gameplay
. Lasermaxx keeps changing nickname
. there are a total of 3 max players online at any given moment but hey, small community = better understanding of each other (so why is this a con?)
. if only they removed the swords it would be the best dancing simulator out there
. capes should be only for the best of the bestest, so of course 99% of players have them (guess which percentage i'm in) // edit: now you can buy capes with in-game currency so the percentage has gone up to 99.9, you can still guess which category i fall in
. the ranking system is... ok i dont wanna talk about the ranking system

10/10 would play the campaign again! Recommended

author: {'steamid': '76561198032137848', 'num_games_owned': 1957, 'num_reviews': 775, 'playtime_forever': 758, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 562, 'last_played': 1510865669}
review:
Rewrite...i had originally gave this game a recommend, I have come to learn that was premature. the game itself is quite unique, great looking and has a load of potential. what little community remains however, is "Supposedly' elitists who have spent 500+ hours in the game who claim you must as well to even begin to participate in their MP cliques. The forum is a troll haven for those cliques and mostly one of the most unfriendly MP atmosphere's you will find on steam, which is bad when the game is MP ONLY..lol. you also need to understand priot to purchase that this game is over as far as the Devs are concerned. their IS NO content, nor will there be. no campaigns, no storyline, no single player modes or any other features what-so-ever. you have very nice graphics, 4 premade fighters you can choose from, you can outfit and get workshop weapons for them. you can do the tutorial and fight against bots in practice mode. (which they seem to frown on for some reason, probably because you aren't in their servers as cannon fodder for them to earn 'notes" which is their currency used to unlock more weapons and so forth). and that's it. Redo the tutorial for 500 hours or in practice mode and you supposedly will then be able to 'hang" in the very small circle of elitists that are left in the MP servers. so when they say MP only they mean MP ONLY. 

so i redid this to make it very clear, practice and tutorial will get you no currency, there is no levels, or upgrades or any othat stuff. it's a small MP community only game so be aware of that when you make your purchase...if you want straight up swordplay fighting i suggest Mitsurugi Kamui Hikae, it's at least a satisfying little indie game for single player. If you do like MP then of course this is a really beautufl (though devoid of any other content) game. But just really make sure you understand the limitations of the content before wasting your money and investigate the community you will have to rely on for ALL of your gameplay as you may find the atmophere a no-go = you are stuck with a bare game and no place to play and no other content to justify the money spent. except fo course, playing practice mode with your character.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048694896', 'num_games_owned': 824, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 2054, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1859, 'last_played': 1538870980}
review:
A great dueling game. The game is very hard to get bored of because there are 5 playable characters, 5 sword types (I think), and 3 stances you can use while battling. You can experiment for hours, and then you can play for hundreds of more hours mastering your favorite. Not many people use Pure, so your opponents may not know what to do against a Pure fighter. Thanks to community maps, there are also many more ways to play. Though, the community isn't as large as it used to be, so there will more than likely only be 2 or 3 servers you can join with a sizeable amount of people in it. Because of that, I would suggest you also get a friend to buy this game, and then you two should play together (which doesn't get boring quickly, thanks to special duel types in community maps). Also, be warned: If a person is playing as Vanguard, they will more than likely spam the balanced attack, which currently is OPed (and should get a balance check sometime in the future), you have three options:
1. You are a good player, so you can time your attacks against this insane character (or you're good at grabbing, which can really be helpful against this character).
2. You are a decent player, and you take your chances against this character.
3. Just go to another arena.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011724675', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 1210, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1120, 'last_played': 1437008073}
review:
Bad stuff first. It feels very unfinished it needs more maps and characters and weapons. no shortage of weapon skins though. I got it for 3$ during a sale so for that price it's acceptable. they seem to be still updating it and I am a huge fan of dystopia so since it's made by them it's expected to be good.

The gameplay is really fun, but there is some balance issues with certain characters which is why I think they need character variation. and a story mode would be amazing. right now there's only training missions and ai combat to do on the side.

If you're looking for another chivalry or mount and blade I would say this comes close. I prefer the setting but the gameplay for chivalry is much better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064255101', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3691, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2359, 'last_played': 1447981891}
review:
I really didn't have high hopes going into this one, but after playing a few hours of this I'm really happy I picked it up. Blade Symphony reminds me a little of a soul calibur game. I'm really not even sure how you'd classify it. It manages to be super fast paced and exciting without sacrificing strategic gameplay. Stance dancing and combos flow together really smoothly, parrying requires good timing and foresight, and overall the combat feels great.

I've been told the community is pretty dead, and I suspect maybe the summer sale deals have caused things to pick up a bit. In my case, I found a server with at least 16 other people to play with within 5 minutes of starting up the game.

I kind of expected lag to make this kind of fast paced combat a complete shit show, but surprisingly few of my (very numerous) deaths have been lag related.

I'd definitely recommend this game, but if my experience is anything to go by, it'll take some time to learn the ropes so try not to get too frustrated.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096242534', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 91, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1434818229}
review:
This game is a double edged sword.
The mechanics of this game is advanced, but comes at a price of somtimes weird and hard to control movements, attacks. The hitboxes in this game confuses me as well as the animations. 
Its a difficult game to master, and has very few content, community.
So if you are not a hardcore sword play fan, I suggest going for Dark Souls.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078982103', 'num_games_owned': 725, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 57, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1434812699}
review:
First, I would like to say that this is a good game, a very technical, complex and deep game, but for me it has 2 big fails:
The first one is that the online mode is completely empty. There are a few servers with people in but the game says that I can't connect them because they are in a different version, and the ones that are for mine don't have anyone inside. I don't know why the creators decided to separate both regions knowing that the online is dead...
The second one is that the game has any 'solo' mode. I know that is an 1vs1 online-oriented game, but other games similar have a little story for practising or whatever. Blade Symphony doesn't have any mode like this so you are obliged (as the game has a dead online) to battle against a IA that does not suppose much challenge.

I was expecting a sale on this game because it seemed pretty interesting to me, so when I saw it on a flash I bought it. For the first time ever I'm going to ask the refund for this game, maybe it was great on the past, but now it doesn't...

review: Initial experience not great - bought it with a friend and neither of us was able to host a server the other could join, ended up joining a US FFA server just to actually play the game - dissapointed with any really feeling of combo control. My benchmark is JKA and Chivalry - I don't think this game comes close to either of them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034773088', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 64, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1434798922}
review:
TL/DR: This game is awful, go but Chivalery or Mount&Blade Warband if you want some skill based melee combat focused game.

It is Lagg the game, with terrible hit detection, idiotic stance system, awful and delayed animation and with sluggish controlls in general to top it all. Dodging is obsolete, wall running never palys any roll in combat, grabbing never happens because before the animation even kicks in the enemy alread akwardly steps away trying to fight the horrible controls, the weapons litteraly make no difference in combat except for f@cking rapier and its gamebreaking fast attack spam (because blocking is not only deleyed but also usless because of the multihits). Dodging is  usless because you will never jump out of the reach of the attack, especially since enemy will just run at you while having the weapon winded for attack and there is near no difference between doge and run, rolling sometimes work but again the distance covered by roll is way to short so you just need to hope that enemy will just miss  and not chase you.  ANd the idiotic maps, who had the f@cking bright idea to have people que for 3 duel spots  rather than spawn each pair of players in their own deal arena  so that you dont have 6 pople playing and rest just watching and waiting.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998968717', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 55, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1434791927}
review:
Bought it on the sale, having seen it earlier. Grabbed the two player pack since it was just 0.40 euro more. Discovered an abandoned game, with nice aestetics and a semi-interesting system that I could not test out. Hosting a server puts you in lan. The only supposed way to do it turned was apparently going into settings, controls and enabling the dev console, just to play the game.

In the end, steam invites do not work, these console commands did not work, probably because of a lack of port support. Give it a miss if you and a friend want to have fun, this multiplayer only works once upon every alignment of the planets and lots of port and costomizing work. Official servers are also gone, so are achievements.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016005020', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 58, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1434791923}
review:
I really didn't get to play much of the game itself mainly because of the glaring issue that you need to mess with the dev console if you want to do your own Server, as it defaults to lan without any way to customize it. Since I barely got an hour in I'll simply leave this as a warning.

Seeing as I really only wanted to play this to play with a few friends over the internet, I can't really recommend it if you want to do the same thing, and I can't really speak otherwise as I haven't (and likely won't) gone with random groups.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050289737', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 1617, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1557, 'last_played': 1561502359}
review:
Blade Symphony!
Sadly its hype died down and not that many players enjoy this game so much.

I really loved this game because this was a sword fighting action game that allowed you to do combinations with swords. This game has sword, helmet and map customization through workshop, and you could of had a lot of fun when it was still popular. You can become a professional in this game as they have all time rankings (https://www.blade-symphony.com/ladder) and this game made you really want to try beating someone. The game is worth trying out, but its a risk if you buy it, but I personally like it.

8.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198153529314', 'num_games_owned': 100, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1434566473}
review: Horrendous. The camera needs to be manually turned with every move you make, since it affixes to your last position rather than tracking your movements. The attacks are clunky and hard to dodge because you can't fucking see anything, and the roll mechanic is hard to break from, so at times you'll be rolling across the floor like a jackass for hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985969658', 'num_games_owned': 999, 'num_reviews': 685, 'playtime_forever': 1091, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1091, 'last_played': 1422855944}
review: Some of the best combat I've ever seen in a game. Responsive, multiple different levels and tactics. New added class was overpowered, and there is not many people left besides a few really good people which ruins the fun. Also sometimes the missing or hitting doesn't make sense, as you should hit them but it coutns as a miss, or you blocked them but they can still attack you before you attack them and a few other inconsistent annoyances. But the combat usually works perfectly. More customization, as well as new blades not costing a stupid amount of money, would be nice. Nice how you can cusomize your chartacter and choose your weapon, both which alter gameplay and have different moves. 8.5/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198099112686', 'num_games_owned': 217, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 31385, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19884, 'last_played': 1618950860}
review:
300 hours and I still don't think I've fully unraveled the entirity of the game. That being said, it is extremely complex varying between 5 different characters with 3 (or 4) stances/movesets, 5 unique weapons, and a specific playstyle for each individual. No matter how you come about this game, your form of strategy will ultimately be true to you by the end of the match. Bringing with it, a "rock, paper, scissors!" attitude to a 3-D sword game involving finesse and aim, Blade Symphony can quickly turn into a game of wits rather than strats. 

While being competetive is quite viable, the intense steep learning curve set by "vets" and new players whom find arguably cheap strategies can make this "multiplayer only" game seemingly unfair. If your looking for a special community, don't get your hopes up too high. While there is a significant number of players who are amiable and didactic, the majority (in my eyes) are complacent and pugnacious individuals who will always find excuses rather than a solution in fighting you. Take this community with a grain of salt. The "devs" had walked out quite some time ago due to controversial aspects of the game (as so its said); however they are seemingly making a return. Despite all this, if you invest 10+ hours into this game, you will more than likely develop a sort of crack addiction that can make Lindsey Lohan's meth induced third chin flinch. As you've seen from other reviewers, they range from 2.1 hrs. saying "dat waz coo" to 360420 hrs. in dog years going "IF THIS WAS WORTH 500 DOLLARS ON UPLAY, I WOULD TRADE IN ONE AND A HALF NIPPLES, MY COLLEGE BOOKS, A PINT OF VIRGIN BLOOD, AND A YEARS SUPPLY OF KRISPY KREME FUCK MUFFINS TO PLAY THIS AGAIN. 

A truly unique game made the Source engine by some guys who love gaming and gaming communities. If you boil down hard enough, this can swiftly take its place in your favourites list for its competitive aspects, as well as casual. Although, a "casual" will most likely be overwhelmed by the learning curve; intricacy of strategies, tactics, and finesse; and uninviting, seasoned players. Whether its on sale or not, I'd say its a must have for a more hardy and experienced gamer for this (like Dark Souls hard, etc). This game will make you rage. You will win some, and lose some more. You will lose matches against players who sound like elmo with a dependency on heroine and an obscene amount of gaddamn tylenol where you would rather twist your left nut by gluing it to the bottom of a weed-wacker than lose to them again. I'm going to begin my second round of the game with Nyquil, so if I think sleep is the name of another player in the game who I have to beat before my stomach caves in and eats itself, I'll end up sleeping anyway. 

Get the Folgers and Monster combo drink ready. You'll need it to play and wake up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037255378', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 122915, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 104901, 'last_played': 1556818823}
review:
If you need to be convinced to buy this game, you won't play it for long. If you buy it instantly after looking at the trailer, you'll probably play it long enough to be satisfied with your purchase. 

Pros: 

Tight nit community that will make up for not being a large community if you fit into this niche

Solid combat system. There are some flaws but those won't matter to you unless you're talented enough to understand them. You'll likely be satisfied with the current combat system if you fit into the niche. 

Pretty good graphics, especially for a 10 dollar game.

Workshop allows you to add in your own custom sword, mask, and armor designs.

Since this game is built on the source engine you can make your own maps

You can mod in mechanics to an extent 




Cons:

There is almost no chance the community will grow past 30-50 active players. If you like the game and want to experience it with a larger community, that won't be a possibility.



45/69

author: {'steamid': '76561197993508296', 'num_games_owned': 1013, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 549, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 549, 'last_played': 1433505550}
review:
Dead game. There's one server, maybe two where people still play. The achievement doesn't even work.  

All of this is a damn shame because this is one of the most interesting and beautiful games in terms of mechanics and aesthetics, form and function, that I have seen in a long time. It is innovative and competitive and calls on reflex, skill, and intelligence. Unfortunately, it has gone unrecognized and unsupported. Maybe the controls are too weird or it took too many steps outside the comfort zone of the average gamer. 

I will say that it doesn't feel natural to control this game with a mouse and keyboard; pressing buttons isn't enough. Maybe with better technology and tactile control, this game would work better. I hope that a game like this appears when we have the hardware interface to support it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087228392', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1471, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1454, 'last_played': 1474922094}
review:
I just bought this game today, and i'm in love with it. The combat can be a bit hard at first, like the others are saying, but it's not too bad. I joined a server today, and fought with diamond players, and even won. MAYBE you'll have a hard time against higher players, but if you're used to combat games, you'll get a hang of it in no time

pros:
-nice players
-graphics are good
-even a small pc can run it
-smooth combat


cons:
-small playerbase(not really a problem, but for some it is)
-minor bugs(but again, no problem for me)
-there are a FEW douches, but it's like 1 out of 20 players.

overall, a pretty good combat game, and always people to play with, even if the game has a small playerbase.

personal rating; 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198052595334', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 153, 'last_played': 1431898266}
review:
Crazy advanced fighting system, both extensive and intuitive. Basics are easy, but application challenging. Proper skill basis. Fantastic gameplay.
Accurate variety of sword TYPES, while retaining fantasy variants.
Good customization of characters- slightly limited but ample.
NOT PAY TO WIN. Swords have slightly different characteristics, and they can make a specific strategy more effective- but the overall blocking, parrying, dodging, and landing remains the same.
SWORD VARIENT DO NOT EFFECT ANIMATIONS, SPEED, OR REACH. (Only TYPE, Katana is wielded differently from Longsword).

Only complaint? Bot AI is a little stupid. Means PVP is a must for actual improvement.

review: I've loved swords since I was a kid and have a katana. This game is a truly beautiful sword fighting game. I love playing with my friends and love meeting new people here. They are all funny and really helpful. (all the pure haters can suck it) I'm a few wins away from being a master, but I love playing the game even when I'm losing. The workshop and player made items are amazing and I wish I had talent like that. It sucks that the player base is not there anymore. I miss all the full servers. Hopefully the devs will update it soon and the player base will build back up. I love this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028571180', 'num_games_owned': 1217, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 2928, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2808, 'last_played': 1645899851}
review:
Blade Symphony is a great game as far as the idea goes, and it's not terrible at exectuting it well. There are problems however, serious balance issues with this game. Considering its all online, you're going to quickly find out the game is ran by 3 classes, even though there are 6. 

The same 3 classes are used and they will spam their abilities till you wanna punch your monitor. You see, this game is about timing, its essentially a game of rock paper scissors, heavy stance beats fast, fast beats balanced and so on. Whoever is in the better stance, at the right time will land the attack, simple enough right? Sure, if you don't have people who use one ability and spam it, so regarldess what you try, you'll get hit with the same ability over and over and over, no cooldowns. A particular favorite among players is the power class, it allows you essentially sit back, wait for your opponent to attack and then power house their ass down. Its so easy in fact that 90% of Diamond and Master ranks use the same 3 classes.

 So would I recommend this game? Absolutely not, its a terrible game with no balance, clearly, because no one makes a game with a  class that can hit you 3 times and win. Broken mechanics like that plague this game (hence why it was on humble bundle sale for $3.00) its essentially a piece of shit and the devs' wanna squeeze every last ounce of $$ they can from it before you realize the game is broken, and has no community. What community it does have are 40 year old virgin neckbeards with no life and are at "Master" rank and all they do is plague the terrible high ping servers. If you're the type of gamer that plays anyway they have to just to win, you'll love this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033502573', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1949, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1918, 'last_played': 1430679950}
review: This game is terrible. The framerate is inconsistent leading to losses, the reaches on weapons are terrible, combat is NOT skill based, and whoever picks the character 'Pure' wins everytime. 2/10 just because I've seen worse

review:
Went to try this game. Came to say this 7 hours later. Much stabbing fun, and a great multiplayer crowd - didn't have a single disconnect during a match, and everyone was very friendly. Strategic and tons of depth, but with approachable and well implemented mechanics and a comprehensive tutorial.

Recommended - would stab again.

review:
visually appealing but as far as mmo's are concerd a bit to brutal for my liking so for me this games a swing and a miss. dont get me wrong i can see why other player would like this game but its not for me sadly.

the reason its hard to aim your sword at one target when you two or three people attacking you from behind. i will admit however the dueling system does'nt allow any other players to interupt the duel by cancaling out the other players avatars this way one on one duals will go uninterupted.

though i will recommend all newbie players play the training sims first before you play for real seriously the games that complex.

in concludtion this game has it good point and its bad points so what ill do is ill give it another go anthor time but for now at least ill give this game a personal rating 5/10 for the time being this is due to the fact that my first time playing this was when i was tired and thats why i intend to give this game an othe go in the future i the hopes that i can give this game a farer assessment.
