author: {'steamid': '76561198069817378', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1169, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 753, 'last_played': 1538706498}
review:
Weapons duelers like Chivalry and Soul Calibur are based around using different types of weapons with different skillsets like hammers, nunchucks, and zweihanders. Blade Symphony takes this concept and narrows it down to just swords, and by doing this, they have a created a skill-based duel  game that is fun to watch and play.


Story wise, Blade Symphony isn't much to look at. Here's the gist of it: You're a blind swordsman trying to become the best in the world. Seriously, that's it. However that's not where Blade Symphony shines. It's graphics are very well done, especially at the particles when swords collide. All of the models, both sword and duelist, are very well done with textures fitting the weapons, like giving the katana "Serrated Serenade" a serrated edge. When wandering around the maps in free for all mode, it's a joy to be able to climb up onto a roof and take in the scenery. While playing I didn't notice any texture pop ins or jagged edges.

While Blade Symphony may be lacking a story, it more than makes up for it with its deep customization  and sword play. Upon entering, you're guided through a series of tutorials teaching you about basic things like sword types, all the way up to advanced side cancelling, with Puny Human planning on releasing more as time passes. You'll pick from one of four classes, with Judgement being your defensive tank, Ryoku being the nimble fiighter, Phalanx your long reach sniper, and Pure with her fancy spins and sword flurries. Along with your sword type, either katana, longsword, rapier, scimitar, or jian, and sets of fast, balanced, and heavy stances, you have an unlimited amount of strategies waiting to be learned. You'll see common ones like Judgement with a longsword to deal massive damage, or Phalanx with a rapier to deal bursts of damage, you can visualize more unique ones. A slow and bulky Judgement wielding the jian, which speeds up your move recovery, can help him compensate for his slow heavy attacks. Fighting tooth and nail with another player is electryfing, and the main reason why this game is so much fun to watch. When not slashing other players into bite-sized chunks, you'll be either waiting for the way too long load screens to disappear, or using your currency to purchase new swords and masks. While they certainly change how your character looks, they don't do anything to impede the balance of the game, since everything is cosmetic. This makes the game purely reliant on skill. The only way to get good at the game is to practice, practice, practice.


THE VERDICT:

Stuff I liked:
+Simple yet deep swordplay
+Vast customization
+Skill based gameplay
+Electryfing duels

Stuff I didn't like:
-Horrendous loading times

9.5/10 Outstanding

With how easy it is to get into Blade Symphony and how deep the strategies go, it's easy to lose several hours into one play session. If you want a multiplayer duel with a large amount of depth and customization that takes a minute to learn and a lifetime to master, stop reading this review and add Blade Symphony to your cart.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000363145', 'num_games_owned': 649, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 529, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 322, 'last_played': 1503422478}
review:
Being a long-time Jedi Knight player (JK2 and JK3), and also an app/mod dev for JK, I had quite the expectations regarding this game. Devs promised me exciting fights, exhausting duels, a lot of skill-based gameplay and... I got it.

For those who didn't really fall for lightsaber dueling or don't think Star Wars Universe has anything to do with Blade Symphony I'm gonna try and convince you to this game without any further comparisions to my favorite franchise.

The whole idea of this game is to create a competitive environment for players to duel with various melee weapons (but really mostly swords and such). The goal was to make it pleasurable, fast, dynamic while keeping it more advanced/difficult than just your average arcade game in TPP where you hack and slash your way to victory.

It's a game of strategy, analysis and customizing your gameplay to fit your style. I wanna talk about the latter first: It's really well done, you get to choose from 4 characters, and each one of them has got a completely different moveset and playstyle. [b]I mean it, you don't get two same moves for any of the heroes.[/b] I've noticed 1-2 similiar moves but then again they follow up into something else, have different range, different purpose, are from a different "string" (I'll talk about it later). [b]If that's not enough for you, you get to choose a sword type - there are 5 at the moment.[/b] Each one of them has got different properties and different "defensive" ability. You also get to choose what the sword looks like but that's a detail.

Let's talk about the gameplay: It's brilliant. How do you mix dynamic fights with tactics? You put 4 categories of attacks, each one of them countering 1 of them, at the same time being weak against another. Attacks also have exact "trails" - some leave you open, some attack from the left, some attack from the right, some make you spin and attack everything around you, but there are still openings your opponent can use. So can you. Combat is still fast-paced and you feel the adrenaline rush. Add "strings" to that. Attacks come in patterns but you can break the pattern, reset it and completely confuse your opponent. It's truly a game of skill, predictions and observation. [b]Choose the right style, combo the way to surprise your opponent, fake an attack, reset your pattern, parry, use the openings in the opponent's pattern - seems simple, but is ingenious.[/b]

There are a few gamemodes but really you should know you can take part in FFA, duels (1v1, 2v1, 2v2) and Hero mode. Hero mode chooses one of the players to be the "hero" - he gets empowered attacks but all the enemies are trying to kill him at the same time.

As for the audio: it's neither bad nor good. I didn't really puy much attention to it and for the most part I just had my own music running in the background. Have to say I've played a bit with the in-game music and it wasn't irritating at any part. Only thing I could wish for is some better hit-sounds.

Graphics are just ok, living up to standards but still pretty simple. That's ok, you wanna stay focused on the fights and there's no irritating visual stymulus coming from the game itself. Some of the fighting areas seem a little bit empty and poorly designed but it's not much of a deal at all. Lastly I'll just say that camera work is intuitive and you can actually adjust it in any way imaginable (e.g. angle, yaw, shaking, moving, rotation, height, distance).

I can really recommend this game. If you like dynamic sword fights with a bit of tactics you will enjoy this game. It's simple, but holy shit, in its simplicity it's beautiful.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042690775', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 13950, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12148, 'last_played': 1454753071}
review:
Voulez-vous savoir ? Il faut d√©velopper ses tactiques, techniques et ne pas se laisser intimider par l'adversaire, autrement, vous vous retrouverez la t√™te dans un puit. Le syst√®me de combat est tout √† fait original: ce n'est pas un "side-scrolling game" mais un jeu en trois dimensions dynamique o√π vous disposez de trois "stances" (Fast, Balanced, heavy) qui font varier le type d'attaque que vous porterez, ainsi que de quatre personnages ayant leurs propres capacit√©s et d'une multitudes de types d'√©p√©es disposant de leurs atouts et d√©savantages; cela change √©videmment des bons anciens jeux de bastons. Courir sur les murs, esquiver, dasher, feinter, vous disposez d'un bon nombre d'options pour remporter la victoire. Il y a plusieurs syst√®mes de combats: le "Duel" ou pourrez vous battre en √©quipe ou seul sur de tr√®s charmantes cartes disposant de trois ar√®nes, le "FFA", ou tous les joueurs qui rejoignent se retrouvent sur une grande carte, o√π vous pouvez d√©fier n'importe qui; ce mode est mon pr√©f√©r√© et de loin puisqu'il ne faut pas oublier un √©l√©ment tr√®s important du jeu: le social (j'y reviendrai un peu plus tard~), le "control points", qui une simple capture de points de contr√¥le. Alors~, je parlais du social, est j'y reviens: ce jeu est g√©nial pour rencontrer d'adorables personnes ! Asseyez-vous autour d'une table et si vous parlez l'anglais, vous vous ouvrirez les portes de l'amour et de l'amiti√©~ ohohohoh. Mais il ne faut pas croire: il y a des fran√ßais dessus, peut-√™tre pas autant que des anglais ou allemands, mais il y en a.

Et bien je conclurai en d√©clarant qu'il faut porter plus d'attention √† ce jeu, il poss√®de un potentiel fou, et vous √™tes assur√©s de passer de tr√®s bonnes heures √† am√©liorer vos comp√©tences.

author: {'steamid': '76561198105065951', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 9143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7964, 'last_played': 1418429064}
review:
Welp there are some good parts about it. I'll talk about the community first. In a nutshell the community is full of biased power hungry tyrants, with all due respect I will call them out. Mostly all the Admins on Blade Rebellion (Which WAS a community server) were horrid (most). Here are some crucial examples, from my view as a Bystandard. I was in a bad mood because I was new and I did'nt really know how to play. Redmund challenged me, so I was like: "Okay lets go" then I noticed he was an Abusive Admin after I bested him. He Muted me and then fought and fought. So I left because well I'm no fools toy. Anyways I wanted to talk to Himura about one of his admin being excessivelly abusive. He ignored it, for some reason I actually thought this was a cool server and I was VERY, very, wrong...

Gameplay: As far as I've played this is a pretty cool game, just know that practice makes perfect! But like all good games it lacks: Some type of challenge scenario for training, Something else besides Multiplayer. Either way it is a good game and I've had my moments in this game aswell: (This was in one of the tournements in Blade Rebellion) Kevin: AHHHHHHHHHH (Note I was on 1hp) Other guy:..... Kevin: (Smashing the Keys to evade and win), Kevin: OMG YESSS AHAHAHAHAH WHOOOOOOOOOO!!!
Yeah its pretty Fucking intense...

I'd would love to recommend this game to my friends and any other Gamer who is reading this, Ultimately the choice is yours I'm Just here to Help...

author: {'steamid': '76561198052432727', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 726, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 433, 'last_played': 1538928309}
review: Want a fighting game that includes Tekken levels of complication? No? well too bad. This is a fantastic title that no one should miss. A mixture of fencing, MGS Rising, and parkour, this title will have you trying to out play your opponent in a game of wits and movement. the lag is non existant, the workshop is great and my god, the community is fantastic. go buy this title right now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001013891', 'num_games_owned': 1061, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 945, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 240, 'last_played': 1455647297}
review:
Blade Symphony is a nice break from the constant point-and-shoot games that have flooded the video game market. The tutorial is rather brutal, and some players may be unforgiving. But the game is truly enticing. The fighting styles are varied enough so that there is really any number of ways to defeat any number of fighting styles. Battles feel balanced and intense, and the controls are tight, if not weighty.

A campaign mode would do nicely, but overall the modes available are fun. The variety of swords means you always need to be on your toes. I personally found very little difficulty in the control scheme; switching between stances helps keep the flow of bouts at a constant pace. With the different possible fighting styles, this game almost requires you to know where your attacks will land and what your opponent will do next.

Overall, there could be more to do, but the battles are fast paced and always feel fresh.
9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198078323176', 'num_games_owned': 444, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 759, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 607, 'last_played': 1511371867}
review: I suck at fighting games. I really do. But for some reason I'm pretty good at this game. The controls are some of the best I've seen in a 3D fighting game. Not too confusing, and it's fairly easy to get combos going, and thanks to no lock on feature, it makes free roam so much more fun. Free for all has to be one of the most hectic and fun game modes I've played in awhile.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034295961', 'num_games_owned': 441, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1409, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1291, 'last_played': 1629077627}
review:
The game itself is pretty good. The gameplay's very reminiscent of Star Wars Jedi Academy's lightsaber combat, but with a stronger emphasis on 1v1 duels, and a significant amount of extra depth that makes the game feel more like a fighting game than anything else... At least, if you're playing in Classic mode.
However, this game is unfortunately completely dead, even after the recent free weekend, price drop, and update. Seeing a server with more than 0 players is a rarity, which means if you're wanting to give this game a shot, it'd be best to try to wrangle a group of friends together so that you don't have to laugh at the embarassingly bad AI. Even though the game is pretty cheap at the moment, it'd be best to wait until the developers follow through with their plan to make the game free-to-play, as the game is pretty unbearable when the only players are bots.
And a small suggestion for the devs: Make it possible for players to vote to change the style of bot-created matches on duel servers! Arcade mode is pretty bland and shallow, which makes grinding for EXP in this game's current dead state a lot more tedious and unbearable than it should be when most servers you join end up having nothing but arcade mode bots.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050325190', 'num_games_owned': 145, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1168, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1422639080}
review:
First of all the concept is great, a game which requires alot of skill and tests your reflexes to the limit.
There are too many flaws in the different classes availible, there is one which basically 3 shots, and can block everything. The playstyle and pace doesn't fit the fight pit maps, it's more of a 1v1 game design. The animations and art is the only good thing about the game, after 1 hour it gets boring and one-sided. I'd rate it 5/10, the game isn't complete garbage, they could add 1v1 maps, and team 1v1 maps, like Team A vs Team B, 3 rounds and if one dies he gets replaced by the next in the team, order is random, and 1 life per player per team.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023422423', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 786, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 786, 'last_played': 1415764825}
review: Novel and Entertaining, but flawed. Starting out is hard, you will get rolled very easily when trying to learn/practice new things. This game is very linear and competitive, which might be right for some but frustrating and/or boring for others. I for one fall into the latter category, I hate to say. The playerbase is also very mature, so new players will have trouble meeting others of similar skill levels as many players you'll encounter are also far more experienced than you. If you like Chivalry: Medieval Warfare you will likely like this one. Avoid if you're a casual gamer.

review:
A spectacular sword fighting game with combos and some acrobatic elements.  It currently lacks content, but it's gameplay makes up for it. It has some unlockables, some characters, and variety of swords with their pros and cons. Also, i missed some gore in this game. Fun fact, the way you charge your combos reminds me of anime called Sword art online.

If it's on sale, it's steal even if there isn't much content in it or a huge playerbase.

review:
I belive this game has a great aspect of learning and practice behind it. You are not forced to learn, however you do learn either trough the mant tutorials and the more you can add to the game or through just playing it in general. You'll learn to utuilize your character, your sword type, and the 3 (4 to be specific) stances to make sure you do your best in any match.

Oh, and did I mention there are a wide selection of customization options in the workshop?

author: {'steamid': '76561198009078453', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 405, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 405, 'last_played': 1425663849}
review:
DISCLAIMER : I don't fully recommend this game but I rated it up because the pro/con balance stays positive.
I'm going to be direct : if you don't like competitive/versus gameplay, just go away. This game isn't for you. No need to read the rest of the review.

Now, if you're still here, you might be interested.  
Let's be honest, this game is HARD AS HELL when you're a beginner. The tutorial doesn't really help, there's no solo/bot play at the moment and the  only mode available is 1v1 Versus. There is no matchmaking, you are free to join the server you want. This is how, on my very first game, I fought against the 113th world's best player. No need to say I got REKT.
Despite the density (not easy to understand at first glance and not very intuitive controls) of the game and its little balance problems (just check the forums, but it's nothing that can affect you as a beginner) Blade Symphony remains pleasing.
I'm not the best versus player in the world, on the contrary actually... yet I won my first match after a dozen of fights which is not so bad and quite rewarding.
Nice addition : There's Worshop Content available for this game.

Finally, I'd say this game needs time to add what it lacks of and fix some issues. Just give it time.
I'm not going to rate this game /100 as I'm not a big versus player and I don't think I have enough knowledge of versus games to rate this accurately.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032580675', 'num_games_owned': 203, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 566, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 539, 'last_played': 1434225327}
review:
Seems to be generally hit and miss with people i know who have played the game, but i'm a fan of the mechanics at work.
The different sword types give you suprising variation without even changing your movesets, and the difference between character speed and attacks manages to avoid imballance between styles (Except for phalanx-rapier users, dirty bastards)

review:
This game was once fun to play, the class balancing is atrocious. When all the characters were on a level playing field when skill was involved to outwit your opponent, that is when the game was fun.

Now all you need to do is pick one character and spam the same attack over and over again, as fast as you can.

Seeing that it's free now? Get ready for microtransactions. 

what wasted potential

author: {'steamid': '76561198012029473', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2729, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1986, 'last_played': 1439660466}
review:
Blade Symphony is a game of patience and strategy or if you're me, you'll just spam random attacks and hope the enemy walks into it.  I somehow made it to Master rank for one day but got shot down quickly back to Steel.  When fighting against any rank, it gets scary because you don't know what they'll do.  Not everyone just spams Heavy Attacks and hopes for the best, some people charge it and do some crazy charge jump and one-hits me, I cry each time it happens.  Then again, it's probably my fault I don't move away.  While I do find the game sometimes imbalanced, it's probably because I suck.  Anyways, there have been good and bad moments but the game is worth every cent. 

Side Note: Most of the community is nice, I once went AFK due to a distraction and pressed sit, my opponent didn't even kill me and just let the game get to a tie.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098141967', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 439, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 180, 'last_played': 1623563027}
review:
I find that Blade Symphony is a very unique and fun game for all kinds of people! The variety of the four characters each with their own skills and talents also adds an interesting aspect to the game. The four characters are all balanced and not op, even though they might be harder to play and more difficult to understand. If there was one thing I would change, it would be to change the character known as Pure a little bit so she's not as powerful.

7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198024278825', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 5817, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4985, 'last_played': 1425330813}
review:
I a werid relationship with Fighting Games. I love how it brings mind games from RTS, 4X and Chess down to a simpllistic pure intense reaction based form but I hate at the same time outside of Smash Bros most fighting Games require you to learn A LOT of pointless combos that feels more like a History Memorization than fun. Blade Sympony is simple to control but very hard to master. The combos are more in how you use your movesets since  at any time you can use a heavy, blanced, fast and Air not to mentions the air cancel of first three. This is fighing game that gets the complex parts right but at the same time is much more easy to understand the funimentals of combat and excute them over say Tekken or traditional 2D fighters. I have learned a lot and still learn a lot but I enjoy this game because it requires you to more of learn what you should do to bait the other guy in and that combacks are common if not very possable always in Blade Sympony. 

Grab your favorite Sword from the Workshop and slash on.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119365788', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1837, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 572, 'last_played': 1608261544}
review: So far I have fallen in love with Blade Symphony. It has its fair share of issues, but those are all outweighed by the excellent combat mechanics. There are four fighters all with very unique fighting styles, and strengths and weaknesses. There are also five different types of swords each fitting to different fighters in unique and interesting way. There are, however, some issues, for one, offline play There is an AI to practice against but it is incredibly bad, you have to set up what the AI will do, you can for example set it to attack or defend, it cannot do both, making it effectively useless. Also the player community is fairly small, which is sad, I have played ten hours so far and I have already run into some people I recognize repeatedly, but overall I love Blade Symphony's combat mechanics, and that's what sells it for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975898631', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 262, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1425941600}
review:
Very intriguing and highly challenging game that keeps me coming back for more despite its lack of content at the moment, although more content is being added.

When I say highly challenging, you really need to think before you strike, but do it fast. You also need to think about your fighting style and weapon of choice and the arena / free for all combat setup is superb. This is NOT a hack 'n' slash as I found out and even the AI is merciless.

The long sword is your friend to begin with; run through the tutorials several times and set up local games against AI before you go head-to-head, trust me on that.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969385956', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 231, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 231, 'last_played': 1414257420}
review:
Imagine if you will instead of just tapping R to reload a gun you had to tap P to open your pocket cover, then hit G to grab the bullet in it, then hit P to pull the bullet out, then hit C to chamber the bullet, then hit T to cock the gun. There's a reason most action games don't overcomplicate the controls in combat.

That's the problem with this game. It pours buckets of needless complexity into it so the more used to it you are the better you'll do - which sounds better than it really turns out to actually be in this case. You can't just pick this game up and play like most offline fighter games. Every stance beats a different specific stance: Heavy beats balanced, balanced beats fast, fast beats air, air beats heavy. These stances (aside for air) are all changed by selecting the stances [b]manually[/b]. In addition to this every time you click the attack it'll be a different physical move. In many cases veering in a way entirely unlike the previous attacks. So you also have to deal with having to memorize the number of each attack in each stance to make sure they'll land somewhere that the opponent is standing.

What makes it so glaring is you have to tell it to tap 1, 2, 3, and spacebar to switch stances constantly if you want to have any honest chance of doing anything against an experienced player. You can't just rush in with a favorite stance and do anything. They'll switch to the perverbial paper that beats your perverbial rock (because for some reason it displays what stance you are in to the opponent). So you're forced to mess with the stances constantly lest they simply get all the hits.

Sadly the problems with this game don't end there.

Some moves are simply useless compared to other moves. Charge Attacks give the user an [u]unblockable higher-damage attack [i]and[/i] a burst of running speed[/u]. That's nifty except for the fact the user can release the charge anytime they like (including early) and they can start another one immediately after - there's nothing about it that leaves them open and in fact even makes them even more dangerous to approach due to the extra speed.

The game engine is clearly not designed with platforming in mind yet a lot of the stages require you to platform to compete. Whether you're fighting on catwalks, rooftops, balconies, rafters, or trying to run on walls (yes you can possibly do it, but seriously try fighting on those and tell me that felt like a good forumula of controls and environment).

The lag of this game is pretty bad. In one fight I watched a guy not even move form the starting position 10ft away from me. He swiped the air in front of him and killed me with a perfect combo.

The animations and visuals of the game [i]are[/i] nice though. If there's a sale it may be worth your time to grab this despite the fact the combat is more or less gimmicky.

It's "free game" level of quality. Don't spend $20 on this expecting excitement.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022001483', 'num_games_owned': 210, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 98, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1413606866}
review:
Its an interesting idea. You enter a map, and then you can either just go around fighting other players without restrictions (server-specific rules and etiquette may vary), or challenge them for a proper duel.

The graphics are nice and there are buttloads of custom content (thank you steam workshop for making installing them so easy).

As for gameplay, the swordfighting isn't as smooth as chivalry or mount & blade, and the jumps and parkour aren't as smooth as warframe (when its not lagging like hell or when you are not with a shitton of alien dogs trying to get a piece of your ass), but the gameplay is pretty damn solid.

If the only thing holding you back from buying this game is the price, wait for a sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029080542', 'num_games_owned': 337, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 1941, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1419, 'last_played': 1574740345}
review:
Te presento la siguiente situaci√≥n: Llegas a un server de 24 jugadores, comienzas explorar al mapa y te percatas que todos los espadachines est√°n medio de una gran batalla otros tantos est√°n sentados limit√°ndose a observar, otros tantos estan ‚Äúpracticando‚Äù al aire libre, otros tantos solo estan intentando llegar a los puntos mas altos y‚Ä¶ ¬øcu√°l es su escenario? TODO EL MAPA, si en la batalla sales volando y caes al primer piso, no te preocupes, tu contrincante ira a por ti para terminar lo que empezaron (y no, no hay pausas, si a√∫n tienes vida la batalla continua), es jodidamente genial combatir con tu Katana y que puedas andar por todo el mapa, saltar, intentar huir y realizar algunos movimientos ‚Äúninja‚Äù.

Si bien a los nuevos jugadores les costara un poco de trabajo familiarizarse con los controles, pero una vez controlados podr√°s realizar tus propios combos.

Son 4 los personajes que podr√°s escoger, aprender a luchar con cada uno de ellos es una opci√≥n no un requisito, escoger√°s al mejor espadach√≠n que a ti te parezca, cada uno con sus pro y sus contras. Los objetos desbloqueables no son muy variados (es mi √∫nica queja) y para conseguirlos solo te tienes que limitar a ganar tus batallas, pero esto no hace a un jugador mejor que otro, aqu√≠ no existe esa regla la cual es si eres de nivel alto ganas por tus accesorios, aqu√≠ los accesorios solo sirven para verte m√°s ‚Äúguapo‚Äù ‚Äúwao‚Äù ‚Äúnice‚Äù o todos los sin√≥nimos que se te ocurran.

Existen 4 modos de juego disponibles, el que ya mencione donde llegas a cierto mapa y todos est√°n en una batalla o algunos simplemente se limitan a observar, duelo, donde peleas uno contra uno o dos contra dos y el modo de capturar el punto. En mi humilde opini√≥n el mejor modo de juego es el sandbox, donde no existen limitantes en el escenario.

A todo lo anterior mencionado, s√∫male que tienes la posibilidad de visitar la steam workshop donde puedes escoger la espada que quieras y los accesorios que quieras a‚Ä¶ y mapas no oficiales. 

Llevo m√°s de 20 horas jug√°ndolo y me ha dejado con un buen sabor de boca, las peleas entre estos espadachines son excelentes

author: {'steamid': '76561197972147951', 'num_games_owned': 524, 'num_reviews': 168, 'playtime_forever': 873, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 835, 'last_played': 1414260700}
review:
Blade Symphony , un jeu dont je n'avais jamais entendu parler et pourtant .

Un jeu de duel √† l'√©p√©e, ce n'est pas chose qu'on voit souvent dans les jeux vid√©os, preuve en est que les jeux ind√©pendant nous apporte bien le rafra√Æchissement et le fun , que de vieux joueurs comme moi attendent, car je pense sans mentir, que sans les jeux ind√©pendants, j'aurais fini par l√¢cher le jeux vid√©os depuis un petit temps tellement les grosses productions sont devenues sans saveur .

Bon le jeu maintenant : 

Bien que ce jeu pr√©sente plusieurs modes, le mode phare est le duel , vous arriver sur une carte , 3 ar√®ne sp√©cifique s'offre a vous, a vous de rejoindre l'une d'elle et d'y affronter votre adversaire .

Bien qu'au d√©part vous arriviez sans connaissance , et que vous aurez tendance √† spammer vos coups, vous comprenez vite que contre un joueur un minimum aguerri , la solution n'est pas la .

plus que les coups en eux m√™me, avant tout le timing et la position est primordiale , l‚Äô√©nervement est votre pire ennemis , le calme est votre alli√© .

Bien que seulement 4 personnages √† la base avec leur caract√©ristique propre, il serait b√™te de dire que le jeu n'a pas de contenu , car chaque personnage a une vari√©t√© d'√©p√©e a d√©bloquer a sa disposition, aux caract√©ristique propre elle aussi . le jeu est plus √©toff√© qu'il n'y parait a la base .

particularit√© de gameplay : 

Votre personnage a 3 positions , fast (rapide) balance ( coup moyen) et heavy ( lourd) .... bien qu'il n'y ai qu'un bouton d'attaque , ce qui pourrait para√Ætre simpliste, il faut comprendre pour commencer, qu'un coup est diff√®rent suivant que vous clicker simplement, que vous le chargez √† moiti√© ou compl√®tement . 

en plus de ceci , par rapport a la direction que vous presser , vous pourrez attaquer droit ou de cot√© , ce qui offre d√©j√† pas mal de possibilit√© .

en plus encore, votre personnage a des combos , et rien n‚Äôemp√™che de par exemple commencer votre premier coup avec la position heavy , pour continuer vers le balance et le fast . ( enfin si vous comprenez ce que je souhaite raconter :-) )

On ajoute a ceci , un roulade , un blocage, un grab ( attraper votre ennemis pour le punir) et un strafe ( petite impulsion de votre personnage sur le cot√© pour surprendre l'ennemi) et vous aurez compris que niveau gameplay sans √™tre mirobolant , est plut√¥t complet et permet pas mal de technique d'attaque.

Graphiquement parlant c'est bien joli , tr√®s agr√©able √† l‚Äô≈ìil ,rien √† redire .

Pour un compl√©ment d'info , le jeu propose aussi le mode ffa ( pour les moins patient, un peu comme le duel , √† la diff√©rence que tout le monde se retrouve sur la carte, et c'est vous qui demander le duel aux personnages que vous croiser) l'avantage de ce mode est qu'alors , vous pouvez vous battre un peu partout sur la carte et ne serez plus cantonner seulement √† l‚Äôar√®ne pr√©d√©finie .

Aussi pr√©sent un mode capture de point , pas vraiment int√©ressant a mes yeux , mais √ßa √† le m√©rite d'√™tre propos√© .
je pense qu'un autre mode existe encore, mais je me suis vraiment cantonner aux modes duel.

Point important rare qui je pense est important dans un jeu ; la communaut√© en grande partie sont mature et sympathique , bien s√ªr il existe toujours des c... mais j'ai √©t√© surpris par l‚Äôamabilit√© de la plupart des gens, qui n'h√©site pas a te conseiller ( si vous n'√™tes pas anglophobes bien sur , car oui l'anglais est la base du jeux vid√©os pour communiquer :-) ) .

Aussi un petit cot√© personnalisation cosm√©tique de votre personnage, un ladder avec des ligues pour la motivation de devenir le meilleur . Bref ce jeu √† des atouts a partir du moment ou vous n'√™tes pas un rageur et que vous souhaitez un jeu avec une belle courbe de progression .

Merci pour la lecture et on se retrouvera s√ªrement √† croiser nos √©p√©es bient√¥t .

author: {'steamid': '76561197990614614', 'num_games_owned': 397, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1413527033}
review:
I played this during the free weekend, and I didn't play much of it, so bear that in mind with this review.

The tutorial is sorely lacking; despite there being a myriad of sword types the tutorial only goes over two of them that I remember, and very shallowly at that. I'm not expecting a basic tutorial to run down each character's moveset with each sword, but at least taking the time to distinguish the defensive/offensive differences between each type would be welcome. That being said, the game sorely needs a tutorial for each character.

Second, I don't really see any "tactics" in this game. From what I played you mostly just spam attacks while standing at a certain point compared to the enemy. The ninja character in particular seems to rely on neverending light attacks, but all of them seem to rely on spammed attacks to some degree. The videos seem to show some sort of parkour-fighting system, with wall-jumps, but if that's included in the game it's not gone over in the tutorial beyond informing you that there's such a thing as a jump attack. All the battles I won I won by spamming attacks faster than the enemy, and the battles I lost I lost because I didn't spam as fast.

I see POTENTIAL in this game, but...honestly, it just seems unfinished. I think it was released prematurely and could have done with some more time in development. It's not a terrible game, but I can't recommend it to anyone either.

author: {'steamid': '76561198152195162', 'num_games_owned': 273, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 608, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 525, 'last_played': 1486702636}
review:
Este juego es impresionante, muy buenas mecanicas y gran variedad de golpes. Eso si Aun no he conseguido jugar una partida privada con mis amigos y mi chica (que conste que le compre el juego) todo un caballero.

En fin Al tema: Me encanta pero me gustaria que incluyeran mas personajes por que acabas aprendiendote todo lo que hacen, no pido 200 pero si tres o cuatro mas (estaria bien ya que solo hay 4 de momento ). 

Considero que deberian facilitar las opciones de crear una pequenya partida privada entre amigos por que busque por todas partes, y nada ninguna explicacion. hasta que me meti en la web oficial, Ponia que se debia hacer, segui los pasos pero no funcionaban y me quede con las ganas. Por favor si arreglarais eso tendriais 10/10... pero mi nota por esas cositas es un 7/10.

Respecto a todo lo demas deberias probarlo, es pura magia :D (y a los adictos del anime se llevaran una sorpresa . pista: workshop)

Muchas gracias.
atte. Z3RO

review: A really nice sword fighting game with a very good looking art direction and soundtrack. The combat feels a bit slow at first but once you become familiar with the parameters it's really solid. Very rewarding when you make your own character and find a specific sword fighting style with the sword you've chosen. Definitely worth a look and a pretty good and relaxing social experience in Free For All servers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062026641', 'num_games_owned': 295, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 129, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1424331991}
review: This is quite possibly one of the most fun fighting games that I've played, and will be for some time to come.  I'm not the biggest fan of the genre, but Blade Symphony is that one game that makes me want to explore it deeper.  From smooth combat, to the most flexible play style of any game, amazing visuals, a beautiful soundtrack, and a very expansive workshop referencing that references most games that have swords, it's certainly a game that I wish more of my friends have.  Even the training room breaks newcomers into the game easily, and then lets them on their own to learn from their mistakes.  From when I first found the game from a Cryaotic stream to today, it's a game that I still love no matter how many times I get put in my place by the training bots for making one mistake.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997467243', 'num_games_owned': 752, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 242, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 174, 'last_played': 1445702561}
review:
Tr√®s bon JcJ. On dirait un subtil m√©lange de Chivalry au niveau des diff√©rents types d'attaque et Warframe pour le dynamisme. Pour l'instant pas beaucoup de modes : Duel (enfin le jeu est bas√© sur √ßa essentiellement), FFA (o√π l'on peut aussi se duel en priv√©), Capture point (Pas besoin de vous faire un dessin), Hero (un joueur a un buff et il est contre tout les autres).
4 persos avec des styles relativement diff√©rents, allant du bourrin de base √† une ninja, donnant ainsi diff√©rent combos en fonction du personnages. A cela on ajoute 5 diff√©rentes types d'armes chacunes ayant ses caract√©ristiques (aucune ne domine les autres). Le syst√®me de "notes" pour acheter des skins d'armes ou des skins de persos, je ne l'ai pas encore compris (on les gagne seulement via les duels ?) mais on peut toujours utiliser le Workshop pour personnaliser nos armes ! (A vous la Gunblade de Squall !).
Concernant la musique, elle est vite aga√ßante en Capture Point (d√©sol√© mais une m√™l√©e g√©n√©rale avec une musique douce est aussi pertinent qu'un groupie de Justin Bieber √† un concert d'ACDC), on appr√©ciera notre propre musique du coup ^-^.
Pas cher du tout et tr√®s sympathique !

author: {'steamid': '76561198117362934', 'num_games_owned': 483, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 329, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 277, 'last_played': 1486710518}
review:
Maybe its just my internet that makes me hate this game, but the lag is so ridiculous that I cannot even bother play. The idea is great, the gameplay looks sound, but since this game involves a lot of precise timing, the minute you suffer from a little lag you just spend your entire gameplay experience getting decimated.
That makes it really horrible to play. Spent nearly every moment in game with no idea how to earn currency, still not sure and pretty much losing every single match. No matter how hard I tried to block or attack, i would always miss. Always get destroyed. This was very off putting. I stopped playing the game for nearly a year. Came back to see if any updates made it better, but alas, its the same game that lost its luster.
Its a nifty concept and unless you intend to spend hours of your life wasting away to figure out how best to fight, don't bother. A real waste of money. Glad I got it on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198158386659', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 208, 'last_played': 1414235759}
review:
Great game to switch things up. When I'm free from things and wanna just go 1v1 with someone or 2v2 with friends or hell a free for all this game does it for me. By all means its not going to be something your going to be great at right off the bat. Combos and speed to react is a major key. If i rate this out of 10 i'd give it a 8.5/10 or a 9/10 due to only 1 view option as i know of. 
~I wish we could make our own guys/girls for this game that would make it perfect 11/10 =D. Great steal for the price

author: {'steamid': '76561198047461764', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1131, 'last_played': 1459384645}
review:
Do not buy,
-game is horribly optimized,
-dosnt support high resolution,
-game dosnt look as good as it does in the trailer, (I dont like being lied too)
-fighter balancing issues,(Pure and Judgement are gunna be the ones you fight with. Phalax just sucks, ryoko teir 2 is amazing so is pures teir 2 which is faster then phalaxs teir 1. Pures teir 1 left side attack puts you behind your enemy then you spam teir 2 and you win.  Judgements teir 3 can kill a person in two hits. )
-forces you to wait in a queue and watch other people fight for a couple of mins before it lets you in to fight, so god forbid if you lose your gunna have to wait several mins till you can fight again.
-very small community, so have fun fighting the same people over and over.
------

However the game was fun for a bit, i wouldnt reccomend this game just because the game will be dead within a month.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041752171', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 817, 'last_played': 1449599770}
review: It's a beautifull game with nice sounds and visuals. Blade Symphony combines deep but easy to learn mechanics and fun gameplay. Lot's of different weaponry and full workshop support. Fight, win, participate in events, find new friends. And just have a damn good time in Blade symphony.

author: {'steamid': '76561198131472213', 'num_games_owned': 81, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 145, 'last_played': 1413748676}
review:
It is a fine game with a lack on progression and content.
You can play matches against your friends/ your mom or someone else. 

What really attracted me was the complex fighting system with a variety of combos and play styles that it provides and the fact that you can make your own gear into the game.

Reminds me of fighting games like Tekken or Street fighter.

[EDIT]

Being the very first game i reviewed, i thought it would have improved, seeing the raw potential of the game. But it never did, hence my review changing to "not recommended".
It is being quickly overshadowed by many games, sadly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047559055', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 11353, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2258, 'last_played': 1605419576}
review:
For the most part, I have trouble giving this game a thumbs up since I know after this weekend I probably won't be playing with people who started the time I did. With the learning curve being somewhat high; not too much though, and also it being a little tricky to understand, this fun I've been having could be very short lived. 

Although that only being the case, I can't really see why not to pick it up. With it soon being 75% off and now maybe one having a taste of the game, this might spike up the players. The combat is very well classed right now of all the people you can choose from. Sure, sometimes spamming is the way to go and can be frustrating to deal with, but the game offers helpful strategies to bypass this. Then after a person learns to mix and match their fighting moves, they then learn which one they like the best. 

With an interesting plot, good balancing that's simple, and nice play time to boot if there are players to play with, then this game is a must have for a fighter enthusiest.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076478631', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1796, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1678, 'last_played': 1611416502}
review:
I played when it was free to play for a weekend and liked it a lot so went ahead and bought the game. It was on sale for less than $4 which was a great deal
If you like fighting games in general you defenitely should get this game. It feels a bit like the old Jedi Knight series games where you had lightsaber duels
I have to say the soundtrack is amazing and fits the game really well. The artwork is great too
I do have some requests to the developers tho and I'm not sure if they ever get around to reading the feedback here but as many comments suggest the game would benefit a lot more from the addition of 2 more characters and 2 more sword types as it would add a lot more depth and options
Also another good addition would be dual wielding swords, double blade swords (like a staff with 2 blades on the ends and grip at centre), more combo options etc all this would make this game even better and improve replayability

author: {'steamid': '76561198036245257', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1436679048}
review: This game is great. I love the graphics, how you can combine moves, the worshop content, all of it. Except for the fact that the animations aren't very fluid and that the whole 'combo mixing' doesn't really work. Here's why. Combos work with a three-tiered (four if you consider air, but it's a minor thing.) While I enjoy how the mousewheel controls which attacks you use, unless you're really spamming in attacks hard, it's completely useless to even consider changing what your do. If you opponent is using heavy? Spam light. Balanced? Jump around spamming light. Plus, your 'combo' is destroyed every time you get hit, so it's sort of pointless. On to animation fluidity. I was really impressed by gameplay, watching people and devs seamlessly switch between heavy, balanced and fast without question, their character twirling and slashing without any thought put into what they're doing and just scything through the competition. Sadly, it's almost nothing like that. The animations are all the same, and can be easily guessed because of how little they change. Your opponent has their arm extended to the left? Attack right. There's no challenge in that, and eventually it just becomes a parry-fest. Character movement is kind of iffy considering that your character is always facing your camera, so if you were to look to the side to follow, they'll have the upper hand and attack your side. On top  of this, it's just an extremely steep learning curve. I can't tell how many times I've wanted to explore the weapon possibilities in combat only to be forced to spam a single 'style.' Anyway, I'll give this game 6/10 with room for improvement. I'd still like to see a system implemented that randomly selects a 'style' for you to hit next in. So you could design them and with the click of a button automagically play out an attack string.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985194039', 'num_games_owned': 3349, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 352, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 351, 'last_played': 1420150272}
review:
Assez bon jeu dans l'ensemble.
En gros, Blade Symphony est un jeu de duel √† l'√©p√©e jouable en multijoueur.
J'aime beaucoup le principe du duel mais il existe d'autres mode comme le Duel 2v2, le mode capture de points, etc.

Le jeu a certes quelques d√©faut que j'espere qu'ils seront resolus comme la cam√©ra du mode spectateur qui est affreuse et qui s'affole pour rien. mais dans l'ensemble des bug que vous pourrez voir, il n'y a rien de bien m√©chant (du moins, rien d'assez frustant pour vous faire quitter le jeu).

Le jeux est exclusivement en multijoueur ce qui n'est pas un point n√©gatif en soit mais pour un jeu de cet envergure, un mode solo avec une petite histoire par personnage aurai √©t√© bien. Mais bon c'est mon avis sur le sujet.

Le jeu ne comporte que 4 personnages jouable mais a deja un belle panoplie d'√©p√©e de base. On y remarque peu d'√©quipemet ou de tenue mais je ne clashe pas trop le jeu sur ce point car je suppose que plein de tenues et d'√©quipements seront disponible dans le Workshop prochainement...Il suffit d'attendre.

Chaque personnage a ses type d'attaques (comme dans un jeux de combat) mais chaque type d'arme ont leurs caract√©ristiques. Par exemple, on peut parer avec une √©p√©e longue mais pas avec un katana. En gros, il y a plusieurs combinaisons possible.

En gros, Blade Symphony est un jeu int√©r√©ssant, avec son ambiance ninja/samourai futuriste et ses musiques d'ambiance typ√© japonais mais avec quelques bugs pas genant en soit mais qu'on aurait pas aim√© voir et on reste un poil sur sa faim.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985443104', 'num_games_owned': 1739, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 453, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 453, 'last_played': 1413692659}
review: Taken as a tightly cropped slice of the action, Blade Symphony's arena duels showcase some stunning character designs, downright poetic combat maneuvers, and exciting combat mechanics. But that's only a small piece of an unfinished and rather sloppy whole. This multiplayer fighter looks, feels, and actually is incomplete in spots, which puts a real damper on the few bright elements that make it almost worth the fuss.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072552882', 'num_games_owned': 348, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 301, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 301, 'last_played': 1413910817}
review:
Blade Symphony, This game is absolutely incredible. The graphics of this game are on par if not better than any AAA title game this year. This game strives in realism, the combat and graphics alike. It is like being in a real life sword fight, as a medieval sword fighting enthusiast and reenactor I believe I have the expertise to say that this is a very realistic game. If you don't have the money to own a sword collection like myself this game is a great substitute, the swords on the workshop are all so realistic and people must of taken months if not years to design them. 
 
This game is just incredible so many different game modes to play and so many realistic sword fighting moves/techniques to use, I love playing this in the winter as my fellow reenactors don't like going out in the winter. Thank you for making this amazing game I love every aspect of it, if you don't buy this game you will regret it for the rest of your life.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074271863', 'num_games_owned': 96, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 59, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1413561915}
review:
Blade Symphony...Es un gran juego, la jugabilidad es bastante buena, la idea es bastante buena, el tema del parkour le da un peque√±o bonus, la variedad de mandobles, jiane¬øs?,katanas etc etc le da un algo que lo hace muy divertido.
Lo he podido jugar poco ,pero, en lo que he visto es muy bueno, ademas tienes estas 3h para probarlo hoy asi que para la gente que lo quiere probar, este an√°lisis no les va a ayudar mucho pero para la gente que quiera comprarlo si,como es natural hay gente que es muchisimo mejor que otros pero dejando eso a un lado las partidas online son muy entretenidas.
Hay 4 personajes (creo) cada uno con su propio estilo de pelea, aunque tambien mientras juegas puedes cambiar tus estilos de pelea alternando entre fast, balanced y heavy:
Fast es mas rapido pero inflige menos da√±o, normalmente podras hacer mas combos que con balanced o con heavy aunque como ya he comentado no inflingira tanto da√±o como con los demas
Balanced es una mezcla entreheavy y fast, una combinacion perfecta para comenzar a jugar, no inflinge tanto da√±o como el heavy pero es veloz, los combos son bastante buenos en balanced, y sobretodo se pueden hacer cosas impresionantes si se consigue conbinar con un salto.
Despues esta el heavy , inflinge bastante da√±o, pero es lento, eso es mas bien para hacer de ''tanque'' mas o menos....
Encuanto a graficos deja un buen sabor de boca para lo poco que pide, los controles son dificiles y poco intuitivos, o por lo menos a mi me lo parecen, sobretodo al intentar hilar ataques entre los tres modos, cuatro si se cuenta air( ataque en salto) como modo.
En conclusion es una gran juego si te gusta el estilo y eres lo bastante rapido con los dedos al jugar, tambien requiere unos reflejos lo bastante buenos como para contraatacar y bloquear rapido.

review: Played this on the free to play weekend. It had excellent content, the fights were enjoyable. while there are not a lot of combo's to be performed, that changed the strategy from button combo's to timing and distance from your enemy. I would reccomend this to anyone who enjoys a fighting game in an interesting enviroment. especially if you are not into tekken or street fighter need for memorization of combos.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059225004', 'num_games_owned': 1654, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 47, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1413724017}
review:
- It should be noted before anything that this game is on my wish list and I played it while it lasts on Free Weekend Weekend promotion so I'm glad I got a chance to try it - 

...quite an interesting game although the game looks simple is quite challenging to master, so you need to play it a few couple of hours to become good swordsman. The game is arena duels multiplayer-oriented and looks fast paced, the dodging looks good, moving around feels fluid and the concept itself seems good. But when you get down to attacking and striking your opponent looks sluggish and slow. I'm no expert on sword styles but I'd love to learn the actual styles of the swords you use rather than just "here have a japanese katana now, go ahead and swing it around" e.g. katanas are two handed swords, don't wield a katana with one hand!
Unfortunately, the game has limited characters and personally I got the impression that classes are unbalanced, on the other hand game looks pretty, you can play with keyboard and mouse with no problem and the game has nice community.

review: I might be a little Bias on this becuse I love Malee torament like games. This one right here takes the cake. The fighting micanic in this game is pretty uniuqe in the sence that it almost encorages players to explore different methods in fighting. Its dynamic fighting style is what draws me in every day to test my skill against players with interesting forms. If it is your first time playing, watch other players that have been playing longer once you know all your moves for a character you like. Best advice I can give.

author: {'steamid': '76561198134693828', 'num_games_owned': 553, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 1180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 564, 'last_played': 1451052743}
review: Very awesome sword-fighting game. Tutorial teaches you the basics but the game has quite a deep combat system that will undoubtedly take a lot of practice to truly master. Combat has moments of slow and fast-paced action, with the focus of the game being around 1v1 and 2v2 dueling, as well as a FFA mode which is good for beginners. Each weapon and each character has its own style of fighting and combat is very direction-based.  It requires strategy, thought and observation if you want to be great at it. The game's graphics are very nice and animation quality is top-notch. You can do a lot of very cool moves, from wall-running and jumping to combos and power attacks. There is a lot of room for community input, along with steam workshop integration. You can customise your characters and unlock various cosmetic skins for both weapons and armour.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002630642', 'num_games_owned': 314, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3093, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1386, 'last_played': 1548127556}
review:
This game is awesome. The fighting system is a generic fighter combo system with the freedom of three-dimensional movement, so you can feel right at home while feeling out of your element. The learning curve is sharp for no longer than the first three duels or so and then you know everything you need to know. 

Swords hurt. Grabs hurt. Throwing Knives hurt. Getting wrecked feels bad.

It's such a simple and serene game, the atmosphere is very immersive and the sense of honor that everyone in the community just generally has. Every duel is honorable. Everyone bows. It's like Dark Souls PvP Etiquette in a game that didn't fuck up its PvP. It makes you feel like an actual samurai.

Get this game. Get in a server. Git gud. Have fun.

review:
Interesting concept, flawed execution.

Based on the description snippet given of the game and screenshots shown, I thought I was in for a fast-paced parkour/swordfighting game.  Instead, what I got was a slow-paced fighting game reminiscent of fencing, which is interesting, but it controls like ass and is definitely not what I was looking for.

Glad I played this while it was free.

review:
Remember that one scene from [i]Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon[/i] where Shu Lien and Jen have that bitchin' swordfight in the middle of that dogo? 

And that scene fron [i]Princess Bride[/i] where Inigo Montoya and Dread Pirate Roberts go at it in the castle ruins?

And that badass scene from [i]Kill Bill[/i] where The Bride fights Gogo & the Crazy 88's, all at the same time?

This is that, all of that, in video game form, with a frickin' sweet soundtrack to back it up. 

Buy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060363327', 'num_games_owned': 300, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 956, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 729, 'last_played': 1472542830}
review:
Have you ever wanted a game where you can use real strategy to defeat your enemies, where it's just as important to help a team or to study an opponent's movements?

Don't listen to all the people who 'just don't like it' or think it's 'just another hack and slash'. They've played it about an hour max. This is amazing once you start to understand it, far beyond what a lot of people are giving it. There's options in game modes, large communities, teams, enemies, all that jazz. Just play it. If it's on sale, you need to buy it, and play it for a while. It's worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007252726', 'num_games_owned': 722, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 735, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 514, 'last_played': 1413690660}
review:
This is not Jedi Outcast/Jedi Academy fighting mechanic sequel. It felt like trying to mimick that and Way of The Samurai but stray too far from the fundamental idea.
The graphic is good but not great, the world felt empty and uninspiring.
The characters lack personality, and by going with mask, it feel no emotion.
The mechanic felt kind of wrong, the hit collision doesn't feel right.
I really do want to like this game, but as of now, unless they intend to implement single player mode to liven up the world, it's a no buy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001261160', 'num_games_owned': 293, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1413683400}
review: Thrown attacks hone in on you and are un-dodageable due to shitty netcode. Said attacks also do 1/5 health and take about a second to complete. Complete game killer, not worth it even if on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056186844', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 1512, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1512, 'last_played': 1414001366}
review: This game is surprisingly fun as all hell. Some of the reviews on YouTube don't do it any justice whatsoever. Well worth the $3.74 (in my opinion). It's definately not a button masher (if you're playing it right), not too hard to learn. It'll take you a couple hours to get the hang of it just because it's so different, but you won't get totally crushed as a noob. I just started today and I'm already on par with a lot of Master and Diamond ranks. Theres nothing pay to win in it because; 1. Theres nothing to pay real money for, and 2. The only upgrades in "gear" are cosmetic. All Katanas have the same stats and skills, all Longswords have the same stats and skills, so on and so forth.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077349985', 'num_games_owned': 540, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1413681514}
review:
I was kinda excited to test it over the free wekend period.. but as i played this game suddently it all got messed up. The tutorial sucks. At some parts you really wonder how to parry with balanced stance ... but u just start charging up up something that does not even do anything. Normally u would start charging an attack with mouse 1 .. and with mouse 2 u would defend but the tutorial does not explain how to attack and defend in different stances.. since i read the keybindings i am sure.. that it would be trial and error.. and i very well CANT and WONT play the same tutorial instance for 30 minutes. 

For everyone else.. this game is simply worthless. It may have a great basic concept - but as casual gamer you are lost. If there is no fix for the tutorial i would recommend to stick with key controlled attack games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198154236239', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 145, 'last_played': 1413681770}
review: I havent played the game for too long. But after playing it for a couple hours I must say that the game is gorgeous, but the fighting mechanics could be improved. By adding a list of moves that each character can use in the customization screen one could make a fighting stance that fit the character better, with a specific weapon. I found that Pure is incredible for using a rapier because of her quick and percise movement, as well as the aireal attack allowed me to go in for a straight jab with more power. Possibly by adding a move customization One could make it so that the next attack after the Air attack would be another power move, if combo'ed correctly. This attack could be like the counter move when you are knocked over, using the momentum of your body to gat in a more forceful jab, which could be even more effective after having jumped in the air. I don't want to get into too much detail, but i also feel like there should be more freedom in the way I fight. LIke being able to control ryuko's moves to strategically use his flippin abilities, at least with more control. I have learned to use them to some extent, but i am unable to attack well afterwards because of the way the camera moves. Anyways, I really enjoy the game, But i also enjoy games that require me to try to level up to get better weapons and such. But the way you have made the game to force the player to figure out how to utilize the characters unique moves with each weapon, and changing the stances to create new combo's are really cool, and i Have to give respect to you for doing so, at the level it is at. I tip my hat to you, and say thankyou for making this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198115712156', 'num_games_owned': 234, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1413676976}
review:
Community been dying out for a while again. Kickstarter promises were not kept, game was released in an unfinished state to get more financing to keep the project going, so you're basically buying a released game that's still early access. Critisism gets censored from forums and even screenshots are subject to deletion. Patches break more than they fix and it takes ages for them to come out. Game is incomplete in many ways including: unfinished/broken characters/swords/maps and so on.

Buy if you want to pay 15 bucks for a fighting game that's somewhat unique but with a dwindeling playerbase and all of the above.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015259099', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 214, 'last_played': 1413664605}
review:
So about Blade Symphony. Let me start off by saying if it hadn't been for this free weekend I'd never have picked it up.. or rather never would have tried it, as I didn't pick it up.

I absolutely loathe the asian theme, the futuristic art-style, the over-the-top animations, the character design...basically the entire presentation of this game doesn't so much speak to me as it does shout "Stay away. Far away".

However that is a personal preference and even though I'm essentially right in this I am also aware of the fact that there are people who have the audacity to be wrong and like this sort of stuff. Not much you can do about that.

But the game isn't just looks, so let's ignore those for now.

The fighting, the heart of this game.. well it isn't bad. It is actually rather enjoyable to begin with.
It is however rather repetitive after a while. This is not - as some other people commenting here seem to think - due to a lack of content but rather due to a lack of input. 
I actually like the fact that weapons are uniform across characters and I could do without the different character-traits as well. Purely cosmetic characters - making the outcome of a fight only about input-skill&speed rather than character attributes feels cleaner to me.

Input however is the problem.
You have far too little actual control to actually do something creative in your attacks, which means it all comes down to timing. Once you have ascertained that your timing is better than the opponents the fight is more or less over and will play out accordingly.

I'm not going to go into balancing because I haven't played enough of it to actually notice - or care - and I've also limited myself to the Longsword, as it is the only of the weapons in this game I actually give a toss about. So while there might be balancing issues - there almost certainly are, would be the first multiplayergame not to have those - I can't comment on those.

I can however comment on performance. 
Some of the maps are rather mess as far as performance is concerned and - as with all melee games - if your ping rises or isn't stable it will have significant impact on your experience.
The performance-drops I noticed aren't significant enough to be blamed for getting defeated in combat (outside of really close matches on a very high skill-level which didn't really affect me all that much) but they are really irritating and a drag on the amount of joy the flow of combat delivers.

This flow sadly isn't all that great either. If your opponent is fast enough you can get locked-in by combo-attacks which basically drain most of your life before you are able to defend yourself (as you can't block mid-combo, you can block it entirely or not at all in my experience). Similarly you can get yourself locked into the combo-animation and killed because you didn't hit the opponent but also were unable to respond to his attacks. Cancelling animations to perform new actions would obviously break the animation-style the game aims for, so unfortunately there is little to be done about this.

This highlights the input problem, combo-animations may look nice (to other people) but fighting with individual attacks&strikes gives you much more control over your character and combat in general.

Right now the game is very heavily discounted and I can't bring myself to buying it, even though - despite the named issues - I had a couple of really enjoyable fights in this game.  Not even worth the 4‚Ç¨ they are asking for it right now, at least not to me.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992617068', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1413668834}
review:
Don't think so -- feels way too stiff, the camera angle is seriously terrible (I want to be able to see more of what my opponent is doing), and the stances/combos aren't nearly as intuitive or interesting as I'd like. The videos make it look like a combination of Soul Calibur and Toribash but the experience of actually playing the game is currently pretty crummy. That said, the big free-for-all matches look like they still have a lot of potential (I'd really love to be enjoying the game as much as I enjoy watching the last few minutes of the trailer), and the game seems fairly WIP, so I'm happy to give it a few dollars and more time to improve.

Honestly, speaking as someone who plays console ports with a mouse and keyboard when he knows he really shouldn't simply because I can't be bothered to hook in a controller, one of this game's biggest problems could be that it's obviously designed around a mouse and keyboard. I'm not sure they can overcome that basic issue, but we'll see. More single-player content wouldn't hurt either -- the current tutorial is pretty light and doesn't compare favourably to playing the game online.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025314526', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 47, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1413664095}
review:
First of all I have to say I was very interested in Blade Symphony for awhile, and since it was on free weekend why not give it a shot? The main issue is even for free the game was an utter dissapointment. I spent more time waiting for it to download than I did playing it. 
The game is quite sluggish, and while playing online fights are just a joke where none of your hits are connecting though they seem to be, if you try to grab somebody it only works like 1/5th of the time. There is no running or fast paced movement, you can just do sidesteps instead. 
Using a controller or keyboard setup the game is just a giant mess. Maybe if the game was more fluid and there was a better layout for the fighting styles it could work but there doesn't seem to be a benefit to any weapon type or anything you choose. Even with the $3.75 sale price I'd still feel like I was getting ripped off. 
People complain about Starforge being a ripoff as a greenlight/kickstarter type title because promises weren't fulfilled, but I feel like the community with this game got it much worse. This game seems to have just taken two steps back with every step forward from what the original goal was.
If it comes out on a free weekend again maybe try it, but I was personally disappointed to a large extent and definitely would not purchase this in it's current state.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976756967', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 39, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1413645390}
review:
I wanted to love this game, I really did. It's both beautiful and deadly.

The main issue I have is that I am just flat out bad. Now this is where it's easy to think therefore that because I'm not recommending it, that I'm raging. Being utter crap in this game spells doom for a very good (or is that bad?) reason.

If you don't have great reaction time and/or you are not a natural at this game there is no effective way for you to practice. Unlike other games where practice does indeed make perfect, here you don't get the chance. You'll be very lucky to come across enough bad players in a row for your own skills to develop. You'll most likely be matched up against advanced players who have been around for a while, and any hope you had of liking the game would be sliced to ribbons, like your face will be. Being able to practice and develop your skills shouldn't be down to match making luck.

The AI training opponent doesn't solve the problem either. It's actually not much help, so you're still stuck in the same situation (if you're rubbish). It doesn't behave human. That's true of many games but you need an AI here who will mix things up a bit. It doesn't have enough options to make it helpful or fun. There's not even a proper offline mode to keep you interested and to help you develop your skills. That's the whole crux of the problem, no way to improve your skills. How about more advanced matchmaking, putting players of similar ability together? Handicaps to help players? Speed settings?

I would only suggest buying this if you and your friends want to have a bit of a laugh. It's not worth the risk to your wallet if you could be bad at it with no mates. Yes it may be cheap. However I just purchased Killing Floor (which is excellent) at under ¬£4. With sales like that on Steam you can get a deal that makes saving a tenner worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026774454', 'num_games_owned': 201, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1087, 'last_played': 1462054170}
review:
The game is pretty unique amongst the normal sword fighthing games and it represents it self very well. Both the atmosphere and the soundtrack is designed to give you a feeling of honor between swordsman and it does a really good job of it. 

The visuals aren't too flashy which is a big plus considering this is a semi-serious game. The element of mods is another big thing since people can add any sword they want into the game. For example people who always wanted to wield the MGR High Frequency swords can do so in this game. 

The downside is the game feels unfinished and even if I don't know what is going on with the development I can safely say it is unfinished. The ping difference between opponents can create huge disadvantages, climbing places or running on walls feels bland and somewhat glitchy. All the classes have one or two moves that can make them somewhat overpowered if used "correctly". 

So considering all this I can safely say this is a good game, and has the potential to become a lot better with the right fixes. Even though it feels unfinished the gameplay is still nearly addicting and fun. If you are wondering, it is worth checking out the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982225800', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 318, 'playtime_forever': 57, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1413649428}
review:
Decent game, and I definitely had fun with my one-hour spent with it. The community -- that is, people who have stuck with the game and are experienced -- were very polite and helpful.

Unfortunately, I'd have to advise getting against this game because of the lack of a player-base. I had the luxury of playing during the Free Weekend which saw a big boost in player-population, but according to SteamCharts[0], the game's population always bounces back to pretty frighteningly-low levels after every sale/Freekend. And this isn't the type of game a noobie would want to get into, where only hardcore, experienced and dedicated people are playing it, ready to wipe the floor with someone who doesn't even know what they're doing yet. The accounts of other people also corroborate this problem (see the other reviews).

The forum community is also pretty toxic. So don't go there hoping to get a decent discussion about the game going.

Anyhow, as far as mechanics go, the swordplay felt good and balanced, and I really enjoyed out-witting some of my foes, as well as the prospect of further polishing-up my technique/understanding and participating in mind-games - but that's likely because I was mostly playing people who weren't part of the dedicated player-base. I do question how the character/weapon balance will pan-out in mid-to-high level play. That always becomes an issue in these types of games.

So yeah, I wouldn't spend money on this unless it was a $1 or something. Play it if it ever goes on for a Free Weekend again.

[0] http://steamcharts.com/app/225600
