author: {'steamid': '76561198085797583', 'num_games_owned': 373, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 62, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1413646796}
review:
Blade Symphony is a good idea....executed poorly. Sometimes it only takes a couple of matches to figure that out. If you've ever played Warframe then this game has the same idea; only with just PvP. The first thing I noticed was just how the whole layout of the game was going to be. Upon completing the tutorial I instantly knew that I would be facing players just simply spamming attacks. The blocking system isn't a smart one. You just simply go into a block stance and hope you block. So basically there's no skill involved. Even I just went in and mostly spammed my attacks because there's no real smart system.

The second thing I noticed was the projectile system. In order to block them you need to face them. Otherwise it'll home in on you and take about a quarter of your health. I don't much mind the damage so much as the fact that it acts as a heat seeker and you don't always block when you should (I mean come on they throw them at half a mile an hour). Running up walls is a chore to do as well since you have to run a little and jump and repeat (not asking for super running but a little more distance with it would be nice). The constant team changing also threw me off. One minute I'm fighting a person and the next minute I'm fighting with him. I like to stick to the team I'm given in a match.

The graphics, sound and music are all nicely done and the moves flow fluidly. The only thing I was irritated about was the fact that heavy attacks seemed too quick to be heavy and the hitboxes already seemed a little off. I realize I'm throwing a lot of negativity about this game. I know it's an indie game and that it isn't going to be perfect...but there's a lot of annoying elements that I unfortunately can't get past. I personally don't recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028797094', 'num_games_owned': 715, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1413743488}
review:
Short version: I recommend despite not being a big fan of fighting games in general. That said, it might not keep you terribly entertained for any great lengths of time, but it has potential as long as more content is added by either the devs or by the community.

Long version:
Basically game plays similar to a fighting game. Two people, one arena, best out of three. The twist is in the combat system its self. Swords clash and deflect off each other, creating opening for light attacks and heavy stance attacks, when timed well, can do tonnes of damage to the people who dare give you an opening. Grabs, projectiles and charged attacks are thrown into the mixture as well to give you some more interesting options to play with.

To break it down there are four characters available in the game as it is now, each with their sword fighting style and speeds.
Sword lines project the path your sword is going to travel when you attack. To avoid taking damage from these attacks, you opponent can dart out of the way, roll to avoid the sword's path (yes, provided you can time it right, you can roll under a horizontal sword swing to avoid taking damage), block to take less damage or clash swords with an attack of their own.

That's just the basics of how the fights turn out. There are two types of server available as of now; Duel and Free For All.
The way duel servers work is quite neat. On each duel map, there are three different arenas to fight in. If all three are in use, you can queue up to join one of them and spectate the current dual as you wait. At any time, players in an arena and its queue can vote to make the arena they are in a 2v2. Free for all servers are quite different. Instead of the map being split up into three, all people are in one big space and can attack at random or challenge each other to private duels to avoid being interrupted by randomers.

As you fight, you gain a form of currency called 'notes'. These can be used to buy new swords, skins, capes and masks for your preferred characters. I'm interested to see how the workshop is integrated though. The workshop seemed to undermine the whole currency thing, letting you download free, visible-to-all swords. All the items off the workshop have been removed though, so they're probably addressing that now. The global ranking system is a neat idea too. With every win and loss (and apparently hit landed too) contributing to your rank which is on display and for everybody to see. Is a nice little touch to either give you a boost of confidence or a boot up the ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• depending on whether you've been playing against a dev or not.

Speaking of which, the devs are friendly and very in-touch with the community. I've run into them a couple times in game, which I can't really say for anything else I've played.

Anyway, I would say this game is worth your money. It's a nice little idea, and I'm interested to see how the devs are gonna continue to add to this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014723748', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1413643042}
review:
This is an awesome concept that I've dreamed about since being a little kid. Unfortunately, the execution here is pretty lackluster and doesn't do much to sate the yearnings for a good Bushido Blade replacement.

Distances are awkward and difficult to judge, even when camera options are changed. Attack animations are stiff and only one or so exists for each attack direction. Some attacks "hit" before their animation shows it should, giving a very cheap feeling to some stances and moves.

While the concept is good, I wouldn't recommend anyone spend serious time on this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047840871', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 36, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1413639789}
review:
Wer hinter diesem Titel sowas wie Tekken mit Schwertern vermutet, liegt falsch.

Es gibt 4 Fighting Stances (Heavy, Balanced, Fast, Air), die mit den NumKeys oder MouseWheel im Kampf ausgew√§hlt und in mehrstufigen Kombo-Attacken kreuz und queer kombiniert werden k√∂nnen. 
Wenn man verstanden hat wie das funktioniert, kann man sogar etwas Einfluss auf den Ablauf der Kombos nehmen. Man muss nur schnell genug sein.

Klingt eigentlich vielversprechend.
Ich kam aber nicht klar mit der Steuerung. Zu komplex. Kaum Kontrolle. Verstehe die Blocktechnik nicht. Der Angriff l√§uft mit  <A>+RM f√ºr Right und <D>+LM Left etwas hakelig, weil es ziemlich schwierig ist  dies zeitnah und synchron zu bewerkstelligen. MB gedr√ºckt halten f√ºr Aufladung der Blocks und Angriffe. <Q> um den Gegner zu greifen und Greifattacken abzuwehren.

Habe es dann mal mit dem Controller versucht. Tutorial half nicht, auch nach mehrfacher Wiederholung.

Au√üerdem gibt es keinen SinglePlayer Tournament Mode. Nur PvP Matches und Training.

Ansonsten ist das Spiel nicht schlecht. Die Musik nervt nicht und passt gut zu den sch√∂n gestylten Kampfschaupl√§tzen. F√ºr jedes Szenario lassen sich mehrere Arenen ausw√§hlen, z.B Tempel, Klostergarten, Dojo. 

Der Entwickler hat anscheinend selbst Ewigkeiten damit verbracht das Spiel  immer noch zu testen und zu verbessern. Es hat also durchaus noch Ambitionen besser zu werden. Und so teuer ist es ja schlie√ülich auch nicht.

FAZIT:
Ich habe Blade Symphonie bei einer Promo-Aktion  gratis spielen k√∂nnen.
Ich geh√∂re aber leider definitiv nicht (mehr) zur Zielgruppe, weil ich einfach zu ungeduldig bin. 
Die anf√§ngliche Frustration motiviert mich nicht zum Weiterspielen.

Schade, denn es gibt meiner Meinung nach zu wenig hochwertige 3D Pr√ºgelspiele.
Blade Symphonie ist zwar hochwertig, aber f√ºr mich nicht spielbar, weil mir die Spielsteuerung zu kompliziert ist.

5/10 ( 8/10 wenn die Spielsteuerung nicht so kompliziert w√§re )

BTW.: Steam muss die Empfehlungsauswahl mit einem neutralen Votum erweitern.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074877829', 'num_games_owned': 1871, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 96, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1708551071}
review:
This game has many many good features, the best of which is that it's trying something new. It does surprisingly well.

It's so promising that the crippling failing is more frustrating that it would otherwise have been.

The bad thing about it is the worst possible thing in a game - when I lose, I normally have no idea what I did wrong. The game doesn't make it easy enough or even possible to find out what just happened to you. Not even a slo-mo replay after losing a 10 second fight.

The tutorial doesn't even tell you what skill it's trying to teaching beyond "timing". Never made clear what you're looking for or when you're meant to react to it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047854734', 'num_games_owned': 1404, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 279, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 279, 'last_played': 1413637563}
review:
Blade Symphony. The name. Read it. Blade. SYMPHONY. How fucking badass ain't that? 

Okay, here's my thoughts on the game beyond a badass name. 

PROS: 

Ooooozzzzes style. 

Steam Workshop with easy creation, seriously, it's awesome. 

Good optimization. 

Cool maps. 

Fantastic animations. 

CONS: 

Lacks a lot of content. 

Not many players. 

Pretty steep learning curve. 

Unbalanced gameplay, just roll with the fast style [1] and you'll shrek errday. Anything else and you'll get shrekt errday. 

--------------------------------------------------

Overall, the game needs more content and the gameplay needs to go deeper as well as be more welcoming. Honestly, maybe some sort of leveling system would be well addictive? 

Shines outside, lacks inside.

review:
The game is nice. But that's it. stances and your personal reaction mean nothing really. I was hoping to see something close to B&S or Gunz where timing meants if you will live or die. I was so wrong. I'm not saying that this is a bad game, but it's far away from what it should me in Hack & Slash category.  If you like swardsplay and cool, traditional martial arts moves, then get it. If you want a challenge, where 0.1sec means everything, then this is not what you are looking for. The game has a potential, but it needs a complete mevemnet rework. 
I give it 5/10 (for hard work and good idea)

author: {'steamid': '76561197969115036', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 22, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1413621397}
review:
Eins vorneweg: Ich bewerte nicht das Spielkonzept oder den Spielfluss.  Ich glaube durchaus,  dass das Spiel an sich Spa√ü machen kann. Hier die Punkte, warum ich es trotzdem nicht ohne weiters empfehle:

1. Das Tutorial f√§ngt an dem Spieler unterschiedliche Moves und Stances beizubringen - soweit gut. Nachdem man diese  durch hat, soll man unterschiedliche Bots bek√§mpfen um verschiedene Gegnertypen kennen zu lernen. Guter Grundgedanke - wird nur leider v√∂llig torpediert, weil die Entwickler den Spieler genau in diesem Moment in einen neuen K√∂rper mit neuer Bewaffnung stecken und sich dadurch viele gerade gelernte Moves √§ndern (Stichwort Blocken). Zudem darf man nicht einmal mehr die Stance wechseln. F√ºr Anf√§nger eine ziemlich frustrierende Enderfahrung.

2. F√ºr ein Spiel das mit "tactical sword fighting" wirbt sind die unterschiedlichen Schwertgattungen und Haltungen gerade einmal auf Hollywood-Niveau umgesetzt - sprich v√∂lliger Unsinn. Das Langschwert zum Beispiel wird hier durchweg nur mit einer Hand gef√ºhrt. In der "Fast Stance" dann sogar noch im Rapier-Stil - gute Nacht ihr Handgelenke und gute Nacht Schnelligkeit, Kontrolle und Kraft. Wer sich nur einmal halbwegs mit echter Schwertkampfschule und richtigem K√§mpfen besch√§ftigt hat dem rollen sich hier die Zehenn√§gel auf.

Was bleibt? Nun, vermutlich ein relativ gutes Beat-em-Up das M√∂glichkeiten mit Combos zu experimentieren und wildes Schwertgefuchtel bietet. Falls man denn den Tutorial- bzw. Anfangs-Frust √ºberwindet. Allerdings kein gutes "Sword Fighting" im Sinne von Schwertkampf. W√ºrde daher gerne eine "Neutral" vergeben - mangels der M√∂glichkeit dazu wirds dann leider doch ein "Nein".

author: {'steamid': '76561197978768541', 'num_games_owned': 400, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1413623784}
review:
Um es kurz zu fassen: Absoluter Bullshit.

Das Spiel versucht sich am Schwertkampf in Kombination mit Geschicklichkeit und scheitert daran gnadenlos. Nicht einmal geschenkt w√ºrde ich das Spiel weiter spielen. Meinen Eindruck konnte ich im Tutorial und einem PvE-Kampf gewinnen und bei beidem war die Komplexit√§t auf dem Niveau eines einfachen Hack&Slay-Spiels. Dazu ist die Grafik l√§ngst nicht zeitgem√§√ü und das auf der Ultra-Einstellung. Wenn ihr ein Spiel mit sch√∂nen Schwertk√§mpfen wollt, dann rate ich eher zu War of the Roses oder Chivalry. Ist zwar ein v√∂llig anderes Setting, spielt sich aber wesentlich angenehmer.

review: Amazing game. Incredible degrees of flexibility with the combat and workshop accessibility. It is well due a rework. I still regard this to be one of the greatest swordplay games I have ever had the privilege of experiencing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047350141', 'num_games_owned': 81, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 273, 'last_played': 1413717772}
review:
At its very core, Blade Symphony is a simple game, and that's what makes it great.
The selection of characters is somewhat limited, but each one coupled with the different weapon types means that there are a multitude of options available to players right from the beginning.

Combat is relatively exciting as well, since you have to anticipate and respond to your enemy's selections and actions. 
Every exchange is unique, as the attack-chain system allows you to combine multiple different stances into one, fluid attack. 
Sure, there are some kinks in the system that need ironing out, but the overall feeling is that the developers have created a very polished game - even at this stage of development.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973923018', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 28, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1413609739}
review: I played this just long enough to realise it's not for me. I can see that this would have a lot of potential but the downsides for me are that there's only one attack button (just with different stances), and they aren't kidding about only partial controller support - you cannot play this game without touching a keyboard (grab does not have a button by default), and you can't even navigate menus with the controller. I played most of the tutorial and jumped into an online game since there's no single player mode other than the tutorial. The online play experience seems to be mostly sitting around watching one really good guy slice people up until it's your turn to be destroyed and then go back to waiting. The one thing I did like about this is the level of character customisation, but it just wasn't fun to play. Overall I'd say Blade Symphony is like playing a brawler at home with a bunch of friends waiting for the loser to pass the controller to you - only without the friends. 3 out of 10, would not thrust.

review: I like the concept of this game, but the gameplay is not that great and controls are a bit confusing.  The game sometimes lags and freezes up.  Joining a severs or creating one is terrible.  Finally, there's seem to be only like one or two max for swordsmanships...  I mean no one holds a Longsword, greatsword, or Katana in one handed!  The fighting style and stands does not fit with most swords.  3/10(That's being nice)

author: {'steamid': '76561197970291212', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 22, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1413614754}
review:
It's dead sexy, and a valiant effort to try and recreate the magic of the lightsaber duels of Jedi Knight games past. Alas, I  ultimately found it feeling too loose, floaty, and detatched for my liking. It's a game that seems to reward precision, but it gives you one of the worst control schemes I've seen for doing it.

Noble, but flawed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032525906', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 21, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1413611992}
review: The amount of lag in this game is horrible, I had 40ms the entire time and would be fighting with people that also had around 40ms and randomly they would dissappear or freeze on my screen and pop up behind me doing a big combo. At first I thought these were cheaters standbying or something but it happened in all matches. I can only imagine what the people that I beat were seeing. the attacks are pretty much the same over and over. The playstyle itself is just a couple of stiff characters with hardly any human looking movements meaning their backs were perfectly straight and all their attacks were linear (boring). This is going to sound like a stereotype but the only times I died were because the opponents were appearing behind me and be in the middle of a combo hitting me before I saw them move. This also happened on some of my wins.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069285562', 'num_games_owned': 209, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1040, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1012, 'last_played': 1416676976}
review:
This game is very funny. I tried it out when it was free at weekend and i can say that i love it. I bought it for 3.47 or something like that so I can improve. 

For everyone who likes being a little bit competitive sometimes and wants to see progress in his work : Go buy it! The game doesn't really "help" u to get in the game. Tutorial gives u the basics and the Training sessions with bots are boring and easy. But as soon as u enter a server u will love it. U'll search for competetors and duel one after another. You will improve by every mistake and it won't get boring that fast, because everyone got his own fighting style... some go more agressive some stay more defensively ; sure u will say right now " then there are noobs who take forfeits in sitting in one corner" , and i can easily say that this is not true. Why u may ask? The game gives u everything u need to take or make forfeits. U can win every (EVERY) fight. I play with my brothers and friends and we compete with each other and others on the internet. The game is worth it's cost so go ahead and buy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998186102', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1413513435}
review:
To be fair. I only played through the tutorial.

...and that was enough for me to make up my mind on not pursuing further play in this game.

Straight to the point. I thought the character and controls felt a little too stiff, and I didn't enjoy it one bit. Perhaps actually going through the online play, earning experiene and upgrading may bring about some fun. Maybe.

Another point, the name of the game, "Blade Symphony" sounded similar to one of my favorite bands from 90s, Switchblade Symphony. I was sort of hoping for some reference to them in the style of music, but there wasn't. 

I'm thankful that I got to try it during free trial weekend. Please do not hesitate to at least try this game while it's free. I didn't like it, but you just may.

Uninstalled.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003970062', 'num_games_owned': 2015, 'num_reviews': 355, 'playtime_forever': 28, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1413584706}
review:
The game is a cool looking idea, but the execution is quite poor; the controls are overcomplicated for what they do, requiring you to press two buttons instead of one to make a light/medium/heavy attack for no clear reason. It is rather hard to get a really good grasp on how the game works, as you really get little vision on what you did wrong. The imagery around the game suggests that you'll be doing all sorts of awesome parkour stuff, but the game itself doesn't really explain how this works at all, let alone really encourage you to do it. The game mentions that the tutorial is unfinished and more is coming soon...

But let's face reality here: from what everyone else is saying, this game is an early access game which isn't in early access anymore, and it is unlikely it will ever be "done". What you see is what you get, and while it has some stylishness to it, I just didn't really get anything out of it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964863427', 'num_games_owned': 1542, 'num_reviews': 191, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1413579862}
review:
Must be one of the worst fighting game I ever played. Ouch, left behind a nasty aftertaste. It could be called "Fencing for snobs". The game delves into insane complexities that do not have anything to do with fencing. The animations do not look like real fencing moves. The blades do not collide properly, instead both players interact according to obfuscated, overcomplicated rules. Want to do a simple thrust or cut? You can't. Want to parry? No chance. 

Play Mount and Blade. That's how it's done - start with the basics, four attacks, four defenses, long way to master them. Or if you want a complex fighting game, play Virtua Fighter 5 Final Showdown. Whatever you do, stay out of this garish... thing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000242913', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 416, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 416, 'last_played': 1413587324}
review:
Cool concept. However after comfortably winning my first five duels against human opponents (including a player ranked 750th worldwide) by mashing the left mouse button while sidestepping I'm not convinced the game has anywhere near a high enough skill ceiling for competitive play. Typically you have three 3-4 strike attack moves that you can mix and match, along with jumping, grabbing and chucking a ranged weapon. Sure you can charge a strike or ‚Äòparry‚Äô when players swing at the same time but there‚Äôs still not much to it. Personally I need far more depth for a fighting game to retain my interest.
Also:
-The arenas are small yet still look extremely basic 
-Surprisingly poor animation quality for a 3D fighting game
-Not much to do, few customisation options and characters. Only 2 modes - FFA or 1v1
+Although it is pretty original
+And has at least one futuristic cyber butt
It's also reasonably cheap, but still not as cheap as you can pick up some older (and superior) - albeit more conventional fighters. Pretty hard to recommend in its current state.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043802980', 'num_games_owned': 763, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 542, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1442401606}
review:
Great game about swordfighting!
You have 4 different characters, bunch of sword types (longsword, katana...) while able to do some customising, include workshop items.
While in battle you have 3 type stances, your attacks depends on your movement and it, different guarding, depends on sword.
You can choose any type/character at start, while playing you get notes that can be used to get other swords, skins.
Different gametypes, as Duel or Free For All (meanwhile in it you can challenge someone for fast duel).
Pretty easy to start, while many things to master.

author: {'steamid': '76561198110651309', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 126, 'last_played': 1413566563}
review:
I'll say this now; GET THIS NOW WHILE IT'S ON SALE
Blade Symphony is an enjoyable, tactical, 3D sword fighting game. It encorperates, parrying, blocks, parcour, large climbable capture point maps, and various styles of attacking: fast, medium, slow and aerial. Each of the four characters has a speciality, and verious swords with different abilities are customisable, allowing for various combination of swords, characters and stances. While I agree that the game can be shallow, with no story and easilly spamable movesets, if you resolve to stick to a certain style it can be very interesting, as a game to play for 20 mins of so between other games, or bit of multiplayer. While I wouldn't pay a huge amount, for under ¬£3, it's well worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971387955', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 213, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 213, 'last_played': 1413574010}
review:
Just found this gem of a game over the free weekend. It's something I've always kind of wanted in a sword fighting game. It's easy to learn the game and it's fighting mechanics. The tutorial is good, but doesn't teach you everything, but you can just ask people in the community for tips or tricks and they'll help.

They have a control point game you can play, but it's kind of lame because 2 or 3 players will go and capture the points, but everyone else will just try and fight each other. Then the match ends and restarts so quickly that sometimes you don't even need to fight. 

I hope there will be more games added that you can play. Like a co op survival against bots that are attacking your dojo and everyone needs to work together to defend it against the attackers. Or parkour race maps where players race to the end and try to survive the deadly traps in the parkour gauntlet, then at the end of the race the remaining players fight to the death for last man standing and win.

Maybe a bounty hunting mode, within a huge map and players either need to defend their teammate that has a hit on them or be the assassin that takes out the bountied player. Or objective maps where players go through different levels and fighting bots to get to the end.

This game has a ton of potential, but needs time to build itself up and get the word out about their game. Also the steamwork shop community is awesome! Tons and tons of stuff you can download, that just make the game a little more fun and I really like that this game listens to the community. I have this game on my wishlist and plan on purchasing it when I'm done with the free weekend. I'm telling all my buddies about this game. I hope this game isn't dead, because it's just so epic.

Sure, sometimes it's a little buggy, but it's a lot of fun once you figure out how to fight properly with the character you've chosen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049749120', 'num_games_owned': 342, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1413564418}
review:
i do recommend this game as i feel like if you can actually become better at this game you can get past what i feel are its biggest flaws. 

now i've only played this for a short bit and maybe i'm just not giving it enough of a chance but it just feels very clunky and while i have seen some very fluid attack motions most of it is very out of place. i see very little variety of characters (yes i know there aren't many but still) and its typically Phalanx that i see and perhaps its due to his range? i'm not sure. anyways despite this i feel like this game has a lot of potential to be a great game. after some time (perhaps a year or so) i may take a look at this game again and see how its progressed and update this review.

review:
I highly recommend this game for anyone who is a fan of swordfighting, or really anything. It is a great online multiplayer game, with plenty of maps, modes and more. I hope it gets a few updates like new characters, costumes, and more, but it is so great.

P.S. I recommend getting the game along with the soundtrack. The soundtrack is one of the best parts.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045381877', 'num_games_owned': 557, 'num_reviews': 2586, 'playtime_forever': 395, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 375, 'last_played': 1538107555}
review:
I got to play a little of Blade Symphony During the Free Weekend Weekend event, and I have got to say it is pretty cool. In Blade Symphony you customize one of 4 characters, and go into battle in a handful of game modes, including duel, free for all, and capture the point.  The swordplay is pretty easy to learn in my experience, but that does not mean it does not take skill. So its easy to learn but hard to master I guess. Blade Symphony has Workshop support, so this help alleviate some of the need for more content, even so it is still pretty slim on modes, maps and what not.  Overall I have got to say if you are looking for a small, multiplayer, swordplay/ action game, Blade Symphony is worth looking into.

EDIT; I should note I have no idea how the community is when its not a free weekend, I have heard whispers that the game has an extremely low population.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991365839', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 39, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1413549931}
review:
It's been a while since I've played a game that frustrated me from the moment I started playing it, luckily, my quota is now filled after playing Blade Symphony. I may only have an hour logged, but that's more than enough time to determine that I'm done with it.

Pros:
-Looks pretty (nothing ground-breaking, but better than most crap on today's market)
-Runs well, stable framerate
-Interesting character designs with (some) customization options
-Workshop support

Cons:
-Basically everything else
-IMPOSSIBLE to play with keyboard and mouse, controller is 110% recommended
-Still impossible to play with a controller
-Combos are non-existent beyond switching between 3 different stances and hitting the attack button (singular, there is ONE attack button)
-Hitting an opponent is almost entirely based on luck (hit indicators are misleading and don't update quick enough between movements, opponents can just spam2win)
-Parrying/blocking mechanics can be countered easily and are essentially useless


Praise be to GabeN for free weekends.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023681921', 'num_games_owned': 651, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1413547655}
review:
I can't give an in-depth description of this game, because there was no way to play it for long: The tutorial is laughably lacking, and the hit system doesnt detect attacks properly. The server i played on had 39 MS Ping, so lag is out of the question. I bet the game can be fun if you put several days into learning it, but if you're just casually trying out new games i suggest you avoid this one. You have to be prepared to invest several days of playtime to play it properly.

(My main experience was being able to parry attacks from across the map and damaging my enemy when i shouldnt have - such as hitting a wall and watching my opponent lose half their health. Wait until the game gets a bug fix before you try it)

author: {'steamid': '76561198052642437', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 41329, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25187, 'last_played': 1664776033}
review:
PLEASE READ ENTIRE REVIEW BEFORE JUDGING.

So ima just come straight forward with this. They have completely screwed up the game this last update.
Now I know alot of people are gonna completely disagree with me, but everyone is allowed to have they're own opinion.
In this last update they ruined many things and one being the parkour. You used to be able to scale walls and Endlessly jump onto things and be a total ninja that this game breathes, but now you cant even jump from one wall to another.
Why on earth would they ruin such a fun thing to do... Everyone likes being a ninja, unless you're completely boring and have no sense of fun at all. Speaking of being a Ninja.. the only class in the game that closely resembles the "ninja"
is Ryoku. Now there was a huge debate of ryoku being way over powered and blah blah blah.. but really heres the thing.
The class isnt overpowered.. Each and every single class there is, takes alot of time to train and get good at.
You cant just walk in and expect to be good in 20 minutes... No it takes a while to develope the skills it takes to be "good" and even then someone is gonna completely wreck ya. All im saying is its not the class thats overpowered.. its the person thats MASTERED the class... thats why there are these things called RANKS-- oak-Iron-steel-diamond-master. That being said every class has its weaknesses and advantages. So thats where you come and learn your opponents weaknesses and advantages and counter them!  I can think of so many people of every class type who are what they call "Overpowered" but its THEM not the class.. so stop trying to modify the game WHEN YOU HAVE DESIGNED IT FOR A CERTAIN SKILL LEVEL!!! -_- 
Part of the reason they did this update was because of people saying certain classes were to OP than others... Which is complete Bull---- as I just explained. 

Back to ryoku... The last update they did nerfed the Tracers -which are the lights that follow your sword for a short period of time when you're attacking and also deals the damage- They used to follow your sword for a period of .35 seconds and now is reduced to .15 seconds - Which is a very big difference - Quiet commonly you will see you're sword right infront of the incoming attackers attack.. and you will still be hit by there attack EVEN THOUGH your sword is there.. but heres the thing, the sword isnt really there... the sword does nothing.. its the tracers that they hit. So if your tracers are dissapearing sooner, that meens more attacks hit you even tho they shouldn't, because your sword is RIGHT THERE BLOCKING IT. PEOPLE DONT FIGHT PEOPLE WITH FLASHES OF LIGHT IN A SWORDS GAME... come on man.
 The sword I use is Scimitar.. that sword has a very low base damage. 50% front attack damge and 40% side attack damage.. where as the Longsword has 90% base damage all around but has no multihits.. Scimitar had multihits and if you did a side attack with a scimitar.. you got a few more multi hits than you normally would. Which makes up for the damage being so low. More hits more damage right? and Ryos side attacks are his most powerful attacks.. and with the right player who practiced with scimitar and got good at it, like I did you could wreck alot of people... But dont think I was unstoppable.. NOT AT ALL. There are like 25+ people in there who could still wreck my butt anyways.. but since they shortened the tracers... less multi-hits, and less multi-hits meens less damage.. and let me tell u. It really ticks u off when u do an attack that used to be strong.. but now does hardly anything.
Its not just Scimitar.. there are other swords too that are effected by it.. the whole class system is effected by it.
What I dont get is.. This being such a skillful game it is.. Each time they mess with the physics, its like completely reseting your skill level that you had previously and worked hard for. Which is a huge turn off for competitive people who want to play this game.

Now the Community...
This game is FULL of hateful, disrespectful, rude, and just plain mean people. Not saying there aren't any nice people and fun to get along with.. because there are, but a very low percentage of them.
 I for one am generally a nice person. I will admit I have been mean before and very hurtful, and to whoever I did that too I appologize even though you were insulting me first. 
I'm not going to name names, but from experience people in this game will tear you down and make you feel like crap.
Thats ALMOST everyone in the game sadly... which is part of the reason why I think our community is so small at this stage of time. i've had times where I've had a rough day and I just wanted to play a game or 2 to get my mind off of things and I would instantly be told I "suck" or "will never get good" or "go uninstall the game" Just because i'd lose one battle. Not even in a ranked match. Ofc this would make me feel discouraged or mad. Not only that but its also another form of Cyber bullying. If I was a new player trying out this game and someone said that to me, i'd leave too.
You can make friends in this game and in a week later, just dump you for some stupid reason, if any reason at all..

Instead experienced players should encourage and teach the newbies to get better and help them with troubles they are having.. Become tight friends with them and be a Example of what this game should be like. Some people are doing what I am talking about right now, but others dont even care. Most of the top players of the game dont give a crap for anyone but themselfs. 

If I where the creator of this game I would put in a system that encourages players to help newbies learn the game and rank up. Such as getting a cape or some clothing that can only be obtained for helping a certain amount of newbies get established. I'd also put in a reporting system where if someone is being deconstructive or mean to another person
to take a screen shot of the chat and send it to an admin, which then would send some sort of in-game mail to whoever was being mean and tell them to keep it in their pants.

If I where the creator of this game i'd also contact some popular game reviewer on youtube to come review my game and publicise it. I know its just an Indie game, but still if this game would stop ruining itself it could be pretty big.
Its just a matter of publicity and community.

As of right now do I recommend this game... No.. I dont the way the game is heading right now I dont see much light ahead of the tunnel... but if maybe some of my ideas where implimented into the game, then sure, but right now... not so much. 
I appreciate you reading my review feel free to leave your thoughts and I do expect some jerks from the game to hate on my review, but that simpley just proves what i'm saying is correct. Thank you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030072258', 'num_games_owned': 1484, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1413508665}
review:
It is a very fun game and the game mechanics works very well for a Online Sword Fighting game. After playing it for a while, I found that the tutorial, which does explain the basics, is confusing and clonky. Even after the tutorial, i found my self lost and confused as i was duelling people online. I only got better because of those online players since they explained to me, in simple words, what the tutorial explain in a not very intuitive way.

Overall, once you get the basics down, the reach of the multiple weapons and how to dodge/counter, the game is enjoyable but the learning curve is really high.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992814416', 'num_games_owned': 144, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 35, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1413508800}
review: Terrible animations, bland sound and game mechanics which are neither deep enough to be enjoyable/skillful nor simple enough to be understandable. The tutorial is pretty bad, and does not explain anything useful that one couldn't work out through normal play. The parry system isn't very clear either. Most of the time it's impossible to tell what's going on, it feels extremely mindless and the actual depth and teamwork seems non-existent. This is a very lazily designed game by the seems of it, and is anything but satisfying to play. If you want something that's not gimmicky, try a proper fighting game, not this garbage.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056071220', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 4200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4165, 'last_played': 1398831920}
review:
Do you like fighting games?

This isn't one.

Sure, two players enter an arena and attempt to beat the crap out of each other, best 2 out of 3 wins.
If that's the only way you define fighting game, then go ahead and call it one.

BUT

Blade Symphony is lacking in the depth present in a game like Skullgirls or Street Fighter. It's less about knowing what your opponent will try and more about exploiting the game itself to gain an advantage.

The third person over-the-should view obfusicates much of your ability to gauge the actual range of your own attacks, as well as those of your opponent. Hit detection is often quite spotty. Which results in awkward advances followed by swinging wildly while backing up. Hit and run tactics are the way this game is played for the most part.

Blade Symphony lacks the consistency of fighting games too. Frame rates aren't consistent, so good luck trying to gracefully and skillfully link sword attacks into one another.
What you'll really end up doing is clicking and wildly swinging your camera around to manipulate your attack's path and speed.

It doesn't have the careful balance of fighting games, either.
The project's leader, Flux, set out to initially balance the attacks each character possesses using a very simple method.
He played against the "knight" character, who for the purpose of this process used only his slowest, strongest attack. Clicking over and over, using only this attack, Flux then played each character and gave them tools to counter or get around this attack.

Then he was done balancing. The characters were done being iterated on, for the most part.

The dev team tweaks the numbers, at this point - sword swing speeds, damage values etc, but the ongoing balance meetings really only involve Flux asking the "top players" (read: most popular/vocal at the top of the leaderboard) what should be done. And of course, you can imagine the clamoring for the weakening of characters that they have trouble with, and the buffing of their mains. To be fair, it's not really the player's fault - it's natural and unavoidable to be biased in your own favor, no matter how impartial you think you are. The blame lies with the devs for outsourcing it's finer balance decisions to the most highly competetive players.

Several characters have attacks that are so fast, they actually exceed the game's ability to display and often detect. Which can have wildly inconsistent results.

This game plays more like a third person action game, or an extremely bare-bones character action game.
That's multiplayer only. Very little realism to be had, with characters defying physics with certain attacks, outlandish Errol Flynn techniques, and in some cases outright flying.

If you can look past some very bizzare balancing philosophies (ie none at all) and don't expect to play more than one character (ie the one everyone at the top of the leaderboard plays) then you might enjoy this as a unique competetive experience. But all I can see is a whole lot of potential wasted by poor decisionmaking and direction.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040844389', 'num_games_owned': 426, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 56, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1413502291}
review:
Le jeu est plut√¥t sympa, il a l'air d'avoir pas mal de truc possible a faire mais, y'a clairement un truc qui casse le jeu et qui est limite encourag√© je trouve:

Le spam.
Pour peu que tu tombe sur un mec qui spam le bon coup avec le bon perso et la bonne arme, bah ... Tu pleure. Par exemple, l√† je ressort d'un combat qui m'a juste fait chier parce que le mec a spammer un coup unique (et deux trois fois il a fait autre chose parce qu'il arrivait pas a me toucher) et m'a vid√© ma vie en deux coups. Super. En gros, faut esp√©rer avoir du bol et ne pas tomber sur des idiots qui spam.

En fait c'est pas vraiment le jeu que je ne recommande pas, c'est le multijoueur. (il doit √™tre super entre amis)  Or, le jeu a l'air plut√¥t centr√© sur ce multi comp√©titif, du coup bah... Ca donne clairement pas envie d'y jouer. Le probl√®me vient peut √™tre de la quantit√© d'arme et de perso disponible, ce qui reviendrait au syndrome Warframe. ("On veut faire plein de chose, mais on oublie d'√©quilibrer certain truc")

Et si vous d√©cidez quand m√™me, de jouer en multijoueur petit conseil: Si vous voyez un mec avec environs 1000 points, ne combattez pas, changez d'ar√®ne. Ou de serveur m√™me. Sinon, vous allez vous faire d√©glinguer par un gros gland qui spam ses coups comme un autiste.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045056085', 'num_games_owned': 248, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 312, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 116, 'last_played': 1541444898}
review:
This is the most fun game I've ever played, I am very picky about my video games, this is my favourite game so far! 

The animations may be chunky on a few characters, but the fighting is balanced even with different fighting styles - each character has their own unique style of fighting so they are better aginst some and worse aginst others. 

The player customization is a bit limited, but you can edit your character colour scheme, and a secondary colour, the workshop also alows the download of difrint masks. 

The game looks beautiful even on the lowest settings, and I have a PC from 2008 not meant for gaming, and it runs amazing for me, there are a few maps that give me fps drop, but it isn't anything too severe. 

I Highly recomend this game, the turtorial is VERRY detaled and tells you all you need to know for combat, and this game is based on skill, and not luck, or the best weapon/character. (I usaly don't write reviews but I went out of my way for this one, I think it well worth $14.99 (¬£10.99).

review:
Tried on Free Weekend. It's interesting, it has very nice graphics and style and i love games like this..but I have to say that collision/hitboxes are not good. Often you can't recognize if you hit or not the enemy. 
Great idea but the game does not fit properly. Anyway the price is too much for the content.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097537717', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 914, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 831, 'last_played': 1391939730}
review:
* The sword fighting is nice, but some of the attacks feel too "floaty".

* The community is dead. There are only a few advanced players that fight each other all the time. New players get destroyed and quit the game. Not worth purchasing at full price if you're a new player.

* Hitboxes are weird and don't function like you'd expect. They're simply broken.

* The 2v2 fights are fun.

* The parkour is useless.

* The combo system is great.

* Mod support is great.

Overall, I recommend the game. It is a good game, it just needs further development and a bigger community.
For now, however, I wouldn't recommend a purchase at full price.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999339008', 'num_games_owned': 2912, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 43, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1413487310}
review:
A rather interesting third person fighting game.

But for collectors, you can pass. 
Some exclusives are kept away from new players. And when you'll play this game with your friends, you won't be able to access the whole content.

Fortunately for the less collectors, it's only cosmetic.
For the others, well, you're too late, and not good enough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008739074', 'num_games_owned': 3863, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 536, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1576449854}
review: Reines PVP-Spiel mit wenig M√∂glichkeiten trotz Steam Workshop. Das Spiel ist sehr schwer f√ºr Neueinsteiger und man verliert schnell die Lust daran oder der Ehrgeiz steigt. Zwei Pluspunkte bekommt das Spiel f√ºr die nett aussehenden Arenen und die verschiedenen Kampfstile, sei es nun ein schneller Angriff mit dem Degen oder ein starker Angriff mit dem Katana.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015347457', 'num_games_owned': 666, 'num_reviews': 258, 'playtime_forever': 348, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 347, 'last_played': 1417809439}
review:
There is zero balance in the game, I've learned from experience that you can spam one stance and win, Especially with judgement (the knight.) ontop of this, the two ninjas bounce around so much that they're hardly viable, The ranges on some characters are PITIFUL, and the sword balance? There is none. Either go longsword for straight up killing power or rapier if you want to troll. There is not really any skill to the game, just timing when to attack and that's really no different than playing rock band / Guitar Hero., when you think about it.

Overall, I'd give it a 2/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198002861171', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 16525, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8945, 'last_played': 1444424119}
review:
wonderfull art direction though content seems light at first there is depth here to satisfy even the hardest core of fighting game snobs, but there is a simplicity and fluidness to it's combo system that makes it more accessible to newcomers.

the community is small but  tight and welcoming enough that real rivalrys are not hard to find and most older players are willing to give private leasons to help bring you up to speed.

to summerize if you have ever longed to really quest to become the best swordsman in the world nothing else captures that journey in quite the same way.

just remember to bow :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198116422452', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 124, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1448796898}

author: {'steamid': '76561198041874581', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 20383, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18221, 'last_played': 1560567618}
review:
At one point I was into this game, edging on Tryhard. It was an amazing game. I put very much emphasis on [b]WAS[/b].
During the winter sale a year or two back I purchased this "unique" title, I was nervous and hoping for a new game I could play for hours on end without getting bored and this caught my eye.

Blade Symphony; or BS for its shorter possibly literal term, was the game that occupied much of my time.
As any gamer I was raring to go, but stopped as I played the Turtorial to grasp the basics. Only to be thoroughly confused at the poor quality of the walkthrough. Regardless I pushed on, ignoring the poor walkthrough eager to test my mettle against other players, which I did. Over and over I lost, and sometimes won by learning the ways of the game on the fly or browsing YouTube for the in-depth explanations of mechanics and gameplay that the game so thoroughly lacked. But I knew that I wouldn't win right off the bat, not without much, [b]MUCH[/b] practice and failure.

This game is not for the easily disuaded. For you will be deterred by the complexity of the game, and even the most smallest of mechanics will be difficult to grasp. Unless you persevere and learn by trial and error for sometimes the longest of times as I and other have. The learning curve is immense and only those who want to succeed, will.

Months had past, and I had become regular on BS. Frequently I would marvel at new ways to play, new tips and tricks that gave me that edge in a time of need. Or playing with new-made friends, enjoying the time spent together.
But this is a community that is rancid with poison and toxic behaviors. People acting like immature internet teenagers, threats, put-downs, and flatout hostility is a common thing. Browse the forums, look to the past as they do not, and learn from it, as they [b]most certainly[/b] do not.

So I left BS, only to return having heard that changes were made a few months after my departure. Only to see that the game I had enjoyed to an extent, was rendered virtually garbage in my eyes. Nothing had changed, things weren't better. The game wasn't balanced as it should, and it never was. Nor will it [b]EVER[/b] be if appropriate steps are taken.
[spoiler]Listen to your fellow gamers "Balance Team", nothing will change for the better if you lock everyone out or cover your ears to reason or possible ideas...[/spoiler]

I cherish the time I spent there and I always will, but it is clouded by memories of frustration and forced ignorance towards sour behavior.

Overall Summary:

Gameplay - Fun at first, Interesting and unfinished, repetitive reletively soon and difficult as Hell if you aren't committed.
Community - Terrible. Aside from the few who aren't. You know who you are :)
Developers - Learning, as all should. But never act /  learn enough with / from the knowledge given.

They say BS is a niche game, well its a fairly small niche I'll give you that.

This is not the game for casual's. This is an unfinished game that shouldn't have left Early Access; most likely farther back than that, which needs serious work if its gonna reel me back in.
I bid you farewell Blade Symphony, it was at first a grand pleasure. But now I'm not so sure... Debate if you will it so, but my views stand, regardless of its harshness.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027308552', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 1048, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1048, 'last_played': 1474223188}
review:
Enfin un jeu de combat qui offre de r√©el duel. 
Le jeu est profond et est plus compliqu√© qu'il n'y parait. Ici l'adaptation du style de combat est oblig√© ou c'est la d√©faite assur√©. Ceux qui veulent bourr√© s'en voit donc exclu car ils sont facilements contrables. 
Le niveau graphique du jeu est assez bon en nous offrant des environnements d'une grande beaut√©, (Une map divis√©e en trois ar√®ne). 
Le jeu est sous forme d'un classement permanent cr√©ant ainsi une envie de se surpasser. Faite cependant attention en rentrant dans une room, vous pourriez tomber sur les meilleurs joueurs du jeu. 
Autre point fort: La customisation via le workshop qui offre un grand contenu qui plus est cr√©er par les joueurs.

Cependant √† l'heure d'aujourd'hui la communaut√© est tr√®s faible. Trop voir completement d√©sert√©e. D'o√π le fait que je ne puisse recommand√© ce jeu.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032943425', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 95, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1452583529}
review:
The videos make the game look polished, finished, and requiring skill to play.  In reality, the game is nothing like that.  Yes, the graphics look good, but the rest of the game is pretty horrible.  They have you run through a tutorial on how the mechanics of the sword dueling goes.  They somewhat explain how the different styles work.  Then they throw you against AI to let you try them out.  Afterwards, you are left to go find a match and test your metal against other players.  Finding a match is a bear and because the matches support multiple contestants competing in a 1:1 battle, you usually find yourself sitting around spectating for a good portion.  Horrible matchmaking aside, that's not even the worst part.

The game mechanics you learn from the tutorial do not translate well against other human players.  Against AI who react and use dictated techniques the gameplay is fine.  But against users who can change styles, combo attacks, cancel actions, and can move anywhere of their own free will, it's VERY different.   Half the time you find yourself against people who are new (not their fault) and who rage over "cheap moves", which are really just the usage of the different "styles" to counter other styles (which is a game mechanic).  The other half are people who have realized that they can do things like cancel a combo at a certain time and instead choose a single move.  This means there's no consistency in the dueling.

The game sounds awesome in theory, but when they executed their ideas, they did so poorly and without proper testing (I assume, otherwise they released the game knowing of the issues and thought breaking the mechanics they set up was a good idea).  It's really not worth the money.  I picked the game up with a friend and even between the two of us, we had a hard time having fun with the game without mixing in other players.  The second you do, the game becomes even more miserable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069506376', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1411591271}
review:
Beautiful Graphics - Yay!

Solid soundtrack - Yay!

Interesting take on swordplay - Yay!

Utterly stupid walking animations - Boo.

INSANE online learning curve - Boo.

Tutorial isnt exactly fully fleshed out, and doesnt prepare you for anything but bots - Boo.

Stylish characters - Yay!

Only 4 Characters to choose from - Boo.

Limited Customization options for Characters - Boo.

Nearly UNLIMITED customization options for you armory/playstyle - Yay!

Overall, Glaring problems with Sparkling Awesomes.

Dont buy it if you're a casual.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013882641', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 152, 'playtime_forever': 988, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1582758950}
review:
Un GROS dommage!

Dans la situation actuelle, ce jeu n'est pas recommandable bien qu'il ait une s√©rie de qualit√©s ind√©niables.
Explications :

Dans les faits, le jeu aurait pu √™tre tr√®s tr√®s bon. Le principe de base m'accrochant d√©j√† √©norm√©ment : un jeu de combat bas√© sur les √©p√©es. Parer, contrer, esquiver, manier plusieurs sortes d'√©p√©es, d'attaques ainsi que de "stances" => attaques rapides mais peu puissantes, attaques moyennes √† vitesse normale et attaques lourdes assez lentes.

Tout √ßa √©tait bien pens√©, le gameplay n'est pas mauvais bien qu'un peu lourd. Chaque arme, chaque personnage, donne un feeling compl√®tement diff√©rent au jeu. Ce qui rend le gameplay riche, vari√©, mais aussi impardonnable dans le sens o√π si vous ne connaissez pas quelles attaques sont contrables √† quel moment, avec quel stance, quelle √©p√©e et quel personnage c'est foutu. Un principe exigeant, mais accrocheur.

Mais, car oui il y a forc√©ment un GROS "mais" les developpeurs se foutent un peu de la gueule des gens. Le d√©veloppement du jeu, qui est loin d'√™tre termin√© √† son stade actuel, n'avance plus. Ainsi nous n'avons toujours pas de bots (pour p√¢lier ne serait-ce qu'un minimum aux serveurs vides, mascotte du jeu online dans ce cas) √† proprement parler, pas de tutoriel complet, pas DU TOUT assez de maps, 4 personnages, des attaques et des √©p√©es compl√®tement unbalanced qui g√¢chent presqu'enti√®rement le plaisir de jeu (pour un jeu de combat, c'est un comble...) et j'en passe.

Voil√† donc pourquoi il n'est pas recommandable : il n'est pas DU TOUT fini, et je doute qu'il le soit un jour.

Un √©norme dommage pour un jeu qui avait beaucoup de potentiel, mais ne sera jamais exploit√© faute √† des d√©veloppeurs qui ont pris la tangeante apr√®s avoir amass√© assez de frics durant une alpha et une beta promettant monts et merveilles que nous ne verrons assur√©ment jamais.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982259841', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2006, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 994, 'last_played': 1463826935}
review:
Blade Symphony does one thing and it does it well. This game is all about swordfighting. It is presented in a few rather similar formats. What must be understood is that it is not just another fighting game.
There is a somewhat hidden element of social interaction and importance of good manners. People have different opinions on the importance of manners, and some seem to deliberately be rude to get you off balance. Beating these people is immensely rewarding.
The best and worst part of this game is the heavy reliance on the community. The community does carry the game in every way it is lacking, but only when a decent number of servers are populated.
I'll leave ya with this: Bow before (and after) every fight, don't attack people who are typing and don't use shurikens. I will find you and I will play foul if you do. Otherwise; I'll see ya in-game for some sword-clashing!

author: {'steamid': '76561198032284462', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 849, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1411518674}
review:
I can't help but think this is a very niche game.

If it included any single player, story element, more tutorial, maybe.

But as it stands it's a multiplayer only, dead server with around 10 players still playing.

The combat is actually really good, and if I could connect to any one perhaps I'd enjoy it, but all I seem to be able to do is fight AI.

and that's it. no gear to change the characters except for visual changes, 5 sword styles + 4 characters styles = 20 total possible combinations

I wouldn't bother buying this game unless you have a small group of friends you want to play a decent fighter game with, that's the only reason I can think of bothering to get this game as it currently is

author: {'steamid': '76561198028239897', 'num_games_owned': 225, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 358, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 222, 'last_played': 1432101568}
review: The game is kind of fun. Except that mostly all of the players are really good and it is hard to get good (in my opinion). Every fight i find myself losing because everyone is good and people who are not good dont play the game, also there is a bot that you can fight but the bot sucks so much that even if you are playing for the first time you can beat them really easliy. So basically the game is unbalanced it is very hard to get good and the hit boxes are also kind of off.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006411483', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 1605, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1589, 'last_played': 1475384015}
review:
This game started out well in earlier stages, but unfortunately is full of exploits and serious balance issues - not worth the price. 

I was in the top 1000 players when i was playing. Once you get into the upper end it's mostly people spamming as phalanx, which says a lot for the games balance.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989358587', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1414361027}
review:
As a new player getting into the game -- I'm lost. There is a quick tutorial that I tried that does a poor job of really teaching the mechanics. Granted, I have no experience in sword fighting games but I did not expect this to be so difficult to pick up which isn't necessarily a bad thing. But the tutorial doesn't even register when you do the moves it asks you to do and sometimes counts things that aren't what they wanted you to do which ended with me being entirely confused.

It is only a problem because there is literally no one at my skill level to play against. There are 3 servers that have anyone in them and they all destroy me.

Also it seems like it's only really enjoyable on a controller, which I don't have.

author: {'steamid': '76561198092875215', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 722, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 83, 'last_played': 1503957503}
review: I bought this out of curiosity and I don't regret it at all. I'm not a fan of fighting games but I had a lot of fun playing this game. The roster isn't over whelming, and I like the idea that all swords are cosmetic so it's more skill based. While it is a little rough around the edges I can say, as a person who doesn't like fighting games, this was worth the purchase.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068471336', 'num_games_owned': 163, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 2396, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1883, 'last_played': 1502425451}
review:
Fight! (In elegant style.)

The Good-

Gorgeous scenery
Graphics are quite nice
Soundtrack is also quite nice, and fitting
Combat is BRILLIANTLY done, and very original
Some workshops creations are quite creative and unique
Animations are quite fluent, but can slip up at time
While there's only four or five "classes," you're bound to find your playstyle within the class, and with four or five different types of swords, each with their own effects


The Bad-

Pretty rinse-and-repeat
Total lack of ranked matchmaking, so don't be surprised if you get paired with high-ranking individuals who slice you to microscopic pixels
Gameplay diversity only goes so far, as it's in development
Combat system, while very unique and interesting, has a pretty harsh learning curb

author: {'steamid': '76561197990899902', 'num_games_owned': 7723, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 679, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 548, 'last_played': 1423394933}
review:
This is the best online multiplayer swordfighting game that's still active hands down. Swordplay is fun, you have a lot of customization options when it comes to how you want to fight and how you want to look while you fight. You can fight free for all or duel 1 on 1. There's also steam workshop support which is always a welcome inclusion.

I thought this would be another budget indie title or a game with dead online servers but it's still somewhat active from what I've played, and it's a ton of fun. If you want to chop up dudes online with your sword then just buy this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057621579', 'num_games_owned': 1221, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 81262, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20266, 'last_played': 1708944336}
review:
[strike]I just have to do a review of this game now.
But eh, so much to talk about, where do I start?

[h1] The Game [/h1]
Blade Symphony is a quite unique and "fresh" 3D Slash-em-up, using the source engine. I personally never saw a game like this, but the setting is still awesome.
You have your 4 characters; [spoiler] 3.5 Characters, because pure is still unfinished [/spoiler]
 Phalanx, Judgement, Ryoku and Pure. All of them have their own move set, animations and taunts even, who are all optimizable. (Im not going to discuss who is under-and overpowered, so shush)
You can equip those characters with 5 different swordtypes; Longsword, Scimitar, Rapier, Katana and Jian, which are all unlocked in the start of the game and the only thing you can unlock is eye-candy, which doesnt affect gameplay at all. Meaning, no matter how long you play the game, you wont unlock anything that will affect gameplay.
Coupled with some parkour (which is useless) and a nice fighting system (which I wont explain either) and you have a perfect game, right?

...No..not really.

[h1] The Good [/h1]
-Nice Fighting System
-Responsive Controls
-Good designed free for all and Duel game modes, where FFA can be moddable, being a source game.
-A lot of workshop integration which fits this game perfectly
-Online leaderboards which keeps track of your progress

And now....the dark side of this game

[h1] The Bad [/h1]
-Bad Tracers (Hit detection if you want it that way)
-Hitboxes can be just awful at times
-Lag can do a lot of weird stuff
-4. Character Pure is unfinished
-Characters have attacks which are just broken or weird
-A lot of balancing problems
-Random and unexplainable FPS drops sometimes
-The General Duel maps have FPS problems in general
-Ranking system is just not executed well
-Buggy Physics and just stuff thats not supposed to happen
-[u] The Game Is Dead [/u]

This is where the normal review ends. Ill give this game a 5.5/10. Dont pick this up for the normal price, get it on a sale, when you really want it. Yes, I have a decent amount of playtime still racking up. But at this point I cant recommend this game.
You can end here or keep reading for some more details, details, yay!
EDIT: No, I dont hate this game. The community is great (aside from a few people), the concept is awesome and the game is overall fun. I just cant recommend it at this state. YES, I like this game.

[h1] Dead Symphony [/h1]
Simply, this game is dead. Trying to get in new in this game is hard, because the most active players are the advanced and good ones. The community doesnt grow, the devs (and the balancing team) keep doing decisions and decision which are just not explainable. Most old-school players quit and/or switched to other games;

For a reason, you will notice when you go online everyday for a week: You keep meeting the same people over and over again. And the new players will just get crushed by the advanced ones (This game is multiplayer only), having no chance to get better without avoiding the good players all the time.

The game isnt even THAT bad, its just how I said. Fighting the same people over and over again just gets boring.
BUT, the community IS good. Some people of the balancing team are nice players and some devs even play the game!
The game being dead, means we meet the same people over and over again (For the third time now), but that also means that were a BETTER community. We know eachother better when theres less people.
Well, yeah, sucks that the community keeps getting smaller because more and more people are quitting.
If the devs dont do something, this game is poorly advertised aswell, the game is going to be dead soon. Dead for good.

God, that was a lot of random bu!!sh!t. But you wanted a review and here it is.
Thanks for reading! <3 [/strike]

Its free now, go play it. Its good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051295351', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 8222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6278, 'last_played': 1510512513}

author: {'steamid': '76561198063235175', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1231, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 978, 'last_played': 1418871076}
review:
Blade Symphony has one of the best sword fighting mechanics available, being similar to games like Star Wars: Jedi Academy and Jedi Outcast (which served as the base for Blade Symphony) and a really good community/workshop support, letting players instantly view downloaded workshop items from others without actually having to download them. Although a good game, it has many exploits and bugs that are yet to be fixed by the developers.

Overall score: 9,0

author: {'steamid': '76561198071416196', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 28277, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11901, 'last_played': 1450452134}
review:
Blade Symphony,Is a new game on Steam from Hack&Slash genre,Unlike Moun&Blade series it is based around 1v1 or 2v2 duels.The way you choose your attack type is quite similar to Mount&Blade,You swing your sword the way you move or rotate your camera therefore the use of attacks is quite easy.The diffrence in system thats used in Blade Symphony then Mount&Blade is that in Mount&Blade you used same attack all time but in Blade Symphony those attack differ due to combo boxes(Left bottom side of screen).
All attacks have three versions(Which is awsome for me) Tier 1,Which is uncharged attack,Tier 2,Which is half-Charged and Tier 3,Which is fully charged.Thanks to this all characters have huge variety of diffrent attacks.
This game is prefect for lovers of Swords,Acrobatics,Parkour and Combat.In this game all of those are in use for you.
So far there are four main characters(Hopefully there will be more) Judge(Knight),Phalanx(Gentlemen),Ryoku(Breakdancing Monkey) and Pure(Ass of steel).All four have completly diffrent play styles.
Judge is a heavy knight that got huge power but he is quite slow(On higher ranks he is annoying as hell).
Phalanx is a gentlemen that uses mostly stabs that stun lock any oponents.
Ryoku,Breakdancing Monkey,King of air cancels and air attack,Nearly everyone plays him due to over powered heavy straight.
Pure,Only Female character,To our surprise her chest is quite a regular size BUT that ass is so amazing.

Not talking about the few last patches that have over powered two characters and two swords,The game is great for a person who loves Sword fights,DON'T GET FOOLED BY THE VIDEO,You don't create your own fighting style but you create your own sequence in which you use the moves,It will still probably come down to meta but well...Remember kids,Don't do meta.

The Game itself is quite good.If I would have to give it score out of 10...Gameplay 8/10,Graphics 9/10,Story -/10(Who needs a story for Hack&Slash).So the verdict is,8.5/10.Its a great game I would recommend for anyone intrested in Swordfighting to purchase it!
Thanks for reading!

author: {'steamid': '76561198030845622', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 628, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 616, 'last_played': 1410395332}
review:
An extremely deep and pretty game. Each fighter and sword feels different and you learn quickly which you feel the most at home with. The challenge after that is to break free from your comfort zone to learn to move and strike in new ways. Seeing missed opportunities comes after only an hour or so, and you will curse yourself for having such imperfect reflexes as to miss the opportunity for a block or a grab in that split second it emerged and was gone again.

An extremely solid game. Don't miss playing in the ladder games. People are friendly, and there is room for players of all skill levels - even mine (currently 29-77).

author: {'steamid': '76561198139909817', 'num_games_owned': 146, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 41, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1406632679}
review:
"Blade Symphony" is great combat game. In the game you have a lot of weapons (swords) to choose from same as your character customizations, etc helmets. I love blade shymphony because all crazy moves and combinations you can make to defeat your enemy. You can play storylane, practice or play online vs other players in a huge numbers of arenas!

Rate: 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198025021719', 'num_games_owned': 559, 'num_reviews': 165, 'playtime_forever': 2182, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1277, 'last_played': 1408610868}
review: This is perhaps my favorite "fighting game" ever. Sword combat that doesn't rely on secret ABABAB up down left down nonsensical combos. There is a system and logic behind all the moves. It's just about the only action dueling game I can stand to play, because it's the only one that makes sense. And it supports workshop swords, so if you like swords there are billions of swords and sword-like objects to choose from.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970667107', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1759, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1663, 'last_played': 1407062773}
review:
Coming from a background of dueling games (DF2, JO/JA) I can say that this game is satisfying in that respect. There are four current classes with more on the way, and a handful of different weapons and variations on their appearances, including a diverse variety of steam workshop items, which is always a plus.

The game is quite enjoyable when you can find equal tiered players on the same level as you, where you can play the game in relative ease of mind, but there is a darker side to Blade Symphony, and that is its community of "veteran" players. So unfortunately, this is a game that I cannot recommend to those interested in getting into a dueling game, unless you have incredibly thick skin.

The community in this game, is in fact, not "great" as some of the highly ranked players have posted. If you check their steam names on the official Blade Symphony website, you'll see where they measure on the ladder and whether or not you can believe a word they say. The vast majority of the veteran players in this community are rude, immature, and generally disrespectful to new users. So its like any other game then, is what you're thinking.

And it is, sadly, this is what competitive gaming has become. Its nothing more than a festival of higher ups telling you how bad you are. This is something the devs need to regulate, because when it comes to admins on the official servers, there are none from what I've seen. Players can get away with the worst kind of behavior, and harassment of new players with great ease.

Now the short version: If you want a good fighting game with a good community, stay away from Blade Symphony. The game itself is good, but the community will leave you wanting to uninstall the game from their relentless immaturity, and rudeness.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012845915', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 5576, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3308, 'last_played': 1556301250}
review: A very friendly community despite it being small at the moment, a creative take on the slash 'em up genre, utilizing tactical sword fighting as opposed to button mashing. Varied sword play which changes upon your chosen character, stance and play style.  Awesome character design, absolutely fantastic soundtrack and lots of fun items on the workshop. About as close you can get to Bushido Blade online. Oh! And shurikens! 10/10
