author: {'steamid': '76561198057775596', 'num_games_owned': 419, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 1423, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 780, 'last_played': 1593386474}
review:
Este juego es tan bueno como infravalorado.
Se resume en lo siguiente:
- 4 personajes, cada uno con su estilo de combate, y dentro de esos estilos tres posiciones intercambiables durante el combate.
- Distintos tipos de armas con distintas estad√≠sticas (estoque, katana, espada larga..).
- Combates a tres rondas donde el que gana es el primero en conseguir dos victorias.

Al principio parece muy complejo, y no voy a mentir, puede ser tan t√©cnico como quieras, llegando al punto de que un personaje con el arma equivocada puede ser mucho m√°s d√©bil de lo que deber√≠a (o lo contrario).
A√∫n as√≠, es est√∫pidamente adictivo; fue hacer el tutorial y tirarme m√°s de 50 combates seguidos online, sin importar el resultado. Con amigos seguramente sea a√∫n m√°s desafiante y entretenido si cabe.
El √∫nico pero es que apenas hay jugadores en 3-4 servers de 30-y-muchos.

Dadle una oportunidad en serio, escoged lo que mejor se adapte a vosotros e intentad dominarlo.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969826281', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 60734, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22880, 'last_played': 1675803113}
review:
Community been dying out for a while again. Kickstarter promises were not kept, game was released in an unfinished state to get more financing to keep the project going, so you're basically buying a released game that's still early access. Critisism gets censored from forums and even screenshots are subject to deletion. Patches break more than they fix and it takes ages for them to come out. Game is incomplete in many ways including: unfinished/broken characters/swords/maps and so on.

Buy if you want to pay 15 bucks for a fighting game that's somewhat unique but with a dwindeling playerbase and all of the above.

review: Badass, elegant, quick paced swordplay that really gets the adrenaline pumping, a wide variety of seemingly endless combo possibility. Intense online battles that can either be 1-on-1, team matches or chaotic free-for-alls. Featuring a beautifly simple battle concept featuring each class handling each weapon-type differently and in-depth hit reg. A large variety of different weapon designs including a ton of community-made weapons referencing popular cultures like anime and other video game franchises.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038688196', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 856, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 686, 'last_played': 1416952692}
review:
Best way to describe this game? If you ask me personally I would have to tell you that it's like a bunch of techno-ninjas and french duelists decided to gather together and kick ass. Blade Symphony has really easy to handle controls, but is still challenging enough to be good at. (I'm nowhere near the good point yet.)

For $25 (USD) I bought a 2-pack of this game with its OST and within 48 hours of the purchase I've logged almost 10 hours of gameplay (This is huge since I tend to work almost all the time.) The gameplay is addicting and the community is full of good sports. I know I personally have received pointers numerous times.

Hope to see you in the arena!
     ~WinterCaxyl

review:
Blade symphony (un titre bien pompeux) pourrait plaire √† certains joueurs, et para√Æt d'abord s√©duisant. Moi, je l'ai trouv√© mal roul√©, pas seulement difficile mais d√©sagr√©able √† prendre en main, rempli d'effets bling bling. Le c√¥t√© "style de combat personnalis√©" n'est pas tout √† fait le m√™me que sur le papier et n'innove pas de beaucoup malgr√© de jolies tentatives et pas mal de possibilit√©s de combinaisons. Les duels sont ennuyeux, et m√™me la victoire est peu savoureuse.
Le personnage r√©pond mal aux contr√¥les, et c'est peut-√™tre un choix de ralentissement fait dans un souci de clarification des duels, ce que je respecte, mais qui au final n'est simplement pas agr√©able √† mon go√ªt.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026767944', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 417, 'last_played': 1432258779}
review: Excellent game. What it lacks in overall depth and scope it makes up for in rich swordplay and quick, visceral duels. If you were a fan of Jedi Knight II's multiplayer or Jedi Knight Academy, I urge you to give this a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041953999', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 633, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 476, 'last_played': 1446859706}
review:
I don't know where to start with this game. 

Blade Symphony is an fast-paced third-person action swordplay game that is challenging and hard to master but will keep you entertained to the fullest when climbing your way to the top.

This game has the best way of importing things from the workshop that I've seen since Garry's Mod. You can download different swords to use and masks to wear. 
Speaking of swords and masks, the game offer many different types of swords to match your playstyle. From Longswords to Scimitars and Katanas to Rapiers, Blade Symphony really let's the player choose. 
Aswell as having the many swords to choose from, you can choose one of four different characters each with their own unique way of fighting to suit you. The customization is endless in this game!
The graphics are where this game falls short. The game itself looks great but there's much more potential. For a game like Blade Symphony graphics are just as important as gameplay.

Blade Symphony has something I've never seen before in it's genre of game. It's hard to pinpoint what it is that makes this game so enjoyable. Maybe it's the online servers with hundreds of people to meet, duel and make friends with. Maybe it's how well it works and co-operates with it's players. Maybe it's just the whole game!

In closing, I think Blade Symphony is a fantastic and cutting edge game in it's genre that is focused towards the players enjoyment of the game. I really recommend you pick it up and try this game out, I sincerly think you'll like it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012804095', 'num_games_owned': 994, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 482, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 482, 'last_played': 1400262674}
review: Buen juego con graficos de esta generacion, la verdad es muy llamativo y el tema de las habilidades y demas esta muy bien pulido, a mi francamente es un juego que me gusto, es full pvp, tiene muchas horas de diversion y ademas es un juego como pocos se han visto, el genero en pc no esta muy pulido y ver algo asi y con estas caracteristicas mola, cuesta un poco acostumbrarse a los controles y logicamente hay que tener manos y practicar mucho para ganar un duelo, aun asi es un juegazo en todos los aspectos, lo recomiendo por que ademas el precio no es nada del otro mundo para los graficos y jugabilidad que tienen, yo he jugado durante unas 8 Horas y no le he visto ningun fallo, salvo q no esta traducido, aunq me defiendo bien con el ingles, me gusta jugar en mi idioma natural, un saludo a todos y gracias por leer mi analisis :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198056687923', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 917, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 549, 'last_played': 1485363449}
review:
A fun different game, anyone coming from Dark Souls might be wierded out by its 3D Sword Path reticle( thats ACTUALLY what its called)  but may find the strategizing similar, except its PVP, single-players beware. Blade Symphony has as many swords as TF2 does hats, actually probably not, but you can get just about anything you can imagine.
There are two main modes FFA(Free for All) and Duel, FFA is essentially a sandbox, where you can RDM all you wish or challenge people to a duel, plus there's parkour! not really, you just get a wallrun, but you can do a lot with that.
build up your strats, everything is critical. 10/10- Do reccomend

author: {'steamid': '76561198041543513', 'num_games_owned': 761, 'num_reviews': 213, 'playtime_forever': 450, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 275, 'last_played': 1405486713}
review:
I have been eyeing this game for a while and was fortunate to get it in a bundle. 

If you like swordplay, dueling, and heavily-skill based gameplay, then you will enjoy this game.

The aesthetics are fantastic with very detailed models, skins, and weapons. There is strong mod support for user-based content, adding a large variety to the customization potential. The music is very good at keeping you engaged in the extremely intense combat.

Although you will be primarily using the mouse, the controls can be very tricky to master without lots of practice, and the learning curve is moderate to high - depending on whether you are used to aggressive, all-out-offense gameplay (you will find this game very difficult if that is your preferred playstyle). The tutorial is very helpful and critical to understanding the mechanics of the game - playing practice fights with the AI can help you get a grasp of how each character + weapon works. The combos are not complex since you are just moving and using the mouse, but things like timing, switching stances mid combo, parrying, and dodging are important to balance and master.

The feedback for where and how your sword will strike is provided by a faint aura showing the weapon path. Manipulate where you will strike by using the mouse and also by moving around. You can do air attacks by jumping first. 

There are different types of weapons, like katanas, longswords, and scimitars. Each weapon has different characteristics - for example: the katana is a fairly advanced weapon, inflicting heavy damage during counterattacks, but weaker in overall regular attacks. The longsword is pretty balanced and has a good blocking move. 

You have three different stances, fast, balanced, and heavy - you can switch at will by rolling the mouse wheel. Using these stances, there is a rock-paper-scissors element that becomes integral to survival in this game. When two swords hit at the same time, a parry happens; however, different stances will override the parry, inflicting damage and creating a window for counterattacking. You can switch stances in the middle of your combos, and this makes the game very intense when you are trying to strategize and outmaneuver your opponent. 

You can also cancel attacks to feint, and the tutorial does a good job of teaching you how to do this. 

In the beginning, when you are first learning to play, be prepared to die. A lot. If you play roguelike games or Demon/Dark Souls, you should be well accustomed to dying - it will be the same here. Even when you are defeating the AI consistently and with excessive ease, you will still die when you play online. Just remember, its all part of the learning process.

I noticed that the connection time can get pretty lengthy, so that is something to consider - there is also no average wait timer, so you can't know for sure how long it will take to find/enter a match. There is also a lot of complaints about the card drop rate - if this is something you care about, I have found this game to have the most ridiculous drop rates. I still have 3 drops left, and others have reported only 1 drop in 8 hours. This isn't too big of a deal if you intend to play this regularly, but definitely be aware.

This game definitely takes a significant amount of skill, and I advise you to stay away if you intend to play casually or do not like games that are too difficult. Otherwise, give it a try, and you may find the challenge to be to your taste.

Recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994653997', 'num_games_owned': 1439, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 820, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 370, 'last_played': 1662325076}
review:
A fast way to describe this game is like Jedi Academy meets Bushido Blade. 

If that isn't enough then the best way I can describe playing this game is with a story of my first win in a Duel. 
There are two kinds of servers you can play on, Free For All servers where you can practice and talk to other players or Dual servers where you go one on one in ranked matches. 

Whilst you are cued to fight you watch however is currently playing. The game operates on a "Winner stays on" system so a good player can stay on for dozens of matches. That was what was happening this time I was playing. The player who was controlling the ring was using a rapier, a sword that can break through a players guard easily and get a lot of low damage hits in. He had completely wiped the floor with me the first time we fought and so I got to watch him fight three other players before I got another try. 

I spent that time watching his tactics, the Rapier is great head on but does almost no damage if you try to swipe with it, so he was forcing the other player to come at him from the front. Either by throwing knives at them when they hung back or by diving in himself. In a sword clash or parry the Rapier will almost always come out on top so he was able to take people down with ease. Over the three fights I watch I figured out a strategy to take him down. 

I was using the Tone Death, the first Longsword you get in the game which is good for wide sweeping attacks. When the match started we bowed and then I started to circle him, trying to get in a position where I could get around and past his guard. He didn't seem to be expecting it when I finally came at him and, instead of meeting him head on, rolled past his guard and brought my sword round in a wide horizontal swipe that took of a good sized chunk of his health. 

The rest of the first round continued like that, with me chipping away at his health until he finally fell. The second round started differently, he came right in on the attack, striking at me and putting me on the backfoot. I rolled away as fast as I could to get away from his attack. I managed to land a few hits hear and there but he was hurting me more than I was hurting him. I was going to lose if that kept up

Charging up for a fast strike which would take of a huge chunk of my health if it landed, he came around for a final strike. You can shuffle back instead of rolling, it doesn't carry you as far but also doesn't leave you vulnerable to attack. So I started shuffling like a 50's singer and managed to dodge all three of his attacks along with the follow up. In the moment after his attack I brought my blade down it a heavy vertical strike and took of the rest of his health. 

His body slumped to the floor and I sheathed my blade as I let out a breath I hadn't even known I was holding. I don't think I have ever felt happier at winning a game in my life.

review: Blade Symphony is a third-person sword fighting game, this game is all about tactical combat and adapting to your favourite fighter and type of sword.  Along with amazing customization options and swords, there are many epic maps which are beautifully designed and built to provide those 'epic duel moments' that I've always wanted to see in a fighting game of any kind.  You can also spectate ranked matches on servers and watch pros unleash skills you might not know.  Blade symphony is easy to learn, but very hard to master.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007550860', 'num_games_owned': 517, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 516, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 516, 'last_played': 1405038652}
review:
Have you ever played an MMO and sat in front of a town dueling all day and then thought "I wish this could be the whole game"? That's pretty much Blade Symphony in a nutshell. The sword gameplay is fun, although the animations are stiff. There's a couple of characters that can be somewhat customized. The online community is small, but they were friendly and enjoyed the game. 

However if you're looking for ANY modes outside of 1vs1 dueling you won't get that here. The game has a lot of loss potential, especially with such nicely designed larger maps, due to its completely lack of versatility.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085491251', 'num_games_owned': 485, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 559, 'last_played': 1449103454}
review: so i've played this game for a few hours now and can honestly say that it's one of the best games ever played, but a factor that contributes to that is that im into swords and sword to sword combat and stuff like that. so for those other audiences that share the same factor as me, this game is definetly for you. now as for the game itself, i find it hard to believe that this only came out a few months ago. everything seems to run smoothly and i haven't run into any problems yet. the environments, though limited so far from what i've seen, are beautiful. the music fits really well, and the combat?? the amount of possibilities is too much to list. everything seems so fluid and well done. if there was a metal gear rising: revengeance online, i'd say this is the closest we'd get to it. so all in all, i give this game a 10/10 and highly reccomend it to competitve players, sword and sword combat fanatics, or anyone just looking for a change of pace from all the fps' that've come out lately. so as i said before, i highly reccomend you buy this game and support the developers so they can make the game even better than it already is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095506754', 'num_games_owned': 488, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1442327152}
review:
Este juego es JODIDAMENTE GENIAL.

-PROS-

¬∑Un manejo y un cuidado de movimientos de espada impresionante.
¬∑Alto repertorio de personalizaci√≥n, con archivos de workshop que realmente merecen la pena.
¬∑Dos modos de juego:Duelo y FFA(Free For All). En los servidores de duelo se te junta contra otro jugador y se os enfrenta en un combate. En los servidores de FFA se puede pelear contra todo el mundo al mismo tiempo, pero no se vera la barra de vida de los enemigos, lo que lo hace m√°s dif√≠cil. Tambi√©n puedes retar en duelos privados a los otros jugadores y pelear solos o ver a los dem√°s en sus duelos propios.
¬∑Interfaz y estilos de combate sencillos de comprobar.
¬∑Las posiciones(o "estados") de combate y el encadenamiento consecutivo de ataques de diferentes estados permite combos muy poderosos e impresionantes.
¬∑Es altamente divertido y muy desafiante.
¬∑Est√° muy bien optimizado y a√∫n teniendo unos gr√°ficos impresionantes va muy bien en t√©rminos de rendimiento y pocas veces se queda parado o se congela en medio de un duelo.

-CONS-

¬∑A veces puede tocarte en una partida el t√≠pico Willyrex-en-miniatura de mierda que se conoce todos los combos del juego y es un espadach√≠n pro que te mata sin moverse(Literalmente, yo me enfrent√© a uno que en todo el duelo s√≥lo esperaba a que atacara para hacer una finta y un contrataque)
¬∑Es probable que la mec√°nica de juego te resulte complicada, teniendo en cuenta que muchas veces se basa en buenos reflejos y astucia para saber afrontar cada situaci√≥n(No lo considero un punto malo, ya que me encantan los juegos dif√≠ciles o desafiantes, pero no es as√≠ para todos)
¬∑Aunque el juego est√° muy bien balanceado en cuanto a armas, personajes, estilos de combate... hay algunos puntos d√©biles que si se conocen se pueden explotar y explotar al contrario de paso(Cosas como paradas con un arma en espec√≠fico que al usarse contra otra arma en espec√≠fico te puede jorobar el resto del duelo, no pienso dar pistas para que lo busqu√©is vosotros) Sin embargo como esto se puede considerar "Skill" o "Capacidad de asimilaci√≥n"(As√≠ me lo dijo un guiri), pues no se si contarlo como punto malo...
¬∑Tarda entre 5 y 10 minutos de media para cargar el men√∫ principal o conectarse a alguna partida.

-ULTRA MEGA MIERDA-

¬∑Las partidas son creados por los jugadores, lo que est√° bien porque as√≠ el desarrollador no gasta m√°s dinero en mantener servidores, y te da m√°s opci√≥n a la personalizaci√≥n y la opci√≥n de jugar solo con amigos. El problema, es que como vivas en Espa√±a, o tienes una conexi√≥n de 9042309534786908 GB de la hostia o te comes m√≠nimo 250ms de ping. Para el que no lo entienda, el que juega en Espa√±a se arriesga a que todas las partidas en las que se meta no pueda pelear porque cuando le da click a atacar tu personaje no responde y el enemigo se ha teletransportado detr√°s de ti y te ha acuchillado antes de que el juego mande la se√±al de que est√°s muerto. Esto se√±ores es una puta mierda y hasta ahora solo he podido jugar en una partida en condiciones y aun as√≠ me iba un poco mal. Este error b√°sicamente me impide jugar contra personas, que es lo m√°s divertido y me tengo que conformar a pelear contra un bot que solo sabe hacer un movimiento. Adem√°s me imposibilita la personalizaci√≥n m√°s all√° del workshop, porque los objetos "vanilla"(O sea originales del juego) se desbloquean con monedas llamadas Notas, y esas Notas se consiguen ganando partidas contra personas. (Y que nadie diga que mi conexi√≥n es mala porque todos los dem√°s juegos online me van perfectamente)

-Resumen-

Blade Symphony es un juegazo de los que marcan. No solo est√° muy bien desarrollado si no que es muy divertido y mola mazo. Tiene problemas, desde cosas menores como lo de la dificultad a veces excesiva o animaciones un poco bug que no importan mucho, a cosas gordas como lo de la conexi√≥n que directamente me impiden jugar. Sin embargo si tienes suerte igual encuentras un servidor que vaya relativamente bien, y te lo pasaras genial. He de decir que hasta lo que se dice 4 d√≠as el juego estaba a√∫n en "Early Access"(El 7 de mayo el juego sali√≥ oficialmente), que para un juego que se termin√≥ oficialmente hace apenas 2 meses lo han hecho muy bien. Yo lo comprar√≠a aunque sea para probarlo, y alg√∫n d√≠a se solucionen los problemas m√°s importantes y todos vivamos en chuchelandia y nos apu√±alemos con bastoncitos de caramelo

review:
0/10 The Parkour Section ruined my life. Never forget.

In all seriousness:  This is one of the only games that can give me a sincere sense of tension and anxiety. Those moments when you and your opponent are both an inch away from death can really get my heart racing. If you love fighting games with insane depth then this is the game for you.

Or if you love brutally difficult parkour courses that you get through with sweet ninja sword techniques, this is also the game for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198092265875', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 8284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7572, 'last_played': 1497492163}
review:
When I bought this game, I loved it. It was fun to play a fighting game that, unlike mortal kombat (in example), did not require me to learn 80 buttons to do 1 move. So I will start with the positives. (long review I know, sorry, if anyone feels these are false please feel free to state your opinion. But this is how The game seems to me and many people I have heard in game) PS summary at the end  (not very detailed but just my opinion on genral aspects I feel are flawed and my suggestion on whether or not to purchase the game)

     -Characters to fit the individual. Characters have their own fighting styles which players can choose from to what they feel is right for them.
     -Sword types that have their own unique properties which can be used to enhance a characters abilities depending on their match.
     -Steam worshop for custom sword skins, because it's nice to have a good-looking sword along with a custom helmet.
     -Easy to learn combat system- It is nice that opposed to pressing 2 buttons on each side of your keyboard, you just switch between 3 stances and attack while moving in one direction standard wasd and left mouse click. Easy and effective.
     
Now the negatives.
     -FPS: not a problem for a while, but Many people start to have extreme fps drop and lag after playing for a certain amount of time. In my case i start to lag every 10 minutes, in which case I need to close it and restart steam to fix. Then it will be perfect again, not time consuming but bothersome.
     -Character moves... Remember how I said characters are unique and fitted for different individuals, well that's a nice concept. If they were not so annoyingly over powered. The character Phalanx can attack at extreme distances that cannot be escaped and are hard to manuveur against, the character judgement can kill in 1-3 hits, Ryo (op as well but hes my character so my word is biased), Pure... not often complained about.
          -Prior to certain updates some characters had extreme strenghts when people started complaining an update was made that bumped up every character... except Ryo  (downgraded since he was the most complained about) 
     -Horrible parry system as of now. If an enemy attacks and is finished, but still has his sword touching the floor and you jump attack him/her you will be stunned because of the tracers left behind.
     -Community: okay for the most part many people of high rank always like to talk down to those below them. I Earlier the players were much more helpful and wanted newbies to get better. Not really the case anymore...
     -ALT-TABS I love this feature taking initeative. This game for me and many other people who have said it in game, always alt tabs for no reason and it always takes like 10 seconds to come back (in which case your most likely dead because the community is full of people who like to attack you while typing, or alt tabbed[maybe an accident but i doubt one who runs away then attacks when you stop moving is mistaken...])
     -one glitch in city map where you get stuck if on certain side of the rooftop.
     -Community friendly chat. People are nice to talk to but the conversations are 50% of the time just about how 1 character is too op (then in another server youll hear the exact opposite.) other 50% communit can be quite friendly.

Summary:
               Blade Symphony is a game with great potential and can be a fun game. Ranking system should be, perhaps, more complex as it is to plain to be accurate. The characters are lacking balance and makes the game more about picking a character for each fight as opposed to allowing the individual to progress with the character they like the most. fps issue and certain bugs must be dealt with. Overall broken combat system makes this game less and less realistic as a fighting game (in that I mean this game is currently all about jumping and running around) to include the aweful parrying system and poor tracer effects. Perhaps a game I would suggest to buy on sale as I do hope that the devs will fix these issues in which case I feel this game could be very good. But I would not purchase it at full price. Other reviews may say otherwise but before wasting your money I hope you will take in consideration and actually think about the fact that onky 30-70 people actually play this game still.. (no understatement.) Leaving you with mainly empty servers. or servers a region/country that might not be near you that actually do have some people..

author: {'steamid': '76561198005165207', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 137, 'playtime_forever': 431, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 399, 'last_played': 1434658877}

author: {'steamid': '76561197967728395', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 442, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 431, 'last_played': 1405252529}
review:
This game is a really good example of why you don't overthink a good concept. The premise is really good - a variety of swords & fighting styles in either ffa or duels. Unfortunately, the game has just an overly-complex combat system - it typically devolves into lmb spam. Unfortunately, I can't really recommend this game at any price - either as a fighting game or a sword combat game, there are other games that achieve the goals of this one at a fraction of the cost.

[b]Pros:[/b]
Beautiful Graphics
Amazing Variety of Swords & Fight Styles
Steam Card drops

[b]Cons:[/b]
The controls are abysmally bad - making the game nearly unplayable
The Stance System bogs down the game play, rather than enhances it
The community is very small, so new games are hard to come by
There is no single player option

author: {'steamid': '76561198028375811', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 502, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 502, 'last_played': 1405188365}

author: {'steamid': '76561197998453563', 'num_games_owned': 846, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 131, 'last_played': 1405360197}
review:
I'm having a lot of fun in this game, but I do have some gripes

The tutorial is pretty bad. Leaves out a lot of stuff like movement (running along walls) and theres a part where you have to fight a fast AI and a long-reach AI. The game does not advise you on how to do it so I just get my ass handed to me and just spam click until its over and learn nothing from it. I don't get the chance to.

People tend to use shurikens at the start and end of duels. Fuck them. I don't know how to use them either (thanks to the tutorial) and it seems blocking them is random. It takes down a good bit of your health and homes in on enemies. Fuck these and everyone who uses them

The game itself is super fun and so far, the people in it are very cool, too. Workshop items are amazing and everyone can see them if they're approved.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010706519', 'num_games_owned': 1060, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 320, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 146, 'last_played': 1474869672}
review:
I was Worried about purchasing this because i didn't think there was all that much too it and i would get bored within a few hours.  After finishing the tutorial and joining an online server I learned not only did i still have plenty to learn but how great the community is. 

The game Is beautiful not only in its asthetics but also with the animations that all seem to flow really well together and in the heat of a duel it often looks like the 2 combatants are locked in dance rather than Combat.  The 4 different characters all have a Unique yet believable Fighting style which does suit certain sword types better than others but doesn't limit you.  (The first time you see a knight/samurai use a Rapier like it was a longsword you might laugh a bit.)  There is a character and sword combination for everyone.  

There are no Upgrades or unlockables that change how you play or make you better the only thing that makes you more successful at the game is practice.  If you make a mistake you will know and most likely lose a large percentage of your health.

The community is friendly and if you are having trouble you could join pretty much any one of the servers and ask for help and get it.  Though there still are those few players who are venom (Those who are just rude and sore winners/losers) but for the majority Your duels will always end with "Good fight!" "well played"  "GG" "That was a close fight!"  Its rare these days to see a community who are so willing to help each other the only other game I can think of with such a good community would be the PAYDAY community.  

So yes After all this ranting I would Recommend this game to anyone whether or not your a sword fighting enthusiast or just want to enjoy a solid game (did i mention its built on the source engine?)

author: {'steamid': '76561198005217817', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 533, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 496, 'last_played': 1413586722}
review:
Its a great game! The visuals are nice and so is the combat, im having alot of fun with it.
+ theres steam workshop for it so theres alot of customisation

BUT... theres always a "but"
so far there are 2 thing that i dont like
1. No matchmaking. You just join a lobby and duel people, not that bad is it? Well on my 2nt duel i got matched up with someone that just so happened to be 20th in the ranking (out of 10 000 players). Needless to say i lost 15/2 (HA GOT HIM TWICE)
2. The game promises Tactical Sword Fighting but from what i've seen so far all that the "top players" do is just jump around like retard (i dont mean wall running or cool tricks like that... just jumping) while spamming theyr charge attack. 3-4 hits like that and you're dead... yeah.... tactical... but dueling a lower ranked player is quite enjoyble.

I would still recommend it because like i said, its fun... and thats what games are for right?

author: {'steamid': '76561198122550158', 'num_games_owned': 530, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 310, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 231, 'last_played': 1522696979}
review: I highly recommend this to anybody who liked Soul Caliber, but is looking for something a little more in depth. For starters there are a few different sword types, each type doing different amounts of damage depending on how and where you strike. The best part about this game to me is all of the user generated content. My character (Ryoku, he does a lot of breakdancing while I swing my sword around xD) is currently wearing a Jack of Blades mask, and fighting with Elucidator (From SAO). The game itself is beautiful, especially for an Early Access game, and the game has lots of polish. If youre a big fan of games like Chivalry or Kingdoms Rise but want a little more feudal Japan in your world, definately check this game out!

author: {'steamid': '76561198106034611', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 451, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 434, 'last_played': 1503800549}
review: FIrst of all let me address the graphics. This game is beautiful, and while the textures aren't the greatest, this game is dripping with style. at least in the form of the characters. Some of the levels, while their layouts are excellent and give alot of opportunity for varied gameplay, are a bit bland. The characters themselves are beautifully styled and handle completely differently from each other. The fighting is simple to learn but difficult to master and there are many subtleties to learn for those that are into that kind of thing. The music is it's own piece of greatness as it really is spectacular. Aside from the slick and stellar combat, the music is the highpoint of this game. Mixing oriental and western influences, the music is original and fantastic. I highly recommend this game to any who like fighting games, and even to those who do not but wish to try something different

author: {'steamid': '76561198009097768', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 2152, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1898, 'last_played': 1408327412}
review:
A clash of swords rings through the battlefield, it's just you and your opponent in this tiny epitome of battle. You circle your opponent, and dash, feint, and jab towards him. All the while, your opponent has gotten some blood on you from a few well placed strikes, but you know if you could just get inside of his defenses, you would win within seconds.

He swings too early, you dash forward and shove your sword through his stomach, complete a series of moves, grab him, and throw him to the ground as he bleeds out. He dies in front of you. You win.

Truly a dance of death, a symphony of slaying.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029828587', 'num_games_owned': 470, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 161, 'last_played': 1399828234}
review:
First off. a disclaimer:I don't like this game because I was hoping for a 'Bushido Blade' game, like way back on the PS1. Ultra realistic (as a game could be) A few stances and almost accidental combos that did exist but where a nightmare to memorise and know when to pull off. The idea was realism in sword fighting. A few tense jabs of tension and then a flurry and someone would be dead or bleeding to death. Ocassionally someone would take a light wound and make a come back, but it was rare. You could run about the scenery for a while, but at some point you just had to assume a stance and swing your sword and hope you guessed your opponents intentions.

On the other hand we have 'Blade Symphony' which is basically hop, spin and jab.And a lot of jumping and spinning around, I mean a lot of jumping. The advertisements shows a thing of elegance and beauty that doesn't translate into the gameplay.

It's kind of a Manga versus reality situation: and Blade Symphony is totally Manga, If wall hopping and spinning left and right , and VERY importantly: you're willing to put up with no real match making system based on rank - you'll have a hard time finding fellow noobs - then go for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061684288', 'num_games_owned': 887, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 500, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 254, 'last_played': 1632593171}
review:
This is an extremely addicting game...

For the first couple of hours.

It's incredibly fun and all of the classes have their own things to get used to, which will give you a few good hours of gameplay.

If you're playing with (against) friends, it's even more enjoyable.

I wouldn't say but it full price, but if it's on sale, and you're a fan of fighters that require skill, pick it up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062785811', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 2206, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1647, 'last_played': 1435024076}
review:
Blade Symphony is a supprisingly fun game. Like all games however, you must get over the community before everything else. The majority of the players are still learning the ropes and will most likely be general assholes to you. However the Vets are kind and willing to help you improve your prefrormance. The ranking system goes from Oak < Iron < Steel < Diamond < Master. It is a tad weird how the system works , but all and all it pushes you to verse people that are higher level than you to get higher results. The more you lose in the game the more you head into Oak tier. 
Moving on the the playing style. There are 4 characters you can choose from and each have a strength and a weakness. No class is OP nor is any class lagging behind. Pick and choose your battles wisely and learn all the characters! 

Remember to bow as the match first starts! Otherwise you look like a general ass. 
Have fun!

author: {'steamid': '76561197990903648', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1402460528}
review: This game requires some time to pick up various techniques during combat, becuase from my perspective when I bought this game was it might be a straight hack n slash with few move which that wasn't the case. The bulk of Blade Symphony's core fighting mechanics, duel mode stages, and  characters are well designed in general, but this makes the numerous flaws and incomplete areas that pop up all the more glaring.The tutorial itself gets things off to a poor start. While doing a decent job of explaining the basics of combat, it isn't complete. I also feel that the multiplayer aspect is also rather lackluster becuase it is focused mostly on dueling. I think this game has a chance to shine so I would still recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121551767', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 595, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 532, 'last_played': 1448243947}
review:
Gameplay,
As a person who plays a lot of fighting games, this is does pretty well for a sword fighting game. With 4 characters offering varying playstyles, no player is left regretting their decision on buying this game. The parrying is very well made and blatantly adds a whole another level of things to master to truly be good at the game. They also offer 4 different types of swords with different statistics to fit the player's playstyle, there are also no bonuses given for those who actually change into a different sword with the same type. All of the swords are just models with the same damage output and playstyle. The graphics, textures, and quality are also very good and the game can still run very well on older computers/non-gaming computers.However, not one game is without flaws. The two problems I've had  are the lack of story line in this game and while I do realize this game was made for multiplayer, it is rather disappointing there is no actual singleplayer other than the practice mode against bots. There are also some RARE game impacting glitches, however they are getting fixed. This is however, rather expected of a rather new game that just came out a month ago. Overall, I give the gameplay an 8/10 and I expect it to become more polished in the future.

Community,
The community is very helpful and nice. Players will bow to honor the fight has begun. Almost everyone just lets you have a timeout whenever you encounter a problem, whether it be lag or just things in real life. New players will not be left feeling disappointed nor clueless, since other players who are experienced with the game "spar" with the new player and tell them what they do wrong and what they can do to fix it. Also, another addition to the game is it's compatible with the Steam Workshop, meaning you can add new weapons and clothes to your character while without any actual bonuses, it still makes you feel like a complete and utter badass. Overall, I would give the community a 10/10

Conclusion,
For a game that is only $15 I have massive praise for this game for being so well done and lets the community in itself make the new content for this game. The graphics are good, the gameplay is smooth, and the community is helpful, I truly see this as a game any fighting game player would want to have. I give this a solid 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198036529334', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4549, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1027, 'last_played': 1592875553}
review: This game has the best sword fighting mechanics I've seen since Jedi Outcast. It's amazing that this was made by one person. There's a lot of depth in the fighting system, and it's all very well balanced for player skill, so the noobs can still be competitive as they learn. You can get by spamming fast fencing thrusts for a bit, but eventually you'll run into someone who knows how to counter it and get stomped into mulch until you learn how to adapt. This has a better tutorial than most fighting games, but learning each character's ins and outs is a bit time-consuming. Despite this, I highly recommend Blade Symphony for being one of the rare games that does real-time sword fighting well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051079368', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 4010, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1364, 'last_played': 1409765462}
review:
'My opponent was jumping straight at me, and just when I thought I had him countered, he rewises his trajectory in mid-air, then landing sword first on my poor face. After the match, when I asked him what it was, he answered mystically, 'It's called air canceling'. That got me wondering, so it wasn't cheating or lag, but a trick within the game's rules... After a few minutes in the training room, I realized I could pull off the same move with some practice, though using it in a match... Well, that was another story...' Then I realized something bigger, this game was much like swordfighting or martial arts in itself... The only way to reach the next level is to learn with your (avatar's) body, feeling it all through combat.

But just how do you recommend a game that's a cross between fighting games and third person action? Well, there's just nothing quite like this anywhere. The combat is a mix of 'FPS-twitchiness' and hack-and-slash, combined with hp bars, rounds and move dynamics of your average fighting game. 

While weapons differ to a lesser degree, the 4 classes all have a distinct feel to them. But just comparing the diversity of the classes and moves doesn't do this thing right--- There's just so many ways to do battle, spam fast attacks and find yourself countered by a heavier attack (or not if you spaced yourself right). Thought you had it all calculated and fall into an attack cancel, taking a heavy blow to yer face. While the tutorial and basic mechanics feel very barebones, there's just so much to find out on your own, this game would last ages for anyone with even a little competitive spirit.

To top it all off, there's free workshop content for customising your look in any manner you like, crazy anime weaponry, cardboard tubes, ski poles and of course videogame swords. Most of the community is also very helpful and there is a samurai-like code of honour when it comes to dueling. The only downside is that the majority of the remaining population has been playing for months now, meaning that any newbies like yours truly will have their bottoms handsomely handed to themselves.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962269921', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 3677, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3618, 'last_played': 1438910678}
review:
Interesting game, but not worth the money or time. The entire game / content can be absorbed in about 15 minutes, as there are only a few playable characters and moves are simply combinations of other moves. If you have a group of hard-core fighting game friends you may still be bored out of your mind after a few play sessions, as there is simply not enough things to do to keep playing the game. To compare, Soul Calibur has 20+ characters each with dozens of unique moves.

To make matters worse the game is entirely multiplayer. There is absolutely no single player content or anything to do by yourself. The "practice" mode is not even helpful. Compare to Soul Calibur, you have multiple modes ot try things out and learn against AI opponents. This game gives you one randomly spawned AI character.

Being only multiplayer means you will be subject to ping issues, trolls, server disconnect/lag, and in general you will find yourself spending a lot of time watching other people fight, finding maps, or swtiching between levels. A common session is start playing, join a server, then wait for a while to play. Right before your turn the server changes maps.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977154621', 'num_games_owned': 132, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 16592, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6270, 'last_played': 1691348866}
review:
This is a fantastic game, well worth buying.  It has easy to learn, difficult to master combat mechanics that are for the most part extremely well balanced. In fact, there is nothing in this game that can't be countered or out-strategized in this game, and very few exploits that seem unfair. The true magic here is that even the exploits are balanced. The price paid for this fine balance is that there are only four characters, but they are genuinely different and equally viable characters. Get fluent with the controls, and they can become an extension of yourself. That is more than can be said for most fighting games.

Learning the game past a certain level can be a traumatic experience, and one area the developers should work on is improving the offline training facility and tutorial. It is not adequate, and venturing into duels with only the current offline training is suicide for all but the most twitchy ADHD junky. The best advice is to proceed directly into one of the FFA serves and talk to people, learn the ropes there. The community is your best friend here. But nothing beats the adrenaline of fighting duels, and that's where the true test of skill comes out. The community will not be your best friend there. They will poke you to death. I will, at any rate.

About that  community. At least in Australia, it is a model of what an online gaming community should be: hilarious, obsessive, friendly with just the right number of trolling bastards to keep things lively.  The game modes might seem limited to 1v1 and 2v2 duels, but there is a lot of fun to be had in player-organized events, especially if you like some chaotic fun. 
 
Lastly: the action is fast and relies on very narrow windows of opportunity, so there will be issues if you try to play it with a high ping. This is a recipe for frustration, and the best attitude is to think of ping as an additional, advanced challenge. Seek out a server with low ping to learn, or most of the subtlety and elegance of the game will not be apparent.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043091908', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 11528, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10680, 'last_played': 1511567308}
review:
There aren't many people playing anymore, that's a fact. Those still playing are mostly veterans, who have already been playing for years, like me. 

However, I see so many negative reviews complaining about the player base that I can't help but say in this review that if those people didn't stop playing after seeing only 4 or so players on a server, or because they got beaten by skilled players, the game could become more popular again.

So, if you're a new player getting destroyed by veterans, don't ragequit, ask for tips/help and keep playing a bit more, it'd really help the small player base out.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989973155', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4456, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4264, 'last_played': 1478669733}
review:
What can I say? This is probably one of the best sword fighting games I've played so far. This is a very technical, skill based fighter which demands a lot of practice and a lot of cunning. The game really shines with its 1v1 duels, with very little lag issues so long as you're playing with low ping, and each character has a unique fighting style with a bit of a learning curve to get used to. If you like dueling in Chivalry and/or Dark Souls pvp, then you'll like this game.

The Steam Workshop is also a huge blessing, since you're allowed to download and/or upload your favorite blades for use in-game. Most of them won't be seen by everyone else, but even having them available clientside is pretty awesome.

On the downside, it isn't 100% balanced, but that's to be expected from most fighters anyway. The rating system as I write this right now is also a little funky, constantly switching you between tiers and you win and lose matches, but it's not the worst thing I've seen and it really doesn't matter anyway. There's also a lack of content as, outside of dueling, there really isn't anything else to do.

Definately consider this one though. I find it well worth the investment, but it's not really for everybody.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055222922', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 311, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 190, 'last_played': 1486953238}
review:
A long time ago i tried an idependent fighter called the showdown effect, it was a broken mess that relied on visual effects. When I saw Blade Symphony I thought it would be a similar disaster. But this was good because I was completely wrong about this game. I love games like legend of zelda and no more heroes, especially the sword mechanics, and the ones in this game... are brilliant. It's strategy on steroids. There are so many variations in how you can play that it's just... unbelievable. I heard the guy who made this game spent 8 years on it. To the creator of this game. If you see this then I want to say thank you. When someone shows dedication to making a game like this the rewards should be great. The graphics remind me of the kind of style in the infinity blade games. Before I give my final thoughts I'd like to acknowledge one more aspect. The music. It's a blast to listen to while fighting. 

All of this combined made an epic setting for a video game that I haven't seen in years. This is innovative, and should not be overlooked.

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197991859824', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 67, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1401628002}
review:
The premise of this game is an interesting one. The idea of a fighting game based on real skill and sword fighting, rather than ludicrous button combos or spaimming weak attacks, is a very inviting one.

In reality what you get is a game where your character flails around wildly and jumps around like a spider monkey. It is nothing like a real duel. The free 3D movement is incredibly clunky. The tutorials are incredibly unhelpful, and there is little oppurtunity for training. 

The game has potential, but right now feels completely unfinsihed and broken. Maybe it will improve over time, but I'm not holding my breath.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059137211', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 148, 'last_played': 1405966028}
review:
All in all, not a bad game I mean, the idea, the models, it's all there but I feel like the actual issue is the animations, they lack action, certain movements are good others you feel no weight to the action, they swing the sword as if it was made of weightless plastic, and some  movements are just painful to look at. The walking animations of quite a few stances are... Off balance, they walk awkwardly with no sense of balance.

While the game is good, I would not recommend it to anyone just yet, I feel it's terribly unfinished.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060591956', 'num_games_owned': 479, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 1083, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 817, 'last_played': 1436740830}
review:
This game is simply amazing. The fighting styles, the techniques, the way in which it's not just continuing clicking on the same damn button as if it was Mortal Kombat or any fighting game that requires amazing combos to beat a person yet they use the same button. ANYWAYS, this game let's you have the fun of kicking someones butt. Despite how many times you're going to lose at the beginning, you'll begin to understand that this game is not easy at it seems to be. 

Set aside from this, Blade Symphony is a third-person 3D swordfighting indie game which focuses primarly on multiplayer. It takes you to the basics of how swordsmen actually battle. Every attack has an opening so timing in this game is efficent or else you'll lose badly. You choose how you want to attack the person and which every attack, there's a different set of styles depending on the character you chose to play as. Advanced play has been primarily used by players who are masters in this game while the newcomers only know basic mechanics and so on. While the masters use all their flawless techniques, the newcomers would only not know how to time their attacks but also use basic fighting styles with little less combos that create openings for the masters. Many newcomers will not want to learn how to play the game therefore leading them to not only not knowing how to play it but losing in an instant to the masters or other players who had been learning this game for quite a while.

Other than that, this game like I said before, I love it. It's awesome. The community in this game is not so mean but at the same, not so friendly. So you could say it's in the middle. I see no reason to get bored of this game when it's gamemode is primarily on multiplayer with Steam Workshop items you could download from. Learning how to play something will increase your benefit of actually having a chance to win at a battle rather just going on full force with one blow.Well, have a nice time in this game and wish you the best of luck!

author: {'steamid': '76561198077433564', 'num_games_owned': 452, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 482, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 369, 'last_played': 1417293978}

author: {'steamid': '76561198010246863', 'num_games_owned': 298, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 4266, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4168, 'last_played': 1476175578}
review:
STOP BEFORE YOU BUY THIS! Get it on sale. In it's current form it is worth 7-10 dollars like Jedi Knight Jedi Academy was when still in stores; however, unlike JK: JA, this game has questionable balance issues and no single player content... of course unless you want to fight a weak training bot for hours on in. 

PROS:

Skill Based
Workshop 
Active Community 
Rank System
Intricate Sword Fighting Mechanics
High Replay Value

CONS:

Skill Based
Small Community
Rank System is flawed
Questionable Balance issues
Small Content
Repetative
Infuriating at times

edit:

I've changed my recommendation. The community is scarce. You will be buying a game and playing against people who've played for a long time and stuck with it while the new players left town.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970585475', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 1850, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 833, 'last_played': 1630503899}

author: {'steamid': '76561198011866221', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 186, 'last_played': 1460533164}
review:
I just simply love the depth of this game. Especially changing stance mid-attack, using feints, the swords clashing, it really gets intense.

I also love how the sword TYPE is the only weapon difference, with appearance not adding more than appearances. You get several types and character types. Each character has different moves and strengths/weaknesses. While each sword will modify attack speed and damage, with pros and cons.

So there is a lot of room to experiment with. I especially LOVE the depth of each type of gameplay. I've only played one vs one and found it easy to pick up and learn. It's definitely easy to pick up, but hard and rewarding to master.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042703602', 'num_games_owned': 337, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 301, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 250, 'last_played': 1400536268}
review:
Its been a while since i found a game with the sort of fighting style. its alot of fun to play. FFA sometimes can get annoying with people randomly attacking you when you are trying to find a duel, but still alot of fun either way. If you like a good sword fighting game that takes timing and some skill, be sure to check this one out.

I tend to go into games like thesee with low expectations, so this really didnt disappoint me.

Recommend, 8/10

review:
Og√≥≈Çem

Blade Symphony to bijatyka online stworzona przez niezale≈ºne studio Puny Human Games. Niedawno gra wysz≈Ça z wczesnego dostƒôpu. Oto najwa≈ºniejsze cechy gry: only-multiplayer, dedykowane serwery, wsparcie dla Steam Workshop, customizacja postaci, 4 postacie (na razie), 3 style walki.

System walki

Zacznijmy od najwa≈ºniejszego, czyli systemu walki. Jest on dosyƒá rozbudowany ze wzglƒôdu na podzia≈Ç na 3 style oraz 4 postacie, kt√≥rymi ka≈ºdƒÖ z osobna gra siƒô inaczej. Wyr√≥≈ºniamy styl szybki, w kt√≥rym zadajemy lekkie obra≈ºenia, zbalansowany i wolny, w kt√≥rym zadajemy potƒô≈ºne ciosy. Wszystkie style mo≈ºemy ≈ÇƒÖczyƒá robiƒÖc tym samym efektowne combo. Ataki mieczem mo≈ºemy wyprowadzaƒá w prawo i w lewo, co dodaje wiele mo≈ºliwo≈õci na arenie walki. Dodatkowo mo≈ºemy atakowaƒá z powietrza i blokowaƒá ciosy przeciwnk√≥w oraz wykonaƒá ‚Äûsuper-atak‚Äù, kt√≥ry po za≈Çadowaniu (przytrzymaniu LPM lub PPM ‚Äì przy obronie) zadaje krytyczne obra≈ºenia. Jak ju≈º wspomnia≈Çem w grze mamy do dyspozycji 4 postacie. Judgement to najbardziej uniwersalna postaƒá. Jest stosunkowo szybka i silna. Phalanx wyr√≥≈ºnia siƒô atakami na d≈Çugi zasiƒôg. Ryoku jest szybki i bardzo zwinny (nawet za bardzo, ale o balansie za chwilkƒô). Pure to mistrz akrobacji, jest bardzo trudna do opanowania (i niepraktyczna). Je≈ºeli do 3 styl√≥w walki, zr√≥≈ºnicowanych atak√≥w i 4 postaci dodamy jeszcze multum mieczy robi nam siƒô z tego imponujƒÖco rozbudowany system walki, kt√≥ry jednak ma wielki minus, a o tym poni≈ºej.

Balans

Balans w bijatykach to podstawa i niestety w tym aspekcie Blade Symphony radzi sobie ≈õrednio. Ryoku jest bardzo szybki, co powoduje ze jest bardzo trudny do pokonania, poniewa≈º gdy dostajemy obra≈ºenia nie mo≈ºemy nic zrobiƒá, a on mo≈ºe robiƒá w ≈Çatwy spos√≥b skuteczne uniki. Pure nie gra prawie nikt, bo podczas wyprowadzania cios√≥w wykonuje szpagaty, ta≈Ñczy i skacze, a w tym czasie nasz oponent wyprowadza kontre lub po prostu robi unik. KolejnƒÖ rzeczƒÖ sƒÖ miecze, jest ich wiele i nie sprawdzi≈Çem ka≈ºdego (gdybym to zrobi≈Ç to ta recenzja zosta≈Çaby napisana w 2015), odblokowujemy je przy pomocy ‚Äûkarteczek‚Äù, kt√≥re zdobywamy za wygrane walki. D≈Çuga rolka z papieru toaletowego, tak dok≈Çadnie wydawa≈Çoby siƒô ≈ºe to musi byƒá bardzo s≈Çabe, a jest na odwr√≥t. ‚ÄûMiecz‚Äù ten blokuje ataki i zadaje bardzo du≈ºe obra≈ºenia. Na szczƒô≈õcie nie wszystkie miecze pasujƒÖ do ka≈ºdej postaci, wiƒôc trzeba pr√≥bowaƒá i uczyƒá siƒô ka≈ºdego ostrza. Wydajƒô mi siƒô ≈ºe wszystkie te rzeczy mo≈ºna zbalansowaƒá w jednym patchu.

Czapki i parkour

W grze mamy stosunkowo rozbudowanƒÖ customizacjƒô naszych bohater√≥w. Mo≈ºemy dobieraƒá miecze, nakrycia g≈Çowy, i ca≈Çe stroje. ≈öwietne jest to ≈ºe gra posiada wsparcie dla Workshopu, w kt√≥rym ju≈º teraz znajduje siƒô wiele ciekawych stroj√≥w zrobionych przez graczy (jak i r√≥wnie≈º mapy !). Je≈õli chodzi o poruszanie siƒô postaciƒÖ po lokacjach to mamy mo≈ºliwo≈õƒá biegania po ≈õcianach, robienia przewrot√≥w, odbijania siƒô od ≈õcian oraz wbiegania po ≈õcianach na wy≈ºej usytuowane miejsca.

Gdzie tu pisze ≈ºe to jest Alpha ?

No w≈Ça≈õnie nigdzie, bo tw√≥rcy uznali ≈ºe gra jest sko≈Ñczona, a nie jest. 4 postacie w bijatyce online ! 4 postacie !!!!!!!!!!!!!!! 4 !!!!!!!! CZTERY !!!!!!!!!! Tw√≥rcy obiecywali ≈ºe dodadzƒÖ wiƒôcej, ale pewnikiem nie umieli ju≈º wytrzymaƒá i w ko≈Ñcu wcisnƒôli wielki czerwony przycisk RELEASE. Niestety ta gra mia≈Ça wielki potencja≈Ç, lecz nie zosta≈Ç on w pe≈Çni wykorzystany przez ma≈ÇƒÖ ilo≈õƒá postaci, tryb√≥w, a w szczeg√≥lno≈õci przez brak jakiegokolwiek wyzwania dla gracza. SƒÖ ligi, kt√≥re jako≈õ ma≈Ço mnie emocjonujƒÖ skoro na jednym serwerze mogƒÖ byƒá ci s≈Çabi jak i ci mocni, a tw√≥rcy nie wpadli na to ≈ºe mo≈ºna zrobiƒá tryb turniejowy, w kt√≥rym rozgrywaƒá mo≈ºna pojedynki na ma≈Çej arenie z losowymi przeciwnikami w tej samej lidze. T≈Çumaczenie tw√≥rc√≥w: ‚ÄûJeste≈õmy ma≈Çym niezale≈ºnym zespo≈Çem ze znikomym bud≈ºetem:, jako≈õ mnie nie przekonuje do tego ≈ºeby wydawaƒá nie uko≈ÑczonƒÖ grƒô. Je≈ºeli lubisz bijatyki, w kt√≥rych wa≈ºny jest timing, skill i taktyka to polecam gorƒÖco. Jednak je≈ºeli lubisz gry z du≈ºƒÖ zawarto≈õciƒÖ i postawionym przed graczem wyzwaniem, czy chocia≈º no nie wiem levelowaniem postaci, to po kilku mo≈ºe kilkunastu godzinach zrozumiesz ≈ºe nie ma sensu dalej w to graƒá. PodsumowujƒÖc mnie osobi≈õcie ta gra siƒô podoba i mo≈ºe jak bƒôdƒô chcia≈Ç powalczyƒá na miecze to w≈ÇƒÖczƒô Blade Symphony, bo ma klimat i jest bardzo grywalna.

Ocena: 7+/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198038104218', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 300, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 205, 'last_played': 1412902698}
review:
I-I think I'm in love!
This game is Great! I bought the humble bundle to raise some money for the red cross ($10 to be exact) thinking that I would never play this hunk o' junk, well I was wrong. Though there are some bad parts about this game like I hate how its in the future, the character animations are wierd, and occasionally it the fighting is unfluient. Aside from that, I love it! The fighting looks absolutly sick! You can run on walls and do backflips and all that. Don't get me started about how smart the AI is! The AI is probably the smartest I have seen in a game. It starts out slow, but as you win more it gets harder and harder until you lose to the point you rage quit. As updatesgo on I expect it to reach the score of 9.5/10 for me. Right now however I am giving it a 7.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198031160707', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 1625, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 641, 'last_played': 1588846377}
review:
Do you enjoy katana's scimitars, fencing coils, and a lot of other swords? Do you want to stab someone with a pencil? or a lightsaber? or THE KATANA FROM GURREN LAGANN. or do you want to be fancy? do you just want to stab people epicly? This is the game for you.

[UPDATE, YEAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAARS LATER] It's weird looking back on that time. When the game was alive. It had the modding support, it had the player base, it had the tournaments, videos of tournaments, faffing bout with fun stuff, and customizing.

The first blow was a simple one- they took away the customizing.
I remember it, because that's when I left, all those lovely, I want to say thousands of workshop items?

Gone. Doesn't work anymore, and what customization there is, there's that painful dark 'pay for this for customization' option. Which, granted. May have worked if they didn't remove the customization.

The second blow I'd have to imagine was the free to play. I bought it way back then, and got off it, but if I had bought it more recently and was stuck with it more? It'd feel like a betrayal.

Sure those two things alone can't kill a good game. But the third and fatal blow fell-
The players didn't find it fun anymore, the life sucked out of them they left.
Sure not all at once but the majority, just left. And in a game like this, you need at least two willing to play.

Good luck to you if you want to have fun with this, I wish it the best.
But it's not for me anymore.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025335532', 'num_games_owned': 181, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 166, 'last_played': 1447535751}
review: Super fun. It's got a street-fighter vibe to it, or a 1v1 in Super Smash Bros. Except you're dueling with swords. I don't think it can really get any better than that. There are four characters with four very distinct personalities when it comes to fighting, and each can be manipulated to suit a certain fighting style, especially with weapon selection. All-in-all, it's a really fun game and the players seem like a nice enough community. The inclusion of Steam Workshop is an awesome plus too. Ever wanted to fight with the Master Sword? A lightsaber? A giant pencil? Here's your chance.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058533589', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1025, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1025, 'last_played': 1400904121}
review:
Blade Symphony is an excellent game, and is a prime example of how users and developers can stay in touch and collectively make the game what people want to play and how they want to see the material of the game advance and adapt. With full Workshop availability, customization and visuals, this allows for an extremely immersive and relatable experience.

As far as gameplay goes, the different types of weapons, characters, and skill sets make each matchup its own experience, and perpetuates the adventure and strategic value within the game! Figuring out different swords, characters and combos with each make for a fun game, and one that retains balance - an important concept to consider when it comes to fighting games!

The ranked system should be explained in more detail, but otherwise seems to be fair judgment. To put it simply, this game is an incredible experience, amazing detail to graphics and sword techniques in the real world, and makes for an interesting and fun, renewed experience that players are sure to love.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093892118', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1350, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 956, 'last_played': 1434908508}
review: Blade Symphony ist ein PvP-Schwertkampf Spiel, welches sich entweder im 1 v 1, 2 v 1, 2 v 2, Free-For-All, "Hero"-Modus oder doch einfach gegen NPC's zum Training spielen l√§sst. Es ist optisch wirklich sch√∂n gestaltet und √ºber die Steuerung kann, zumindest ich, mich nicht beklagen. Die Soundeffekte m√∂gen recht ungewohnt sein, durch monotonen Toneinsatz in diversen anderen Spielen, sind aber dennoch gut eingebaut und mal was anderes. Allerdings finde ich, dass sich dort noch einige Dinge verbessern lassen, wie (evtl. Performance, also fl√ºssigeres Spielerlebnis) brachialere Optik der Angriffe, oder v√∂llig neue Angriffe durch die vielen verschiedenen Kombo-"ketten" zwischen Luft-,Schnell-,Balance- und Starkangriffen.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982968719', 'num_games_owned': 446, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1400925192}
review: This game is terrible. What the game implies is that each of the various swords have different fighting styles and this just isn't true. Each of the character avatars have different fighting styles. Some which draw from the swords featured in the game. The problem is that the character avatars do NOT switch styles when they use different weapons. So the fencer guy will use his katana like a rapier.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116508567', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 175, 'last_played': 1414122217}

author: {'steamid': '76561198058590030', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 425, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 392, 'last_played': 1401047597}
review: Blade Symphony is somewhat unique in not only how it emmulates a common console-type game onto the computer, but also the customisation in-game: there are four characters, and each can choose one of five weapons, a total of twenty unique combinations, granted, some are better than others (Phalanx with a foil or katana, for example). In the future, I would like to see some variation in the later iterations of each of these weapons, such that each Katana differs not only visually, but also statistically and, perhaps not so likely, that items your character wears influence how you play (e.g. a helmet that gives you 5-10% more damage, but causes you to take 5-10% more damage). This is a game that has some way still to go, but has the potential to be great, even for immersion gamers like myself.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998961777', 'num_games_owned': 776, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 836, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 521, 'last_played': 1617071511}
review:
[h1]Genre: Third-person "Arena" Fighting Game
Reccommendation: Worth to play if you look for a simplistic but polished fighting game.
Playtime: Unknown, Likely more than 15 hours.
Rating: 9/10[/h1]

[b]Review:[/b]

A really nice "fighting" game, more of centered on the whole idea of Fencing. It involves 3D Movement, you have a much higher time limit, no unfair abilities, and the whole game is "relaxing" too.

As for combat, there is no kind of absurd "button combos" (like pressing right, down, right + attack just for a special move), but instead it's all using your mouse's left click, where holding a side movement key will change the attack.
There are 4 kinds of battle stances: Light, Medium, Heavy and Air. Switching to these is instant (Air is automatic) and can be done between attacks to make your own mix, depending on your playstyle. "Combos" are actually just following attacks from a specific stance, maybe mixing them with another stance, but every stance has a limit (varying with the characters) where if you reach it, and if it's the longest chain limit, you will be left vulnerable for a brief moment. You can charge attacks, grab enemies, and use throwing weapons (Tomahawks, Ninja Stars and Knives).

But the amazing part of this game is: Steam Workshop support. You can literally pick any sword or mask that is approved (almost every one of them), download it, and use it in [u]any server[/u], and everybody else will be able to see it too.

The community for this game is really nice too, but there is [b]some[/b] bad players (Cowards, Bad losers, spammers, quitters). They are very rare to see, though. Rare enough to not even matter.

TL;DR: This game is very unique and is almost the first of it's kind, and I'd love to call it a Fencing game. I give it a 9/10 (not a full 10, because of a small lack of content). Highly reccommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058745529', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 2171, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 444, 'last_played': 1535849909}

author: {'steamid': '76561197990561137', 'num_games_owned': 435, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 1634, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1016, 'last_played': 1538313070}
review:
Reading negative reviews made me doubt this game little. After watching some videos of the game you can immediately recognise the Source engine, which made me doubt the game a little more. In the end I decided to try it. Aaand... it wasn't a bad choice!

In the begining you will propably be the "noob spamming fast attacks", but don't worry about that. Don't rush your experience, figure out some moves, watch others as they fight (FFA servers!), ask questions in the chat - the community is really helpful! Most of the players dig the atmosphere of the game - when a duel starts they nod, if a player writes something in chat (hovering icon over head) they don't take an advantage of the moment and kill you. Basically first 5 hours of the game -> 3 new steam friends :D

The game has a role play aspect to it, and I really hope the dev team will consider improving that even more. Blade Symphony is not just about the swords, but it's also about the social interraction.

Arcade Aspects
You can play this if you have like 15 minutes of free time, but only after you spend a couple of first hours in the game figuring it out. Many streamers on Twitch just jumped into the game with their friends and quitted after 10 minutes because they didn't have a clue what they were doing... Grab a coffe on a saturday morning and just play through the tutorial, figure stuff out on your own, no rush. After that you will be able to pick some fights, win/lose, have fun, and quit.

Technical Aspects
Blade Symphony is using a highly extended Source engine. The only features I've recognised it from are the chat and the voip. Oh and the (high) framerates obviously. The graphics are very pleasing for the eye, and the motion blur fits the action perfectly.
About the networking - Source can handle pings under 200ms pretty well. This aspect is very important when it comes to such an action game. Above 200ms duels become laggy and you might see your opponent attacking you from nowhere. To overcome that just don't play on Australia servers :D

Overall
Really entertaining, takes some time to figure out in the begining, great community!

P.S. It surprised me how well it's made on source engine.
